The hotel is oriented perpendicular to the freeway so there are few rooms truly on the back of the building facing the airport (rooms 1217-1219 on our floor) but those rooms are directly across from the ice and vending machines (not enclosed in a separate room or alcove) which I’d consider to be a much greater noise problem than the freeway.The breakfast buffet was very good, including oatmeal and four cold cereals, scrambled eggs, pancakes and make-your-own waffles. The breakfast meat was unlabeled and were peculiarly dark cubes, possibly Spam. Seating was abundant. Fresh fruits included apples, oranges and melon but no bananas.A number of local and chain restaurants are within walking distance but nothing suggestive if fine dining. The surrounding neighborhood included a car dealer and light industrial buildings but felt safe for walking in the evening,The fitness center was relatively large with a variety of equipment. There is an outdoor pool, surrounded by additional low rise rooms (many of which could have problematic highway noise). The airport shuttle was efficient, but not quite free. I really dislike signage suggesting recommended tips, but there is one posted in the bus, suggesting a per-item tip. Bring lots of dollar bills, but don’t expect those tips to actually translate into meaningful assistance with handling your luggage.All in all: a good but not great hotel. The basics are solid (sleep quality, room features), and the included breakfast buffet is a big plus. It is a good choice for a short stay between flights.

We stayed at this hotel last night when arriving from a long night!Free shuttle from the airport. Use the phone next to the caroussel 24. When you have called, go outside caroussel 20 in the center area behind the green line. There is a shuttle bus that says Best Western on it.Check in process was quick and easy. No issues. Staff was friendly. Room was clean, bed comfortable.Took a shower this morning and the shower doesnt drain, it must be clogged with other people’s hair and filth. See picture attached, that is with the drain wide open. Would recommend employees to have that looked at.Other than that, I strongly suggest this hotel.

The airport BW is really convenient. If you get the rooms away from the road, you can really enjoy your sleep. The bus line is rt outside, and there is an option to take the shuttle to the airport terminal to catch a shuttle to Waikiki. You can also have a cheap tour of Pearl Harbor- by Uber or taxi- only 2mi from this hotel. If you want fun in chinatown- it is only a bus ride away. The Ala Moana Center is about 30 to 40min by city bus for $275. The pool area is noisy but all faciilities are clean, staff are super professional. Great for a business trip.

I was visiting to visit the oldest bar in Hawaii. When I made the reservation I was told to call them from the phones at the luggage area. I found out they were gone because of construction. I told them and didnt know that. I called and they arrived for pick up within 10 minutes. It was a short drive to the hotel. The rooms have fridge and micro in them. There is a small store there but the prices were high I thought. If you go out the hotel and turn left and go to the corner and then left(5min) there is a mickie D;s, shell gas station, Ihop, and Dunkin Doughnuts. Across the street there is a Airport market, sushi, 2 bbq's and starbucks. Pop st shell was 2.09, at hotel 3.39. There is no restaurant at hotel but they will shuttle you to another of their hotels for one. Break had Waffles, S Eggs, meat, cereal, bread and bev.

We've been attending the annual event here at Hickam field and Best Western continue to impress with government rate, reasonable price for leisure and the services is always top notch. Even though I was recommended by my peers to stay at Hale Koa, but I chose this one because of the services, and convenience of location to all other area of interest, local eateries were among the best one. Will always come back to this one for years to come.

My husband and I are staying for one night enroute back to AZ. The FREE shuttle is wonderful and arrived in a few minutes after our call to the hotel. Because our flight arrived early in the day....10:30 we were not able to check in so stored our luggage in a secure area and had lunch at a near by IHOP. We want to especially commend Beau at the front desk who was so kind, understanding and did everything she could to help us. Once our room was ready we checked in and were delighted with how lovely, clean and comfortable the room was. It is close to the highway but our room was far away and up on the 12th floor so was very quiet and provided us a good night's rest. If you need to stay near the airport we recommend this hotel with the highest regard. The pool area is very nice and there is very good store on site with beer, wine, sandwiches, etc. They also offer a free breakfast every morning starting at 6:30.

This hotel was perfect for our late night arrival to Honolulu. We were on our way to Waikiki Beach. Instead of paying more than double the price for our first night in Waikiki, we decided to stay near the airport at the Best Western. We used the complimentary shuttle to the hotel and used the shuttle the next morning to return to the airport to get our car rental. The complimentary breakfast is outstanding with eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt bar, waffles, pancakes, pastries, juice and coffee. The breakfast is in the onsite restaurant, so I would recommend bringing money to tip the outstanding staff in the breakfast area. I didn't catch the waiters name, but he was so friendly and helpful. Thanks for a great start to our vacation Best Western!

We enjoyed stay at this hotel because it was clean, had a complimentary free breakfast, free 24 hour on call airport shuttle, and staff was helpful and friendly. We were able to watch planes coming in and going out too. While there was some traffic noise, you would not hear much from airplanes.

I stayed at the Best Western Plaza Hotel when my husband was unexpectedly airlifted from our trip in Kauai to Honolulu for further medical treatment. I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the hospital he was at. It was actually a delightful place to stay. The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, there were several restaurants within walking distance. I ended up venturing out to do more things on Oahu when my husband was napping in the middle of the day and the Best Western was always nice to come home to. I also had a surprisingly beautiful view of the mountains. If you are sensitive to highway noise, do not stay here at it is literally right next to the highway. However, I found it to be great white noise for sleeping. I think if you also want to take advantage of Honolulu’s beaches, this would be a bit of a trek for you. For me, it was perfect.

Very close to the airport, free shuttle was prompt. All staff were friendly and helpful. We were at the back of the hotel, away from the expressway, so traffic noise was minimal. Better than usual hot buffet breakfast with plenty of seating.We were able to catch a bus to old Honolulu (about 30 minutes) and Waikiki (about 40 minutes) right opposite the hotel. Front desk staff gave us change and advice on buses to catch. All bus fares are $2.75 each trip (get a day Pass for $5.50), or $1 ($2 Day Pass) if aged 65 or over. All bus drivers we had were good, and stop announcements are announced along the way.

This Best Western Plaza Hotel - Honolulu has both location close to the airport and an excellent shuttle service. The shuttle service runs 24x7 with dispatch by call-in from the airport, which I used after dropping off my rental car (with a gas station about 1 block away.). We used the 5am shuttle to meet our 7am airplane. The staff is friendly and helpful.

My room was clean and well kept while I stayed here. The amenities and proximity to the airport are why I stay here. I have been a member of Best Western since 2014. This location is one of the best I have stayed in.

I arrived late but was greeted by two awesome individuals, Raymart and Beau. Both were cheerful, very professional and quick. Really made my stay start off with a great impression! When I got to the room, it was beyond my expectation as it was a lot larger than I expected and very nice and clean! I really expected a lot less for the amount they charge but was surprised to say the least!

It may be close to the freeway but all in all it was a very pleasant stay.. highly recommend a rental car if you’re wanting to go to any beaches or do anything for that matter. Hotel was very clean and all the staff were very nice

The service I got from the people of this hotel and the way this hotel works is one of the best standard Best Westerns I have been in. Only downside was the freeway out the front door but I would stay again and would recommend it 100%!

With less than a five minute drive this location is great for anyone spending a night or two or stuck with a layover. The breakfast has many Great options very delicious. McDonald’s and Starbucks is within walking distance. The staff were very polite and patient.

The hotel was close to base and easy access to downtown. My Housekeeper, Ms. Mercy really did a good job. My room was always clean and on time. Thank you for giving me excellent customer service. I will definitely stay there again.

The rooms are adequate. The decor plain. The noise was tolerable given the location. If you need to stay near the airport this is a good choice. The pool hours are too short. The breakfast was outstanding & the staff are very friendly and efficient.

Being close to the airport is the main advantageous feature of this property.The room we were in (number 117) was old but serviceable. It could use modernization. It faces the pool area so curtains need to be closed most of the time.Hotel is next to highway so location is noisy. So noisy that most people could not sleep with such noise but we were exhausted from an overnight flight and got our 5 hours of sleep before our next flight.

Staff was awesome, very helpful. Rooms clean and pool is perfect area. Breakfast included, courteous staff and breakfast stations are awesome which was my most favorite part of the whole stay. The waffles were amazingly scrumptious. Waiter was very helpful and all the breakfast stations and made you feel very welcomed.

Excellent kind room service and front desk staff Mercy did an outstanding job taking care of my room while I was here. I will absolutely be recommending this hotel to family and friends who plan to visit in the future.

The hotel is in a great location and very military friendly. My room was always attended to and I couldn’t be happier with the cleanliness of the room maintained by Mrs. Mercy. I would recommend any military PCSing to consider this establishment.V/rMr. Brewer J.

Hotel is 5 min from airport and adjacent to the freeway. If it wasn’t the road noise keeping you awake, it was the air conditioner. Cars racing by, trucks, motorcycles- there’s a reason they supply earplugs. Has 70’s decor, old and run down. There are many better. Due to plane problems, was assigned to us by airline so had no choice but to grin and bear it. Only positive was it was clean otherwise they’d have no stars. Not sure if there are other wings to this hotel but freeway side is terrible

Free Airport Shuttles, covered parking, continental breakfast convenient to all areas in Honolulu for business and pleasure. Clean rooms, great staff personnel. Has pool, bar and snack shops on site. Walking distance to car rentals, city buses, liquor and tobacco stores.

I was there because I got ill at the airport and no flights were available employees friendly I would come back to best western again if a flight gets canceled I would definitely tell friends about it

Staff to include front desk, concierge, restaurant,and house keeping were extremely friendly. The house keeper Mercy, went beyond mmy expectations and ensured my stay at this facility was comfortable. The staff at the restaurant knew exactly what I wanted every morning for breakfast and ensured I had my daily coffee and croissants. The front desk was very patient and informative about local activies and eateries. Highly recommend staying at this facility.

The hotel was close to the airport so since we were arriving late it was my choice. But a little pricey from the reviews. The hotel is definitely dated and very close to the highway so previous reviews were accurate. The hotel has two parts a small 2 level section which practically sits under the freeway so I can see how people described their room as being noisy. We were in the 16 story high rise and we barely heard the freeway at the tenth level. So if you stay ask for upper levels, away from the freeway. Staff were great from check in/out and at the buffet. Even though rooms were dated they were clean. Buffet was well stocked and you were given a variety to choose to from. Well staffed so you didn’t wait long during busy times. The price though was a little high fo me 278 Us itax in and I booked as a Best western member. But when I logged into trip advisor to input the review. I noticed prices offered through trip advisor was almost half what I paid. Curious I entered numerous dates and never found the high price I paid for one night. So lesson learned don’t bother with the Best western membership and use the cheap hotel booking sites you will save a bunch of money! Especially If you have an money exchange Canadians

This hotel isn't fancy, but they do try to make sure you're well taken care of. Our bed and pillows were comfortable. The room was clean. Breakfast is served from 6:30 - 10:00. It is complimentary for guests. Others pay $13 for children and $18 for adults. It is a buffet, but there are waiters checking to see if you need anything. The selection was very good: breads and pastries, fresh fruit, oatmeal with toppings, scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, waffles (even coconut syrup!), yogurt with toppings, cold cereal, juice, milk and coffee. It is located very close to the airport. It is also a short drive to the naval base. Expect to hear noise from the highway right next to the hotel. They charge for parking in their parking garage; get your ticket validated at the front desk so you won't be charged again when leaving the garage. The parking garage gets crowded. They have a nice fitness room with weights and cardio equipment. There is a small store by the lobby where you can buy souvenirs, snacks and amenities. Staff has been friendly and helpful.

Great service overall. Also room service was very accommodating and did a great job keeping my room tidy. Room Attendant name Mercy. She respected my privacy and also having a bad experience in the past with Room Attentants taking things from my room that didn’t belong to them.

This hotel’s only real merit is that it is close to the airport in Honolulu. It is also 40 minutes from Downtown and located on the main Nimitz Highway into town. There is also a busy overpass just above the hotel - the noise level would be a huge deterrent to staying here again. They do not serve dinner - but offer a shuttle ( but you can walk it in 7 minutes if you can stand the noise of the traffic ) to the Honolulu Airport Hotel where the food is modest if varied. Breakfast is served at the Best Western and although the restaurant is austere the food was varied and of a reasonable standard. The staff were all warm and friendly in true American style, but the rooms were modest - with carpets that could not conceal their overuse. There was also I adequate bed linen for keeping warm overnight. At US $ 209 a night this cannot be described as good value for money .

.....from the airport, but almost - perhaps a 5 minute taxi. We stopped in Honolulu for an overnight before connecting to the Big Island and this property worked out very well. Nice full breakfast in the morning after a long day of travel the day before. Would definitely recommend if you need an overnight stay before a connection. Rooms may be a little dated but were definitely clean.

Very close to airport, rooms are nice, very clean, very good AC, very good wifi, great breakfast and amazing staff. Not a luxury stay but definitely suits my style of travel and would recommend to friends

In addition to a fab location, the entire front of house deserve a mention as they went above and beyond to make my first visit to Hawaii and stay with them a very memorable and pleasant one.I had initially planned to use taxis for my entire stay but was shown how the public transport was easy and very convenient for the places I’d mentioned I’d like to visit whilst on the island. Fantastic breakfast with plenty of choices whether it’d be continental or waffles or eggs or fruits or even oatmeal. Reasonably priced in comparison to staying in Waikiki. Free shuttle from airport also.Will definitely be returning and staying here again.

Stay was pleasurable and enjoyable. Except for the side of the bed if not careful would slide right off. Could not get enough pillows, they were to soft. But other then that its was clean, helpful staff and pRking was available. I would stay again for a discount..loll It was an 8 out of 10.

Close to HNL. Hotel needs a major upgrade. Highway noise is deafening due to close proximity to H1. AVOID the building parallel to frontal road.Fast food food restaurants in walking distance. Hotel has a small store with food/wine/sundries etc.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Best Western. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet and also the convenience of dish various shops that surrounds the Best Western. The staff was very pleasant and intended to my needs.

The shuttle picked us up promptly even though it was 2 AM. Front desk person was very welcoming, friendly, and helpful. Very comfortable, clean, and updated room in “the tower”. Excellent, plentiful breakfast, too.

I have stayed at this hotel twice while in Honolulu on business. The hotel is just a five minute shuttle ride from the airport, and both times I used the shuttle it was on time and the drivers were very personable and friendly.My room on the sixth floor was very spacious with plenty of outlets, nice TV/Desk work area etc., and everything worked fine. The hotel is adjacent to a major street and elevated highway, however in my room on the sixth floor, and about half way back away from the highway, I heard no traffic noise. The HVAC System worked well and was very quiet.There are a few restaurants near by as well a couple of fast food places. There is also a fairly well stocked store in the lobby of the hotel. Overall my stay (12 hours) was fine and I found the convince of the hotel being near HNL a bonus. I will stay here again if in the area on business and would recommend it to anyone. While my only interaction with the staff was at check in and the shuttle, both were positive.

I stayed here for the night as I had a flight to Melbourne the next morning. It was awesome having the shuttle to transport us to the airport that early in the morning. Also, having the McDonalds right beside the hotel was great for grabbing something in the morning.

a very nice hotel witha large garage, near airport, big room , very closed to rental car .I spent 2 days very well .Clean room, closed to freeway , so in fee minute is possible to go in pearl harbur or in downtown . Very good for family

We had an overnight transit stop at Honolulu airport before flying to Kona the next morning and opted for the Best Western. The location is great, about a half-mile from the terminal. It is easy enough to walk if you know where you’re going, but there is also a free shuttle that runs approximately every 30min. The room was fairly spacious, clean and comfortable, with cable TV and good free Wifi internet. The main criticism was that there was a lot of road noise, as it is situated very close to the elevated Nimitz Highway and there is no double glazing to block the sound. We kept checking the windows to make sure they weren’t open as there was so much noise entering the room. We woke up to road noise quite a few times during the night. The hotel has a small and poorly equipped fitness room which we didn’t even bother trying to use, instead opting for an in-room cardio circuit session before our flight. There are a number of decent restaurants about a block away, including an IHOP, Dunkin Donuts, Big Kahuna’s Pizza, and Ninja Sushi. In the morning, the hotel served a reasonable, free breakfast buffet. For an overnight transit stop, I thought this was a pretty reasonable hotel.

Mercy was my cleaning lady and what a pleasure she is. She keeps my room clean and stocked. She was very nice and sweet. Any time I needed something she never got upset or frustrated with us a family of 4 two big teenagers and 2 adults. I would return and recommend this hotel because the breakfast was great, they have parking , clean rooms with no odor and my girl Pretty Mercy. Thanx

This 12-story hotel is very close to the airport and has a great free airport shuttle that runs every 30 minutes. The staff was very nice, our room was spacious, and there was a very good free breakfast! In addition, you can walk to several fast food restaurants or an I-HOP nearby. HOWEVER, the very noisy Nimitz Freeway is on two sides of the hotel and literally right above some of the rooms located around the pool. Be sure to ask for a quiet room in the back of the hotel! Our room, #1120, was very quiet. It was located in the back corner of the hotel on the 11th floor with big windows (you could even see the ocean in the distance), but the freeway was front and center when you looked toward the mountains! The hotel was a good spot for an overnight stay before a flight, but I would be very careful about the room location! See the attached pictures rather than the professional ones.

Yes it's close to the airport but take the extra time and stay somewhere else.The hotel is literally underneath the freeway. We chose this because we had an early morning departure but none of us slept so we'd have been better off to stay further from the airport. The only way to block out the traffic noise was to keep the loud window A/C running and the room smelled a gym locker. The front desk staff and shuttle drivers were all pleasant but the

The hotel has been given a superficial refresh without actually updating anything. Stains everywhere in common areas, bad smells, very noisy. The airport shuttle was nice, but we paid SO MUCH less to stay at 4-star hotels the remainder of our trip. This was not a food value.

As the hotel is close to the airport, we went there before our long-distance flight. They offer an airport shuttle service and told us to phone to get picked up from the airport. The number didn't work, so we had to take a taxi. On telling this inconvenience and additional expense, we were just told that usually the number worked. No "sorry" or anything similar! We knew the hotel was close to the road, so we had to keep the window shut. But this was only possible with the air-conditioning turned on. We could hardly sleep, because it was so loud! 185 $ for not sleeping is too expensive! Don't go there!

I stayed several days in this hotel. My stay was pleasant. The highway was a little noisy, but I didn't mind it, because I don't sleep well in silence. If you want to cancel the noise, earplugs are furnished. The staff was very accommodating and Mercy was a top-notch room attendant. She gets 5 stars. She came back when asked and was quick to replace towels and change linens when needed. Thank you!

Booked a room as we had an early flight home the next morning, front staff were pleasant enough but that’s were it ended. The fridge did not work and there was crap all under the toilet seat and bowl. Booked for 4 and there was 3 towels and the air conditioner sounded like a 747 jumbo taking off. The staff that came and cleaned the toilet and brought the towels were pleasant and apologetic. Give this place a miss as there are better options elsewhere.

My family of 4 pcs moved to Hawaii and we chose the Best Western to stay in for lodging until we could move into housing. We had a 2 double bed room during our stay. It came with a small fridge and microwave, which was nice. Our room service was amazing! Mercy took care of us during our month long stay, she would go above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed even if she didn't service the room for the day. She cleaned our room thoroughly. She is a very sweet and personable women. I appreciated all her help. There is a small store and restaurant downstairs for convenience and a laundromat as well. The only reason I and giving 4 stars is because of the noise of the freeway. It can be a bit loud unfortunately. But other then that the hotel staff and our stay was great. I definitely will stay here again and I would recommend to family as well.

We stayed here for 10 days and had a lovely room with plenty of light. Staff were very friendly. Close to the airport and to other destinations. Other restaurants in the vicinity. Only criticism is the location of the gym on the 12th floor so if you are in the rooms directly below it can be a bit noisey.

Awesome location for a quick turnaround to the airport. There are enough stores and restaurants near by for a different atmosphere if your choice is not the hotel restaurant. We stay here often and we have seen so many positive changes throughout this past year.

I stayed here for nearly two weeks while in Oahu on business. My room was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location perfect since I was working on Hickam Field. I appreciated the guest laundry facility. I would stay here again.

We were hardly in the hotel, but the 3 nights we stayed were quiet and comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and always wished us a good day and a wonderful night sleep. Location a bit far from areas we needed to be, but overall value of hotel was worth it.

Excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommend Mercy for outstanding guest service skills and warm spirit of aloha to all. Highly appreciative and would definitely stay here again, thank you

Mercy makes sure my room is in perfect shape every single day. Is a great feeling coming from work everyday and your room is spotless and smelling great. She takes her time make sure everything is good and in order. RM 807

Had a good time with my stay here. My room attendant Mercy was awesome and if I make it back to Hawaii I wouldn’t mind coming back. Five stars because of Mercy. If they let me put six stars I would just because of the fabulous room attendants.

This hotel is very conveniently located close to the Honolulu airport. The shuttle bus service is phenomenal. We didn't wait any length of time for the bus and the driver was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel had a comfortable bed and was clean. There was some traffic noise but not too bad.

During my stay at Best Western The Plaza Hotel was fantastic with the free and fast WiFi. Breakfast in the hotel’s restaurant was good and well-priced.My room attendant Mercy was fantastic! She was very nice and polite to wait to clean my room. Thank you so much!

Hotel is located near the airport and 20 min st the most from downtown Honolulu or Pearl Harbor. Staff are friendly and professional and house keeping is accommodating, Mercy was the room attendant and she was incredibly helpful. I plan on returning anytime I need a place to stay.

If you were a newlywed couple intent on a luxury-filled and memorable honeymoon destination at a resort on the beach...well, that isn't the Plaza. IF, however, you are a business traveler intent on finding a comfortable place to stay with easy access to the airport and freeway, then I encourage you to consider The Plaza Hotel by Best Western. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Nice sized desk for setting up an office away from home. Nice pool. The hotel has its own dedicated parking garage, so your rental car is always close at hand. The restaurant associated with this hotel offers breakfast every day, and evening meals several nights a week. On those nights where the chef has the evening off, The Airport Honolulu Hotel (sort of a "sister" hotel to this one) takes over evening meal duties. The two hotels are about a leisurely 10 minute walk from each other, and there is a two-way shuttle service running continually between them. The food at both hotel restaurants is tasty; the portions are generous.The staff is friendly and attentive. Sharon, the desk lady on duty when I arrived, was very helpful and ready to answer any and all questions. Myrna, my room attendant, was dillgent in her duties, ensuring that the room remained clean, comfortable, and well stocked with coffee pods. When I return to Honolulu on business, this will be the place where I'll stay.

mercy and amalia is both friendly and does there job good, thank u for having them here, they are awesome.my room is nice and clean and yeah. they both make me feel comfortable staying at the hotel. Thanks for having such great people work here.

I’ve been here for 1 week (816) and Mercy my room makes sure my room is in perfect shape every single day. Is a great feeling coming from work everyday and your is spotless and smelling great. She takes her time make sure everything is just right. Thank you Mercy a very sweet and nice lady.

Our flight back to Melbourne was cancelled so we were put up at this hotel by our airline for five nights. Yes, five extra nights in Honolulu and all paid for - it was hard going ;)Pros- close to airport- free airport shuttle- bus stop across the road. Very easy to get to Waikiki, Pearl Harbor or North Shore. The bus system is excellent and a day pass is only $5.50- hotel restaurant food is delish and staff very friendly. We definitely looked forward to breakfast and dinner each day. - our room was super clean and freshly decorated- in-room coffee pod machine was great and provided a decent coffee. We did buy some fresh milk as they only had a dairy free powdered option in the room- the pool area was a good place to relax and get some sun.Cons- nothing drastic, the reception staff sometimes gave the impression that we were interrupting them when we approached the desk. They were mostly friendly but I think they were just super busy.- as this is an airport hotel, it can be a little noisy from the nearby freeways and airport. Being the plane nut I am, I didn't mind. We still slept really well.I would stay here again for the convenient location. I really love staying at Best Westerns because they are usually consistent with great amenities.Tips- IHOP, Dunkin Donuts, McDonald's, convenience store and other take out food places nearby. Safeway, Longs pharmacy and other eateries only a 15 minute walk away.

Ms. Mercy greeted my with a warm Aloha smile and was so full of information about Ohau. She help me with my luggage and actually took me to my room. I wish more people would show the Island spirit. Well done Ms. Mercy. Much Mahalo.

This isn’t the most perfect hotel on the island, however, it is very convenient to the airport if you have an early morning flight. It is clean. It is comfortable. The staff are great. I recommend it.

I am currently staying at the hotel. Earlier today, while i was taking a nap, someone or something opened my door and slammed it real hard. That woke me up, so I ran out to see who it was, no one was there. Took a nap again, woke up at 5 pm, my door was wide open, even after shutting it tight and locking it. This is creeping me out.

We stayed here one night as we got into Honolulu late. I suspect that is pretty routine or this hotel. It is along side a multi level highway. You can almost reach out and touch it :-)It is, what it is. My only complaint I that we pre-paid for a king bed room in the main hotel, but when we got there late they had already assigned us a room with two very small beds tucked right under the freeway. They remedied the situation but it didn't leave me with a good impression.

It close to airport with free shuttle the rooms are clean and comfortable we had an upper floor with views of the mountains and the airport.there is a MacDonald next door where the food is good and there is a servo that has a good supply of everything you may need

We had a late flight into Oahu and a cruise starting the next day, so this was a good choice. Older hotel but clean and well maintained. Close to the airport with shuttle that came soon after we called for it. Also located in close proximity to the tangle of expressways north of the airport, so there is some highway noise. Efficient check-in, comfortable bed, good shower. Would stay again in similar circumstances. Can walk to McDonalds for McBreakfast.

We left a non-disabled friendly hotel downtown and came here. Glad we did! Very pet friendly, large rooms, great staff all the way around. The location is great. Easy to get downtown and to all the great spots without dealing with downtown traffic. The food was excellent- reasonably priced and nice portions. Get the spaghetti and meatballs--Fabulous(Cheers chef)! Amenities (pool, laundry, convenience store, and parking) are easy access and very nice. GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

I definitely recommend this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful to me when I asked questions about the surrounding area. My room was very clean and well kept. Everyday that I stayed, the housekeeping staff would check on my room and ask if I need anything, Plain and simple...this hotel was way worth the price.

I did book the hotel due to the proximity to the airport. The hotel is okay, staff is friendly. You need ear plugs (provided in the room) when facing the highway. The room was okay, only the carpet in front of the window was completely wet. The hotel doesn’t offer continental breakfast (you have an menu but the offerings doesn’t seem to be good).

I had forgotten about the international dateline, arriving a day before our reserved date. They accommodated us with a wonderful room at a price close to our reservation price. Being that it was 2 am, we were most grateful that they helped us out. Everyone was sincerely nice and helpful. We will definitely stay they again if need be. One small item, I do wish they had a shuttle to down town, as taking a taxi was most expensive. Also, it is important to note that there is a shuttle to and from the airport. This is important because the Honolulu Airport closes at about 11pm and there are no taxis anywhere to be found at the time at night.

I cannot articulate how pleasant my stay has been, while here at Best Western! Amalia has been my room attendant since 10/12 and her service has been exceptional. I felt my space was respected and my requests were honored! I will be here two additional weeks, but I’m sure she’ll continue with great hospitality! Thanks Amalia for all that you do!

High floor facing the airport/runway perfect for spotting all departures easy to see, Hickman arrivals all turn short again though you can still get them from the room, windows open as well..........McD and dunkin doughnuts next door

We have been here for few days now and have received nothing but awesome service! The food and beverage staff has been so nice. The food is very good! I had the sweet bread French toast with coconut syrup and it was so delicious. Dinner was great. There are many items to choose from even for the kids. James was very nice, he talked us through the menu to make sure we all got exactly what we wanted for dinner. He definitely made us feel at home! We’ve had housekeeping come to our room everyday, even on the weekend. Our housekeeper Mercy makes sure that our room is always stocked and clean. We really appreciate her hard work. She is really good at what she does. Everyone here has been so helpful and friendly. I use to work In the hospitality industry and I am absolutely amazed by how well this hotel is staffed and run. I am so glad that we chose to stay here.

Outstanding costumer service. Mercy, my room attendant was very professional and polite. Thank you Best Western, in Hawaii for a comfortable stay. I've never stayed at your hotel before, but now you have a customer for life. Job well done!!!

This hotel is really nice hotel and I love the services! They are really nice people. I had madam Luz as my housekeeping and she’ve done a good job to cleaning our room, she’s friendly too! And My family like James and Janice (they’re at the plaza cafe) and love the food! I’m going to missed their bread pudding

Very sweet lady, she made sure the days i was here that my room was cleaned and well kept up.. i enjoy my stay and i would definitely recommend anyone to stay as well... if i ever visit Hawaii again i will come here

This review is for the accommodating Mrs.Amalia for her warm and caring approach with great hospitality. She was always courteous and kind. Me and my family truly appreciate you and will never forget you or your loving spirit.

We ended up doing a stay-cation do to a misunderstanding. It turned out very enjoyable. Breakfast were on target and roo service was very good a good mention for Ms Amalia who always maade sure our room was cleaned and properly supplied.

Great hotel with cheap price for Oahu. Pool is really mellow and nice. Just pretend highway noise is the ocean. Convenient to hit north shore and Waikiki area events. Very comfortable room with king bed. Plenty of space. Cheap parking compared to other hotels and no resort fee that I noticed. Great way to be close to airport and still be able to be mobile all over.

The hotel’s airport location was very convenient for our one-night stopover in Honolulu – arriving after 9:00pm and leaving 10:00am next day. Our room was lovely and had every amenity. Breakfast in the hotel’s restaurant very good and well-priced.The free shuttle bus to the airport terminals was a bonus.

Checking in and out was very greetingful and made us feel welcomed. The Plaza Cafe has the best pancakes that i've had since my childhood, and my keikis had a blast in the swimming pool. Shopping mall's are very near and easy to find. My kids want to return to the same hotel on our next trip.

Mercy was our room attendant. She was very polite, kind and hospitable. She made sure we had all we needed and our room was very neatly cleaned. We appreciate having her and will love to have her again. She indeed made our stain pleasant one.Thank you for hiring such good staff.

We have a had great stay at Best Western Plaza Hotel. Our room handle by Mrs. Mercy,, she is doing a great job,, our room always clean. She is also very friendly. Everything we need,, she is always helping us. And also Michael as a waiter in Plaza cafe, he is amazing. He also give us excellent service. Thank you

We have had a great stay at Best Western Plaza Hotel! Our room service by Mrs. Mercy has been amazing! She does an excellent job! The room is always clean! She's always on top of her game! I'm so glad to have her as room service!

the stay was great they have places to eat that are really close by, the staff was always polite and helpful, we had a amazing room attendant her name was Amalia, she kept making sure we had everything we needed in our room, and with a child that was potty training she put extra towels under his sheets as to assist with his training, thanks Amalia.

We were sent here by our airline when our flight was delayed by 14 hours. We were given a large, spacious room on the 10th floor. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed being able to nap and shower while waiting for our flight. There is a large, beautiful courtyard with a pool. McDonalds is directly next door and there is a convenience store and restaurant in the hotel itself. Nice and close to the airport. Our room had views overlooking the mountains. Although the rooms seem a bit dated, this hotel is more than adequate for short stays, or for people who plan to be out and about enjoying honolulu!

Most friendly and helpful room service employee ever, so lovely and great first impression of hotel. "Marcy” you did a greate job. The restaurant staff were just lovely and the food was amazing I was very pleased. They were always looking for ways to serve and help us. Thank you very much.

We enjoyed our stay here but realized we were far away from things, but we did use public transportation to get to downtown Honolulu and had no issues getting there and back. The beds are not the most comfortable but the rooms are clean. The hotel could use some updating for sure. A lot of military personnel use this hotel also. There is a McDonald's right next door and there is a gas station, IHOP and Dunkin donuts about a block away, do it's a easy walk to all of them. Great pizza place called Big Kahunas a block away from hotel also. We would stay here again since we now know how to get where we want too with using public transportation.

My husband and I stayed here for a few weeks while waiting for our house to be ready. Thanks to Mercy she was extremely helpful and always cheerful. She really cares about the people she cross paths with. Mercy thank you for making our stay at the Best Western awesome!

We stayed at this hotel for one night before a flight. It is literally across the road from the airport. Great location, but there is nothing special about the hotel. The room was fine and clean. It was expensive for one night and almost made me want to stay closer to Waikiki Beach for the price. There was a shuttle every half hour to the airport. We were running late and the shuttle driver was nice enough to take us to the airport to make it in time for our flight.

We stayed here for 4 nights and we loved it. Families who traveled with their pets are welcome.They have a swimming pool, laundry and 24Hr shuttle. They also served breakfast and dinner. The location is close to gas station, restaurants and relatively close to a major highway although its a little loud at night but its tolerable.The staffs are friendly and very welcoming.Our assigned room attendant Ms. Mercy took care of us for the duration of our stay. She is professional and showed us the unique style of Hawaiian hospitality. We will definitely coming back in this hotel and will personally request Ms. Mercy as our room attendant.

Hotel was decent. Kids loved the pool. Close to the base and to different restaurants. They gave us food vouchers to use at the restaurant at the hotel. Our room attendant Amalia was Awesome. She was very nice and polite!

I would definitely stay here again. I normally need a hotel really last minute and best western is always booked so I’m sure that says a lot about the comfort here. I finally got to book a room here in advance and the stay was great.

One night stay after a seemingly never ending day of travel from the UK. Really convenient for a quick overnight stay being 5 minutes from the airport. Road noise is a real problem here, sometimes it feels as though the card are driving through the room with a surround sound that most home cinema systems would be proud of. Not too surprising I guess as it is built under a flyover. Room was mostly clean but had a stale smell and some debris in the bath. So in summary, does what is says on the box but not the best for sleep quality.

I always miss my family when I travel for work but the staff at the Plaza are so awesome they truly made me feel I was a part of the family. Amelia and Mercy both tag teamed the 8th floor and took great care of my room. I had to move rooms mid trip (my jobs fault, not the hotels') but both ladies were always happy to see me. I just happened to here during the whole Hurricane Lane drama and Amelia came in everyday and said she would be here for me if I needed anything, I was worried about her coming to work but she wasn't and was always very reassuring. Now if thats not family watching over family I don't know what is. And it wasn't only the maids. The maintenance guys were just as awesome. I had a bicycle to get around and twice the brakes needed a little tweaking. Juanito G. and Moises never hesitated not only to let me borrow the tools but actually fixed my bike themselves. There was not one day that I didn't run into the staff in the hallways and truly felt like they cared about me, my bike and my travels. That type of service makes any travel a little easier.

On behalf of my wife and I, we would like to take a moment and thank Amalia for her attentiveness, service, open and friendly personality from August 24-September 6, 2018. She kept our room well above standard and at no time did we have to want or need anything.She is just what we’re looking for any time we traveling. My wife I travel a lot, and we wish there wqere more people like her. Thanks Immensely,Davie/Eileen

This hotel is near the airport and right on Nimitz freeway so a little noisy. But, the room is larger than hotels in town and you can avoid the traffic nightmare for the most part. Some good local restaurants within walking distance, don’t let the industrial area fool you

Yes, I would recommend this hotel to a friend and his/her family. The house keeper "Mercy" was very friendly and she did a good job in cleaning our room daily. We stayed here for over a week now and two more weeks to go with no issues. Great services and also good location to stay for military PCSING or TAD.

The hotel and room were clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and had us into our rooms well before check in. The WiFi was flawless. The pool and surroundings were clean. The dinner menu was very good and our food was served promptly and prepared to our liking. The only downside to this hotel is it is trapped in the center of a freeway system. However, it is very close to the airport and if you have business and aren’t sight seeing this is an excellent hotel.

Mercy is always so sweet and it’s always a pleasure to see her. Mercy goes above and beyond to make sure we’re happy with our stay here. She is a very hard worker, we always look forward to seeing her every morning, even if we don’t need anything. we love her!

It was a wonderful place to stay at. The staff was great, talked to them a lot when I seen them through the day. Also Mercy our room attendant was great she always made she we had what we needed. Good job!

Best Western is conveniently located right outside the Honolulu Airport. Close to the Navy Exchange & many good restaurants. For us, it was right in the middle of everything. Equal distance to every destination we went to, which was perfect. More importantly, it is located just about 15 minutes away from Tripler Hospital (which was the reason for our visit to Hawaii in the first place). The service we received at the hotel was good too. The room attendant, Amalia, was great with our housekeeping services. We always came back to an extra clean room. The hotel itself was great, but it was the first hotel I've been in that doesn't have balconies. But it's okay... it's safer for the kids that way. It's right next to the freeway & the airport, but the sound of the vehicles, bikes, planes & helicopters going by made it more interesting, most especially for my son. He's so used to hearing them back home, so he enjoys the sounds. Every time he heard a bike or helicopter go by, he'd push the chair to the window & just stare at it as it goes by.

I was expecting a little more from this hotel when I decided to stay here for the first day of my Hawaiian vacation. I chose this hotel based on its proximity to the airport, which was very convenient when I landed in Honolulu after a 12 hr flight. However the hotel is a little bit rundown and is located right next to a large busy highway, neither of which gave a very nice first impression. The hotel is close to Pearl Harbour, but far from the city center & nice beaches. My room was quite nice though, with a great view of the surrounding hills & forests.

I want to express my great appreciation to the Front desk agent, Maam Carissa.I missed my flight at night & I needed a hotel to stay. That time I forgot to bring my power adaptor which I needed to charge my phone. Without any second thought Carissa offered to personal power adopter. It really saved me from worrying. Thanks Carissa for doing the extra mile service.

Excellent accommodations and caring staff. Friendiest staff that I have ever encountered in all my years of travel and staying at other hotels. Highly recommend Best Western The Plaza Hotel to anyone in the military or associated with the military.

Came here for a PCS with my family, and had to stay at this hotel for over a month. The rooms were very comfortable, and spacious enough for long term stays. Wish the refrigerator was a little bigger. The hotel is very military friendly which we love. The restaurant downstairs was perfect for breakfast every day or an occasional dinner. The staff is all very friendly and helpful. We loved our room attendant, Amalia!

We stayed here while waiting for our housing to become available and we enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is located within walking distance of several restaurants. Although the hotel restaurant was a little pricey, the food was really good. We were traveling with our dog and they made it really convenient by putting us in a room that allowed easy access outside and to the designated pet areas. House keeping was very attentive. Whenever Maria was working she made sure we had everything we needed. She was awesome! Overall, we had a great stay at the Best Western.

This Best Western is very near (like ON) the highway. Very loud outside but did not notice noise on the inside. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. We only stayed for one night before boarding the cruise ship but I was happy with the hotel. If I wanted to stay in Honolulu for an extended period of time I would book something closer to the beach but this hotel was fine just for the night.

We stayed here for a night before catching an early international flight. This hotel is only 5 minutes away from airport with free hotel shuttle, which scheduled to leave hotel on every 30 minutes (we are supposed to get there 10 minutes earlier) We got a corner room which was a lot larger than the regular BW hotel room. The room is comfortable but the downside is that it was located next to the freeway so there were plenty of street noise. There’s a restaurant and a convenient store on site. If you are looking for food options passed 9pm, IHOP and L&L Hawaiian Grill are within 5 minutes walking distance, also there’s a McDonald which opens 24 hour right next door. Our wait time for check-in and check-out took longer than expected because there’s only one staff at the front desk.

We were stuck for a week trying to get back on a military flight and this hotel worked well with our changing schedules without late fees and cancelation fees. The Internet was great, pool, restaurant on site and so close to the base. We had a wonderful room attendant Amalia who always cleaned super fast and was kind to the kids. We stayed on the 8th floor of the new building and had zero issues with the room. The front desk was always helpful and courteous. Thank you for supporting the military lifestyle!

Outstanding hotel and all personnel were professional. Thank you very much, our stay was great. the hotel was very clean and the rooms were outstanding. Room service were very good, room were very clean.

AMALIA was our housekeeper. She was so great! Not only did she do a phenomenal job, She was personable with me and our kids. I was so impressed by her work. She gave us excellent service. When we cam in for the night, It was so refreshing to come back to a clean room. She took a few days off for vacation and we all missed her!!!! Thank you AMALIA :)

The Plaza Hotel is conveniently located only a few minutes drive from Honolulu International Airport. We stayed there for one night after a late international arrival and early departure of our domenstic connecting flight. We arrived so late that the regular shuttle service was not running any more, but after calling the hotel they arranged for the shuttle to pick us up anyway. The staff at reception was really nice, check-in and check-out was uncomplicated and quick. Our room was clean and spacious with a large and comfortable bed. We did not have breakfast as we had to leave rather early in the morning. For an overnight stay in transit the hotel was just what we needed and I would absolutely stay there again.

The hotel provided us with excellent service from check in to check out. Mercy brought extra blankets for my children without us asking and was very attentive to our needs. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.

Entire staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. Amalia kept our room clean and was willing to work around our schedule. Hotel is close to airport so noise is expected but was not too bad on airport side. We asked to move our original room that was near the road because noise was terrible. Desk staff was understanding and changed our room quickly. Not a luxury hotel on the beach but just fine for traveling and exploring the island.

Staying for over a week with my Army Daughter who is PCSing had a great stay and an extra clean room thanks to the greatest housekeeper ever Mercy!Also front desk and all the other Hiusekeepers were just as friendly!

Over priced, old room, staff not friendly. no lift for second storey, no offer to assist with bags from staff.ground floor room reserved for guest with pets....dont worry about families travelling with young children, pets are more important. gets kids to lug bags upstairs.room facing busy road.better of sleeping in airport than pay the rates you have to here....btw, no breakfaststay elsewhere

We chose this hotel for its closeness to the airport and courtesy airport shuttle. There were no reservations for the shuttle. You show up at the time you want to leave and they take you to your airline. We were awarded a special room with many windows that was large because we are diamond members. The room itself was nothing fancy. We were so close to the airport that we could see it from our window. However, we couldn’t hear it. We had to leave too early in the morning to take advantage of getting their free breakfast, but having just arrived in the late afternoon from the East Coast, we were up at 4:00 a.m. anyway, so we chose to walk to the next-door McDonald’s to eat. McDonald’s is open all of the time, even at the early time we went to it. We had no issues with the hotel at all. If you stay at this hotel, it will be fine for the night.

The staff was very accommodating, the room was in great shape, updated and clean. Location is right at the airport for convenience but maybe not for a long term vacation stay unless you are renting a car and can drive to local tourist areas. The room was much quieter than expected due to the businesses of the hotel.

Good access to airport. Reasonable amenities. Good value for business travel. Several neighborhood restaurants within walking distance are real hidden gems. Fair exercise room. Friendly staff. Clean hotel, nothing fancy.

Very good hotel to use if you are needing to have an early flight. It is clean, comfortable and without fuss. Love the free airport shuttle. Should have been more diligent reading about advising hotel about arrival and needing airport shuttle from the airport...that was our bad and a tip for other travellers.

Place really needs a facelift. Hall carpets are worn and tattered but the rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Price is crazy high for this quality of hotel. Hotel is noisy no double pane windows for this place so bring earplugs. Contrary to most Best western, breakfast if not included but they do make good eggs benny. The staff is courteous and friendly. It served our purpose since we were picking up our car at the airport the next morning so the “free” shuttle was well appreciated. But there is a big sign in shuttle that suggest 1$ tip suitcase. The driver is very helpful and courteous so I would say suggested tipping is in line with the service received.

She does a very good job and is always helpful and cheerfuland she is very professional in her job and is a great employee and they are glad that they have her working here.a always has a smile and a great attitude.

Good service! Wifi works great. Amailia is very quick with the house keeping! Shes very nice. Also, everyone will give you friendly smiles, very generous. Prices are a bit high but it’s a good stay...

We are staying in the Best Western Hotel. its been awesome and our stay has been made better by Mercy. She makes sure that we have everything that we need to have the most comfortable stay possible. Thank you!

Mercy is an outstanding room attendant! She is always smiling and eager to meet the needs of my wife and I. She has definitely made our stay here a fantastic one! I recommend her for promotion review!

I chose this hotel for the lower price than the Waikiki hotels and the free airport pick-up. We were only there two nights before cruise. They also have a restaurant and a guest laundry, so we boarded the cruise with clean clothes. It was very safe, because the military uses this location as an overflow for families.Cons - noisy; airplanes and constant freeway noise. Ask for room away from the freeway. This hotel is a $20 uber ride to anywhere. Since we were only there 2 nights it wasn't bad. If you are here longer, rent a car, the hotel has a parking garage..

Amalia really keeps our room clean and well stocked.She did awesome in our room 823.she greets us.thankyou for her. We love her as our room attendent.She always has a nice smile and is very pleasant. Definitely ask for Amalia.

Amalia our housekeeper gave us the best service we had in a hotel in a long time. We stayed here for a little over a month, anything we asked for she did what she could to make us comfortable thanks alot amalia

The staff here is AMAZING!!! We were here as guest waiting to get our house and they treated us as family!! My children hugged Miss Sonia the room attendant she is amazing, super friendly and caring takes care of everything for you. The front desk is great and the restaurant staff is welcoming. Best hotel on the island.

Last minute trip to meet up w family. Wanted to stay close to base. Nice clean hotel, friendly staff and right on the bus line for easy access to other locations! My housekeeper was Maria and she was excellent. Very friendly and took care of my needs very quickly! Only downfall is that it’s right next to the highway so at times it does get a bit noisy but it’s only during certain times of the day.

Stayed here on a business trip. The hotel is very well maintained, clean and conveniently located near Pearl Harbor. The room was clean, comfortable and a perfect base of operations for my visit. The restaurant is good, the food is tasty. Service was quick and friendly. The hotel staff was friendly and pleasant. This is a good place to stay if you visit Honolulu. Sign up for Best Western rewards and parking is 50% less.

This hotel is the perfect option if you need to be close to the airport, but also want to experience the island! Our housekeeper Mercy was very friendly and her upbeat and warm personality made us feel relaxed and welcome!

My family & I really appreciate the pleasant stay with Best Western. Thi is actually our second long stay and I am completely pleased. We we’re quite comfortable. Our room was clean & tidy everyday thanks to the wonderful housekeepers. Thank you Mercy for all of your hard work & wearing your smile everyday.

Location: Excellent for a one-night layover. The complimentary shuttle between hotel & airport was efficient and drivers were friendly & helpful.Room: Very clean and bed was comfortable. However, A/C could not be adjusted. I overheard that some rooms are too hot and some are too cold. Mine was too cold but the comforter helped.Front counter staff: Not too friendly, slow but got the job done.Restaurant: Was going to have breakfast there but waited for over 5 mins and there was nobody around. No wait staff and no host. So I was afraid the service would be slow too and went to MacDonald's, which was just next door. Service there was excellent.This hotel is located very close to the airport and highways. I requested a room away from the freeway and higher floor and was granted what I requested. I thank the person who set aside a quiet room for me.I am a BW Gold member but received no recognition for loyalty because I booked my room through a 3rd party. Not that I care about the free bottle water and the snacks, but I think staff should at least recognize my loyalty for choosing BW over other hotels even I didn't book directly. The front desk staff specifically said that since I booked through Expedia, they don't recognize the membership. It was a bit blunt and disappointing. Other than that, the stay was excellent for a one-night layover.

Had a very pleasant stay for 2 weeks at the best western plaza hotel. The beds and pillows could be a little softer though. Try not to get a room right next to the highway though, you can hear traffic 24/7.

We had a wonderful stay in Hawaii at the Best Western Plaza Hotel. The interior was nice, very good customer service and dining. Our room attendant Emelita was so sweet and kind, mahalo!Jennifer Holiday

This hotel is convenient to the airport at Honolulu, especially with the free shuttle taking you to and from the airport. It is ,though, a bit run down (rugs) with out-of-date decor. The nearby McDonald's is useful for a quick snack before crashing and trying to recover from jet lag. Ok place to stay in between long flights like between the mainland and Australia and New Zealand (a stop over....)

We stayed one night at the Best Western after arriving in Oahu in the late evening after a long day of flying. It was a perfect place to get a good night's sleep prior to picking up our car rental at the airport, doing a visit to Diamond Head and then driving to our final destination on the North Shore. We found our room a bit dated but clean and comfortable, and was a reasonable price. The shuttle from the airport was quick and convenient. The hotel was located so close to the airport we actually walked back the next day to pick up our car rental. There was breakfast at the hotel restaurant but there was also a number of restaurants within close proximity.

Staying one night as a layover, hotel is clean, staff is friendly and easy to work with. Shuttle to and from airport. 12 floors with bottom 5 floors for parking, great view of city. Cons not particularly close to anything other than the airport, $40 to taxi to Waikiki which I thought was pricey (but has nothing to do with hotel other than distance from town). Overall this is a clean hotel for a layover but I would be disappointed if staying for a vacation.

Throw-up in and around elevator- couldn’t be cleaned up until maids were off break; other elevator wasn’t working; no stairs until 3rd floor; loud parties on our floor-nothing done; filthy, disgusting

Stayed for last night on Oahu as we had an early flight out in the morning to NZ.Our room was clean, quiet. The staff made us welcome.We had been staying down in Waikiki and then moved out to friends at Pacific PalisadesDue to the wet weather and congestion on the motorways early morning decided toMove to hotel near the airport. Could recommend this hotel if you are in transit, handy and with shuttle service. Will stay at this hotel again, for sure.

From April till July, we are staying at the hotel till we can move into our home. This place makes us feel at home when we get to see our room attendant Grace. She is like family to us. Every day my 2 boys and baby girl enjoy greeting her and getting blessings from her. She takes care of us and preparing our rooms neatly before we get back to the hotel with a long day of traffic, work, school, and stress. Thank you Tita Grace!

Highly recommend The Plaza Hotel if you are PCSing to Hawaii or just visiting in general! We have been here for nearly a month (arrived 4/28) and will likely be here another month. The hotel and staff are extremely accommodating to Military and their families, and have made the transition easier. Our room attendant, Amalia, is fantastic in every sense of the word. She is professional, helpful, courteous, friendly and knowledgeable of the area when asked. Our room always looks pristine when we return from a day of exploring. Employees like her are hard to find! Our stay at The Plaza Hotel has been wonderful and thanks to AMALIA for going above and beyond! I hope they appreciate her as much as we do! Also, there are many food options within walking distance of the hotel. Mcdonalds, Jamba Juice, Big Kahuna, Ninja Sushi, L & L Barbeque, Ihop, and many more. However, if you are looking for breakfast options I HIGHLY recommend eating at the hotel as their breakfast is 10/10. We will be recommending The Plaza Hotel to any and everyone!

The room is tidy and gives you more than enough amenities for a great stay. Amalia is awesome. She does a great job cleaning rooms. I noticed this when I met her as she was leaving my room. She was nice and courteous. All workers were knowledgeable and reliable during my visit. I will be staying here again if I were to visit Oahu.

This lovely hotel was our home for 60 days; perfect view, pool, walking distances to mcdonalds, dunkin donuts, ihop, starbucks + jamba juice, sushi, korean bbq n etc..The plaza is not a 5 star hotel, but from the front desk to the housekeeping staffs are the super friendly and very accommodating to our needs. Love the cleanliness of our room thanks to Mercy for making us feel at home and always checking in on us. Thank you Mercy and Staffs.

My family and I have been staying at the Best Western for two weeks now, and so far we’ve had a great experience. This location is near highways, which allows easy access. There’s a handful of good eating location at a walking distance. Staff here is great, they’re friendly and professional. Our housekeeper Amalia is wonderful. She’s always helpful and taking care of our needs. She makes us feel at home during a time where we’re under some stress with moving from the mainland to the island. Overall we’re very satisfied with everyone and everything here.

This is our second time staying at this property. The first time we stayed was for 45 days straight three years prior due to a military move. This hotel does so much to welcome the military and their families to the island. They not only give you free parking for the TLA program, but also meal credits for the onsite restaurant. Our second stay was this one for 10 days as we are moving away from the island. Imagine our surprise when upon walking into the restaurant for dinner the first night, we were greeted by a hug from Techi, who remembered us from three years prior! The staff at the restaurant for our first visit was amazing and they continued to be for this stay as well. James, Michael, Techi, and Ramon in the restaurant all remembered our family from the three years prior and greeted us like we were long time friends. It blew us away that they remembered us!The food in the restaurant is great and well priced. The breakfast offers very large portions, as well as the dinner! The menu has changed a bit from what we remember but everything was delicious. I have worked in the hotel industry for several years and this is great food at a great price for Oahu standards. The rooms are nice and clean, and I believe they may have been updated since our last stay. Our housekeeper ( Zeniada?) was always sweet and cleaned our room with great attention to detail. We will always recommend this hotel to friends moving to the island. Everyone at the property greets you kindly and genuinely feels like they care about you. the property does have small issues, like the parking being tight and it being a bit noisy from the highway noise. But to us, it is still the best service you could find and that definitely outweighs the negatives to us. Mahalo Best Western for making the beginning and ending of our time in Oahu so easy!

The workers are very customer friendly, especially Beau and Raymant. Hey, they were able to put up with me and that's saying a lot. The Hotel is near all the military bases and the airport with easy access. The parking is a bit of a bite. But it worked for me. I would recommend it and would stay there again. Checking in and out was a breeze. This time I had the floor with all the party-ers but I could have gotten a less convenient floor. Considering all the traffic and guests, the staff just manage to do an amazing job. Again, Beau was super. Hopefully she will be on the desk when you check-in.

We stayed here 3 nights while we had a look around Honolulu before going to the west coast of the island. The shuttle service to/from the airport is good and the hotel is right next to a bus stop where you can catch buses to all the major sites. For $5.50 you get a 1 day pass. The room was clean, comfortable and the staff were friendly. The only slight negative, which the hotel can't do anything about, was the road noise next to the pool area which was quite loud.

We stayed here both on arrival and before departure from the airport during a recent visit. On arrival we used the courtesy phone (just a couple of carousels down the hall from our bag pick-up) following the clear instructions for the hotel. We were given clear directions (over the crossing, go left until green curb) to the bus, which was with us within minutes. It was driven by a friendly, helpful and informative young man. We were welcomed by a friendly receptionist, and our room was clean, comfortable, and had everything we needed for a good night’s sleep - followed by a leisurely, delicious breakfast. Hotel was very convenient for car rental pick-up.Equally pleased during outward journey. We arrived early, but our cases were taken from us, we sat by the pool, and our room was actually ready for us ahead of time. The evening meal was every bit as good as breakfast had been.There is, indeed, traffic noise, but it did not disturb our sleep at all. It was more intrusive whilst sat at the pool.Would definitely use this hotel again if visiting Hawaii in the future.

Just to thank Mercy for the excellent Housekeeping services. More of you would make the Best Western a great place to stay. Thank you for the awesome service and please keep up the good work. You are awesome!!!!

I only stayed here one night...and was glad that it wasn't more.The staff made a vague attempt at being friendly, but wasn't very convincing. As I struggled to pull my suitcase over the unevenly stone tiled floor, TWO staff members stood watching, and didn't even bother to ask if I needed help. The room was clean, but there is mould growing around the tap and border of the bath. Breakfast was more or less disastrous...don't be fooled by photos of beautifully displayed fruit. None of that...just a drab dining room with tired looking waiters. I ordered a coffee with hot milk, but received a bowl of pre packed 'milk' and about 10 minutes later a separate cup of Luke warm milk. The food was tasteless and so greasy (as in a layer of oil floating on the omelet).I get that this is a budget hotel...but even so, it really was quite grim.The only good thing I have to say is that their Wifi is free and acceptably fast.

Even though this is next to a freeway, the room we had was exceptionally comfortable and quiet. This was our last night in Hawaii, and Best Western provided us with a very nice night's stay. The shuttle was very prompt and we were able to easily make our flight. This is probably the best Best Western property we have stayed throughout our travels in the U.S.

Was booked for 10 days; stayed 7 before returning home. Room a bit noisy as it faced the highway - ask for a room not facing highway. A/C ran a bit loud it seemed, but didn't spend a lot of time in the room - picked for price and location to where I was working. Nice store in lobby with drinks/snacks - very friendly. Laundromat on site - was expensive for convenient. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.

Good service, clean, comfortable, mediocre food, freeway noise. Good for an airport motel. Would probably stay again. You're going to lose reviews requiring 200 characters. I've told you what I think and don't have anything else to say!

Having arrived at 20:00 after a 24 hour journey, I didn't have the energy to rent a car and drive to our final destination. The Best Western Plaza Hotel is ideally situated close to the airport and with a shuttle bus to take to back and forth when needed. i only stayed one night, but the room was comfortable, and the staff were friendly. It wasn't particularly cheap at £206 (around $300), but August in Hawaii! What did I expect. I'll recommend the Plaza, but only as a stopover at the airport.

We stayed at the Best Western Plaza Hotel when my husband and I were in the process of getting our house in Hawaii. We stayed from March 16, 2018 - April 24, 2018 and our housekeeper Maria was such a ray of sunshine. She always made sure we had clean towels and always went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed! I will miss her smilingly face in the mornings, as she brightens anyone's day she comes in contact with and you can tell she enjoys what she does and is SO good at it! She definitely deserves a raise! Thank you best western staff for having us and a special thank you to Maria! I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family when they come to visit! Mahalo!

This was a basic, no frills hotel but we only needed a one night stay so decided to save some money. Still was $169/night through Expedia. Clean room, standard size and it was surprisingly quiet. Our room looked to the back of a factory of some sort but it was a Friday night so no activity there. They have a pool, small but surprisingly pretty with bushes/trees all around instead of a tacky fence. The restaurant is open for breakfast early but is not open for dinner every night which was not advertised on their website. We got into the hotel at 7pm starving and found that out. They did have a pleasant Shuttle driver that took us over to their 'sister' hotel 5 min away. That meal wasn't very good at all with terrible service. This is an Industrial area around the airport so nothing else around except a McDonalds to go and eat at. It is the closest to the Pearl Harbor Memorial which is how we chose it. Small gift shop with overpriced food items (4.99 for a pkg of Goldfish crackers).

I stayed in this hotel for 31 days while I waited for Military Housing. Overall, it was a decent place to stay. The driver of the shuttle van was quick to pick us up and very friendly. The front desk staff is very knowledgeable, and helped with correcting my reservation. (I booked using the government rate and not the TLA rate). And our housekeeping lady, Mercy, was super friendly and thorough. The wait staff at the restaurant were always cheerful and helpful.Here's our stream of conscience:- The king size bed was dangerously comfortable. More than one day disappeared because of a surprise nap. - Our TV was upgraded from a 36in to a 55in, which was super nice. - The refrigerator and microwave were standard sizes for a hotel. - The bathroom had one vanity and bathtub that was just a little too shallow for a nice relaxing bath. - The pool area was rarely crowded and had a decent size. Chairs and Tables and clean water. But quite a few ants...- Complementary WiFi allowed for four devices. Which for two technologically immersed people is about half as many as we needed.- The location was fairly convenient. Hickam is about an hour walk or 8 min drive, and the Pearl Harbor NEX was about the same.- The floor would get wet whenever it rained, which I found really weird. - Parking was free for guests, and the garage is floors two through five, with six through twelve for the rooms.- There were two elevators, and no choice to use the stairs. There was no service elevator, and the two elevators they did have were slow. Especially at rush hour.- There are four washing machines and four dryers on the first floor, but they are $3.25 per load, each. - There was a free gym on the twelfth floor. It's not real big, but there are some free weights and one bench, two treadmills, and some other things.- On Tues, Wed, and Thurs, the restaurant is closed, and guests are directed to Airport Honolulu Hotel's restaurant, which is honestly better. It's just a 10min walk...- The number of homeless people right outside the hotel is a little concerning.

Not too far from the airport and a few miles away from Waikiki. Housekeeping did an extraordinary job with the rooms. Also, not that far away from JBPHH and the Arizona Memorial. Would gladly stay here again.

My wife and I stayed in the hotel, after long travel, we received good greeting from the front desk, she is very helpful and considerate, thanks, the facility is good and clean. Very near the airport, easy to return our car rental.

Imagine my dismay, after my last experience, when I learned we'd been booked into this hotel to attend a work training. My room was in the main tower (as opposed to a room off the alley like last time). We were checked in by Beau at the front desk. Best Western couldn't ask for a better representative. My room during this stay was WAY better - clean and updated. Still a little noisy but tolerable (this is an airport hotel after all). I wouldn't recommend this property as a base for your Oahu vacation, but it's very convenient when you need a location close to the airport. This was a very positive experience. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. If I could give half stars, I'd rate this stay 3.5.

I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times, and each time, the hotel benefits get worse and worse.The staff is a hardy bunch of friendly people, but I have a feeling this is a case of management cutting the corners for a profit. Out of 4 nights, 3 times we needed the staff to change towels. We are not talking about a spots—some of these towels looked like they were used in a crime scene clean up. Parking prices are just like those in Waikiki, but this hotel is not near Waikiki. They used to have an outside company that provided a shuttle service to the NEX, and that was great because while I was at work, my wife could take in some shopping. Maybe the management should do something like that. If you are looking for a hotel with a friendly staff, and away from Waikiki traffic, this is a moderate hotel with normal Waikiki prices. They used to offer all you can eat crab on Fridays, bar, and dining everyday, but that too Iha’s been cut back.

Would recommend anyone to stay here when you can get something comparable in Waikiki or another neighborhood. If you're just there overnight and want to be close to the airport then it's ideal otherwise would not recommend.

A convenient place to stay (nothing fancy) if you have to stay overnight to change planes at Honolulu airport. Unfortunately I had to wait at least 20 minutes for the shuttle even though I used the special phone in the baggage area and was told it would only be five minutes. I had to go back and make another call and was told the shuttle driver was busy dropping people off and was on his way.
