I am one of their Diamond Members and was treated like a once a year traveler. Only 2 small elevators, terribly slow and crowded Room door had been kicked in slow check in & out pool closed bad value for the rates they charge Way over priced gift shop Too many more defieciencies

Beau & Hi'ilani at the front desk were very friendly, kind & helpful when we needed a 3 night stay at the last minute. Our double queen room was spacious & clean. We had a refrigerator & microwave. The T. V. reception & Internet service were both excellent & fast. The pool was in a beautiful setting with shade. The gym has many windows with nice views while you're working out. The restaurant has a very large, delicious chef salad that makes a wonderful, filling, healthful meal for 2 people.  The buses are convenient to Waikiki & other areas of Oahu. Senior price on the bus is only $1.00 each way & you can get a transfer if needed. (Bring your Medicare card)The bus drivers are very knowledgeable and told us where to get off for our stop. We stayed here twice in 45 days & would choose Best Western The Plaza Hotel, again. The 4 plus lane highway goes right past the hotel. We turned the climate control on Fan Only at night and did not hear the noise from the highway. You can walk one block to McDonalds or 3-4 blocks over to the small market for reasonably priced food items. The front desk people can direct you to the market.

Older BW property adjacent to Honolulu International Airport. Complimentary 24 hour airport shuttle. Rooms are clean and beds provide a restful night's sleep. Very friendly management and staff with a great ALOHA Spirit. Rooms adjacent to freeway are quite noisy, but hotel provides earplugs. Swimming pool, cafe, and very good gift shop with lots of travel/food necessities. Guest laundry.Nothing fancy but good for a quick overnight stop when flying in and out of HNL.

We stayed here since our flight was quite late arriving and we knew we'd be tired. The service was excellent, and the room was great. Just the highway was super noisy in the room even with all the windows closed. We enjoyed the pool (really lovely!) and breakfast (super-yummy) and it was conveniently close to the rental car location (walking distance). We were happy and would stay here again if we get the chance to come back.

Stayed only for the night.Was great location from airport.Very decent size room and had everything that was needed.A little small shop in lobby to buy drinks and small snacks but it closes early.This place is near the road so it can get a bit noisy. But we were on a high floor so it was ok probably be worse if we were down lower floor.Otherwise it was decent. Would stay here again.

Window would not close and could hear the traffic outside and the room would not get cold!! Reported no matience in the night we just got in from a east coast flight and had flown for about 16 hours just wanted rest!!

Good night in a good room- but even high it is noisy - staff courteous and attentive- pool had been emptied- restaurant was basic but plenty of food - got to stop in Honolulu airport ? Stay here. The rooms are large and the beds comfortable.

Front Desk Staff is kind and caring. I had a room away from the freeway, which made a big difference in the noise level. The view out of the window was very nice, especially at night. Bed was comfortable plenty of pillows. I had a good night sleep and felt refreshed the next day. Check Out time at noon is great if you cannot go to the next destination until later in the afternoon. I will definitely come back again. Thank you all for a wonderful evening.Cleaning staff, Maria and Laticia were excellent. They were speedy to replenish the supplies I needed. Thank You.

Without question FRAN at the front desk went out her way to make a miserable trip outstanding. She was friendly, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful. She had a great welcoming personality, answering every question with sincere interest in making our stay great! If you go here, your lucky if you get to speak with her.

Was great for us as we needed one night accommodation close to Honolulu airport. Free shuttle bus service to and from the airport. The room was quiet considering we were so close to the airport. We definitely would stay there again. The staff was friendly and made us feel welcome. Nice pool area.

The staff went out of their way to make you feel important and cared for when the need presented itself. Ideal location and service to airport for departure. We enjoyed the swimming pool and leisure in the sun.

We chose The Best Western Hotel as it was close to the Honolulu Airport and we needed a room for one night. The room was clean. It was very noisy, right beside major freeway & airport. Earplugs on night table for a reason. The restaurant in hotel is limited to certain days & early hours. We flew in from another island and it was difficult to find a restaurant other then McDonalds open after 9pm. They are missing the boat there! The hotel is very, very dated. Whoever decorated it, is surely dead. Best thing about it, the rooms are clean and the security guard very friendly. We asked for help finding a place to eat, he actually walked us through the courtyard & directed us to the only restaurants open.

During my military relocation here to Oahu, I was pleased to find a hotel that would accept my cat and golden retriever to stay. I'm coming up on 2 moths living in this hotel dealing with all the house hunting nightmares you can imagine, I had to extend my stay here multiple nights, on numerous occasions. The staff were always willing to accommodate. Especially Fran, the front desk receptionist. During the hotel renovation I had to move rooms and Fran help make that switch painless. Thank you, to all the staff in the hotel. This week should be my last here before I move into my house. Crossing my fingers!

Raymart front desk employee is so helpful and his goal is to make sure he does his best to make sure your stay with checking in is the best possible. Check in is fast, the rooms are clean and I never have to wait for the room to be ready. Asked for 2 extra pillows and it was at my door in 10 mins

We had 8 people that went on a cruise of the islands. We had a 10 hour wait until our plane departed and we had our parents who are 91 and 90. I booked a room for them to rest until it was time to go to airport, the woman at the desk was so nice she recommended a day room at a better rate, they took all our luggage, got us two wheelchairs, and drove us all to the airport!!! What could have been a nightmare was a very enjoyable last day in Hawaii!! Thank You!! Dawn from Buffalo, NY

Well, first of all i wanted to say to the maid staff Mercy,Beau front desk and miss Fran Thank you for making us feel like Family, and to the military liaison Mr. Les Nishimura thank you for all the questions that you had answered for me and the helpful advice i got from you. I traveled from afghan to hawaii for emergency leave for my wife, who was being treated at TAMC tripler . she had all the support from all the staff that helped her cope of what we were going though. they made her feel welcome and gave her support.i kept hearing about Miss Mercy and Miss Beau and how they were so supportive of her and my daughter who was with my wife. When I Arrived 18 days later my wife sprits has changed for a positive one. I looked for help with the front desk and got it from Miss Fran who was kind and very helpful with everything i asked. she then pointed me in the direction of Mr. Les Nishimura who helped me over the phone and made me feel important and help with my dozens of questions on what to do. This was no vacation that i was on or my wife. but with Professional Staff and the worker it made it easy and i would make this a place to visit again and again. Thank You Best WesternRIVERA FAMILY

Air-conditioning did not work properly and the staff didn't seem to care. Hotels located next to a very busy highway and the windows were not properly insulated which allowed a lot of that in the lease to come in even worse the air-conditioning didn't work properly and the front desk staff did not make any attempt to offer to help us move to another room they eventually offered us another room after the second complaint but still no assistance in helping with the move nor did they at any point apologize for the inconvenience

We were pretty tired at the end of our trip, so the Best Western Plaza near the airport was a blessing. The room was well maintained and the bed was massive; if you're noise sensitive, make sure you request a quiet room. Ours was supposed to be, but the freeway traffic was still a bit loud. I can't imagine having a room closer to the road and still managing to sleep.The restaurant was nice for breakfast; there is no meal included with the room reservation, but the prices aren't too high. There is also a nice little shop in the lobby (with snacks, drinks, and souvenirs) and an ATM on site. Again, all incredibly convenient, and the airport shuttle is amazing. A very stress-free way to end our trip.As an aside, make sure you do not try to take a taxi from the airport. We're from the UK and so couldn't call to schedule the shuttle; we thought we would take a taxi instead. Our luggage was in the car and we were halfway inside before we told the driver where we wanted to go. He immediately threw us out and said it was the closest hotel and we should get the shuttle. Save yourself the drama and either phone or find someone to phone for you.

If you ever have to spend a few days in Honolulu or overnight near the airport I would highly recommend the Best Western. The rooms are comfortable and the pool is small but refreshing. Breakfast is superb, especially if you go for the papaya!

The hotel location is ideal for a needed one night stay near the airport. But for any extended stay beyond one night, the Plaza Best Western Hotel is not a good choice. The hotel is as clean as it can be considering how aged the decor, and facilities are. It's obvious it's an old building, and it shows in the bathroom decor. The doors are beat-up, the tile grout is old, and dirty. The building overall just shows it's age. The up-side is that the staff are friendly, and professional. The restaurant portions are generous, and great quality, and the gift shop is managed very well. This is a hotel I would only stay at if I had to sleep near the Honolulu Airport for one night.

Our family of 4 had an early morning flight, so decided to stay near the airport. This hotel was perfect for that reason. Most rooms have been updated. Ours was nice and clean. The staff was friendly and the hotel is a hub for Charley's taxis. I recommend Charley's since they have flat rates and saved us a lot of money. The hotel also has a nice convenience store in the lobby and a restaurant (which we did not eat at). We used the convenient free shuttle service to and from the airport

Very close to the airport !!!! Friendly hotel staff !!! Room was clean !!!Free shuttle service to the airport !! 15 minutes away feo waikiki beach and shops !!! Marketplace on site was really convinient !!!

You book here, not because it is a destination, but because it is a necessity. Like: I THOUGHT I was booked elsewhere, and found out too late that I wasn't confirmed. The hotel is adequate. The cleanliness is okay, the view is surreal; you can see EVERYWHERE from the upper rooms, and the sunsets and sunrises are actually pretty awesome from this local, considering that you can see both sides! The hotel restaurant is actually pretty tasty, and there are places to eat within walking distance. The local busses pass directly in front of this hotel and will take you anywhere on the island... but there are homeless camps near the hotel, and for the most part, you WILL encounter homeless everywhere on Oahu, but feel more directly connected to them when they are buying beers in the little store in the lobby. It is clean, but it could be cleaner. It is a place to sleep, and if you are here to stay in a hotel, this isn't going to be your best use of your time. The hotel pool: tired. This picture must be 15 or 20 years old, or touched up significantly.

Very bad experience with this hotel and its unpublicized cash deposit policy resulting in being forced to check out early and stranded. Dont carry credit cards so am familiar with the need to often pay a cash deposit when i check in. I was paying about $140 room/tax rate yet the hotel demanded a $350 cash deposit. As the stay went on i ran ouf of cash and the hotel refused to use the cash held as deposit toward the room & tax. I had an advance for the 5 night's room and tax plus a modest cash deposit. Third day into my stay i was forced to check out as i didn't have cash for that night's room and tax. My deposit was more than 2x the nightly rate so i asked them to take it from my deposit on hold. They said no even though they still had more than enough left over in my deposit to pay even my last night with cash left over. I was waiting for a bank transfer from my new employer and i was waiting for employer to complete a creditcard authorization for the hotel's charges. None of that mattered to the hotel, the desk clerk asked the wrong question to the manager on duty and would not let me speak to the manager directly. The manager said i needed cash for room and tax and refused to use any of the deposit otherwise i must leave. So with no choice i was escorted to my room by security, hastily packed my suitcases and checked out. Ironically, once i had my deposit back i had enough to pay for 3 nights room and tax. !!! Never have i been treated with such a lack of compassion or caring. No bending of the rules. No caring whatsoever. Fine. But i will tell every person i can at every chance i get about my experience and refer them to the hotel who gladly took me in and had no issue with anything.

Good value airport hotel. Clean and comfortable. On site restaurant a bit pricey, but convenient. McDonald's and many other small eating establishments nearby. Kamaaina discount on parking. Would stay here again.

Not exotic by any measure, but the rooms were nice, and everything worked well. Location within easy walking distance of the airport industrial park was helpful for me. I also appreciated having the McDonald's right next door, along with several small restaurants within walking distance.

This hotel gets a 100% for convenience and amenities considering the amount of guest traffic in and out of there. The hotel is practically located centrally to just about everything in and around Honolulu and especially the airport, when you want to beat feet out of there. The rooms I have stayed in have been great and they do go that extra step to ensure you have a pleasant stay.

On our recent trip to Havaii we have stayed in the Airport hotel, but they have no restaurant for dinner, but they have shuttle to the Best Western Hotel close by. What a treat , great food and the gentleman name James was not only great but greatest I have ever had serve me a meal, old school Gentlemam . Thank you James , Tony from Canada.

.... this hotel is ideal. It is convenient close to the terminals, not a difficult or long walk but the hotel does have a regular complimentary shuttle service if needed. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful on our arrival. The room was, as expected, clean and tidy, and the bed comfortable. While a bit noisy from the aircraft coming and going (what else can be expected for its location), it didn't interrupt our sleep.

We were in a pet friendly room ($40. Cheaper) but was clean! It is convenient when you need a night or 2. Easy bus ride to Waikiki.Pool is OK Very noisy with traffic and airplane noise! It's not a destination hotel but a good stopover!

I stayed here while I had a long layover. I wanted something that was close to the airport and not too expensive. This fit. As a benefit, the staff were very friendly. The area around the hotel does not have much to recommend it (it's an airport hotel) -- few restaurants or other amenities. It does have the interstate right out the front door. If you have the choice, I would recommend a room in the main building, not in the "courtyard" overlooking the pool. Ear plugs are provided for a reason! There are a few public buses (stops just out the front door) that take you directly to Pearl Harbor and to downtown. $2.50 is much more affordable than the taxis!

The address to this hotel is not correct and it is very difficult to find. Not located in the best area so be careful. Hotel is right by the highway and a McDonalds so you have a lot of street noise keeping you awake.

Needed a place to stay one night near the Honolulu Airport. Great experiences with Best Western in the past led me to choose this location. There is an issue with Google navigation though. That app will put you on either H1 or Nimitz Highway, and this hotel is located on a frontage road for Nimitz. Not the hotel's fault though. Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean. The hotel will validate for free parking in the garage on the property. Make sure you do this upon check-in

Just spent one night in transit here. Was disappointed as the website makes it look like a little bit of paradise, especially the pool area, but they fail to tell you that the pool photos are taken from the double-decker highway that overlooks the pool so the noise is terrible and the water was cold, so no swimming for me, alas. However, a free airport shuttle, comfortable spacious room, a good bed and a convenience store in the hotel were positives. At $242/night, it was overpriced even for Honolulu standards. Breakfast was not included but I spent the $16 for an omelet since I had a transcontinental flight ahead of me and had starved on the last one. Seemed like a lot of construction workers and military people were staying there so I hope they get a better deal than I did!

The Plaza at HNL is one of the better BWs that I have found in the States. Generally speaking BW provides convenient and very adequate accommodations for travelers looking for a reasonably-priced place to stay without frills. The Plaza meets many of these expectations, but succeeds in bettering the model. It is convenient to HNL airport and reasonably so to downtown Honolulu and other southern Oahu locations. The physical plant is in good shape, the staff friendly and professional and the restaurant is well above average for a medium priced property. Though near the airport the only noise level came from a nearby highway overpass. The noise was not a significant factor. Half-hourly shuttle service to airport. City bus stops outside the entrance.

Clean rooms. Pricey.Free kuerig coffee in room.Nothing really as far as restaurants. The plaza cafe is pricey and mediocre at best. Views from the rooms are industrial oriented. Windows need cleaning badly.

Excellent for airport hotel, shuttle leaves hotel on the half-hour, nice outdoor pool, little airport noise. Nice breakfast menu, but dinner service only Friday through Monday. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel if you want to take the bus to Waikiki.

Very comfortable stay. location was very confusing at first, due to google maps making me take unnecessary turns. But once you learn your way around, it became a very centralized location if you have to travel all over southern Oahu. You will need a car. Perfect for business traveler.

Booked this hotel on line with "guarantee" if a lower price was found for same room on same date the lower price would be honoured. Well I booked on line then found an on line price $70 less, same room - same date. I wrote in to get the difference refunded. I received no reply and no refund. Not which is worse no refund or no reply.

Good location to airport. Doesn't look like there is much close by but there is. Easy access to Nimitz and H1. Very clean and friendly staff. Restaurant was great as well. Gift shop had a good variety.

We weren't expecting much after reading some of the reviews of this hotel on the internet. We were so wrong! We arrived at the Honolulu airport late in the day and figured we'd have to find a fast food restaurant nearby. Surprise, the hotel has a dining room! James, our server was very accommodating and the salmon dinner he recommended was excellent. The house salad was very good as well. All of the staff was friendly. The shuttle service was efficient. The gift shop was well stocked. The room was large, pleasantly decorated and very clean. The WiFi worked great. We would happily recommend this hotel just ask for a room on the quiet side of the building.

We stayed here because it was near the airport. It is plain and serviceable with a delightful front desk staff. However, being near the airport it was quite noisy and is in the middle of a light industrial area with nothing to do. About a quarter mile away is Mitch's sushi which was terrific.

Stayed at this hotel as it was close to the airport for an early flight out the next day. The cost of this hotel was the same as Waikiki hotels. Rooms clean and tidy, bed comfortable and staff very friendly. Sadly there was no where to get food in the evening as there was only there restaurant which didn't look appetising. Only other place open was MacDonald which had a limited menu and tasted horrible.

Cost to park, restaurant was understaffed, but good food, west side very noisy. We stayed there a second time and had a room on the east side and that made things much better. I have paying for parking at a facility when I'm staying there. But it is close to airport and Air Base and Honolulu.

My hanai son and I booked a last-minute, 3-night stay at this Best Western on Jan. 27, extending for a 4th day. Overall, we had a very good stay. Our room was comfortable, very clean and easily accessible. Our beds and pillows were comfortable. The small bathroom was a little old but also clean and the shower spray was strong as was the wifi. Mini fridge and coffee maker worked well. My only complaint was the very thin windows that allowed in traffic sounds of busy Nimitz Highway as if the windows were open. Front desk staff Sharon and Fran were fabulous and very professional. We would stay again but would request a room away from the highway.

Very courteous staff!! Great WiFi from all over the hotel. Parking was free. The location is perfect because it's in the center of H1. There is now internet connection for cat5 cables for government computers.

We stayed here (on a last minute booking) on TLA while looking for a home.They have a great program for incoming military and they do a great job of taking care of the uniform and their spouses. The front desk was always fantastic, the room was above what I have come to expect in a Best Western,and the food at the restaurant was always good. I enjoyed my servers at the restaurant and never had a bad experience or meal. Our regular server Micheal always took great care of us in the mornings that he worked and was always nice to talk to. I loved our housekeeper Mercy who was so kind to us and our toddler. The Best Western was a great start to our time in Hawaii

Such mixed reviews had me nervous. We had an overnight and needed to get with an early flight in mornings. Forum advise told me to stay in Waikiki and avoid this location. The reality is that it worked beautifully. When we arrived in Honolulu we called and the shuttle arrived in 5 min. The check in was quick and were placed in a corner room that has been updated. It was clean and very nice! We took an Uber to Peral Harbor and spent a few hours, From there's,we went to Waikiki for shopping and dinner. Lots of fun. Quick breakfast in morning and and a short ride on the shuttle to airport for 9'am flight. There is no way I would have wanted to,fight the crazy traffic here for am 9 am flight. Glad I trusted my instincts on this one. It worked out perfect!

For $200 a night I would go find a better hotel! I was in a upgraded King room that was pretty poor! Old windows in the hotel were very thin so all the noise from the jets taking off to the very busy highway in front of the hotel made it difficult to sleep. It was even more difficult to sleep because our window was off its track and could n't be fixed because it was bolted in place. So even more noise was coming in because the window was open to the outside world. There are very few options for eating in the area and we happened to be there on a night that their restaurant was closed. Something they don't tell you online is that their restaurant is closed several days a week and you have to go down to their sister hotel for a meal. If you like fast food there is a new McDonalds next door. One thing I can says is the staff was very friendly and courteous!

When flying out of Honolulu Airport our flight with Air Canada was cancelled and they put us up in the Best Western hotel for the night. Unfortunately we had a miserable experience at this hotel. Upon arrival to our room, when we turned the lights on, there was a large cockroach lying (alive) in the middle of the bathroom. We called down to the front desk but no one answered. The bathroom itself was grungy- old tile flooring that was broken and dirty. The next morning after heading back to the airport we were itchy and realized we were covered in red bed bug bites that we had not had before. When we finally arrived home we had to face the nightmare of dealing with bed bugs in all of our luggage and clothing from our trip. We would strongly discourage anyone from staying at this hotel, regardless of dire flight/airport circumstances.

Got stranded at the airport trying to fly to Kauai. We opted to stay here instead of sleeping in the airport. Room and bath was clean and comfortable. We had a king bed. Did not do anything but sleep and shower.

Paid months in advance for a King bed in a large room. Was told by the desk clerk at check in this was not available so we would be upgraded to a better room. We were put in a regular room with 2 double beds. We were only here for one night and was looking for a nice experience. That did not happen. Very noisy at night, hotel is in a industrial area next to the expressway. We also had to pay to park. Never again.

Great internet, great service, good rooms, good parking, good location! Would like to specifically mention Mercy, who kept my room up immaculately! I would also like to mention the woman at the front desk who checked me in ( I cannot remember her name), who was professional and gracious! This is not a fancy hotel, nor is it in Waikiki, but to me it is perfect!

Overall the hotel is nice but I recommend more attention to the employees because they are not cleaning the room very well. I spend big money to stay in the hotel and I would appreciate it if the bed sheet changed not just using the same cover for the rest of the stay!

Good: Rooms are clean, on site parking (not free), good free internet, housekeeping is fantastic, close to Pearl HarborBad: Right next to the highway (if noise bothers you), expensive foodSo this hotel has a lot of military and gov workers. The hotel knows this and charges accordingly. Meals are subsidized with vouchers for the military so the rest of the guests pay for the price hike. That being said the food isn't bad at all and there is rarely any wait. I've stayed here many times and I have (without exception) been put in a room facing the highway. Not sure why that is but maybe the other rooms are quieter. So be sure to ask for a room where you'd like to be.

Do NOT book this hotel, ever. Whatever you do or no matter how low the rate is do not book a room here-even if it is free. If your airline tries to make you stay here tell then no & get a different hotel (or just stay at the airport)We got stuck in this dump because our flight was canceled and this is where Allegiant stuck us. Our stay here started with walking to our rooms, sprinklers were on & housekeeping had their cart on the sidewalk (taking up the whole sidewalk) so we had to walk with all of our luggage through the sprinklers to get to our room.We got 2 rooms on the bottom floor, rooms 126 & 127. Room 127 smelled horribly, like a mixture of mold & cigarette smoke with maybe a smidgen of wet dog. Room 126 seemed better at 1st, it smelled better. It definitely had a cheap motel feel but it was what we were stuck with so we decided to make the best of it, we got settled & let the kids look around. That is when we found a giant cockroach by the pool-although I was somewhat fascinated-it was the 1st cockroach I've ever seen, I was also very grossed out, it felt dirty. Then we discovered rat traps a few feet away from room 126's door, also a giant moth waiting just above our heads walking to our 2nd room. My husband noticed snails on the side of the building. The sound of the highway was so loud each room had 2 sets of ear plugs in the room for you to use. We decided to leave for a bit to go get a bite to eat.When we came back there was a cockroach IN the room that smelled ok. We talked to the lady @ the front desk & her only reply was "Oh, that's a big one" Apparently cockroaches are a normal thing here. She would only change one of our rooms so we got a room on the top floor (room 1202) and then they kicked us out of the other room we had to keep(room 126) for hours so they could spray some sort of pesticide(apparently housekeeping does that here). Seriously. All of this and we have only been at this hotel a few hours......who knows what joys the night will bring. Wish us luck and please save yourselves and DO NOT STAY HERE! (a bit more expensive but I suggest the Aston Waikiki Beach Tower)P.S. If I could have given The Best Western Plaza Hotel no stars than I would have.Update: room 1202: while housecleaning knows how to spray for roaches they apparently don't know how to clean. There is hair all over the bathroom and other little bits of garbage as well. The "clean" sheets are nasty....I'm not sure if they are dirty or stained (pics attached of bed 1 & bed 2). I can't say anyone in the top floor room really slept last night-we were too busy hoping cockroaches would not come running out from under stuff.....good news we didn't see any up here. The rest of us in room 126 (the room we got kicked out of for a few hours so they could spray for roaches) survived the night. The guys were busy making jokes about the cockroaches giving them massages last night and carrying them to the shuttle bus this morning, so we really are trying to make the best of it but really save yourself the headache & stay elsewhere.

We just needed a bed for a night between arriving in Honolulu in the evening and departing for the Big Island the next morning. Decided it would be a waste of money to book a hotel with a good view or location. This was a practical choice. A typical American airport hotel with large rooms and friendly service. No frills, but everything you'd need for an overnight stop near the airport.

Mercy was our room attendant throughout our stay. Wonderful personality, very friendly and always in a great mood. Our privacy was respected, and our rooms were very well attended. Mercy was always on top of things and always greeting us with a beautiful smile. If you come here, ask for a room where Mercy attends. You will forever be great full. Food was great for breakfast and dinner. I was surprised of the variety they had on their menu. Service was excellent everywhere, host, servers, customer service and housekeeping. You won't regret staying here. If you haven't found hotel you were looking for now you have. Now enjoy some vacations and book now :)

Needed to break 16 hours of flying Stopped at Best Western Airport Hotel Clean everywhere,Good room,nice bed, plenty of hot water, Traffic noise loud and constant Pleasant staffAdequate restaurant Just what we needed Kinda pricey for what it was

This was the same hotel that I stayed in when I first came to island. They have upgraded the hotel and there added homeliness. Beau, Cyn and Fran were excellent at the front desk. They assisted me in getting situated upon my arrival. Amalia kept my room in fantastic condition and without blemish.

This was a nice hotel for a night between travel legs. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, and food was good for dinner at their restaurant. There is a McDonalds directly next door and a strip mall across the street with a Starbucks, sushi place, and smoothie place. Outdoor pool for the kids. Hotel provides free shuttle service to and from the airport.

This stay at the Plaza has been like all the past visit over 18 years that we have stayed here, we have always been treated like family.Our guest room has always been cleaned above our expectations thanks to Ms.Kylee.The Breakfast staff Ms. Techie and Mr. Michael were always friendly and made us feel like family.The front desk staff was always helpful and friendly especially Ms.Cyn, and the Management team Ms. Beau and Mr. Ralph were very friendly and caring about our comfort at the Hotel.The parking area in the front of the Hotel when signing in, needs to be improved some way?

I stayed here overnight on my way to Guam. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. Despite what others may have experienced my room was clean and spacious. The only downfall was there was construction going on which limited the use of the elevators but I didn't mind taking the stairs. The free shuttle is a huge plus as I was traveling alone with three bags. The shuttle driver couldn't have been more helpful if he wanted to. I would most definitely stay here again.

This place is perfectly fine for an airport hotel. It is over-priced but very convenient and it really helps to have the shuttle. We stayed here entirely because it was a convenient place to stay before our flight. I would not stay here for any other reason than to be near to the hotel. That's really where it earns its value. The shuttle driver is great. Positive attitude and really helps. Earned his tip for sure.The one big thing that they should add is breakfast. If it came with a free breakfast, the place would be better.

The rooms are very nice and clean and functional with mini ice box and microwave. Also have a great coffee maker. Each room has an ironing board with iron and a great shower with tub. Downstaires is a laundry room with washers and dryers and a great snack shop . The restaurant has good food but opens certain days of the week for dinners.

The beds are really small. We had 4 adults in a 2 double bed room, and the double beds were like a twin and a half. Plus there was no extra room in the room itself. The bathroom was super small, and we barely fit our luggage in the room. The carpet was brand new! The tv was nice. It was a perfect location to have McD's for breakfast and to pick up our rental car. The pool was closed when we got to the hotel, and we didn't have time in the morning to use it, so I have no input on that. The elevators are small, and the lobby had a weird smell in the morning. The free shuttle was great and our driver was super nice! Our check-in was very easy, as was the checkout.

This hotel has been nothing but amazing from the moment we landed in Hawaii. When we had no where else to stay we called Les and he helped us when Schofield inn wouldn't. Our housekeeping staff is by far the best we've had. Mercy makes sure to greet us everyday and figure out if there's anything more she can do for us. Rooms are nice and I can't complain. Front desk staff is very accommodating as well. If we ever find our way back here I'll definitely stay here .

I want to say that aside from the tub being clogged and having a broken cabinet in the room we checked into, the staff are so amazing. Thank you to Ralph, Raymore, Ken and Mana for the 5 star service.

We stayed here for our stop-over. Very convenient as just several minutes away from the airport. Free shuttle service was a plus. Nice place to stay for late arrive or early departure being so close to the airport.

Nice place to stay. Not a lot around the area to do. We had a corner room with two windows on the quite side. One window looks at mountains and ocean. One window looks at airport and ocean. Staff friendly made cab rides appointments for us. Ate at both restaurants one at sister hotel and one here. Both excellent food. No smells or anything.

To be frank, we were not expecting much from this hotel or from any Airport hotel, and we were not disappointed. Rooms are outdated; bathrooms so simple and austere that you feel at 'Boot Camp'; and a general decay of the place. On the positive side, Staff was friendly and we were served, punctually at 6:30, an excellent 'a la carte' breakfast. Since by no means it is a cheap hotel, it is time, Gentlemen, to cough up some funds to renovating the rooms and the hotel¡

My stay here at the Best Western has been more than accommodating. Marcy in house keeping has been there with every room concern I've had and showed great care for me and my families well being and comfort. Tracy And Raymart at the front Desk have been more than helpful in any and all questions that ive had from parking to paperwork. I would recommend this hotel two times over because of its staff and cleanliness alone.

My family PCSd to Hawaii and needed a hotel until we found a place. This hotel was conveniently located around the corner from airport and 2min to HWY also by shopping and restaurants. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper, Mercy, was very nice and detailed with our cleaning (we have an adventurous 1 year old) every morning. She even told us fun facts of the island and gave us family activities to do. My only negative is that we didn't have a suite. Because we were staying here for a month it would've been nice to have a mini kitchen, sink, and full fridge, but the microwave and mini fridge did help!

Even though my stay is not over yet, I really enjoy this hotel and the people. This is my first time to Hawaii and all I can say is "Wow". Amalia is an excellent person. She is so sweet and I'm glad to have her taking care of us while we enjoy our stay at this hotel. It feels more like we are family than just guest. Thank you Best Western Plaza ! ❤

You can expect great Hawaiian Hospitality when you arrive. The front desk staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and willing to help. The military liaison, Les will make your transition smooth. The room attendant, especially Amalia, would greet you with a smile and a short but sweet conversation of our day. She made sure our room was squared away. The rooms were renovated and now have a high quality feel! Even though you are in Hawai'i and next to a major freeway, the outside noise is minimal. You are centrally located so to go towards Hale'iwa, Waikiki, Wai'anae, and Kailua side, it's a bus ride away ($2.50 for adults) The amenities in the hotel are great. The pool, it is cold, but with a depth of 3 feet to 5 feet, you and children will enjoy. The restaurant has good eats for $10-$25. It serves breakfast and dinner. If you are military you have food vouchers. If you are not options around the area in walking distance include McD, L-n-L, pizza places, Subway, Jamba Juice, and other places (google it). Also the NEX is a mile walk from the hotel. We like best the renovated room, the convenient location, and most of all the friendly staff. The least, trivial, but if you are handicapable it is not trivial, is that one of the two elevators didn't work but, the problem was fixed fairly quickly. This hotel is pet friendly and the lower part of the hotel is in the process of renovation. That is where you go if you have pets.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Best Western hotel my last night in Hawaii after many years of living in Hawaii. My son and I had the pleasure of staying in one of the newer renovated rooms facing Diamond Head, per my request. We were staying there because of a job transfer to the mainland, I was wonderfully surprised at how beautiful the room was considering I had stayed there once before many years ago and needless to say that stay was not quite as pleasant as this stay was. The staff, Beau, Chris and the funny lady who called me out on not knowing how to work something as simple as the WiFi made a great stay. Thank you all for hospitality and especially your Aloha and Kokua it made our last night there quite memorable.

Convenient to the airport. Staff were very efficient and friendly. Nice size room, a bit noisy due to the freeway traffic, but not too bad. Swimming pool was fun. Restaurant had pretty good food. Great value.

When they provide ear plugs on the night stand it's a good indication there's a problem. The AC was extremely loud and the highway noise was worse. No elevator to second story with large bags. Lamp didn't work, shower leaked, and toilet didn't flush properly.

We arrived a bit early but wanted to check in because we had a meeting. Chandra was very helpful in obtaining a room and in making sure we had directions for our destination. The shuttle service to and from the airport was appreciated. The highway noise is a bit loud and the remodel is still in process. But in general, a very good stay.

My husband and I went to Honolulu for the 75th Anniversary of Pearl Harbor remembrance and couldn't have been happier with our location. Close to the freeway, the airport and all of the events made this hotel the best choice. We recognized that because of the proximity to airport and the city that it wouldn't be the most quiet location but it wasn't uncomfortable. Our room gave us the best views and was clean and comfortable. All staff was pleasant, friendly and helpful.

We needed a place close to the airport with a shuttle for an early morning flight. We had booked a place on line that said "near the airport" but when we arrived we found it was "out in the sticks". These guys saved our bacon with an instant reservation...we ended up in a recently refurbished handicapped room but it was a nice clean room with a comfortable bed. there is an onsite restaurant that is pretty good and the staff were very friendly and helpful.However....you know there is an issue when they provide earplugs next to the bed...and boy did we need them. We were on the 11th floor and literally looked out the window onto the highway. The airport with, with its attendant noise, is right behind you. And to top that off there was a VERY loud fan vent right over the bed that we could not turn off, no matter what we tried. If you are going to be desperate for a good nights sleep this may be a deal breaker!

While location is usually an asset, in this case it's a tremendous drawback due to the roadway noise which makes it impossible to sleep, even with the earplugs that the hotel provides. After flying for 23 hours and missing the final connection from Honolulu to Maui I was dead tired and still couldn't sleep. That's how bad it was. To add insult to injury, the airline refused to pay for the stay since the delay that caused me to misconnect was due to weather so I had to pay out of my pocket at a supposed discounted rate of $150. Way too high for this hotel, especially since I was there all of 5 hours as I checked in shortly after midnight and was up and out on the 5:30 AM shuttle. On the bright side, however, looks can be deceiving as I expected it to be a fleabag based on the exterior and lobby, but the room was very modern, the linens and towels were fresh and seemed to be fairly new and the room was spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable but the air conditioning unit runs constantly and there's no way to adjust the temperature which wasn't good on an unusually cool night, especially since there's no blankets. The woman at the front desk was extremely efficient and pleasant at check-in and the shuttle to the airport was spot on every 30 minutes. So, as the title suggests, the hotel has quite a few positives, but price and location are major negatives since, in this case, you don't get what you're paying for at this price point. But, if you're stuck without a rental car, like I was, and must spend a night or two, ask for a room away from Nimitz Highway, the major thoroughfare.

The best way that I can describe this hotel is noisy. Noisy AC unit, noisy bathroom fan, noisy room. The room itself wasn't terrible, it was clean. It was partially remodeled, new carpet, new sink and vanity, newer furnishings, OK beds and linens. The bathroom was still the old shower, toilet and tile. The noise from the street was awful! It woke me up at 5 AM, and I wasn't able to fall back asleep. It sounded almost like there was no door. The price for the room is way too high, and they charge $30 a day for parking in their garage. If you need to stay here, ask for a room away from the main road (Nimitz),

Pleasantly surprised by the standard of the room which must have been recently refurbished. The rest of the hotel looked pretty run down but they're renovating which generally leads to a lot of wear and tear on the lifts and corridors. It was raining so I didn't try the pool. Arrived late and left early. Shuttle was helpful and there are a couple of meal options within walking distance. Noisy but to be expected so close to the highway. Overall a good place to sleep before an early flight.

Checked in a few nights ago and ran into Beau and Ralph at the front desk. They are both really nice and very knowledgeable with Military TLA check-in. They helped me and my wife out so much that night and gave us so much information we needed to know about our stay. Best services from these two! Thank you!

This hotel is conveniently located within 5 mins of the HNL airport and the 30min shuttle service is great. I especially love the incredible staff at this location. The only thing I wish was better is the food choice in the area. I am a vegetarian and unfortunately there is not much of a choice when it comes to veg or vegan food in the area. It would be really awesome if the hotel offered some choices in this department.

The room was kept clean. The Restaurant was delicious - especially the Huli Huli Chicken - Get it. Get it again!The room service was very good!I went out in the hall to ask one of the housekeepers for some extra coffee for my room, and the housekeeper was very pleasant and gave me plenty.

I just stayed overnight on a layover. Hotel is efficient layover hotel. Airport shuttle comes every 30 minutes so was a long wait for pickup from airport. Room was basic but large. My hotel room overlooked an elevated expressway connecting airport and city. There is a fair bit of street noise but hotel provides earplugs.

Easy check in! I requested a room near the elevator & it was granted :). Keep in mind that the rooms near the elevator is on the freeway side, so its not for light sleepers. The front desk is busy & they have to use a speaker to talk to the parking gate. Lots of work for these GSA's. I hope they get paid more for being parking attendants. Rose, Cecilia, Pam, & Athena are great mutli tasking, concierges, & parking attendants.

Our first impressions were made walking down the manky corridor to our room. The security guard on patrol gave a friendly 'hello' which was both comforting and alarming at the same time (I suspect there was a uniformed security guard on patrol because the elevators don't restrict members of the public from accessing any floor they like).The room was functional, but the noise of the wind whistling against the building was horrendous. I won't mention the noise of the freeway since we expected some noise due to its location. In any case, this isn't the place to get any sleep.There is a McDonald's around the corner if you get hungry.The shuttle operated as expected, but we were forewarned to get in line early or risk missing out. Good advice.I would not stay here again.

Needed a place near the airport and this is the perfect selection. Shuttle service was quick and the entire staff (drivers, front desk staff, housekeeping and restaurant staff) are all very nice and courteous!

customer service is very good,and also helpful,big mahalo to Beau,Athena,and Cheri for there service.And room was very clean,a/c cold,just how i like it,also food is great and the shuttle service is very convenient.I would recommend this hotel again and again,u got my 5 stars;)

Thanks to Mena, Beau, Fran, and Sharon. Helpful, Pleasant, and Friendly. They always make sure you are comfortable and welcomed. The reason I stay at this hotel is because the folks that work there are helpful, polite, and pleasant.

Stayed for 8 weeks as wife was in hospital. Staff was very cooperative. The house keeper did an outstanding job. Left requests that she always completed. Sent out laundry weekly with excellent results. Shuttle pickup at airport worked really well. Shuttle drivers were excellent. Front desk staff helped me with every request. . Restaurant did a good job. Would recommend for a long term stay.

I was stranded at Honolulu airport by a UA flight delay on Nov 5 and was given a confirmed distress booking price of $149. The hotel failed to honor the confirmed price and tacked on taxes and fees to a total of $169.80 on checkout.I complained to the front desk clerk and she told me that she had no authority to change and will speak to the manager on my behalf. I left my email but never heard from them.Since I did not refund nor any notification, I assume that either the manager did not agree to honor the confirmed price or the clerk failed to notify the manager.The other downside of the hotel:1. Quite noisy as it is near the highway and airport.2. Wifi is kinda slow.3. No bottled water supplied.4. No breakfastAirport shuttle was ok.

I am in Honolulu on business and this hotel is one of few that are within the government approved rate. I am staying for 5 nights.  The accommodations were comfortable and the location was excellent. The free shuttle to the hotel was appreciated.  The courtesy and professionalism of Fran at the front desk was admirable. She took the time to properly check me in and went above and beyond to ensure I was well informed. Great staff and the accommodations were commensurate with the price. Cons: Highway noise, datedPros: Staff, Location, Pricing

Clean and tidy and always efficient at check in and out.....shuttle always on call to pick up from airport. A great transit choice. Also within walking distance to Pearl harbour (if a decent walker). Always first choice if wish to stay close to airport. only downside was on this stay my air conditioner was very loud! - but hey first world problem right!! ;)

I reserved a room at this hotel due to its proximity to Pearl Harbor. Next time I will stay closer to Waikiki even with the traffic. First, upon arriving I contacted the hotel for its shuttle pick up. A half hour later I was still waiting despite the fact the hotel being 5 minutes from the airport. I had to call a second time to request it. Frankly, I found the personnel to be unfriendly, at least based on what I would expect from professionals in the hospitality industry. While the front desk staff were able to respond to questions, there were no greetings or expressions of appreciation for being a guest. Lastly, the carpeting in the hallways were filthy and didn't look like they had been cleaned in years. The name Best Western is a misnomer. It should be called the "Worst" Western.

We had to come here from the Big Island for a medical procedure and needed to stay close to Pali Momi. I requested a room in a quiet part of the hotel and was given it. The room was clean and comfortable and there was a note from the housekeeper Amah's which said to contact her if we needed anything. There is a small store in the lobby which carries items you may have forgotten and it is reasonably priced. There is also a restaurant that serves breakfast daily and dinner on the weekend. The food was very good. All in all, our needs were sufficiently met !

I would like to thank Sharon and Fran at the front desk for being so helpful during my stay! I stayed for an extended period of time and they were helpful in getting me the best rate. They also were very friendly when I had questions. Thank you, I'll be back.Room 612

Our stay has been very pleasant. The staff greeted us with a warm smile and friendly attitude. The room service was excellent and our room attendant Mercy has been nothing but fantastic with her bubbly personality, always full of energy in making sure our room was clean and equipped with everything. I highly commend her and the services she has provided-such a great person to converse with.

I was PCSing into Hickam AFB and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. It was very convenient with the option of a meal voucher or parking pass every day. They really have their military TLA program figured out. The pool is nice, and the resturaunt, although spendy, is definitely worth it if you have the meal vouchers. Overall I would reccomend this or the Honolulu Airport Hotel to anyone who needs a temporary place while PCS as it is very Hickam and Pearl Harbor as well.

Upon our arrival to hotel all other hotels were booked. We called spoke to the military liason he got us a room no problem even waiver our pet fee. Fran from hotel staff was very helpful and nice she took care of us alot and seen that we had the best stay possible. When i come back um choosing this place no doubt.

I stopped at this hotel to and from Sydney, to break the long flights. It was expensive for a Best Western hotel, but I wanted the convenience, which I did get. But just as I dreaded, getting picked up at the airport by the hotel's shuttle was easier said than done. As others suggested, I called the hotel upon my arrival, but the lack of signage at the airport for a well defined pick-up point made it difficult -- the shuttle just zoomed by and it was not easy to spot the van, especially for someone who just stumbled out of the Baggage Claim area in a strange airport, at night.On the other hand, catching a shuttle from the hotel to the airport was no problem , as it did leave on-time every 30 minutes.The hotel itself is dated. The air control was iffy and the air flow was harsh. The shower head was sub-par. But I was thankful for a clean place to rest overnight, and the Internet (unsecured) connection worked well .On my return visit, I did get an early check-in (without charge) when I arrived around noon, but the desk clerk made it clear that it was a privilege for which I should be thankful. (I checked out at 5:30 AM the next day.)You can catch a bus going in town at a stop a short walk from the front of the hotel. Coming back by bus, the stop is on the other side of the street and you do have to cross a busy highway to get back to the hotel. There is a 24/7 McDonald's a short walk from the hotel, and a small strip mall nearby with some eateries.$2 for a small bottle of water from the vending machines in the hotel-- you are better off buying it from McDonald's. There is a small shop downstairs, but also expensive.One bright spot: I had a fantastic omelette at the hotel's restaurant.

Sharon on the front desk was very friendly and helpful. She gave me advice about their loyalty program and then signed me up personally. She also gave me some additional information that made the stay even nicer. It's nice to find people like that who seem to love their job . Thanks

there were rubbish underneath the bed from the first day I stayed up until I left...that tells me that they don't clean good....even trash by the night table. They weren't my trash, but left from the previous visitors.

This is the ideal hotel if you want to be close to the airport. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and again great location. As others have mentioned, attempt to get an airport view side room, as the roadside rooms are slightly noisy. Great stay, would stay again in a heartbeat. Thank you to the staff members: Michael, Mena, Beau, and the super cool shuttle driver!

Room is very clean, friendly housekeeping, specially Mercy and Grace they really make you feel at home...Front desk staff are so nice. the food and service was also great.we eat our breakfast in the hotel mostly daily.

Before coming here I received mixed reviews about this hotel. I decided to wait until I got here to be my own judge. Even though this hotel is very close to the airport and highway it is pretty quiet for the most part. My room was very clean and my house keeper Mercy was simply amazing throughout our entire stay. The hotel has a convenient store on the main floor that is decently priced and has most of the amenities you may need while staying there for a long time. The hotel manager and his colleague Ms. Beau were outstanding. I can't thank them enough for helping my husband and I with our military stay arrangements and making sure we weren't being bullied into something else at another hotel on post. I would say if you are PCSing to Hawaii from another duty station be advised of all the financial details required of you before moving here.

Hotel very clean with friendly staff. Close to the airport . Good for a stopover hotel.The housekeepers was very nice, like Mercy, she always was friendly and helpful.My stay was very pleasant. I spent only couple days because was not near to the beach. The food and service was great.

I stopped here twice on my recent trip. The first night we had a room beside the Motorway.... only good if you want an early wake up call next morning !! Second night my room looked out onto the airport runway, and it was a great view, and quiet. Rooms are big, clean, cool, and the beds are very comfortable.The elevators work well. The Staff are very friendly and helpful. Free shuttles to and from the Airport, and to the sister hotel every half hour. Lots of hot water for the bath. Coffee maker worked. I will definitely stay here again.

Needed a stopover hotel between a flight from Kona and a very early morning check in at the airport. Paid €175 room only (approx $196 at time of booking) on the internet.So, what did we get for the money? First off they have a shuttle bus which runs to and from the airport every half hour BUT they only pick up on request by phone, either cell phone or phones in baggage claim area. Had to wait 25 minutes for pick up.The decor in the hotel is a drab yellow and totally uninviting. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and the staff on reception polite and friendly. An hotel of this size should have a restaurant. It does but only on the weekend and Monday. To eat you on other days there is fast food a block away or you can take the shuttle bus which will drop you at a sister hotel where you can eat and charge the bill to your room. You are tied, of course, to the shuttle bus schedule. To return to your hotel you have to wait for that hotel's shuttle bus to take you back. This arrangement is annoyingly inconvenient, obviously done to cut costs and not for the convenience of the customer. Our room was on the eighth floor, level with the flyover on the Nimitz Highway and the windows are not double glazed so the noise level was high at all times. Whilst the hotel is very expensive for what it offers, there is no real choice on the airport and taking a shuttle to Waikiki hotels, which can be cheaper, brings the cost back up as well as the extra travel time.

Our flight was cancelled and had been booked to stay for 2 nights before our flight out. We had been at Best Westerns that did not make the cut, so was a bit apprehensive.The room was as good as it could be for this level, but what really surprised us was the restaurant. The food and service was great, considering that they were overwhelmed with many other passengers from our cancelled flight. The staff were pleasant and when the food finally arrived, it was nicely presented and tasty.We also had to have dinner there and the food was not expected to be as good as it was. Koodo to the owners for caring about the clients and providing a pleasant experience.The only drawback is that it was near the airport and highway, so a bit noisy and nothing nearby to see.

GOOD, I am very happy "MADELINE" housekeeping service for 5 star and over rating i will give 4 star and i hope when i return i can have the same room #815 and same house keeping "Madeline". Thank you!

The service here is outstanding. Workers are very friendly and professional. Housekeeper named Mercy is great. She always keep our room clean, neat, and make sure we have all necessities for the room. She is always friendly and professional. This hotel is my favorite. I will highly recommend this hotel to friends. Thank you so much.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and the room was fine. We booked a night here because we wanted to go to Pearl Harbor during our overnight layover on Oahu, and this hotel is 5 minutes from the airport and about 10 minutes from Pearl Harbor. The hotel checked our luggage while we visited PH and arranged for our taxi. The hotel has a free shuttle to/from the airport. The pool area was very pleasant, with palm trees and other flowering plants. The downside is that the hotel is situated right next to the Nimitz highway, so there is constant traffic noise at the outdoor pool. Unfortunately, the traffic noise is also heard indoors. Our room was on an upper floor, but we could still hear the traffic at all hours. If you are a light sleeper, wear ear plugs or avoid this hotel.

I needed a hotel with a shuttle to and from the Honolulu airport and this one was perfect! They are very close to the airport, and their staff were ALL very helpful and friendly. I think my bed there was the most comfortable one I've slept in! The sheets and pillows were top quality. Everything was clean and nice. An added bonus was my rental car agency just down the block!

We had the best experience staying at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel in Honolulu, Hawaii. Les, the military liaison was extremely helpful getting us set up during our move, making sure everything worked with our orders.Our room attendant Madeline was so sweet and made sure we had every thing we needed each morning. Thank you Les and Madeline for making our experience extra special!

We needed one night in a hotel near the airport to catch an early morning flight. This was extremely convenient. They have a free and fast airport shuttle. The hotel itself wasn't fancy but our room was clean and quiet. Just what we needed after many hours on a flight to Honolulu. I don't think I would stay here for a vacation because it is located under a highway but it met our needs and we would stay here again if needed for one night.

If you are military you should definitely stay here if you are looking for a place to stay. They have the best rate for your TLA. All the staff was very friendly. The food in the restaurant was good. There's an amazing pizza place across the street and there is a McDonalds too. I stayed here for 60 days and I don't really have any complaints. Our dog got out of Quarantine half way through our stay and they had no problem putting us in a pet friendly room. Fran was my favorite! She helped me with all my TLA paperwork and with my check in and check out. I would definitely stay here again.

Free shuttle from airport, quick check in, pleasant staff, clean room, great corner room view, quiet night of sleep, quick check out, immediate shuttle to airport--just what we needed in a one-night layover in Honolulu. Biggest surprise? Terrific, terrific dining room experience. Staff was excellent and could be working in finest restaurants in Honolulu. Attentive, knowledgeable, and caring with all diners, including big families. Food? Absolutely excellent home cooking. Variety on menu and each dish seemed to please diners around the room. Comfort food was terrific after ten days of fancy meals. Again, staff was perfect.

Immediate free shuttle pick up, swift and professional check in, a comfortable and functional room, fine breakfast options, and an easy return to the airport. This is just what we needed, after arriving late at night after a long flight, and then departing to another island the next morning. We will always stay here, when connecting through HNL overnight, or staying over for a couple of nights. Waikiki is accessible by city bus, but only if you want that experience. If you would prefer peace and quiet, just stay here. A fine place!

It was ok. The pool was nice but the WiFi was a little slow. The room was really small. The food was ok not good, but not bad. What I was impressed the most about was the Airport Shuttle. It was really fast and I was able to get to the airport on time.

Could not get breakfast on the first morning because of an out going cruise. Air conditioning did not keep the room cool. Parking spaces are very tight. The staff was really nice. Fitness center needs some updates; treadmills were out of order.

We chose this hotel for its price and proximity to the airport. While there was some highway and aircraft noise, it didn't disturb our sleep. It was definitely adequate for our needs. We had requested a room with two queen beds, but were given a room with one king bed. That error was quickly resolved. The concierge suggested an excellent seafood restaurant that was nearby. In fact, that was one of our best meals on the trip. The check-in/check-out staff could have been friendlier, though.

This is a great clean friendly hotel the restaurant has amazing food the WiFi is awesome and fast and the parking is easy cheap and convenient merey did a great job with housekeeping no complaints. They get my business hands down

The rooms are very comfortable. Beau, Mena, Madeline and entire staff was pleasant. They consistently went above and beyond their principle duties to ensure all of their clients had nice experiences at the hotel. The military liaison, Les, is absolutely great in making the military service members transition in and out of Hawaii a smooth experience. I'd choose this hotel again, and again, and again.

The rooms are nice. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and there is a little shop on the lobby level floor. And it's Hawaii!Mercy in housekeeping is cheerful and does an excellent job!

So we've been here for about 2 weeks and it's been a great experience (especially with two toddlers). Service and amenities are really great (there's cribs!). Housekeeping staff is on point! Our regular housekeeper Mercy is alway quick and detailed. However, the restaurant downstairs has been better. The pasta dishes are the best part, but burgers and sandwiches a bit soggy for my liking.

The staff at best western was amazing. From our room attendant Madeline, front desk Mena, Marcy and all the servers at the restaurant were very friendly and did their best to make sure we were taken care of.

Mena at check in was very accommodating and helpful. She greeting with smile and very informative on hotel facilities. Annie on 10th floor housekeeping truly spread the Aloha Ohana spirit. Both ladies very pleasant.

This hotel is only about 3 minutes from the airport, but you don't have the airport noise. The room was clean and everything worked. It is about a minute from H1 and a 20 minute drive to the beaches. A great place if you want a quieter hotel without all the hubbub.

Hotel has good staff and rooms are airy and clean. Fast food are very close to this hotel location and they offer parking at minimal rate. indeed it is very close to airport but there is no noise of planes etc. We enjoyed our stay at best western and recommend it to new guests with family, couple and single as well.

My trip started with a call to Les the military liaison. Very efficient, had my reservation setup in seconds. Upon arrival the staff greeted me like their family member coming in for a visit. Athena, Beau and Fran gave outstanding service with big smile each time I need assitance. My stay was extended twice which required portfolo adjustments. No problem, accommodation where made in only a couple of minutes. Norma T. kept my room extremely clean and tidy. She knew my work schedule and insured the room was in immaculate condition upon my return. All supplies were freshly stocked and I could rest undisturbed. This is not my first stay nor my last with the great folks a The Plaza. Thank you all.

Looked great in the advertising but upon arrival a different story. The hotel has attempted to keep up with the times, bedrooms were great but the airport and its extended businesses have taken over the area. At one time it was a fantastic hotel by the side of Nimitz Highway but has since had a freeway constructed in front. The overhead freeway provides shelter for several transients who frequent the Hotel shop for alcohol. I was there for business in Wahiawa so this was the closest I could get. All the customers appear to be military personnel transitioning in or out of the several facilities nearby. Staff were great and really friendly. Hate to bring the place down but their location does it for them. I was on a rear facing room overlooking the airport and never really noticed noise from aircraft, but I am sure the customers at the front didn't enjoy the constant traffic. Parking was $30 a night but they reduce it to $15 if you sign up for a Best Western rewards card. I could have stayed cheaper in Waikiki.

Location: near airport, H1 freeway access, central to points east and west of Oahu Room: clean, well-maintained, above average amenities, secure RFID locks Parking: ample and within hotel structure, electric vehicle hook-ups WiFi: excellent...apparently underwent a $100K upgrade Fitness center: small but has LifeFitness treadmills, 6 am-10 pm Staff: professional, courteous, helpful and friendly Hotel shuttle: to/from airport Guests: primarily military, retired, business Misc.: 24hr. McDonalds next door, Starbucks and restaurants in area Summary: whenever I visit, I notice improvements to the hotel and guest services

Stayed here for 3 weeks on a business trip, and the best experience for me was the service of the room attendant that was assigned to my room, Amalia. Always kept my room clean, and well stocked daily!

After missing a flight to Sfo not knowing its 1 flight a day we were bummed, mad and tired. We had option of staying at the airport until 1pm and its 2pm previous day so we said screw closer the better but price wasn't within the budget but after consideration and debate we decided here and thank god we did. Not the usual hussel and bussel in waikiki and staff here more attentive, friendly, CARING, and close to airport. On our way to room lovely MERCY OR MARCY was cleaning a room on our way out of elevator but could probably hear my moaning and ranting about Hawaiian Airlines to my fiance so she asked if there were any particular needs or help with anything that we needed. Thank God for that cuz I needed a breath of fresh air haha. Anyways glad we stayed here for the night. Staff is EXTREMELY friendly helpful and kind. Just what I needed on a bad Day. Thanks Guys.

Check in staff was very friendly. Room - yes, a little noisy since it's right by the freeway. Basic room - but meet the good Best Western standard. Right next to a McDonald's, walking distance to a strip mall that has some very good price meals - Ninja Sushi, Korean BBQ. Not exactly in a tourist location - it's in an industrial area.Free parking is very nice. Yet during our 2-night stay there our validated parking didn't work for 4 times! It was a hassle to call the front desk at the gate every time we tried to leave.

Spent one night here on the way to Guam. Very friendly staff and basic rooms. McDonald;s next door (no restaurant) but a well stocked store in the lobby with sandwiches and drinks. They have a sister hotel that they shuttle folks to for dinner a few nights per week. Free pick up for the airport though. Shuttle left every half hour. Housekeeper named "Annie" very friendly.

It was conveniently located close to our car rental place and the airport. It was clean and offered a nice breakfast in the morning. We didn't use the pool because cause we got there late but there was plenty of parking available.

All respect to all bosses & staffs who does a great job here. It’s a great place to stay it was lovely clean comfy staff was extremely friendly caring pleasant approachable very helpful & excellent wifi. The atmospher really felt like home highly recommend this hotel.

My overall experience was very positive, it's a centrally located hotel getting in and out was very easy; my housekeeper Amalia is awesome I give her a 10 out of 10. I'm looking forward to comeback in the near future. A thousand thanks!! Keep the good job from now on you can count with a new guest

Our US Army Hospital unit had set up all the soldiers here at the Best Western on Nimitz. The rooms we're clean and decent size for 2 ppl. They offered free parking for any hotel guest which was great. The outdoor pool area was a nice retreat after work. Mahalo to our room attendant Annie, we always had fresh towels, our beds made up perfect, and a nice clean room every afternoon when we would return from work. It was a pleasurable experience. Mahalo for the hookipa!Aloha

Enterprise rental car is walking distance and you can leave you key in the lobby drop box when you take the hotel shuttle to the airport. There is a restaurant in the hotel but my wife and I simply stocked the fridge and used the microwave to save bucks.

I would go back there " if they made the rooms sound proof." The sound from the HWY kept us awake most of the night. The shower rose needs replacing. as do the pillows. Good bed thou. Good location, close to the airport.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for over 40 days. The room was very comfortable and clean. I really liked the hotel staff. Very customer oriented. The front desk staff was very welcoming and friendly. The bellhop was extremely helpful and always kept a smile on his face. I especially liked my housekeeper Amalia. Amalia always provided amazing service. She always helped us with anything we needed to know about the hotel and island. My kids loved her and would give her a hug every time they see her. Continue providing the good quality excellent service.

Firstly I wish to convey my immense gratitude to Reid, Front Office Manager, for exceptionally fast replies to all my emails which helped me very much. Many thanks to all other staff especially Beau (front desk). I stayed twice during my trip and both rooms were very clean and comfortable which is important to me. I like the mural on the ceiling in the foyer. It adds to a relaxing, as well as professional atmosphere upon arrival. There was a phone with a direct line to the hotel for the shuttle at the International Airport arrival terminal, (on the left along with all the other phones after walking out with my luggage), which also helped as I was not making or receiving calls with my cell. I highly recommend this hotel.

My 49 days at this hotel was great. The air conditioning is super cold, u can leave your food out of the fridge and it wont go bad. One of our highlight of the stay was the people at the hotel were so friendly. But my our number one or top employee was Ms. Amalia our housekeeper. She is a super star. She was very passionate about her job and gave the highest quality of service at all time. Both my wife and me work at the Frenchman’s reef Marriott in the US Virgin Islands St. Thomas for 5yrs before I join the navy and we have to say that Ms. Amalia stands out above all at the Best Western plaza. Her skills and services is up there with the best of the best. Bravo Zulu. You made our stay enjoyable.

The hotel is located right next to the airport. It's a busy hotel but a very nice one. The staff is very friendly,kind and helpful and we really felt welcomed. Our stay was a week long and Madeline really helped us out. She had wonderful suggestions that really helped us out. I can't thank her enough for making us feel welcomed.

I enjoyed my stay. the staff made sure that my family was safe. This is a top notch hotel. I would stay here over and over again.I certify that this review is my genuine opinion of this hotel, and that I have no personal or business affiliation with this establishment, and have not been offered any incentive or payment originating from the establishment to write this review

I cannot say enough wonderful things about our housekeeping lady Annie! She went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed in our room. She introduced herself on our first day at the hotel and got to know us on a personal level throughout our 3 weeks stay. She was so sweet! Thank you Annie!

Our House Keeping Lady who works on the 8th Floor, Named Madeline is so sweet and takes care of our room when we aren't able to. Janice(Cashier) & James(server/waiter) down in the Dinner Cafe are awesome!Definitely made our stay worthwhile

I was very impressed by the genuine politeness and helpfulness of the staff. Amalia and Gina-- housekeeper and manager housekeeper were very good at keeping my room clean. They were very polite and genuine. I would stay here again. The hotel is coneniently located bt the airport, but I never heard the airplanes. There is some Freeway noise, but minimal. Honolulu is about 8-10 miles down the road.

I had an extended stay here and Amalia ensured my room was nice and clean everyday. She was always pleasant during our interactions. Also, Sharon at the front desk was very helpful as well. I would stay here again.

You can expect a very nice reception from the free airport shuttle service to the check in staff, restaurant staff and the guests that are primarily military--most of whom give you a sense of security because they are coming and going at all times. Room was exceptionally cleaned and restocked daily. Maids are very good. Air conditioning was super and I could have stored meat outside the fridge!

I so wish I could give this hotel a better rating because everyone who I have been helped by or those who work in this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful. They really have an awesome staff. My low rating is really because of the dated hotel along with the price you pay. I've stayed at many best westerns and have loved all of them except this one. It is not because it's not clean because the hotel is actually really clean. It's because it's dated and looks a little run down. Seems like with the amount of money that is made, they could do some renovations.Most hotels here in Hawaii are expensive but many of them ( especially downtown are renovated and look great and around the same price) The other downfall is the bed situation. The beds are full size beds ( not queens) they do have king size beds but with no pull our sleeper sofa option. My husband lift weights and is built with broad shoulders and big arms. It's so hard sleeping in a tiny full size bed comfortably. We couldn't get king size bedroom bc there was no additional sleeping arrangements for my kids unless we purchased another room that conjoined ours. . At 230+ a night that was out of the question. The rooms are a decent size and being that the hotel is about a block from the airport the noise level is low and I can barely hear them of any at all. Bathrooms are a little small but manageable. Parking is insane here and very tight but that is the norm for this area. Food: the restaurant in the hotel is decent. I like the breakfast and have tried many of the menu options.
