Dinner is good depending on what is ordered. Now for military personnel this hotel has a wonderful liaison that has put together an awesome program and package for military. They offer things that no other hotel will do for military and their families. I would consider coming back to this hotel bc of the staff. If renovations were made I would 100% come back and stay with this best western.

There are not too many hotels in this area. It is close to Keehi Lagoon where we had a Championship Event. It is close enough to walk to. They have an airport shuttle also which is nice. Room was very large. It was great that you couldn't hear any traffic noise. It's located between the airport and the freeway

Everything has been amazing! We arrived 8/2 and every accommodation has been met! Fran Beau has been so helpful since the day we stepped foot in the hotel. She has been able to answer every question and give amazing advice seeing as how we have PCSd here and didn't know everything we needed to (thanks army ). We love having breakfast here every morning, Michael is usually our server and we LOVE him! He remembers the little things down to the amount of creamer I enjoy in the mornings w my coffee I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone especially pcsing w the military.

We are here because of my hubbies job. The restaurant is good, with very good servers, but after a couple of weeks the dinner or breakfast gets old. It would be nice if there was some kind of buffet that changes every night(like one night Hawaiian, the next Asian, the Italian and so on) so you can pick and choose what you would like to eat.We did have wonderful Housekeeping service. Her name is Annie and she was always really nice to us and our kiddos and made us feel welcome.The location was great. Really close to the airport, you can basically walk there but unfortunately that also includes some noise. Having the interstate go right by the hotel is a minus too since it is noisy all night long. Some rental car agencies are within walking distance in case you need a car. Public bus transportation is available too with a bus stop right outside the hotel.

Stayed here for 3 weeks for training. Clean rooms and great room service! Recommend for everybody. The only downside is that they charge $15 a day for parking. Other than that, my experience here was excellent. A nice pool outside and a little gym on the 12th floor.

The location of the hotel is only a few blocks away with a free shuttle. The price of the hotel is comparable to other hotels on the Island which is in the above $200 price range. You are paying for the location here, same amenities elsewhere would probably only cost you a fraction of the cost. Also, parking is available for $30 a night. Warning: parking is tight! There also times that they are full, but they allow you to park on the sides of the ramp when it's full, just make sure do not forget to put your parking pass on your dash board so you don't get towed.

Great place to stay. Great service...convenience location. Friendly font desk. Convenient and easy-access to parking. Friendly and helpful customer service from all employees. Wi-fi room connection excellent speed...I finished a lot of my work in-room and I did not have to leave my room to get work done.

It was the best customer service, very affordable, and very good hospitality with an amazing customer service. Thank you Cecilia from the front desk, you did an amazing job and for that i Thank you. Thank you for enrolling me into the points system, and being able to use it one day as reward program. Great breakfast and everything.

I've found this BW to be very convenient when catching the early morning flight to RMI. There's a 24 hour shuttle service, a restaurant that is open several nights a week, and it's close to a NEX small store within walking distance. It's best to get a room towards the back of the BW if you don't like freeway noise.

We stayed here for 53 days while we waited for our house to become available. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating and offered suggestions on places to visit. Our housekeeper, Norma, did a fantastic job at keeping our room tidy and was very flexible about coming back to our room if we had not yet left for the day. The hotel was conveniently located to a variety of places to eat, some were within walking distance. We were not located in the middle of the hectic downtown crowd and were able to easily access the major highways.

Called when I arrived to check my reservation and was told My name was not on their list of guest for the night. Had to call provider to get reservation which when I presented it to the guest the found my name easily. it was an unnecessary scare since it was a Friday

*We are military and currently staying here for 11 nights.*Our pleasant experience began the minute we walked through the lobby entryway. We were greeted by cordial, affable receptionists who were able to efficiently check us in. Make sure to be a Best Western rewards member-- the points add up! From the front desk, a welcoming bell-hop was able to help us into our room with our heavy loads of luggage-- don't forget to tip! I've heard of the hotel offering a promissory note to military using TLA, but this is not the case for outbound families as we are. We were told that is only available for inbound. Either way, it wasn't a big deal. We paid upfront for all 11 nights and are able to pick up the receipt early, showing a zero balance, to take back to our command to begin the reimbursement process.We were given $30 ($10/person) in meal ticket vouchers for the cafe per day. Four nights a week, meals are offered here in the downstairs of this hotel. On Tuesday-Thursday, it is served at their sister hotel down the road. A free shuttle offers transportation and leaves from the lobby every 30 minutes. Breakfast and dinner are served daily-- no lunch. It's casual, sit-down dining and I'd say the average meal costs about $13 or so. You can order as cheap or as pricey as you want. You will be left to pay the remaining difference as well as tip. The portions are very generous and taste about average. My favorite so far has been the spaghetti bolognese and my husband's is the fettuccine chicken alfredo; both are served with garlic toast. There is a mini-mart located downstairs next to the lobby as well selling anything from souvenir T's to ice cream sandwiches. We are in a deluxe King, corner-room suite. The bed isn't our Tempur-pedic, but very comfortable, none the less, and the bedding is very soft. The AC works great for those coming from AC-less housing in town like us! Our room features large windows with views of the airport, Diamond Head, and the ocean in the far distance. Our room is the biggest I've ever stayed in... it's HUGE. Even with 3 large suitcases sprawled out and many other bags, we still have plenty of room to walk around and for my 6 month old to crawl and play. We also have a microwave, mini fridge, cable TV, dresser drawers, cabinet space, and the bathroom is a decent size; featuring a large vanity, and bathtub with shower head. The housekeeping staff has been helpful, attentive, and always very accommodating to our needs. Mercy and Emerita have been taking care of us and are exceptional! Anytime we need extra towels or trash taken care of (so many diapers with an infant), they are there to immediately meet our needs in the friendliest way possible. They were also able to provide a crib in our room upon time of arrival. Parking in the garage is free, just bring in your ticket to the lobby for validation. Also, the free wifi is great and has given us zero problems. Connecting is simple and you're allowed up to 4 devices. There are USB charging ports built right into the table, which is wonderfully convenient. Side note, we don't personally have pets, but I do know they are allowed! Another perk, is the pool! It's never crowded and there's towels poolside as well as tables and loungechairs. The hotel's location isn't bad either. It's not in the middle of Waikiki's hustle and bustle and close enough to basically anywhere you'd like to go. Very convenient Honolulu location. Less than 10 minutes to Pearl Harbor. As far as nearby food, there is a Micky D's within walking distance as well as a Starbucks like 3 minutes away. Next to Starbucks is Blimpie's subs, Ninja Sushi (order the Superman roll!), and Big Kahuna's (the BEST garlic cheese balls, everything is made to order)-- and cash only, ATM located outside! I honestly cannot say enough good things about this place. It may not be a resort, but I don't think anyone coming here is expecting that. For what's it's worth, our stay has already exceeded our expectations. If we are ever stationed here on island again, we will certainly be making a second visit to the Best Western Plaza Hotel.

traveling from oz to mainland USA we paid for 2 nights so our room would be available on arrival at 8am to break up the journey. The hotel is convenient to the airport, the room was adequate and clean.They have a sister hotel 2 blocks away but no lunch was available at either hotel.. They didn't have their restaurant open on a Thursday so sister hotel we went,typical American cuisine, very family friendly and the food was typical budget eating. There is no bar in either hotel. Not an enjoyable stay and on our return to Oz we will spend more time in Waikiki.

I'm giving this hotel an overall four stars, but if you are traveling on a military relocation with TLA and have pets, it's five stars all the way. No, it's not a resort, but you aren't on vacation, you are trying to find a place to live and get out of there. McDonald's is right behind the hotel, and although I am personally not a fan, I can see how this would be very convenient for many families. Also walk-able are a Starbucks, jamba juice, ninja sushi and some other quick lunch type places. The restaurant in the hotel is good. Nothing crazy, but you can get a good solid meal here. You can easily score an uber or lyft to take you anywhere in town that you would like to go. It cost us about $15 to get into Waikiki and enjoy all the perks of the Hale Koa and other resorts. Here is a tip, in order to use the "resort" at Hale Koa, all you need is a military ID. I believe you can also park for free with your military ID. So if you are feeling deprived of the resort experience, just head on over there and enjoy the pools, beach, etc. The best thing is that this hotel actually caters to you as a family on TLA. You will book through Les, who is the military coordinator. He is passionate about providing a good experience for those of us who have just completed an overseas move. The rate you will be charged is calculated so that including tax it will total the TLA rate. No extra out of pocket. Additionally, parking fees and pet fees are waived. Parking is meant to be $30/night and pets $30/night per pet. The waiving of these fees saved my family $90/night. The pet policy for military is literally any pet up to 500lbs. We had our two larger dogs and it was comfortable. If you have pets, you will stay in the courtyard which is well appointed with grassy areas and poop-bag stands. The only downside to this is that there is no elevator for those staying on the second floor. It was an extra challenge to get all of our stuff in, but you make it work. If you don't have pets, you stay in the main tower and I believe you get other perks like meal vouchers to use at the restaurant. We had to attend a one hour meeting explaining all of this, which was kind of a drag, but there was free pizza and it was worth it to keep all of the perks (free parking etc). During the meeting I learned that the hotel will even give you a "promissory note" if you can not afford to pay out of pocket before being reimbursed TLA. I feel like this could be a big deal to some families, and is unheard of in this day and age at any other place. Additionally, the staff here is SUPER nice and accommodating. Always smiling and kind. The gym is decent. There were two treadmills, but one was broken during our stay. Also a universal gym, free weights, an elliptical, stationary bike, and medicine balls. It worked for me and I never had to wait for the one treadmill that was working. The view is pretty cool as the gym is on the top floor. They also have a little convenience store that has any basic items you might need. Also, free wifi, small coffee pot, mini fridge and microwave in the room.

Nice hotel with attentive staff. Rooms had microwave and fridge. Excellent internet access. Close to airport for trips to other islands. The complimentary shuttle was nice. It runs every 30 minutes 24 hours a day. When calling for a pickup at the airport never had to wait longer than 10 minutes.

Just 2 miles from the airport, with free shuttle, this hotel is excellent for stopover for tourists hopping over to other islands.We were assigned 2 connecting rooms even tho I had neglected to ask for this feature. The reservation manager is very considerate., much appreciated by our family of 7 in 3 generation. The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable, wi-fi works well. The rooms are not large, but adequate, one should not expect large rooms, because this is not a resort hotel, nor did I book a presidential suite. We are very happy with the arrangement.Only problem is, breakfast is not included, which I thought all Best Western hotel chains are. Now I know. Also, parking is $30 a day.

Excellent service, nice amenities (workout room with dumbells, pool, laundry, comp paper, fridge and micro in room). A little worn (carpet and doors). But excellent service. Grace who took care of the room did an excellent job, Mena and Fran at the front desk were on the spot and competent. Harold the shuttle driver was helpful and pleasant.Very good for business travelers. Away from the noise of Waikiki and close to the airport. During my 4 week stay I traveled to other islands 2X/week. The shuttle was very efficient and on time. Also the hotel has parking, which is a problem throughout Honolulu.

My family arrived in Hawaii just a week ago and it has been non stop moving. We are so thankful for the helpful and attentive staff at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. The staff is extremely knowledgable and helped make it easy for us to maneuver around especially without a vehicle. Our housekeeper/hospitality attendant, Mercy, is FABULOUS! She has made our stay here very comfortable. Although, I know she has many rooms to attend it's as if she takes a personal interest in making sure everything is just right and especially clean. Especially thank you Les- the military liaison and Mercy- housekeeping.

Our room attendant, Amalia, went out of her way each day to make us feel welcome! She greeted us cheerfully each day, the room was spotless, and we felt like we were truly being taken care of during our two week stay.Having been in business for 30 years, I can tell you that Amalia is the kind of employee you want on your team. She makes every guest (including my wife and me) feel welcome and appreciated.Thanks AmaliaMario Marcozzi and Lynn CheddarJuly 17, 2016

Arriving exhausted in the late evening with very limited options for food and drink we were so very pleased at the helpfulness of the staff. They offered many near by options and even took my boyfriend via shuttle to pick up our order. The following morning they facilitated our visit to the Arizona memorial and allowed us to have a late checkout. It was so nice to be able to return to our room and clean up before getting on a plane again. Kudos to Chris and Athena for all you did!

Arrived at 2 am in morning, reservation was rooms were not available and the hotel was old, small and next to the freeway. Stayed the night checked out at 9 am the next morning with no breakfast. The airport location is terrible and so very loud.

My husband and I took this trip because he had tech school for Chevy. I came a long because I had not ever been to Hawaii. The one thing I learned very quick is people in Hawaii are so very nice. Annie our room attendant was amazing. She came in the first day to take care of my room and I was so completely impressed. I was eating the best pineapple on the planet. Annie showed me on a map where I could go and see my pineapple grow. Pointed out all the must sees for my husband and I to go see. We are here a short time and trying to get as much as we can in. So very helpful took her time to show me around the island from our hotel. Best western you are very lucky to have such a great employee. I thank her for taking such great care of us on our very short stay. Mahalo!!

I would like to say Thank you to my 10th-floor housekeepers Annie and Fely. They were attentive, made our stay very welcoming, they provided great service and made our room look good every day. We stayed at the hotel for a month and they made us feel like family . We really appreciate all their hard work. You guys would truly be missed. MAHALO!

The staff was pleasant and helpful. The maids were fantastic. Like all things in Hawaii, the food was expensive. The breakfasts are not for free like in most of the Best Western Hotels. However, the food was good and plentiful. This hotel has an evening meal but not on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday nights (which is when I was there). They did provide a free shuttle to another hotel where there was dinner available on those nights (just a few blocks away). The one dinner I had there was very good and not too expensive. Overall I found the hotel to be very relaxing and comfortable with plenty of business amenities.

I would like to commend my 6th floor Housekeeping lady, MERCY.She was very attentive to detail, provided a great service and nothing was too much trouble. She was also very friendly and cheerful and my stay a pleasure.Thank you Mercy.

This has got to be one of the best airport hotels I have ever stayed at. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was awesome. The sheets were high end. The location is optimum. Will stay here again.

I paid for two rooms through Hotelsone, and when I arrived in Honolulu Best Western had only one room for me and three other people. The hotel was completely booked and the woman at the counter was zero help. The staff is terrible. The restaurant closes early, and apparently they don't know how to keep reservations. Do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel.

This hotel is clean and well-managed. It is very close to the airport. There was a a McDonald's next door, and several restaurants close by. Parking is not free, but they allow in and out at a daily rate. The property is adjacent to an elevated highway, so ask for a room on the opposite side. There is a huge sound difference. Our friends' room on the highway side was noisy all night, while ours was very quiet. The staff is quite friendly and allowed us a 1 pm late checkout at no extra charge.

I was booked here for business. It is basically at the airport on H1! The hotel has been updated and the facilities are quite nice. The have an outdoor pool and a parking garage if needed, that is secure. There is a restaurant in the hotel that operates for breakfast and some days for dinner. The sister property one block away has a restaurant that operates the other days for dinner.The staff is really great and they bent over backwards to accommodate everyone! This hotel gets a lot of military personnel and the hotel staff is very understanding and helpful!The rooms are quite large and comfortable. They include a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. They even provide ear plugs incase the highway noise bothers you!

The employees here do everything possible to please their guests. We had quite a rough start but because of the calm and caring efforts of the employees, the bump in the road eventually got worked out.The room was clean and, despite some major disrepair and wear and tear throughout the room and bathroom, it was nothing so disgusting that it would scare someone away. However, don’t expect anything about the room or facility to be in the modern or appealing décor. The room was dated, the hallway not inviting, and this establishment is in desperate need of renovation, as other reviews have noted. If you want modern, updated, no disrepair showing, then choose another motel as this one is not for you. For the extremely budget conscious family, they might make the effort to make a stay here worth it but that is a highly personal decision. It is also very noisy due to the major highways just outside the facility. The motel we were told was here first, but then came the highway that was placed right outside their front door. If you get a room on the side of the freeway, it seems it would be quite difficult to sleep. Even the room we were assigned on the backside of the motel is significantly noisy but tolerable. It seems it would hold true, as other reviews have noted, to get a room on an upper floor and preferably one not facing the highway.There is a restaurant but when it’s not open, the restaurant at their sister-facility just a bit down the road is open and they alternate the days each are open and closed. The free shuttle will pick-up and return guests on the days their facility’s restaurant is closed. For breakfast, the restaurant does not open until 6:30 a.m., which frankly, even for us ended up being too late to meet our need since we needed to catch an early flight. The time they open seems a bit too late because this facility caters to those needing to catch a flight and the military who are being stationed in Hawaii. Also, their free motel shuttle only provides rides to and from the airport every half hour and runs 24 hours. The shuttle drivers were also extremely efficient, helpful, and friendly. Do consider leaving a daily gratuity for housekeeping. They work so hard to keep the guests comfortable and the room clean and tidy. Just a couple of dollars always shows them that the guest appreciated their efforts. While traveling over the years, I’ve talked to many housekeepers and they work diligently and rarely get recognition for the effort from the guests. We’ve always carried the motto that “no one is going to clean up our mess” and we make every effort to help housekeeping out by making the room as easy to clean as possible such as gathering all the towels into one place, throwing away trash, keeping the floor and the room free of our belongings being tossed around the room, etc., and upon our exit we make a point to throw all soaps and other used amenities in the trash, saving the housekeeper from having to clean up after us.

I think after all of the fees/taxes the standard room comes out to $260. There are only two hotels (next to each other) that are close to Honolulu Int'l Airport. The staff is very nice, the rooms are clean. There is a restaurant that is open for breakfast and closes at 10:30AM I believe. The food is really good, at a tourist price. Average about $15 for breakfast. I rented a room in this hotel because it is closest to my parents house (as opposed to Waikiki)... a room at Waikiki was actually a little less expensive. We are talking about "location". I live on Oahu, so I was thinking, if I was a tourist and got stuck overnight at the airport and had to be at the airport early, then of course, I would choose to stay at the Best Western by the airport. BUT, if my flight got cancelled and I had to make a decision to enjoy Waikiki one more night and could arrive at the airport late the next day, then I would choose to stay in Waikiki. I have nothing bad to say about the Best Western --- staff was nice, food was good, room was simple and clean. That's all that I was looking for.

Our room was great, clean, nice TV with many channels, while small the bathroom had exactly what we needed for our stay. The issues we had came from the employees of the Hotel. While many were great and most were friendly overall, a large portion of the front desk workers were rude, short, and/or hateful. If you are the type of person or family that are able to avoid needing good friendly customer service during your stay than this is a great place. If you have questions or make a mistake or two by not knowing how to stay at their hotel, than I suggest booking a different hotel.

Free fast wifi. Old rooms but clean and spacious. TV with lots of channels (+BBC). Cafe that serves ok food and Kona beer. Very well staffed. Shop inside. There's an airport shuttle that only takes 5 minutes. It will pick you up at the airport if you know where to find it (between baggage area E & F across the road)It's right beside a big freeway overpass so, really, don't choose this as your hotel for a Honolulu vacation. If you are spending one night near the airport then this is great.Tip: Get a room up on the 11th or 12th floor to be away from the freeway noise. The bruschetta in the cafe is very salty and garlicy so maybe stay away from that.

We stayed at this hotel on our final night in Oahu after a week's stay on the island. It's a basic accommodation without the glamour or the expense of Waikiki or a resort. Access is good from the Nimitz highway, but pay attention to the one way streets. If you have a morning flight, you could drop off your rental car earlier and walk to this hotel and take the shuttle to the airport. Otherwise the parking charge is $30 per day unless you sign up for the Best Western card and then the parking rate is $15. Even though you are adjacent to the airport and a freeway, we only heard occasional sound from planes or cars. The rooms are clean. We had a deluxe king bed room that provided a little more space. The front desk clerk (Raymond?) was exceedingly friendly and informative.

Stayed for 1 night as this hotel is close to Airport. Price was reasonable. We stayed in apartment next to the pools, however was inconvenient trying to go up stairs with our luggage, rooms are outdated & had a very noisy fan in bathroom. Our other family stayed on opposite side of hotel, they had an excellent view. Rooms also had phone chargers, coffee machine. Also had dinner at the restaurant! Amazing food & our waiter (forgot his name) was so nice and welcoming! Funny as well & also went out of his way to help us sing happy birthday. .

Whilst the outside of the hotel and lobby appeared dated - the rooms were spacious and very clean. Bed excellent. Airport shuttle service best I have used. The staff were remarkable - some of the best customer service I have had in a long time. A big thank you to Ramon our waiter on both nights in looking after our very picky eating 2 year old. Food in restaurant was also great - particularly the huli huli chicken

Amalia our housekeeper has made our stay a memorable one! We are transitioning to Hawaii and this hotel is close to all the attractions and base. The Amalia and the staff provided instructions on how to get to Pearl Harbor, Hanauma Bay, the Pali Look Out, and North Shore!

The room we got was right next to the highway, the noise was awful. For 4 days..no sleep.The restaurant is so expensive.The Mcdonald within walking distance helped us all.The public bus service was our blessingwe want to express our heartfelt thanks to Mrs Chandra Law and Miss Sharon at the front desk. MISS Chandra made our few days the best to remember, all she did was provide the best and most professional guest services. She gave us maps, and offer us the most helpful information to get around.She has a great personality, and it is because of her, and Sharon, we made the best of our stay.many thanks to Junio from the maintenance who was so nice to fix our Ac and was wonderful To get us some ginger

We are staying here for 10 days so far so good. Amalia was so nice and friendly and Ronald too. Excellent when it comes to cleaning our room. All the staff are very helpful and professional. Sharon at the front desk was very polite and friendly. The food was great at the Plaza Cafe restaurant. The hotel has a free parking area for all the guest. The location is so close to the airport. I'm glad we chose to stay here at Best Western The Plaza Hotel overall it was Excellent.

This hotel is comfortable, in a convenient location to the airport, and quiet, considering it's near a major interchange and the airport is in view. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable, and the wi-fi works well. The food and service at the restaurant on the first floor was also excellent. Portions are large. There are also a small convenience store on the first floor and a free hotel shuttle that takes guests to and from the airport. Taxis are easily accessible from here; often one is in the parking lot, ready to take a guest somewhere without a call. If you need to call for a taxi, it usually arrives within 5 to 15 minutes.Other amenities: in-room refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot; laundry onsite.

He housekeeping staff there is great! Mrs. Annie was super amazing she made sure we had everything we needed and kept our room in great shape for over 30 days. She's a wonderful person couldn't ask for anyone better best housekeeper I've had in a very long time. She was very professional, very attentive, extremely nice. We will miss her.

My stay at this hotel was very comfortable and accommodating. Ms. Amalia kept my room in the best shape and was incredibly polite and professional. The food here was pretty good as well. Keep up the great work.

Amalia was an excellent and professional maid, she service the room with the highest quality of care and hospitality, her attention to detail and friendly welcome is worth noting thank you very much Amalia

I was in Honolulu for business, staying for two days on each end of my trip, I stayed at The Plaza Hotel both times and enjoyed my stay. Very polite and helpful staff that goes the extra mile. If you are looking for wonderful ocean views stay somewhere else but if you are wanting a reasonably priced quite hotel with a helpful staff and easy access to the airport this hotel should make your short list.Sharon at the front desk was particularly polite and helpful.

The rooms were nice and well taken care of by my hotel janitor Mrs. Mercy as she is a very caring and sweet lady. The store within the hotel satisfied all of my needs when I was needing something and hotel staff was courteous and professional. The view from where I stayed was great in room 615. Mrs. Mercy is well deserving of a promotion. Plus another plus of staying here that McDonalds is nearby for breakfast and sometimes a late night snack. Overall the services were fantastic.

As expected. Decent size room, small refrigerator, very cramped bathroom. Hotel grounds were great - beautiful. Inside lobby area - ordinary. I stayed in a room with double beds. Staff was friendly, but a bit slow. Room noise ok, average for a hotel. Excellent High Speed Internet. Good area close to airport, but parking was a bit steep.

We have been at this location for a little over 30 days this hotel is located by the airport and is very closes to Pearl Harbor. The staff is excellent, especially the housekeeping staff and our Room Attendant Amalia is awesome, she is always friendly and kind with everyone. The hotel has a designated parking area for guests. The restaurant food is excellent and the staff is wonderful. So far our stay at the BEST WESTERN The Plaza Hotel has been great!!!!

We stayed at this location from 5/22/16 to 6/14/16 in room 127. There are rooms located inside the main hotel; however, we stayed in the outer rooms located around the pool. We requested this room because of medical purposes. The area is ridden with transients and there is no real barrier between the public and the outside rooms, which all have sliding glass doors. The transients had to be shooed away many times and it creates an uneasy feeling at night. There was an incident one day where my son and I left the pool are because a man was smoking meth in the parking lot. The front desk never answers the phone, so be prepared to constantly walk up front. Towels are supposed to be supplied at the pool; however, they go quickly. Both times I asked the front desk clerk for pool towels I was met with a quick, rude response - "They're outside." Of course they were not. Why else would I walk the extra 50 feet to ask you? My husband had just returned from the hospital from major surgery. I waited at the front desk and said excuse me twice to ask where I could find an ice machine. After the second time the clerk huffed and complained I made her lose her count. It's as though we were asking too much for simple requests. The room also had occasional roaches, which is normal when palm trees are nearby. I do know a tree/palmetto roach from a german roach though. When I ask for pest control, the clerk attempted to inform me that roaches are common. Yes, I'm well aware; however, I just killed four and found one in my bed and they surely weren't tree or water roaches. There is a "dining area" inside the main lobby; however, breakfast is ala carte and dinner is only served fri-mon. Tues-Thurs you must walk to their nearby location for a meal. There is a gift shop i the lobby that is quite convenient if you're willing to overpay for convenience. The perks were the not-so-crowded pool, lobby gift shop, proximity to airport, and friendly housekeeping. Luz is amazing. Very respectful, courteous, and helpful and never made you feel as though you were inconveniencing her for asking for anything at all. If hotels near the Waikiki strip are booked or over $300/night, I could say stay here, but I recommend looking at something on the strip such as the Hale Koa, Embassy Suites, Marriott if you're expecting a more Hawaiian experience. I just felt as though I was staying in a low-budget motel in the semi-ghetto part of downtown Houston at this place.

We didn't expect much of a one-night stay at an airport hotel, but this place did not deliver.Mildewed, poorly ventilated bathroom with a tub that did not drain. (One member of our party ran a bath at night, and another stepped in the same water when he went to take a morning shower.)Most uncomfortable bed and pillow I have experienced in a long time.Overall, very worn and dark.Two stars solely because of the staff, who were very courteous, and the convenient airport shuttle.I'd change my travel plans to avoid this hotel unless it underwent a remodel.

My wife, infant son and I stayed at this hotel for 45 days until we were able to move into our house. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff was excellent, the wi-fi works great, they had designated EV parking which was a huge plus for us with our PHEV and the restaurant food was excellent. I wish they served lunch, but I'm not sure whether the demand is there. Annie, Ramon, Mercy, James, and the rest of the staff were great. I can't say enough good things about them. They made it feel like the Best Western was our home.In short, I highly recommend this hotel.

works great for military on TLA. The military liaison Les works with you to book and pay. Very clean, parking is good. Close to Tripler where I work, so convenient while I'm looking for a place to live. Also plug for 6th floor room attendants Mercy, Ronald, and Grace. They're awesome and always give me extra coffee.

Hotel convenient to airport. Traffic noise loud and constant outside. Staff friendly and helpful. Room and amenities were very good. Expect to pay extra for parking. Local style eating establishments nearby. Overall good experience.

Rooms were nice and clean, property was well taken care of. Costly rooms. Staff were a bit tired and lacked any kind of enthusiasm. Restaurant was nice. Wait staff was helpful and food was great. Cashier appeared grumpy and bored.Parking was crazy - both with cost and availability.I will not be returning to his property. The amount of money spent should have resulted in better service... and at least a smile.

Enjoy the large room & double beds The room is bigger than average. Location is central to Waikiki, Ala Moana, Downtown, Pearlridge. Hotel provides shuttle bus to the airport. Walking distance to MC'Ds

Convenient & comfortable being close to the airport. Front Desk staff is friendly and absolutely helpful. Easy excess to freeway. Driving is a breeze not like driving into busy Waikiki. Fast food is nearby.

We loved our stay here at the BWPH. The front desk is very helpful and we had the honor of meeting many wonderful people. Ms. Tysie was our housekeeper and she was wonderful, courteous and respectful. We stayed for about three weeks and the plaza hotel and Tysie made us feel like this was our home. We received $10 vouchers each day per person to use at the restaurant, which was wonderful!

Very comfortable - great service - but, do wish the restaurant was open more frequently. Convenient parking and not far from more complete shopping and dining needs. Close to airport and not far from Waikiki...

The Hotel is less than 40 metes from the H1 but all of the windows are double pain- no sound proofing. Don't expect a free meal as breakfast will run you $9-$12. The hotel is clean and the staff are polite professionals- it is obvious they are making the best with what they've been given.

We were attending a wedding at the Disney Aulani resort. We decided to stay at this hotel instead of staying in Aulani. It was more convenient to visit with friends and we were going to the airport early morning on our 4th day and saved some money.

After two days of missed flight connections and a lot of not-so-nice people along the way, my one night stopover at the Best Western in Honolulu was a welcomed change of pace. When I checked in, Beau took great care of me. Since American Airlines had made me miss my connections, they paid for the room and what a nice room it was with a view of Diamondhead. I left my coat on the shuttle from the airport and the driver Chris, made sure I got it later that evening. The next day, I made it to my destination after a good night’s rest.

Do NOT stay here at any price. The highway noise will drive you insane. The stay was pleasant but they apologized every time we spoke. Talking outside the hotel was impossible. Sleeping near the from Impossible. Airplane noise acceptable. Highway noise? Did I say that already? Homeless people walking through the lobby at all hours???

it is basic but serves thre purpose. A bit tired but room was clean and beds comfortable. Restaurant only operates Fri - Mon, but there are MacDonalds and a few others nearby. make sure you get a room away from the Freeway

Desk staff Beau & Charis is very friendly and always smiling. Housekeeping staff was also nice along with the little help we got from the shuttle drivers. Internet is already up to par! Housekeeping missed /didn't empty trash when I checked in. Drainage was slow in shower it got fixed. Rooms are very large. Bathroom need a little improvement , to small also the irons need changing for certain ones.

As soon as we collected our luggage we called airport shuttle from complimentary phone and they were there in minutes. We arrived within no time to friendly and helpful stuff. Arranged our check in. Room was super large great to unpack and get ready for our stay. The staff were fabulous, accommodating and friendly something which is not always common these days! Great budget hotel! Will definitely use again. Aloha.

This was my second time staying here and when I got to the desk, Sharon remembered me (from 2 years ago!) and asked about my wife; what a nice personal touch! Fran asked me for a few items and before I knew it she had my room key ready and my parking validated! They were both super friendly, knowledgeable, and efficient. One of the best hotel check-in experiences I can remember!

Your staff Sharon, Mena, and Lorenzo were absolutely wonderful. They were very accomodating and helpful. The room was quite large and very neat. All the necessary amenities were available. Being close to the airport was a big plus,too, as I was catching a very early departing flight.

Internet upgrades proved to be a joke. First time I have never been able to connect iPhone or work laptop to infrastructure/wifi of hotel. Spent 2 hours on phone with tech support. Not my idea of a fun evening. Claims of having network issues were the justification for my inconvenience.

we chose this hotel for overnight flight back to beijing. it was about 4pm and we needed to fax a document to our agent in SF before 5pm. And it was urgent and important. The two ladies (Beau and Ian or Lan) at the front desk helped me to fax the docs even for free. saved my day. thanks.

We booked this hotel as we had a very early morning flight to catch and didn't want to risk a late arrival. It's a clean & tidy hotel. There's not much around it for dinner so ate in Waikiki first. They have a great laundry which is handy if you want to get a head start on the washing before heading home. A shuttle runs to the airport every half hour 24 hrs a day - will cost $2.

The front desk staff is always great ,friendly and knowledgeable from Athena ,beau,cheri, mena, Chandra and tracey.this trip around they provided me with my favorite room (shortest walk from parking) on short notice .Athena went the Xtra mile and checked and gave me a better rate then I was quoted on the phone .Rosendo acob from house keeping is always nice to run into ,always cheerful and helpful . There are cheaper places to stay at. but the front desk and their service is why I and my family choose to keep coming back

We're taking the Hawaii cruise from Honolulu so this is a convenient location for us: nearby the airport, car rental and our friend's condo. The rooms is not fancy, but good enough for couple nights. The front desk staff tried their best to accommodate our request for checking in early (8AM).

Due to recent airline flight cancellation, we were provided overnight accommodation at Best Western Plaza hotel near Honolulu Airport. Hotel looks like it was recently renovated as lobby and rooms were nice. However avoid rooms in main building facing towards the roadway. Our room ended in "02" and was directly in front of H-1 freeway and Nimitz Highway. I was amazed at the amount of vehicular noise from outside. However no surprise since hotel provided ear plugs in the room which hinted already that outside noise may be annoying. Hotel restaurant open for breakfast and dinner only and is pricey. The $8 airline breakfast meal voucher doesn't even cover the cost of a simple continental breakfast ($8.95) without additional out-of-pocket cost. American breakfast (2 eggs, choice of breakfast meat, hash browns and toast) was $14.95. Coffee was $2.95. Hotel only good if you needed quick stay near the airport but I would highly recommend requesting quiet room away from H-1 freeway/Nimitz Highway. Courtesy shuttle van from hotel to airport operated every 30 minutes on the top and bottom of each hour. From the airport call hotel 808-836-3636 when ready for pick-up and wait on center median outside of baggage claim lower level alongside green painted curb marked "permittee".

The hotel was centrally located to everywhere we went and especially close to work. The only drawback is its located near a major highway and freeway and traffic noise carried over into our room which was near the highway/freeway side of the hotel. The restaurant was amazing with friendly staff/wait persons. We took advantage of the Fitness Center and Pool, although we wished the open hours for both were longer. All in all we had a wonderful stay and enjoyed ourselves.

I had a very enjoyable and pleasant stay at the Best Western Plaza in Honolulu. The staff and accommodations was Very Good. There's a few good places to eat at near the hotel (within walking distance) which was very convenient. I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Close to the airport, and on a couple major bus lines which made it easy for us to get around without a car. We took the bus to Pearl Harbor. A short walk to a couple okay places to eat, and a small convenience store in the hotel lobby to pick up lotion / snacks / etc.When there are two beds in a room, they are doubles even though some places you will see them listed as queens. Okay for cuddling, not okay for (most) friends sharing a bed.Service at the front desk was generally slow but effective.

I would give this hotel more stars but my room 711 is way too noisy and they know it as they supply ear plugs. Hotel is clean, food is good in both restaurant and the little convenience store in the lobby. Flat screen, nice pool, palm trees but there is a highway overpass very close to this side of the hotel, you might ask for a room on the other side. Again staff are so friendly, bus stops outside and it's $ 2.50 to get to Waikiki Beach although with the public transport it's stop and go so it about 1 hour.

I've been traveling to Pearl Harbor for 25 years. I don't stay in Waikiki anymore, the drive is too much. Best western plaza is close to base. That's about it, parking can be a pain, rooms are a bit run down, and if there really full, wait times for elevators is excessive.I stayed a week this time and it was ok, nothing to brag about but it was under government rate, and all I could get.If your there for work, it's ok, i would never stay there for pleasure.

I stayed here for three weeks and my experience was great. Beau and Fran was just amazing at the front desk. I never worried about any noise or bad room service. I loved the staff and I hope to come back soon!!! Thank you for a wonderful experience!!! :-)

This hotel was great! I really enjoyed my stay. They are very helpful and military friendly when it comes to making a PCS move to the Island! Nice pool, mini store inside the hotel and a gym that is well kept. Amalia did a great job making sure my room was good and that I had everything I needed to make my stay pleasurable.

We only stayed one night as we were taking an early flight the following day. The hotel is close to the airport and very clean with everything you need including free wifi. The staff at the front desk were helpful and easy to deal with and the gift shop was reasonably priced.

Thanks to Fran and Mena at the front desk, I will always be a Best Western patron (unless they leave). From pleasantly checking in a walk-in, to adjusting my reservation in order for me to handle my tedious work schedule, providing all sorts of local advice, graciously even waiving a penalty with a complimentary late check out, I truly felt cared for by the top-notch staff at this hotel.

Outstanding house keeping service. Emelita was very nice and professional. She always have a pleasant smile and a warm greeting for you. Great location to avoid the crowd and traffic at the beach. Restaurants close by,

To break up trip from Hawaii to Japan and Japan to Hawaii, I generally stay at The Plaza Hotel (Best Western). Due to schedule, when inbound to Hawaii, I get in very early and the hotel staff went above and beyond to accommodate my stay. Special thanks to Mena and Fran for their excellent support and help. The shuttle driver, the maid staff and the food service people all gave me that wonderful Hawaiin welcome. I will stay here again. The only small issue I had was the room shower head, the shower head needed replacement causing the water to come out extremely slow without pressure.

Very friendly staff. 24 hour shuttle to airport that runs every 30 min. Higher floors and rooms toward the back have less traffic noise. Parking available on site for a charge. Restaurants available on premises or shuttle to sister restaurants. McDonald's is the next block.

To break up trip from Narita Airport in Tokyo to Houston, we stayed again at The Plaza Hotel (Best Western). Due to schedule, we hoped we could check in a bit early. Really exhausted. Staff was most accommodating. Really helped us out; at our age, need all the help we can get. Breakfast was fine; room was spacious - typical of most Best Westerns. The helpfulness of the staff, from front desk (Ms Sharon in particular), the shuttle driver, the maid staff and the food service people all gave us that wonderful Hawaiin welcome. We will stay here again if we do a layover. Also would recommend this hotel if flights canceled. Call immediately for a room as we hear that it becomes very popular when mainland gets snow delays in winter. Also, the Wifi was super. Maybe best we've had in any number of hotels.

The location of this Best Western by the airport was ideal for us because we did not want to drive in the city traffic of Waikiki and downtown Honolulu. Also, the hotel location was very close to the rental car lot so returning our rental car took only a few minutes. Regarding the hotel service, we were extremely pleased with the quick and polite action they provided when we checked in; After bringing our luggage up to our room, we saw that we were placed in a room with 2 double beds - we were supposed to be in a room with a king size bed. The staff immediately resolved the problem and placed us in the correct room on the same floor (which made for easy movement of our luggage). An additional positive note, the hotel restaurant service was great and the gift shop customer representative was always friendly!

This experience was more than ideal. Convenient, clean, classy and comfortable, we are looking forward to another stay here. Thank you for the ease of transportation via complimentary airport shuttle service - the first amenity that attracted us to the property. Excellent, 5-star experience all the way! Friendly, attentive staff. Great food at the on-stie restaurant. For anyone who loves to travel without hassle. GREAT Stay!!

I have always used Best Western when travelling. This time I was disappointed, the service, the room etc was all mediocre. No room service etcThe beds have not been moved or cleaned under for a long time

On a recent trip to Honolulu a friend and I had to stay two extra days because of flights canceled due to snow in Denver on our return trip. We were able to find a room at the Best Western Plaza Hotel at a nice rate. The hotel is near the airport and the hotel shuttle was prompt is picking us up and later returning us to the airport. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the staff friendly and helpful. There was a nearby McDonalds Restaurant and also a nearby bus stop, which allowed us to easily find transportation into Honolulu and Waikiki for further exploring on our extra days in Hawaii. We had a pleasant stay!

I was extremely happy with this hotel. The rooms were spacious, clean & comfortable & the beds very comfortable. We did ask for a quiet room so the highway noise didn't bother us at all. The airport shuttle was great & we didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes to be picked up. The staff were friendly and helpful. This is the best option for a stopover near the airport.

If you just need a place close to the airport, this works well. It has the freeway on three sides, so it is a little noisy, but close your eyes and pretend it's the ocean. It was clean and efficient with excellent shuttle service every 30 minutes.

The hotel is conveniently located to the airport and Pearl Harbor. The breakfasts were very good and the staff very friendly. The hotel's carpet needs replacing. The mattresses are long overdue to be replaced and the A/C is frustrating.

I like to recognize Cecilia for her commendable customer service. She was very accommodating - more than willing to offer me a room that fits my style. I have been staying in this hotel for the past 3 years and never had any unfavorable experience. Kudos to the management for such outstanding effective employees training program.

This hotel is very close to the airport, reasonably priced, clean, with very helpful staff. We stayed here just one night, as we flew into Honolulu to visit the Pearl Harbor Memorial, and then flew out to the "Big Island" the next day. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They provided us with good advice on how best to visit the Pearl Harbor Memorial. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. The only negative is you can practically touch the interstate overpass from this hotel! But that is also what makes it convenient for "in and out" travelers to Honolulu. I think it's a reasonable price to pay for convenience. I slept well and never heard the traffic. My wife, a lighter sleeper, said she heard the traffic. The evening we arrived at the hotel we decided to take the city bus to see Waikiki Beach. Riding a city bus during rush hour in Honolulu is an experience in itself, and gave us a firsthand understanding of why this city is rated worst in the nation for traffic!

I stayed over Christmas and was very pleased with the hotel. It was very clean, quiet, affordable and the staff was amazing. They went out of their way to answer questions and help me with whatever I needed. In particular I would like to give a huge shout out to Beau and Charis at the front reception desk. They know what customer service is all about! Nice job ladies!

It was great hotel friendly staff. we enjoyed the restaurant, huge portions great pasta dishes.They have free transport to airport. Would stay there again. Rooms were clean and spacious. Free coffee in the AM.

Stayed here for a few days after returning from Cagayan De Oro Philippines. Nice place with good rates. Will stay here I am sure on our next rip. Lived in Hawaii from 1969 to 1973 and 1975 to 76. Next trip through Hawaii we plan on seeing how much things have changed around Schofield barracks and the like.

We arrived late in the evening from Kona with a early morning departure for the Mainland. We looked for something close, with a shuttle and low cost. We found the Best Western Plaza. Everything seemed worn and dated in the hotel with construction/repair taking place on the restaurant, pool, etc. No worry McDonalds is on the same block on the far side of the hotel. Shuttle service picked us up and returned us to the airport very timely. Good for a short overnight, with the hotel shop being more expansive than you would expect for travel supplies. Hotel lies beside an elevated highway and a ground highway. Ask for a room away from the noise.

Thank you for the wonderful stay. We will definitely like to,stay here again. Food was delicious and your restaurant staff was great! Usingm the shuttle to the airport was very convenient! The room was very clean and spacious!

We were about to board our flight from Honolulu, only to learn that the destination runway was flooded and the flight was delayed by 24 hours. We needed overnight accommodation, but were unfamiliar with the locality. Fortunately a fellow traveller recommended the Best Western - just around the corner and a few minutes drive on the hotel's complimentary shuttle. It proved to be the perfect refuge, comfortable beds, quiet rooms, an on-site convenience store, and a restaurant . The staff was obviously accustomed to stressed out grumpy travellers, and were extremely helpful and obliging As one might expect, the hotel location cannot be described as scenic - it is surrounded by buildings used to service the airport. However, just a short distance away we found a group of inexpensive cafe's and a few other retail outlets. Summing up - a handy location, clean quiet rooms, good staff, and a free shuttle back to the airport to resume the journey.

This hotel is a good value and is in a very good location if you're visiting Pearl Harbor, Hickam Air Base, or Ft. Shafter. It's less expensive than the hotels in Waikiki and you are only minutes away. Bus stops close to hotel and if you're going to Waikiki, then that's your best choice. It's next to H1, so you may need ear plugs (the hotel provides). Has a shop downstairs next to the lobby and a laundry area if you're here for an extended stay.

I been staying at the hotel for 10 days and Ms. Luz has done an amazing job of cleaning the entire room. She always has a smile and is very friendly, she is so nice and respectful and treated my wife and I as family. The hotel is very nice and Ms. Luz just made it better. Thank you for all you do Ms. Luz and for anyone that is thinking of staying at the best western do it because it is worth it.

We docked at the pier from our cruise and needed a place to stay because of a late flight departure. My husband woke up with vertigo so our plans to tour changed. I called the Best Western from the ship and they told me of their day use rooms. Check out time was 6 pm but I asked for an extended checkout. Fran at the desk went out of her was to get us a delayed departure since out flight wasn't until 10:30 pm. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Thank you Fran for all you help

Wonderful place to stay if you want to be near an airport. Fran, at the front desk, was extremely helpful, getting us into rooms very early in the day so we could settle a bit before setting out for the day. I would definitely go back.

Rooms need upgrading. Location is in industrial area next to noisy freeway. Staff is friendly and helpful though, and hotel is kept clean. Several lights in the room did not work. Window air conditioner was noisy. Bed was comfortable.

We booked this hotel as we had an early morning flight and they offered a free airport shuttle. The front rooms are very close to a very noisy freeway, so ask for a room out the back. The rooms are quite large with a fridge and a coffee machine, but it is quite dated but clean and comfortable. We arrived late and left early so did not use the restaurant or other facilities.

Fran was wonderful checking me in. We desired early check in but the rooms were not available. We flew over night from Asia and were tired. She directed us to a shopping mall where we provisioned and then called us when our rooms were ready. Throughout our stay Fran was awesome. She gave advice for meals and great directions for 3 tired travelers that had never been in Hawaii. The restaurant is great for breakfast. The entire staff is wonderful and attentive. Unfortunately the dinner chefs leave much to be desired. I ordered pork chops which were lovely. However the sides at $7 each were terrible. I ordered the 'garlic smashed potatoes'. I received a dozen baby potatoes in grease. When I explained to the waiter that for $7 a side this was not what I expected. He graciously took them back to the kitchen. He returned 1 minute later with the same potatoes with what looked to be someones fist print in them. I guess at the Best Western Hulk Smash potatoes. Again, tonight as I am a glutton for punishment and a lover of pork I ordered the same dish and received the same baby potatoes devoid of salt, pepper, garlic, butter, chives, and even a hint of sour cream. I offered to make the dish for the chef. I asked to have the potatoes reheated, a dollop of butter, salt, pepper, two tablespoons of sour cream, chives and bacon bits but they would not let me make that order. They could not find my credit receipt and so I paid $7 for a container of cold, raw potatoes that were left at the cashier stand. I did not get recompense but did suggest that the chef use the baby potatoes as suppositories. Cashier actually googled 'smashed potatoes' when I pointed out the difference she said, 'Those are regular smashed potatoes, not garlic smashed potatoes. I would not be so upset but the initial knuckle prints in the first batch of 'garlic smashed potatoes' shows an arrogance and distain that does not belong in customer service. I think this is not the Best the West has to offer.

This hotel was perfect for my transfer trip to my cruise. The staff and room was wonderful. It was close to the airport. Free pick up shuttle was great and on time.This hotel has a onsite cafe and a onsite mini store. The hotel is close to a freeway. The noise level may bother some people. However, it is quite at night when it is less traffic. Complimentary internet.

Very old and not so clean. Beds are ridiculously small and bathroom is woeful but the worst thing is the noise from the elevated highway. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. Staff and service is very good though.

Skip down a little for the pointers.I would have given it 5 but I don't want to oversell this place, the hotel is nice the staff are funny and friendly. The only down fall I have to say is the location. I haven't went to the pool but there was people there enjoying it their gym room is pretty nice (12th floor) because they have free weights and not just a machine and treadmills. But the room, so while I was here for a few days I had friends rent a room at the Princess Sheraton in Wakiki and man oh man that room looked like butt compared to the rooms here. The room itself is nice and spacious but I wish the bathrooms were a little bigger. Bottom line. -nice room small bathroom-right by the freeway always hear cars(didn't stop me from sleeping)-Make sure you have uber or Lyft!! To get you where you need to go. (Ex 16$ from here to Wakiki)-explore the local area there are a few food joints around that are pretty greatPs: I had a awesome made, Annie, she told me some great food places to go and nice places to get some souvenirs (that aren't too over priced)

We stayed here because we arrived late, it was close to the airport and we were staying only 2 nights. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable. We stay at Best Western when ever possible because we are always satisfied with the hotel.

Aloha,Was greeted and remembered by first name by my room house keeper, Ms. Amalia, on a daily basis during my stay. Love that personal touch as well as her keeping my room clean, fresh and stocked. She was always cheerful and had a "Good Morning" and "Have a Good Day" greeting and of course, "Is there anything I can get you?" to include remembering my name. I appreciate that when everything in service now days is so "wham bam" without so much as a thank you for your patronage. For a hotel that's not the Ritz or a Hilton, I applaud Ms. Amalia for her graciousness and professionalism. Mahalo!

A most welcome surprise … the place looks really spruced up from my last visit several years ago. The location is bizarre, almost tucked under a freeway with roaring trucks, but inside the hotel all is very nice. Our room was fairly quiet. The hotel is a 10 minute complimentary shuttle ride from the airport, the staff is superb, the rooms spacious and comfortable. We found the room a/c pretty useless, but they brought us a fan and we slept well. There’s even a nice smoking lounge on the 5th floor. The breakfast menu was large and the food delicious. No room service because the hotel restaurant is only open a few nights a week, but their sister property has terrific food, and it’s a very quick walk. I’d recommend this hotel, it was a good value.

This hotel is clean & bed comfortable with a yummy breakfast on offer in dining room I can certainly recommend this hotel to overnight travellers who wish to be at airport next day and they offer a free shuttle service something we did not encounter anywhere else we stayed so a bonus

If you're in Honolulu and not needing to go be a tourist (i.e. making a stopover), this hotel is a pretty good place. A little too expensive IMO but not too bad considering it's in Hawaii. It's convenient to the airport, has an on-demand shuttle, and has a variety of nearby food locations. Local bus service is at the front door to all locations on the island. Breakfast is very good, dinners a little less so, but satisfactory. Staff was very courteous and efficient, rooms clean and comfortable. Not much of a "view" and too close to a noisy expressway were my only 'complaints'.

Chris was very helpful in getting us to where we needed to go and helped us in our stressful situation to get to the right hotel. I would like to thank Meua, Sharon, Zauaida, Teehie, Michael, Marci, Chabdra, Beau, Soledad, for making my stay very comforting. We have 3 kids so things can be quite trying at times and you put my life at ease by reducing the amount of stress I was under. Thank you all for everything. I would recommend everyone to come and stay because you make everyone feel like family. Mahalo the Rivera family

This is the perfect place to stay if you arrive on a late flight or are leaving early. It's also not too far from Pearl Harbor if you want to visit there. The staff were friendly and professional. They gave us a free room upgrade when we stayed there again the night before we left Hawaii. Most of the rooms do not face the highway, so that was not a problem.

We stayed here overnight on our way to New Zealand, but will stay here anytime we are in this area. Yes, the shuttle service is great. And our driver was so friendly and helpful, he even helped us get our luggage in the elevator and into our room. He told us his name and that he would be on duty until 10p if we needed anything. What a gracious man.The front desk staff were so friendly and helpful. I needed a sewing kit (didn't know if those were even made anymore) at check-in, and the lady gave me one after checking it to be sure all items were included. Thoughtful touch.The restaurant breakfast was very good.I don't know why this hotel was not busier; we did not notice any noise that night. The room was perfectly clean and had everything we needed, and then some.

I was amazed how good was this hotel. The breakfast was one of the best I had in Hawaii, The server Techie was a five star server, the best. The shuttle bus drive Lorenzo was amazing and also five star. The housekeeper , Jycie was excellent. Overall I had much much better experience than Hilton Hawaiian Village. I recommend this hotel very highly.

This is an absolutely no-frills room. The hotel is old and noisy, right next to the road. The bed is hard, the furniture is from the 70s or 80s, and the colors are harvest gold and avocado green -- remember that era? I didn't want to put my feet on the carpet, but the bed seemed clean. There is an attic access door in the ceiling and the "closet" has no door. The lobby is no-frills as well, but there is a convenience store inside, which sells drinks and snacks. We couldn't access the WIFI, and had to use the hot-spot on our phone. The air conditioner works fine when turned all the way down, but if you want to adjust the temperature, it's difficult. If you need a room at the airport, this might be your best option, but I'd double-check. Next time, we have decided that a short drive to another hotel is worth it, even for an early morning flight.

I stayed at this hotel near the Honolulu Airport as I had a 6am flight, and was not sure of the traffic situation from Waikiki that early on a Friday morning.While this is an older hotel, I found my room very well kept, comfortable, clean, and well appointed. The air conditioner worked very well. I was on the ninth floor, on the back side of the hotel and had a view of the airport. Many have commented on the noise level but being away from the Nimitz Highway, I heard no traffic noise, and minimal airport noise. Staff were very friendly and airport shuttle was on time. There is a restaurant on site but it is closed a few nights of the week. There is a fairly well stocked store in the lobby with frozen and microwave food if you are stuck. Overall positive stay, and I would stay here again.

This Best Western suited our purposes being close to the airport. The noise of traffic during the night was a bit loud but the bed was comfortable, the room fairly spacious. Our A/C was very noisy the first night and when I reported it, a repair man came within 10 mins to look at it. He unfortunately couldn't fix the noise but when we returned the next day, the A/C had been replaced with a new unit. Very impressive service.

The hotel is conveniently located near Honolulu airport, but also beside the highway. We heard some highway noise at night but it did not disturb our sleep. A short walking distance away were several car rental options. McDonald's is next door--important to us as we arrived late at night after long travel delays & were hungry. The hotel is modern, clean & with all the expected amenities. Front desk staff was very helpful. The drawback for us was location; if it were closer to Waikiki we would have been very happy to make it our home base.

This is a very clean hotel located adjacent to the Honolulu airport. A free shuttle is provided making this very convenient. Our room was very large and well appointed, more than we needed for an over-night stay between flights. It had great block-out curtains and there was no air-traffic noise.Certainly recommend for a night between flights.

The exterior is unprepossessing, but the staff members are friendly and helpful, the rooms are aging but clean and comforable, and the store in the lobby is unusually well stocked with all manner of supplies and foods--probably because the hotel has many extended stay military guests. There is an outdoor pool and a restaurant that opens for breakfasts (good) and splits evenings with the sister hotel's restaurant one block away (also good).I had no issue with loud jet noise from the nearby airport, and had great courtesy van pickup and deliver service from and to the airport.No problems at although I thought the cost was a bit high--probably because there aren't many hotels close to the airport.

I used to stay at Hilton Hawaiian Village before. This was my first time I stayed at Best Western Plaza in Hawaii. I had the best experience staying at this hotel and it is hundred times better than Hilton Hawaiian Village. Five star service with staff Techie and Lorenzo. I recommend Best Western Plaza very highly.

Staff is helpful to assist us on bus route to Waikiki and Pearl Harbour. Room is better than what we expect in view of the customer's rating of this hotel. Disappointed with the airport shuttle service causing us to wait for around an hour.

A very large clean room for an overnight stay when needing to be close to the airport. The free shuttle was very welcome. The room was very large and very clean, but the room was expensive given it is just a bed for a night. You would not stay there for your holiday

The Best Western Hotel is overall the greatest hotels we've stayed in while in Hawaii. The best part of it was having our daily house keeper, I believe her name was Mercy and we were in room 602. This caring individual would just brighten our morning every single day with her welcoming tone of voice when she knocks politely on our door if we needed service, and her caring hospitality that she showed towards us. Her cleaning part of her was also a plus, she made sure nothing dirty was on the lying around. If one thing I would admire about this hotel, it would be meeting Mercy. God bless and thank you Best Western hotel for your ALOHA hospitality. Mahalo.

The folks here are extremely nice and always extremely helpful. I have stayed here at the plaza many times in the last several years approximately 7 months in total. They do a great job of making me feel at home.

So my husband and I have been at this hotel for over 40 days, waiting for our house to open up. While we have been here we have had many different types of experiences both good and bad. But throughout the entire stay the one thing I looked forward too was the housekeeper Amalia coming to our room. She was always smiles and always friendly and helpful and kind. I have three kids and 2, 4 year olds(twins). She always does extra touches like folding their special blankets ect... It helps, being stuck in a 2 tiny rooms with 5 ppl 3 of them being kids makes for some really stressful times and she helped keep at least one aspect of our stay pleasant. I want to send out a huge thank you to Amalia for making our stay pleasant.

This was a very central hotel (I've stayed for 10 day ). You're minutes from everything There's really no downside to this hotel. The restaurant is great, house keeping is wonderful Mercy she is the best, very nice and helpful and responsive. Recommended if you want to stay very central.

Overall a decent hotel with a good locale for my purpose. The staff was consistently excellent, very helpful and friendly. Others have noted the noise due to the proximity to the freeway, although it was noticeable wasn't too distracting. It had free wifi although it requires you to sign in on a daily basis which got a little annoying since we were there for 10 days. The facilities were great and I had few complaints. Overall some good things and some average things about this hotel.

The hotel as well as the resturaunt are amazing. The staff and comforts make an extended stay quite enjoyable. The food is great. They matched our TLA rates and the laundry facility is updated to accommodate card transactions. Tysee our maid was very friendly and personable!

Stayed one night in March 2016 waiting for connecting flight the next day. I would not stay here again. The hotel is old but clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. However the road noise is seriously loud and constant - take good ear plugs and the hotel is handy to the airport but nothing else. Whilst my travel agent booked it for its location (to save taxi or shuttle fares) once we booked in there was nothing to do. We bused into Waikiki and taxied back again. We may as well have stayed in a nicer hotel and got the shuttle. (Budget travelers)

The staff at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel make this property a very good value proposition. I would agree with others that some of the room decor is dated and if you are expecting a modern in-room contained HVAC system, you won't find it here. I stayed with my son on a medically-related visit from Maui to Oahu so I really just needed a place to overnight between my surgery and the follow-up post-surgery appointment. I had previously been at The Plaza Hotel on a prior medically-related visit. On that trip, The Plaza had updated its cable television system and the local channels did not work on the television Staff tried many things to try to get the local channels to display in my room but were unsuccessful. After providing a review of the property that noted my disappointment, I was contacted by Tracey H Kuamo'o, the Guest Services Manager, to apologize that they were not able to address my issue and to respectfully request that I give The Plaza Hotel another chance. I did on this visit and I am happy to report that I was able to watch the local television channels in my room.I would recommend that if you are looking for a good value in a location near the Honolulu International Airport that you strongly consider The Plaza Hotel.

Staying here for over a month while waiting for a house can be a struggle for a family of 4 plus a large dog in a small two bed 2nd floor hotel room. The staff made the stay less stressful by always being kind and courteous. The housekeepers always did an amazing job, especially Sonia who always wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. It is also helpful when you get friendly smiles every morning and night from waiters/waitresses in the restaurant. Even the maintenance staff are super friendly, they come quickly and resolve the issue. The fridge is a bit small for families who have to stay here for more than a couple days, but it's only temporary. Overall, we've been enjoying our stay here at the Best Western the Plaza.

Staff is very helpful and courteous. Housekeeping Rep Ms. Amelia was very polite and wanted to make sure I had everything needed for a comfortable stay. Rooms could use a bluray/dvd player for people staying over 7 nights.

If I were to rate this hotel on the staff alone it would get a great rating, however, the decor is run down and in dire need of a face lift. Dingy carpets and interior. the parking is minimal. So arrive early. It has a feel of temporary housing, which a local told me is used for our military men when they are new on the island. Shame on the military for making you folks stay here. I would rather stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. It's about the same price. Just no free breakfast. I did not eat the food at the Best Western. After seeing the quality of the rooms I felt I would be best to skip their food. I can not review it since I never saw it.

After a very very stressful week on Oahu for a family emergency, we booked here before leaving back for the mainland. At first we had some issues. The issues were quickly solved by Reid the front office manager. Not only did he empathize with my situation but he went out of his way to fix it. Not only did he move us rooms, he even carried the luggage for my husband and myself. Wow! Wonderful service from management. But honestly the front desk staff need way more customer service training. Maybe it was an off day for them.Ask for a tower room or you may be stuck with an older exterior corridor room. Thanks again Reid. -Ryan and Daniel-

Stayed here until we got ourself a house.Our stay at the hotel was better than the ones i've been at.Had a great time here our houskeeping Annie made our stay even better, made it feel like home. She was so friendly and very helpful to me she gave me suggestions and advice, since it was my first time staying here. She will treat you like a friend like family. I loved my stay here.

Honestly, we were very impressed with this hotel. We rarely choose Best Western and I think I still imagine the Best Westerns of the 1980s. From the shuttle drivers to the front desk to the waiter everyone was very friendly and just seemed to be in great moods. Because we were on our 30th anniversary trip we were upgraded which was unexpected since it was one night and an airport hotel. The hotel restaurant was closing in 15 minutes so the front desk clerk offered to store our bags and pointed us towards a much needed dinner. Our waiter (Ramon, I think) was awesome and did not rush us at all. I had the Chicken Caesar Salad and it was very large and very good. My husband had the fish sandwich and said it was delicious as well. If you need a location near the Honolulu International Airport I highly endorse this one.

Stayed here overnight as no early enough flight from the Big Island in time to connect with an early morning departure from Honolulu the following day. Very dubious after reading reviews, and had no expectations but needs must. Followed advice and requested a high room facing away from the road and was allocated a clean large corner room on the top floor by very friendly and helpful staff. Dated décor but absolutely fine. Noisy aircon however.Good shuttle to and fro from the airport even at 5.00 am.

The hotel is dated and noisy due to a road leading to the airport. If staying ask for a room facing toward the city. The rooms around the pool are very noisy due to the above.The staff especially Cecelia and Mena were most helpful in suggesting the room we got on the trip in and out of HawaiiThey also allowed us to stay later till 6 and beyond as our flied out was at 11:45 pmWe ate in the restaurant most times as there is nothing much around to walk to. The meals where plain and good and also good quantities

Every visit for me includes a few nights at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. The special feeling received from the staff starts from the time that wheels touch the ground at the airport. They always make me feel special and welcomed. Their smiles and personalities will energize me every time. That is important to me having traveled so many miles in 1 year time.
