I visited Honolulu 9 times in 2015 and stayed at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel every time. The rooms were always comfortable. The food is always to taste and filling. Most of all I feel that the staff members are the highlights of my visits. My plan is to continue interacting with this fine hotel in the future. (Near future)V/RK. Mitchell

An excellent hotel for an overnight stopover on my way to Kauai. The shuttle arrived very promptly, check in was also very quick. The room and bathroom was very clean, the bed was very comfortable. There was some noise from the motorway but ear plugs easily fixed that. Breakfast was very good, the staff were friendly and professional. The shuttle back to the airport was very quick and I really enjoyed my talk with the very pleasant driver. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

All the staff is so friendly. From the ladies at the front desk, to the wait staff at the restaurant, to the ladies in Housekeeping. Annie was the housekeeper in charge of our room. Every time I saw her she was so friendly and welcoming. She would always take a moment to talk to us. I saw her do this to every guest she would see. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

We booked this hotel because of it's location at Honolulu International Airport. We stayed only a half day to rest and cleanup between overnight flights from Australia and the US. Although it was pricey for this purpose, as an older couple, we needed the break from the confines of present day Economy airline travel and it was much more cost efficient than Business or First Class airfare.

Nice room close to airport but difficult to get to. The room was great and there was a washer and dryer off the lobby but we never used it so I do not know the cost. The hotel had MANY military service men , and some families at the hotel. There is a small gift shop off the lobby and a restraint off the lobby but a bit expensive. Somewhat noisy with the Nimitz freeway and Hwy 1 both outside the front door. The Nimitz runs under Hwy 1 do using the GPS from the phone sometimes leads to confusion. Parking costs $30 a day unless you are a BW member and then is $15 per day.

I checked in on 2/21 for a week. sharon, welcomed me in and got me settled early which I appreciated as I was up all night. During the week Sharon and Mena were very helpful. Just a great team and support. Hookipa wonderful. The other staff also were open, friendly and helpful. On my next visit I will return here.

This hotel is located about a 5 minute drive from the airport and about a 15 minute drive to Honolulu. Traffic is terrible so we used the bus a lot and there are stops directly across the street from the hotel. Using the bus made it fairly easy to to get to Pearl Harbor and downtown. The hotel is older and parking is not great. Do not stay on the side facing the freeway, the hotel actually provides you ear plugs for rooms on that side!

Even though I was only present one night, the service was good. I wished I would have had longer to stay but I was on my way to the Philippines and needed a good night's sleep which was provided. Thanks for the good service with the shuttle pick and return to the airport.

I stayed here as part of a military tour. For the price and location, you can't beat it. The Front Desk staff were excellent. Ms. Erlinda, Athena, Cecilia, Rose, and Myrna rocked! The made sure everything was well-coordinated. Their attitudes always put a smile on my face. Also, there was one young lady who was maid there, I never got her name, but I swear she was one of the hardest working people there. My room was always clean to perfection. My only warning or caution is the parking, due to space limitations, is rather tight and so you have to be careful with that. I can say I was one happy satisfied customer. For anyone else in similar and likewise circumstances as myself, I would recommend it highly.

We arrived to a very clean neatly prepared room. I travel often for work and stay at this Best Western more than 20 days per year. Not a 5 star luxury resort but always clean and the staff is great. I book through Les and get my rooms on one or two week notice. The ladies at the front desk act like they have known me my entire life. This trip my wife came and she liked our view from the corner room. She also liked that Solodad kept our room so clean and she was very pleasent and cooperative. First class service!

I would like to give a shout out to Lan the front desk reception that help me checking in and providing valuable information about TLA while I check in to Joint Base Pearl Harbor. Also to the outstanding work that my house keeper Grace and Mercy that works at the 6th floor, my room is always in excellent condition and they have great personalities, even giving me advice of where to go around the area.

My experience here was awesome. the room was clean and quiet. The service was great from the front desk and room service. Amalia, who was in charge of my room was super nice and always cleaned the room around my schedule.

First I'll say though we did not enjoy our short stay, we were too exhausted from 20 hours of travel to try and have the problems resolved. Also the staff was fine though we had little contact. Just know that this is a very dated and old feeling place Our room was dirty, smelled the windows did not seal and the traffic noise was just ridiculous. The bathroom set up was just awful no spot to put any toiletries the towels were out on the entrance area. Just a very low end hotel in a loud and dirty area of town. But not cheap spent over $200 to stay one night. We wanted to be near the airport for a connecting flight the next morning what a mistake.

Extremely close to the airport, with a great free shuttle service. The staff are extremely helpful, with outstanding customer service.The hotel is very tired and rooms very very noisy from the highway located right in front of the room. They do supply excellent ear plugs that made a huge difference to the noise. Without these, I would of ask for a room move to the back of the hotel due to the excessive loud traffic noise. The room was clean and comfortable enough as well.The hotel is very expensive, but most airport style hotels are. I am a senior manager for a tour and travel agency in Australia and I would recommend this hotel if you require an overnight stay due to your flight structure. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel to stay while you are here on holidays for a week or so. Research a better location, quality of a hotel or get someone to do it for you.

Just wanted to express my appreciation to Lan & Mina on our recent stay at the Best Western Plaza. We needed a place to spend the day waiting for our 11pm flight back to Ohio. They went out of their way to find us a room and made us feel right at home. I wish I could say the same for other places we've stayed thru the years. My Best Western experience is always a good one.

This was only a six hour stay, got in late and checked out early. Cecilia provided great Customer Service to my sister and I. She went way above and beyond her duties. Once again thank you Cecilia for what you did!! Dawn Edmonson

Joey is da bombvery helpful, found credit card, in dining room. Tanks 2 him rtn it to desk. Saw joey in lobby told me my card is @ da desk. Joey is VERY PROMPT in responding to request i ask 4 xtra towels, xtra pillows, xtra blankets. His actions R professional he is fit 4 dis job. Joey shud be recognized for being an xcellant employee. Joey & other of your employees R da best u hired praised is due 4 each one of themBeau @ front desk rtn my creditcard very kind person. Desk personel R friendly 2!!!Mahalo PlentyMaizelette K. Lacar Guest of Joslin M Sales

Decent place if you have been to Hawaii before or are going there for work on base. The location is right by the airport so you will save a lot of time avoiding the downtown traffic. Staff is great (Mercy) did a good job keeping my room tidy. I worked nights while I was there and found it was not overly noisy or crowded. Gym is small but has enough items to do most workouts.Things that could be improved-Parking is tough in a small parking garage (I am glad my rental was a compact car)-restaurant is only open a few days a week for dinner-laundry should have additional washers and dryers

I picked this hotel because it was super close to the airport and had a free shuttle and seemed much less dodgy than some cheaper options. Shuttle service was great! Hotel is a bit tired, but is clean and bed was comfortable. Hotel is a bit noisey - i stayed on pool side of hotel near on-ramps to highways, but earplugs were provided.

This is perfect if you fly in late night and need a place to stay BEFORE you get your rental car or the night before you fly out the next day. Free airport shuttle. Some rental car agencies will pick you up free the next morning...save a full day of car rental fees! Owl rental cars picked us up the next morning and dropped us off at the airport after our days on the island. Perfect. This BW was clean, staff friendly and helpful. No free breakfast and if you arrive late at night the only place close to eat is McD's. No big deal, just the way it is. Good BW. Price may seem high to the mainland BW's but relax, this is Hawaii. Everything is more expensive. Ask for a room several floors up. We had no noise and a partial view of the water.

The beds were comfortable and that is the best I can say. When entering the hotel it did not have a warm feeling and was very out dated and in need of updates. We were disappointed to find that the restaurant was not open for dinner the night of our stay and we were bussed to a sister hotel which was much nicer. Honolulu Motel at the Airport. The food was very average at the best. We were given a continental breakfast which was a cup of coffee or tea with toast and fruit bowl. We ended up eating and then going out for breakfast at McDonalds. I would not at all recommend this hotel even though it was close to the airport and shuttle was provided. Next time I go back to the Vive in Honolulu.

I stayed here overnight during a layover on my way to Australia. I chose it because it is located very close to the airport. The hotel has a high rise building and a motel-like building. My room was in the (dated) motel-like building, with rooms that open up to the outdoors (no hallway like you'd have in a hotel). My room was on the second floor. With no elevator, it was very difficult lugging our large luggage up the stairs. Also, the room faced a parking area that is adjacent to a small city street. I had a difficult time resting in the room for a few reasons. One reason is that, at some point during the night, the a/c stopped blowing cooled air and instead emitted air that was as muggy as the room. Another reason, there was noise coming from the parking area (voices from people) at late hours of the night. Additionally, the water in the toilet kept running (the kind of sound you'd hear right after flushing when the water level is getting back to normal). At one point (say at about 4 am), I began counting the number of minutes between the quiet and a new round of water noise--- not more than 10 minutes apart!Finally, the most annoying thing during my stay was the noise from the onslaught of municipal and vendor trucks that seemed to come around every 30 minutes from around 4 am throughout the morning. At first, I thought the sound was from a street sweeping truck. I accepted it and figured it would be gone and then I go back to sleep. But not long after the first bit of truck noise, I heard the loud beeping sound of a truck backing up. I am certain that I heard at least 5 different trucks come through with loud back-up beeping sounds. Perhaps they were vendors unloading supplies for the hotel??? I have no idea but it was very noisy and very early in the morning. Surprisingly, my husband was able to sleep through all the noise. So, maybe, if you're a deep sleeper you might be okay sleeping here. I was not.

Outstanding service and airport location make this hotel a best value for service members. Restaurant is close to McDonald's, and has a good breakfast menu. The hotel is clean and has one of the friendliest and most helpful staff!

This is my second stay here. The first time was great. The convenience of the location here is great. This time is for surgery. The staff is helpful and polite. The rooms are keep up with service every day. I am pleased with my stay.

A plane cancellation caused us to find a place for one night. The city bus recommended the Best Western The Plaza Hotel and delivered us right to the front door. It was between a freeway and the airport. I cannot believe how quiet it was and if we hadn't got on the flight the next day I would have continued my stay at The Plaza Hotel. Thank You for being there.

Our plane couldn't leave LA for Honolulu due to mechanical problems.They took us all off and found a working aircraft.We didn't arrive till 2 am !!!!!!The Best Western Plaza Hotel shuttle staff picked us up, no problem !!The desk clerk was very friendly and got us a nice high room with a view.The room was very clean and odor-free.I had some important tax papers to work on and mail first thing the next morning.I only got 2 hours sleep and got up early enough to find some stamps, mail the papers,and grab the shuttle back to the airport heading for New Zealand.So I find the stamp machine in the hotel lobby and wouldn't ya know it, they're out of stamps !! I'm panicking because I don't have enough time to get to the post office and risk missing our flight.Mena and Sharon at the front desk came to my rescue !!! After hearing the story and sensing my frustration, Mena offered to take my papers to the post office that afternoon !!!!!! THANK YOU. Usually I'm not a fan of airport hotels but kudos to thestaff and facility.

great value for the money near the airport. had some noise, but that close to the airport and freeway you have to know that it is going to have some. we manly use to sleep and clean up, was great for that.

Initially our first room had cockroaches in it and if it were up to me I would have found a different hotel day one. The staff gave us a different room the next morning and it was a much better fit.  There are plusses and minuses to this place, for example the restaurant is only open for dinner four days a week, the room I stayed in only had a tiny microwave and fridge stuffed in a short cupboard which also served as the table for the small flat screen. The shower is very hard to figure out, good water pressure but mostly cold.  The staff is the reason I'm still here even with all the issues. Our housekeeper Mercy is generally very upbeat and welcoming each morning. She created a relaxing environment where our needs are taken care of she seems genuinely interested in making our stay better and that goes a long way.

This hotel is wonderful. The staff is very friendly and so polite. Amalia is my house keeper she is amazing, very attentive to my families needs. She always keeps our rooms looking great. I love that she knows my children's names. Wonderful hotel! We love Amalia!!

This is a really great hotel, especially if you've recently relocated to the area and plan to stay in one for more than a few days. Everyone is very accommodating and friendly. The housekeeping staff do an amazing job and are there if you need anything. The beds are also very comfortable and clean. Bathroom is a little small but also very clean, and the showers have great water pressure. They do have a restaurant downstairs for breakfast and dinner only. Like most hotels, it can be slightly pricey, but the food (especially breakfast) is delicious. They also have a convenience store. It's literally two seconds from the airport and the interstate, and the good news is it's not noisy. As a matter of fact, I've never heard the planes taking off. If you choose this hotel expecting Hilton or Westin type rooms, then you will dissapoint yourself, but if you choose this hotel expecting the highest quality service, comfort, and accommodations, and the friendliest staff, you will not go wrong.

Every other day the restaurant does not serve meals and you must be shuttled to nearby motel. Food was good, but nothing was available until 5 PM. IF you are jet-lagged and need to eat, there is no choice. I hate to pay significantly more money for a facility that does not have an open restaurant.

This hotel is great for the convenience if your working on base. Back of hotel is not great quality, which is where I was put up. Lots of trash, homeless and noisy trucks in the morning. The A/C drowns out the noise a lot though. It worked for me for the convenience, but I'd request at the main hotel next time, it's detached from the rest of the hotel and I didn't feel safe going to do my laundry at night alone.

Close to the airport with GREAT shuttle service. The staff and front desk personnel are excellent, although check in lines frequently are long. Somehow their process is time consuming. The hotel rooms close to the highway are extraordinarily noisy! Make sure you reserve a room away from the highway and facing the airport otherwise you will not get much sleep.This is the third time I have stayed here and it is still the same....needs updating although the rooms are clean and well kept. The windows NEED to be sound proofed!The restaurant is above average with super servers. They are extremely accommodating and always with a smile! The hotel caters to military and their families. It is great to see them and we are thankful for their sacrifice.

I had the opportunity to stay here for 3 weeks for work. The best part about coming back from work? Being asked how my day was by the housekeeping staff, especially Annie. She was very friendly and hospitable. She went above and beyond to ensure that I was getting all that I needed. Overall, this hotel has an awesome staff. It really added to my pleasant stay at Oahu. Highly recommended!

Stayed for 12 days, and found an incredibly helpful staff that made the stay well worth it. Hotel was clean, restaurant and cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. Cecilia, Sharon, Michael, Chandra, just to name a few of the personnel who made for a great family experience.

I lived in this hotel for two months. I will be rating it 5 stars due to all of the employees. I had the same housekeeper, Amalia, for the entire time of our stay.She was amazing because she had to work around my kid's sleep and play schedule, which she did everyday. Also, the few times we needed something fixed the maintanance guys were here within five minutes. The ladies at rhe font desk always called when I had mail. I have watched all of them deal with irate and hateful customers with complete respect.There is a gym with free weights and cardio machines that is kept in pristine condition. The Plaza Cafe was the joy for us nightly. The staff is made up of the friendliest people you could ask for. My family will be coming back to the restaurant to see Sharon, Gemma, Ramone, and James because they are amazing at their job.

This hotel is nice. It is a little on the older side, but is clean and the staff was great. Housekeeping service was outstanding, as was maintenance. When I checked in the fridge and Wi-Fi were not working. Within an hour I had a brand new fridge and working internet.Only downside is the location relative to the interstate. If you are a light sleeper the constant freeway noise might bother you. But for me it was not a bother.

I stayed here for a couple of weekends and while here I had a wonderful stay thanks to, Merey and Grace. These two women did beyond what I expected and couldn't ask for more. Thank You for the stay and the comfort you provided.

Staff and airport location make this a high-potential property. The dated and dingy rooms (especially the bathrooms), make this an overall poor value and disappointing experience. The convenience store and restaurant are not open 24 hours like all airport hotels need to be. They removed the lounge years ago, and never replaced it.

Our plane was delayed and we had to stay an extra night ( I know, poor me, stuck in Hawaii for an extra day). Beau at the best western was very kind and understanding of our situation and gave us a very nice room. It was late and she was able to recommend a place to eat that was quite good. Overall, a very decent and quiet place to stay near the airport.

The rooms were in great condition. Very modern hotel. One aspect of my stay that I didn't expect to be as great as it was, was the service I received from my room attendant Annie. At various different times she went out of her way to ensure that my stay was as best as it could be. I will definitely return to this hotel based on her hospitality alone. Amazing attendant.

Each time I make a trip to Honolulu, I always look forward to staying in this hotel because of its cleanliness and most importantly, courteous front desk employee named Beau. She posses outstanding customer service, no matter how terrible my trip was, she found ways to brighten and made my day at ease. Kudos to Beau, and I look forward for another stay in the near future.

I stayed in this hotel for over two weeks as I was PCS'd into Hawaii. This hotel is a great value find. The staff are very friendly and accomodating especially Amalia the maid who took care of our room while we were there.

The staff gave you the feeling that you were family instead of number. The staff always had a smile even after dealing with a hard customer before me. Mercy of the house keeping staff was helpful in keeping condiments and coffee stocked with a very positive attitude.

Easy Access to Military Installations on the Leeward side within the government rate of $177 (as of Jan 2016). A bit of a drive to fun stuff if you're on vacation (I wasn't so didn't care). The older two-story structure is very close to constant noise from Nimitz Hwy. Older, but clean well maintained rooms.

Merey my house keeper does a fantastic room service, is clean well organized. She changes bed sheets daily, removes used towels, restocks the towels organized on towel racks.The coffee pot is cleaned daily, restocks the coffee for next day, leaves a package with cream, sweeteners and coffee stirs. The room is vacuumed daily,trash cans and recycling can emptied daily, new trash can liners installed. I recommend the house keeper and the other staff members.

We had a 6 am flight back to the mainland so it made sense to stay by the airport. Unfortunately there are only two choices, the Ohana or the Plaza both of which are basic hotels.The staff were great and friendly though and while the room was quite basic, it was also clean and offered enough space for our stuff (as a family of 4 with younger kids we have regular luggage plus car seats).There is both a McDonalds as well as a strip mall (starbucks, pizza and a couple of other restaurants) around the corner should you get in late enough you need a bite. We left early so no breakfast for us. The shuttle driver was nice and we had no problems.One the bad side, the hotel is located next to an elevated freeway and the windows aren't soundproof. I'm a deep sleeper so it was quiet enough for me but I could see some being bothered with this.Overall if we needed to stay by the airport we'd definitely return.

Out of All the Best Western Hotels we've stayed This was the BEST of the Best. From the staff to the amenities they make you feel as if it were there just for you. They seriously go out of their way to make you feel your Family.

Quality of hotel very good. I wanted something clean, quiet and these things were offered. Not close to downtown area but loved the convenience of rest/relaxation before return home. I travel a lot, mostly abroad and this was my first experience at a Best Western and I was pleasantly surprised. Not high end but very acceptable for convenience. I didn't eat at the restaurants so I cannot vouch for quality

Just renewed my room here with my family. Cherae and Lan at the front desk make everything so easy for me and always check up on us. Makes us feel like we are at home. Rosendo Acob from housekeeping also always tends to our extra needs promptly. Sandra and Mina also from front desk makes our visits pleasurable that's why we always come back. There may be cheaper places to stay at, but we always come back because of the staff

Since we had a flight early in the morning we chose to stay at a hotel near the airport for one night. However, this hotel was way overpriced for the standard it offered. It felt out-dated, and the vending machines were under-stocked.

Our stay here at Best Western has been great so far. The rooms are pretty spacious, free Wi-Fi, microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker. There is a gym and pool in the hotel. I just wish they had a play area for families with little children to play in.  Our room attendant Annie is very friendly and a family oriented person. She made our stay feel like home away from home. The kids and I enjoy her short company. :) We love the walking distance to Mac Donald and other food places, NEX and Hickam are not that far either. Overall Best Western and it's friendly staff has done us good. :)

I have to say that this hotel staff is amazing. The staff that made my family feel at home include Mr. Les, Mrs. Beau, Ms. Lan, and Mr. James. Me and my family have no issues with the hotel and I would definitely stay here every time. The staff here are very professional and have alot of information that the guess can use. To think about it, I don't feel like a guess here at all. Me and my family actually feel like we are with family here. This the best hotel that I have ever stayed in, hands down.

Family of 3 on our way to Kauai and had to stay one night in Honolulu. This hotel had everything we needed - free airport service and restauarnt on site. Beds were comfortable and showers were hot. Hotel is a bit older and bathroom only has room for 1. I would stay here again only for a one nighter and the free airport service.

I have used this hotel, Best Western the Plaza for all my business trip over the last 4 years. The staff, especially Rose and Beau, at the Front Desk are simply incredible. They go beyond normal to make sure all your needs are met, not to mention their happy, helpful and fun personalities. Their welcome to everyone if infectious. I look forward to seeing the 2 of them every trip.The location of the hotel to the airport, where I conduct the business end of my trips, is perfect and still very convenient for all other foray out and about. I can't ask for any more except longer stay in Hawaii :)Thanks Rose and Beau.

Many positives of this hotel: near McDonald's, clean rooms (only one cockroach in the sink), helpful management, nice pool area, good restaurant and gift shop on site, within walking distance of several small local restaurants and a Starbucks, near the public bus stop, and reliable airport shuttle. The negatives included: no elevators to all floors, noisy rooms, since it is near a big highway, and limited pool hours. Take bug spray for pool time at dawn or dusk. Also, the restaurant is not open every day, so check at the desk.

I want to recognize Cheral who treated us so nicely when we checked in. After an ordeal at the rental car office, I was not in a good mood. Cheral recognized that and showed tremendous empathy and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.. Later, she gave us excellent recommendations for activities near by and for a great and reasonable seafood restaurant also nearby called Nico's. Go there before 5pm as it gets busy. Parking was attached and is priced according to your Best Western status. Ours cost $15. McDonald's right around the corner. Thank you Cheral!!!

Our room was located on the side closest to the highway, so needless to say it was very noisy. But what made up for it was the service and care from the hotel staff on everything we needed. If you get the chance to stay here, be sure to ask for Cherae at the Front Desk. She provides impeccable service! Very warm and welcoming. She even provided us with $40 in meal coupons for the hotel restaurant after she has made a small error on our paperwork. Would certainly stay again, and you should too!

We spent one night here on our way to Kauai. The service was fine and the Restaurant was good but the room was in serious need of updating. It was also rather loud at times as other guests walked down the hall talking. We didn't get a great nights sleep.

These is a good value if you want to stay near the airport. The room was large, clean, and had good internet. The building is a little old so you will hear people in the neighboring rooms, especially in the bathroom. Also, there can be a significant amount of noise from the lower and elevated highway.

Chose to stay here as we had an early flight. Room was fine for a one-night stay. The bed was kind of small for two. The road noise was a bit loud. Okay for an overnight but probably not an extended stay. The bus driver was exceptionally sweet and helpful.

My stay at Best Western was awesome! My son and I stayed a month and I have no complaints. I really appreciate the hospitality of Lan, Charae and Mena! I hope I spelled their names correctly, however, these ladies were present when I needed help the most and were of great assistance!

We needed one night near the airport as we could not make a same day connection, so we booked the BW Best thing about this hotel is its proximity to the airport (but noise was not an issue for us!) and the free airport shuttle. When we arrived we easily found the hotel phones in the baggage claim area and were promptly picked up and taken to the hotel.Check-in was quick and easy and the room was clean and tidy; what more could you want.We did not try any on-site facilities as we arrived late and left early, but I'm sure the hotel would be sufficient for a few days.All in all, exactly what we wanted at a fair price!

My family of 4 had a restful day at this hotel on our way to NZ. The room was quiet and the beds comfortable. The staff went out of their way to help us on Christmas eve. We were there from 10 pm to 7 pm and allowed to use their fitness room and lobby internet. We stored our luggage and hopped the bus outside the door for a beach day in Waikiki. The shuttle was quick and relaxing. The cheerful welcome was needed and appreciated. Great stop over hotel. We will be back.

Our family pcsed here and the staff is just awesome. Amalia is our cleaning lady on our floor and I just love her. She interacts with my 3 kids they just adore her. she also makes sure that we have everything that we need. she makes staying here worth it as well as the rest of the staff here. you don't normally fid a staff that knows your name cause most people dont care to know but Amalia knows all of our names and I think thats a plus. I recommend anyone to stay here and if you want just some one who you can talk to and makes sure that you are comfortable and the sweetest person that you will meet I say try to get Amalia's floor. I cant say enough about her, but all the staff here are so nice and sweet they are always happy. Mahalo!

The employees here go out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. I have been to hotels around the world from flea traps to two hundred dollars a night and I have never been made to feel as at home as these people made me feel. I want to give out a special comment for the front desk clerks Lan, Cherae, and Mena. They looked out for me and my family as if they were their own. I can't wait to come back here.

We only had a very short over. The staff were very accomodating and made sure we had a pleasant stay and rest. The room was comfortable and very close to the airport. The restaurant downstairs had a good hearty breakfast on the menu that helped full our empty bellies.

Traveling to Oahu for business and you need something central on the island, the Best Western Plaza is a good choice . Close to the airport and close to freeway access, you can easily go in all directions on the island. About 15 min to get into town and 45 to get to the North Shore. Rooms are kept clean and the cleaning staff is courteous and helpful. Mercy kept my room spotless. Food is close by. A McDonalds is just around the corner if you don't to eat at the restaurant but if you want local food just walk a little further and there is a L&L restaurant. Overall just a good place to stay.

I came to Hawaii 3 years ago and had the opportunity to stay at the Best Western Plaza on Nimitz. I was very unfamiliar with Hawaii, but the staff was extremely helpful and welcome to myself and my family. They made us feel at home as much as possible. The courtesy, knowledge and the willingness to always be helpful from the staff Cherae, Mena and Lan made my family and me feel as if we were part of theirs. The Hotel has its things that can improve, but the staff all in itself is the best I had to be around. I recommend staying at the Best Western if you want to be welcomed with open arms. They are also a Pet Friendly hotel which for animals lovers who want to bring their furry friends along will definitely enjoy the staffs love for them as well. Thanks for the great stay and the time we had there.

This hotel was good and the service was excellent. The hotel is very close to the airport; however, it is quiet and you can't hear the planes landing. You are not directly in the hustle of Waikiki but you are not that far from it. It is centrally located and close to the various bases, exchange and commissary for military personnel. This hotel is also close to Pearl Harbor and the stadium. The people that work here are very nice and accommodating, especially Mercy and Fely.

We're just finishing up a two week stay at this hotel because of a recent move to Hawaii. The staff was incredibly accommodating and kind. Every staff member we came across was so great. Our housekeeper, Mercy, was especially amazing! Every time she cleaned she would organize my two years olds toys nice and nearly on her bed and that was just so special and sweet. The maintenance man, Sam I think it was? Was also so kind. We got my little girl a new bubble gun without realizing it took a screw driver to open the battery compartment and of course, I didn't happen to have a screw driver laying around in my hotel room. So I asked the front desk if maybe they had anything to open it and they kindly called the maintenance man to help which he kindly did. I couldn't have had a better experience here and I'd definitely come back and recommend it to anyone.

We stayed here while waiting for a house. It wasn't long, but we were impressed by everyone and everything (except maybe the pancakes lol). If you are moving, contact Les for their TLA rate. Ours included two dogs and parking, so it didn't have to come out of pocket. Others' without dogs have included meal vouchers I hear. Speaking of pets, their pet rooms are all tile and have easy access to the grassy walking area, which is clean and not gross at all. They even have a poo bag and trash stand for your convenience. We started in a room with 2 doubles but they moved us to a king when it became available at our request, no problems. The rooms are current and immaculate. One set of rooms (against the highway) are a bit loud seeming due to traffic, but the hotel provided ear plugs on the nightstands - not that we needed them. The staff are all super nice and went above and beyond to please everyone. The location may not be fancy and downtown, but it is centrally located to PH/Hickam, AMR, Shafter, and Triple so travel was a breeze. The only negative is that they don't have luggage trolleys, so be prepared to make multiple trips to/from your room if you have a lot. I would recommend this place hands down if you are PCSing in or just need a place close to the airport.

We have been in the hotel for about a week now and the staff here are SOOO friendly! Our Room Attendant, Mercy, is always smiling and makes sure we get what we need to have a clean and pleasant stay in the room! I would most definitely recommend staying here when you come to Oahu!

We stayed for four nights, we were upgraded to a suite. Very close to Airport and highway. Ear plugs are provided in your room for your convenience. We did not use ours. This hotel is used my many military family's waiting for housing. Small outdoor pool and exercise room at this hotel. Restaurant onsite but no free breakfast at this location.We were told at booking, as Military members we would receive $10 food voucher daily but on arrival were denied as we did not book via the Military Liaison. A loss of revenue to the restaurant without the vouchers, we went next store for Breakfast at McDonalds.Free airport shuttle. Small outdoor pool and exercise room at this location.Staff at front desk and house keeping friendly and helpful.

My thanks again to the staff of the Plaza Hotel. I remember especially Mena, Charae, Chandra, and the front desk staff, as well as the Kunai store and housecleaning. To all my big "mahalo" for a pleasant time. The room was very clean, quiet, and with good views of the city and surrounding Oahu areas. Using the hotel garage was very convenient as I could drive around the island easily from the entrance to Nimitz Highway. Above all, I want to thank everyone there for your Hawaiian hospitality and friendly service. It does help me to feel like family when I visit.

This hotel is very close to HNL airport, just minutes...Saying that, it is an easy 30 minute plus drive to Downtown Honolulu and longer to Waikiki Beach area.However, the hotel was a great stay for on business. Easy access to Nimitz Blvd. and the H1 freeway.If your military, there is a NEX shoppette pretty much across Nimitz from the hotel.And, the Pearl Harbor NEX and commissary complex is only about 2 miles away.The hotel itself looks dated, but my room was clean, the bed comfy and the wifi worked great.There is a gift shop in the lobby & an attached restaurant. There area looks shady, but we walked to many of restaurants within a block or two and had no issues. Many of the locals we passed even greated us. There is even a Starbucks a block away.The staff was amazing, both friendly & professional.

The hotel is close to the airport, While there are no restaurants close by, the service at the hotel was very friendly and accommodating. The shuttle bus driver picked me up at the car rental return and took us close to the departure check-in area for the particular airline that we were using. The desk clerk was also very helpful.

My friend and I stayed a few weeks and had the most excellent housekeeping service. Our housekeeper Mercy was professional and always greeted us with a friendly smile. We were not the most cleanest 20 year olds during our stay, but she had the room clean and smelling great every evening we came home. Thank you for making our stay great!

We stayed here when travelling from Vancouver to Tahiti. It's very convenient being so close to the airport and they have a very good shuttle service. The room was spacious, clean and bright. The hotel staff we met were all very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here if we needed an overnight stop again.

In 1988 I was on my way to Guam and stayed at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. The place was comfortable, the staff was very accommodating, and all other areas of customer service were exceptional. In 2015 I was on my way to Kwajalein and had to overnight (a 7-hour layover) in Honolulu between flights. I stayed at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel again, wondering if my experience would be the same. The place was again comfortable, the staff was very accommodating, and all other areas of customer service were exceptional. Next time I have a short layover in Honolulu would I choose the same hotel? You bet! It's only minutes from the airport, the shuttle runs every half hour, the staff is glad to see you, my bed was very comfortable...

Am a frequent traveler and I travel to HI constantly. This year, was the third time I go for a long stay (73 days) at the BW the Plaza on Nimitz Hwy. When am there, I feel at home. From the moment I interact with the front desk folks (Cherae, Sharon, Mena, etc) to the moment I get to my room and I know it is going to be clean (Grace and Amalia are the best!). Afterwards, in the afternoon, I can enjoy an amazing dinner and a glass of wine at the restaurant and I know I will be treated well by Ramon, Mike, or Techie. Do not hesitate to stay at this wonderful place with folks that will treat you like family.

My dad had an emergency surgery, and being that we were from the outer island, after being discharged from the hospital, we were sent to the best western to continue his recovery before heading back to Maui. To our surprise we enjoyed our stay. Very simple hotel with the service you would expect. Our housekeeper Madeline was awesome, very attentive and made our situation less stressful for our family by assisting in any way She could. Thank you to the rest of the staff as well.

on checking in to my room i was greeted by ms.Sharon she welcomed me back and gave me a room on the 10 th floor i love this hotel, also excellent housekeeping by annie this is why i keep staying at this hotel because of people like sharon and Annie,good attitude friendly and good customer service,i will always stay at best western the plaza hotel keep up the good work and happy holidays!! Evi Savea

I love this hotel, great management, great staff. Continues to get better every year. User friendly, there is a restaurant, small store, laundry, and the cleanest rooms on the Island, and parking. 10 minutes to the base, 17 minutes to Waikiki, 1 hr 20 minutes to North Shore. Free shuttle bus so you can turn in the rent-a-car the night before you fly out. Shuttle runs 24/7 every 30 minutes. What else do you want? I looked for snobs and couldn't find even 1. The are Sailors, Marines, and Air Force staying here too. Buy one a drink or 2.

On checking in to the hotel we were greeted by Ms. Sharon and she welcomed us back and gave us a room on the east side of the hotel facing the city of Honolulu and Diamond head mountain. The last time we were here was 3 years ago and Sharon still remembered us. We have always stayed at this Hotel when we visit family in Hawaii for the past 28 years. Ms. Sharon kept a eye out for us during our 16 day visit that made us feel very comfortable and welcomed. This hotel is very close to the airport that makes it ideal for outer Island travel.

Very good housekeeping by Mercy. Close to shopping and not to far from the beach. Plenty of places to dine at. Can be a little noisy being close to the highway but not too bad. Can't complain. Rental car places are right next door with shuttles to and from the airport.

My family and I stayed here for 10 days on a PCS move off island. It is conveniently located by Hickam AFB. Room was clean. There was a small wait on the room attached to ours for our kids but they opened it up soon after. My kids are all preteens and they gave us extra cots since they do not like sleeping together. Bathrooms are kind of small but clean. For the price it was okay. The gym is on top floor and has enough equipment to get a work out in. Free weights, elliptical, treadmill, universal workout machine, bike, and yoga area. Everything was stocked up like towels and cups for the water machine. It overlooks tripler area. The pool is very clean and has a lot of seating. Sadly it was raining most of the 10 days but our girls still swam. The best part about the hotel is the parking. You park in the garage near an elevator. As I watched others at nearby hotels running in the rain to their cars parked outside I was thankful for the convenient parking garage. We had a great maid, named Amelia. She was very kind to us and didnt mind restocking towels and stuff for the kids. She was very friendly to the kids. The store downstairs is a little pricey but we would just drive to the shoppette if we needed anything (also NEX mall right down the road). The lobby is nice with a computer and printer that was great for me since I needed to print homework. The wifi in the rooms was fast. Im not sure if the people complaining about slow connection went onto bestwestern.com and put in the password. If you only click on best western through your wifi you will get slow internet so remember to log in on your internet browser also. About the room. Smaller TV but we are use to a 60inch. It worked. Buying movies on demand is nuts $12.99 to rent it. We bought a cheap DVD player and rented redbox movies. The beds are a little hard but slept fine. The A/C is amazing!!!! Gets so cold if you like that. There is a small fridge and microwave. The restaurant is not the best. High priced for not so great food but we have lived here for a few years and have had amazing food so it was disappointing. You do get $10/per person vouchers for food a day so that helps for breakfast (breakfast is not free). We drove to other areas to eat and bought food to make in hotel. We made it work. The shuttle to the airport is convenient and runs every 30min. Do bring a few ones to tip the driver for dealing with your bags. We didnt know this and had no cash. The front desk is friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

This hotel offers great room service and easy manageable timing for when room service comes. You simply let them know when you'll be gone and they do everything in the time they are given. The lady who came to our room Mekey left the room perfectly clean everytime. Very helpful employees at lobby personally helped me with bus schedule. Also provides a perfect location for military people.

After my sister was released from the hospital, we spent 3 nights at this hotel. What made our stay memorable was the kindness of the staff, especially front desk personnel Mena and Cecelia the convenience store clerks and the kind housekeeping staff. With my sister needing wheelchair and prompt transportation, the staff went above and beyond to make sure we were well cared for. Many thanks and much aloha to everyone at the Best Western.

I had to go to Honolulu to work. I was booked at a hotel in downtown Waikiki and did not want to fight traffic to go to work and again in the evening getting off work. So I changed my reservation to The Plaza. I was at the Best Western for a month. Not to many things in walking distance but there is plenty around if you have a car. Parking was on the pricey side at $30 a night. The restaurant downstairs was nice and had pretty good food. Staff is nice. Rooms were clean. Can be noisy due to the fact you are between the express way and airport. All and all not a bad stay.

Very nice and polite personnel working throughout the hotel. Everyone seemed to go out of there way to help you or assist you. Was able to check in early and had a very nice room on the 10th floor. Could still hear traffic on the H1/Nimitz highway but was not bad enough to worry about. Shuttle service to the airport was fast and leaves every hour and half hour. Price beats staying down on the beach (downtown)..

There are many "considerations" that come with staying in Hawaii. Yes, goods cost more because of the shipping/freight involved in getting things there but it is obvious that retailers and service providers take advantage of this when possible. This hotel has, quite possibly, the most limited TV channel selection I have experienced in years. This would not be very important if this property was located in Waikiki or some other interesting area yet there is NOTHING near here but the airport. Based on my initial breakfast I would have given the restaurant a very low score (2 eggs , a scoop of hash, some potatoes for 18 bucks and change). It redeemed itself a little on my last day with some tasty eggs benedict. Still, it pales next to the free breakfast I receive at every other BW I frequent (including those with restaurants). The internet is extremely slow and sometimes the router goes down. When calling the front desk in the evening, the person did not even know where the router was located. The parking, while an insult to be charged, usually has space available....if you are driving a subcompact. You're better off parking against the wall because management is trying to milk three spots in place of two. The water temp is hit or miss and will change in the middle of your shower...and back again. The front desk staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. My bed was very comfortable and the room temp controls were very effective. Just stay out of the direct shot from the vent when using the AC. This hotel is priced right at the cost of 3 star hotels near Waikiki but without the obvious advantage of being there.

Arrived after nine, no food, no bar, not even a mini bar. Bed comfortable and at least there was a shuttle from the airport. Needed just a cheap overnight and for that it served its purpose. But I wouldn't use this place again and recommend that you find someplace else, even for an overnight.

Good place to stay. Near airport. Has frequent shuttle. Bus driver very helpful. City bus at door. Easy to get downtown but long by bus (1 hr.). Front desk stuff very helpful and willing to offer suggestion. Only downside is that property is getting a little long in the tooth. It’s location right next to an elevated freeway is very unattractive but minimal freeway noise in the room. Many local food outlets.

We were in transit to Kauai and only stayed overnight. The hotel is very close to the airport and the shuttle was quick and clean. Any interactions with staff were very pleasant and enjoyable. Will stay there again.

sleep good bed,Shower, everything provide in bathroom, special coffee in the morning God bless Best Western in Honolulu Hi, I had been stopped by Best Western in Mainland USA a lot 45 states plus Hawaii, Easy with familiar like family to me,

If comfort and convenience for the price is what you are looking for this is the right hotel for you. Located near the airport and within a block from car rental return locations, this is the perfect spot to wake up early to get to the airport. Clean and nice accommodations. The bathrooms are bit on the small side but you can't beat the price.

From the time I arrived, five hours later than expected, the staff were AMAZING!! All of them were very polite and helpful. Anything that I needed, from places close to eat something unique to a bottle opener to open the wine I had just bought in the store, they were there to help. When I would be picky and ask for multiple laundry bags because I had WAY to many clothes to wash, and then be willing to change my bills out for quarters, the staff was always willing to put up with me. I want to give a special shout out to Mercy! She was the housekeeper who cleaned my room during my three week stay and she did an AMAZING job! She had a lot to put up with as I am a beginning hiker and would come back to the room less than pristine. :) Another plus I had with the room were the fridge and microwave and the cabinet as it became a sort of pantry throughout my stay. Once you get the roads down the hotel is situated in a very good location. I was able to get wherever I wanted to go quickly and efficiently; and as it is really near to the airport, Naval memorials and historical sites, Honolulu, and Waikiki you can't get much better than it to strike a perfect balance between work and play.

This hotel is an excellent choice for travelers going through the Honolulu airport, with an overnight stay. The Plaza hotel clearly specializes in accommodating these kinds of travelers, providing on-call airport pick up and scheduled drop offs every 30 minutes. We stayed at another airport hotel, and while they had the same transportation options, for the same price, The Plaza is a much nicer hotel. Rooms are quiet, well-apportioned, and have comfortable beds. Compared to other Best Western hotels I've stayed at, this hotel is much higher quality. Conveniently located at the airport, and walkable to a few restaurants, Stabucks, and convenience store, as well as public transportation.

Just spent 9 night there on a business trip. The hotel was very clean and the staff and service was outstanding. It was very military friendly hotel. It is located in prime location to most of the major military bases. The only downside is it is located next to the freeway so the noise could be and issue. Highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to Hawaii.

I loved my time here, they have amazing food, the location is great, and our Room Attendant Mercy was great. My room was always cleaned to perfection! The hotel itself was clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. We had to stay here for a while and they remembered everything we liked to accommodate us better.

This place was great. Centered right in the middle of Honolulu, its easy access to both downtown and all the surrounding military bases. I stayed here for about a month, and the staff made sure I had everything I needed, Especially Fely! She was amazing. If ever I come to Hawaii again, I will stay here for sure. AnthonyRoom 629

We stayed here overnight between an international flight and a connection to Maui.The hotel itself is a stones throw from the airport and there is a very quick free shuttle service.It is quite expensive for what you get and looks like it was last decorated in the early 90s.The beds are comfortable and the rooms are spacious.Unfortunately the raised freeway is right next to the hotel and so some rooms are quite noisy.As it is so easy for the airport I would stay here again but just overnight.The hotel really needs to sort itself out and update. I do not imagine people will put up with the high prices and for decoration for much longer.

I stayed at the hotel because the timing for a business trip changed at the last moment and all of the Waikiki hotels were booked except for those in the extreme price range.The location isn't great if you come to Hawaii and hope to be near anything nice (like the beach, shops or decent restaurants). The Nimitz highway was underneath my window and noisy 24/7. (hence the free earplugs). The area around the hotel looks industrial.While location is not a selling point, the staff were very friendly and managed to find me a room when I arrived several hours before check in. Although old, the room was spacious, very clean and had everything I needed (minus a safe). There was enough parking space at the times when I returned each day.As a last minute option for business it was ok.

The Best Western on Nimitz Highway was a great place to stay. The Hotel Staff was friendly and courteous. The Hotel was in a great location for where I was travelling every day for work. I hope to come back soon and stay at this location again.

We've been at this location for a little over a week now and the service has been great so far! The staff is wonderful, very polite. Our Room Attendant, Amalia, does such a great job...staying in a hotel for long periods of time is not the greatest but the staff makes sure to make you feel comfortable and welcomed.

CHERAE provided outstanding customer service and was super gracious in meeting my needs. All of the staff were courteous and respectful and moved quickly with the line during check in. Originally I was given two beds but as a really tall person I needed a king bed. The staff was able to meet my needs. When staying here I went to The Plaza Cafe and got an awesome breakfast.. stay here for friendly and superior service.

This hotel was terrible. The service was terrible. The rooms were terrible. The atmosphere was terrible. The air conditioner was broken and the maintenance did not fix it and we were left to freeze with two babies under the age of two. The hotel is SO expensive and did not offer any restaurant services in its facility on the night we checked in. Yet the hotel charged $200 USD for one night stay. Terrible, terrible, terrible. Will NEVER stay here again

The staff here is so wonderful, the welcome is so warm and delightful. It started from the front Ms. Mena & Mr. Lorenzo. Mr. Lorenzo has the best conversation & is very knowledgeable about the island from entertainment to restaurants. I couldn't have been escorted by a better person. Ms. Mena has a very genuine consideration for all that comes through the door she took the time to show and explain the bus route to me on her off work time. She would even go as far asking me how my day is whenever she sees me. I can tell she is truly a gentle spirit the hotel is blessed to have her.

Parking on property, restaurant not available for all meal times, loud traffic noise are offset by lower cost to make this a good value hotel. Staff provided outstanding service. Moderate shop has good selection of items.

We arrived very early in Hawaii to the hotel, and the shuttle service was prompt and very convenient. The desk clerk was so helpful in storing our luggage until check-in time. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help however they could. We will stay there again when we are back in Hawaii!

My stay started off with a great warm welcome from "Beau". Not only did Beau support my accommodations, she had gone above and beyond to make sure my following stay will be set up to my convenience. She also notified me of restaurants and sites to see and visit. Thank you Beau for being outstanding.

After an airline cancellation, I called to see if they had any rooms. The reservationist encouraged me to get a voucher, but I opted for avoiding the 3 hour wait and paying for a room. The reservationist sent a shuttle over to the airport very quickly. The driver was helpful and informative. The desk staff were accommodating and helpful. The room was recently renovated and in good condition. It was overall a very good experience at this Best Western.

for the couple of nights i was here, i had a great service from ms. Amalia who would always keep our room clean at all times. not only that, the front desk and everyone who works here were always great help. thank you and i can;t wait for my next visit to stay again here.

One of the biggest rooms for the price. Exceeds Waikiki Courtyard Marriott. Stayed away from the traffic in Honolulu and Waikiki and enjoyed a nicer room for the price with no hassle parking. I have stayed at the Aqua Surf, Ala Moana, and Marriott Courtyard. This Best Western had a larger room and the services were the same or better for the same price or lower

Stayed here on our last night on the Island as it is very near airport with free shuttle service. Good choice, though without the usual breakfast option. Location is good if you need just one night with no activity or outing as it is not near anything. Shuttle only runs to airport. Limited choices for food.

My family and I have been staying here for a few weeks while we find a house and it's been great! The staff are very nice and helpful. It's close to the beach and Waikiki! And housekeeping does a great job of cleaning! Especially Fely!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Took shuttle from airport which was quick though tedious to summon.Hotel in inauspicious location but quiet enough, despite airport proximity.Room was spacious withngood, if, boring, views.Initial problem was non working room light and non working bedside table light. Better maintenance called for.Hair on bath suggests cleaning needs improvement.Breakfast as adequateOverall, Average

I arrived into HNL for a connection flight that I had missed. As a direct result, I had to overnight in HNL. I chose the Best Western TPH for my stay as it was close to the airport. My first impression, GREAT customer service. Thank you to the entire team - specifically CHERAE. She was a blast of energy from the moment I walked through the front door. All-in-all, the price was a little higher than what I wanted to pay, but the property, location and staff were all great.Another strong point for me was the fact that the bus stop was steps away from the front door of the hotel. This made it very easy to visit Waikiki Beach and Shopping area.

This hotel is somewhat older in appearance, but they make up for it with amenities and an amazing staff! We are currently staying at the hotel while in transit to moving to the island for the Army. Everyone at the hotel has been so welcoming and friendly. they seem to genuinely care about the guests. I worked in the hotel industry for over 10 years and my favorite thing is the little things the staff does to make you feel welcome. The front desk ensured that we knew about our $40 a day meal vouchers for using their military TLA program. The various waitresses and waiters always seat us quickly and are so kind to our children. They even offer us coffee to go in the mornings when we are wrapping up our breakfast. The housekeeper, Amalia, was so sweet when cleaning our room. She even arranged all of the baby toys neatly in the crib and made up my son's bed with his special blanket! We will be at this hotel for almost two months and I am so glad that I did not listen to others to go to a "fancier" hotel downtown!

Very convenient location near Airport with a wonderful front desk crew. I was told we were given an upgrade but that it was next to freeway level. Arrived room and had DP Pushbutton door....with all the baggage it really helped!Photo shows their positive care they provide to to their clients.Slept well, left early with shuttle and caught cold on return flight. Great Vacation!Ps....Photo is ear plugs with greeting card-Yowsaa!!

The airport shuttle is iffy at best, especially if you arrive late at night. I had to wait one hour even after calling the hotel and been told the bus was on its way. It takes 10 minutes and I waited more than 30 minutes. This is a airport hotel, bus shuttle should be sharp.

The hotel is centrally located, there are several eateries are all within the walking distance which made this place very convenient. The front desk reception are all very friendly, a good value for your money.

This hotel is so conveniently located to the Honolulu Airport. (No noise problem at all.) Free shuttle service to and from airport. Simple walk across the street to get city buses to Waikiki beach area, huge shopping area, or Pearl Harbor. Extremely helpful and competent staff.

We only stayed in this hotel for one night as we were travelling from the UK and picking up our grandaughter who lives in Oahu to go onto our vacation in Maui the next morning. On arrival at Honolulu airport, we used the free phone to call the Hotel, who advised us to catch the free shuttle, which they provide and was waiting outside, it took us straight to the hotel. The receptionists were very friendly. We had breakfast, which was lovely, in the morning, then was taken back to the airport in their shuttle to catch our flight to Maui. There isn't much of a view from the window as it is on an industrial park, but we found it very convenient for our purpose to getting to the airport. We would stay there again.

My daughter and I had to fly to Honolulu Oct. 5th to visit a dying relative, so our trip was not for pleasure. The desk staff,especially Cealia, at the Best Western plaza hotel went above and beyond their duties to serve our needs. They were very very friendly, warm and caring individuals. They took exceptional care of our physical and emotional needs. I truly believe they were angels sent by God to carry us through our difficult time. We are very grateful and appreciative of the way they went out of their duties to lighten our burden. Thank you Cealia

Front Desk Cherae greeted Us with So much aloha n big smiles made sure our stay would be as comfortable as possible Because of her warmness We would definitely come back and stay at your Best Western Plaza Hotel in Honolulu Aloha Pualani Takahashi

We stayed at the Best Western Plaza for our first few nights in Hawaii, as we arrived late in Honolulu, and planned on seeing a few local attractions before leaving on a cruise. The shuttle picked us up promptly at the airport and the very friendly driver quickly delivered us to the hotel. The hotel is well worn (carpets and furniture), and well used by travelers and military, because of it's location next to the airport, in an industrial park. It suited our purposes though, with car rentals just a short walk from the hotel. We were on the top floor which was a little warm (as Hawaii was having a heat wave due to tropical storms). The room was always cleaned and the WiFi worked okay. The staff were very friendly, especially Cherae and Mena who helped out on a few occasions, including obtaining a shuttle to the cruise ship, and directions to the USS Arizona, which was nearby.We ate in the hotel's restaurant once, which was overpriced for what you were served. Overall, our stay was very pleasant

We arrived on a flight from big island and had to fly back to LA very early in the morning so we searched a hotel on or near the airport of honolulu. There are only 2 properties 2 choose from and based on reviews we took the best western.Rate was quite high, but its Honolulu.Checkin was very friendly. The room is basic but clean. There is an outside pool onsite.Wifi was acceptable with a good speed. If you want to visit Waikiki yuo have to take the bus which stops just outside near the reception.

Stay away! Room had ants, worms and fleas. Socks were filthy dirty had to throw away. Room smelled. Manager so rude! Took off one night then tried to get it back..accused me of horrible things. Whole staff is rude which flows from Manager Gene. STAY AWAY!!!!!! Do not go to Honolulu and stay there! OMG, there are no words for how AWFUL it is!!!!!!

We are a Coast Guard family on orders here in Hawaii. Due to a last minute switch in travel plans, the CG put us in the Best Western. Glad they did because the staff here is top-notch. They are warm, welcoming, friendly, and always happy to help. The restaurant staff is amazing as well, and the cooks are fantastic. Cherae at the Front Desk is the coolest staff member around. We consider her our culinary expert as she has given the best recommendations to all the local food joints around here. We have tried everything she told us to and have not been disappointed. We are recommending this hotel to all of our family and friends when they come to visit us. Thank you so much Best Western for welcoming us to Hawaii in true Ohana fashion!

My room was nothing special, but was clean. I was in Hawaii for less than 12 hours, so really just wanted a place to sleep and shower. I appreciated the free and convenient shuttle (that arrived quickly after I called them from the bank of phones in the baggage claim area). The driver was friendly and helpful. If you did want to go down to Waikiki, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel that will take you there cheap (if you don't have a car). Wifi was decent. There was a pool, but I didn't use it. I did use the fitness room, which was bigger/had more than expected. Cardio machines, free weights, bench, medicine balls, a machine, and a few other things, plus water, towels, and a TV.There was the restaurant on site (or via free shuttle at the sister hotel), a McDonald's RIGHT next door, and then a series of "fast" food places (Starbucks, L&L Hawaiian BBQ, Jamba Juice, Ninja Sushi, a pizza/Italian place, a Blimpies, and maybe one more) a block away - a super easy walk.

The Staff was definitely very professional and did not hesitate to go beyond customer's expectation. The location was ideal for me, but might not be for those who have difficulty to sleep, as it is close to hwy and HNL airport. Overall I personally had a great experience with all the staff; mahalo to all of you!

Our room was not ready when we arrived, however it was a bit early (about 20 minutes before check-in time) we were able to do all the paperwork and come back for room keys later. There is on site parking, which was convenient except you have to get your ticket validated BEFORE you leave the property. This hotel is RIGHT next too the highway, surprisingly once in the room, unless you have the window open you don't hear much of the traffic noise. The rooms are big and clean and had everything we needed....the furnishings are a little outdated (low to the ground beds) but felt kind of tropical to the region. We enjoyed having the on-site restaurant there the first night we arrived, since we were tired from traveling and had to be up early for a conference the following morning. The menu selections were limited and the prices seemed a bit high, but the taste was there. Loved the on-site gift shop and found the prices reasonable and even lower than some of the other "souvenir" shops we visited. Found the staff to be "available" but not overly friendly. Overall a good stay and would probably return.

The staff here is very friendly and put forth a lot of effort, but the location is loud (stacked highway), the building is showing its age, and Google Maps really can't handle navigation to and from this hotel.

There are more pros than cons for this hotel, first of all the staff are helpful and very friendly. Cherae, who is at the front desk is amazing! She is always so happy and talks to you whenever she sees you, whether it be in passing or while she's at the desk, She's knowledgeable and answers questions in such a happy manner. The only cons I have is the Wi-Fi connection was rather poor on my electronic devices and kept kicking me off. Overall, the hotel is very well maintained, the beds are a little hard though but the pillows you just sink into.

This is not a cheap place at all, the rate is 180+ for a hotel, the building is great, no noise issues and as a well seasoned traveler I appreciated this. That is the only good thing to say, well that and the hot water was HOT!!!The parking is $30.00 a day, its high but what ever its Hawaii I get it, but with no spots available I had to park along a wall then I got a note telling me not to do that. Laundry was $3.50 to wash and $3.25 to dry, WHAT!!! I have been to hundreds of hotels and $1.50-$2.50 is the range of all places, this place had many machines so this is just greed. The beds are awful, super cheap and flimsy, the furniture is probably 15 years old, towels had hair on them, a few lights didn't work, TV was super dark, AC wouldn't shut off and our room was freezing, the window seal was broken causing the wind to whistle all night long. Front desk staff was rude, the only person who was helpful was Cynthia, a sweet, funny, polite older lady who was very helpful. I didn't get a laundry bag in my room on my third day so I saw a housekeeping cart and just grabbed one bag, since I had to do laundry, and was asked like 5 questions from the housekeeper as to why I took the bag, what room I was in, she asked if I took anything else, just plain rude. I am not saying I wouldn't come back, but it would have to be my last resort to stay at this place, but believe me I will look at every option before coming back.

I looked at 3 rooms before picking the best of the least desirables. Room #1, the AC thermostat was set to 50, yet the room felt like 78 degrees. The window did not close fully and a loud whistling noise was heard.Room #2 fronted the highway and the road noise would have kept me from sleeping.Room #3 had a view of roof top machinery and the vents made noise.**I settled on room #1 and cut my hand on the sharp window frame in an attempt to close it.The pool was a nice size, yet upon closer look you could not see the bottom due to the water quality.On a positive note: All the staff I met were very courteous.

Admitedly, when I dreamed of visiting Honolulu, this is not the hotel envisioned! My boyfriend was working in Honolulu for a month, so I visited from Ohio for about a week. When we pulled into the hotel garage, I could feel the disappointment welling up. This hotel is not in the prettiest of locations. The "neighborhood" is very industrial, and there are several homeless men who hang around the streets in the front. The room was equally underwhelming. It was a little dark, and somewhat dated. However, I put on my most positive attitued (hey, it's Hawaii, and we didn't have to pay for the hotel!!). To my suprise, the bed was very comfortable, and despite being VERY near to the airport and highway, the room was pretty quiet. I also didn't hear noise from neighboring rooms, or people in the hallways. Housekeeping was always excellent, and the room clean by mid-day. I was a little hesitant to eat in the restaurant, but the food was suprisingly good...and the service was great!!!! I found all of the staff that we encountered to be very warm, and welcoming. Overall, in the end, this hotel exceeded my expecations. The pros: Great staff, good restaurant, close to airport. The cons: Weird parking garage, hot/cold water regulation in shower, cannot walk to restaurants or shops

Excellent airport shuttle service. Excellent use of hotel computer systems. Restaurant provided very tasty meals at reasonable cost. Location very good for access to Pearl Harbor Sites as well to beaches and shopping.

Great position close to the airport and close to bus stops for getting around honolulu. 24 hour hotel shuttle service was a great bonus considering we had to leave at 430am. The food in the restaurant was good value and not typical of hotel prices. The staff in the restaurant were very helpful in explaining the menu too. Made the whole experience seamless.

If you are looking for glamour or a beach front, this place is not for you. However, if you are looking for a staff that is going to treat you and your family with kindness, respect and an incredible amout of generosity, then this is for you. This hotel has all the ammenities you can need. The facilities are well maintained. The one thing you cannot substitute is the people. They are amazing. Always go out of their way to assist you in any way possible. Their assistance seems to come out of sincerity rather than the obligation of the job. Everyone seems happy which creates and phenomenal atmostphere for guest. I would return to this hotel in a heart beat. Marci, Sharon, Janice, Madeline, just to name a few, you guys ROCK! Thank you thank you Thank you.

I stayed here for 11 days, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The services provided by Mercy, Cecilia, and Mr. Les were above and beyond and I would definitely stay here again. The only negative comment that I would add is that all of the cardio equipment in the fitness center was not operable. Other than that it was a great stay!

Started out with the wrong room, staff rude, got room changed, hallways and room smelled very musty.A/C worked poorly in room. Very overpriced for this poor quality hotel.Water System turned off one night- that's ok, but the noise from 3-5 am for repairs was not ok! Still don't know why I was overcharged about $50. Stay away at all costs.

From Mena to Sharon ,beau,Frank and Rosendale,sharon,chandra acob .these people made the stay very friendly and enjoyable. I always stay here because of the staff and service. They make me feel like I'm at home. I will always return here. Thank you.

For a business trip, it's hard to beat this hotel. It's less than five minutes from the airport, and right on Nimitz Highway. You can get anywhere in Honolulu or Waikiki in 15 minutes by car. Unfortunately, that same highway causes a great deal of road noise throughout the hotel. Other than that, it is an excellent place. The staff are very friendly and readily assist with any special needs. The rooms are large, comfortable, have big windows that allow plenty of light and air, and are always spotless (Mercy was my housekeeper, and is one of the best). With pool access and several good restaurants nearby (including one in the hotel) it's pretty easy to relax here after a day of tedious meetings.

overpriced for what you get; parking is difficult; location is great; restaurant is variable; shower water is difficult to adjust moderate cleanliness - could be better; have stayed there before and many rooms are noisy with traffic from freeway and planes taking off andlanding

The hotel is almost nowhere from the airport. This is where we chose to stay until we could move into our house. Mercy is our housekeeper, and she was awesome! We didn't have anything to complain about. She was super friendly, and my daughters loved talking with her too! As others have stated, the price of the food was a tad bit on the high side, but it was good.

Good points: The hotel staff are very friendly and clean. Amalia is a wonderful housekeeper! Friendly and helpful. Always cleaned at the same time. The hotel is a good stay for a short time. There's a nice pool and small gym that gets the job done. Very close to the airport, and free shuttle service every 1/2 hour. Very easy to take the bus as the bus stop is conveniently located right outside the hotel a little of to the left, on the highway. Restaurant food tastes great. Needs improvement: The hotel itself is a bit aged. I had trouble with two of the washers downstairs and it's about $3.25 to $3.75/wash/dry. The restaurant food is just a bit pricey.

We were travelling to Australia and decided to break up the long flight with a stop in Honolulu Selected this hotel because of its proximity to the airport We were pleasantly surprised. The room was an old school design with tons of room. Staff were definitely in the Aloha spirit and were a highlight to our short visit. If you are looking for the convenience of being close the HNL combined with a high level of efficiency, the Plaza gets my recommendation.

In the middle of a semi-industrial zone, a few meters away from a very busy motorway. Don't look for a quiet night, you won't get it with the motorway just next to your room. The hotel is old and worn down. The rooms have an OK size, the sanitary is basic. Good enough for one night if you really need it.The staff is really friendly.

This hotel is situated a few minutes drive from Honolulu Airport, there is a shuttle service, the place is clean and friendly and quite ideal for an overnight stay if you arrive late and want a rest before flying onto other islands. We had two adjacent rooms and it all worked very well.

Stayed overnight in this hotel for the Arashi Concert last year. Their staff was very nice (helped me find my to Ala Moana for the tickets) and even mentioned that I can carpool with the other guests who are headed to Ko Olina for the concert.The sourvenir shop inside was very convenient for people who don't have time to go around to buy souvenirs.

This is an old hotel but remarkably well kept and remodeling done to keep up quality. It's still a Best Western, but room amenities were better than most (towels, etc). Beds were better than expected with plenty of good pillows to make short stay comfortable.Staff very helpful. This is an airport hotel; not a resort. if making a one day connection overseas or to another island, this is great. I stayed here probably 35 years ago also for 1 night, and amazed at how well maintained it is. This is THE place for one night at Honolulu airport.
