Hotel provides free airport shuttle every hour which is good. Staff were good and friendly but hotel is showing its age. For a quick overnight stay its ok but for longer I would not recommend it.Good location to airport is a plus but hotel needs a good makeover. Good free wifi.

We just needed an overnight place after arriving in Honolulu on a late night flight - and this served that purpose well. They provide earplugs in the room - and for good reason. The hotel is close to the airport, has a freeway right outside the window - and the air-conditioner pumped out a healthy rhythm all night. Despite this we slept well! The bed was comfortable and amenities were okay. Morning breakfast was a bit of a zoo. Not enough wait staff meant a long queue to get into the restaurant and slow service. However the food was okay and being so close to the airport meant a short shuttle ride back to get our rental car.

Ok so the hotel is just around the corner from the airport which is a big plus if you just took a five hour plus flight with kids. And maybe you want to stay near the beach in Waikiki. But Why? Too many other tourists. Stay at Best Western The Plaza where they treat you like family and take care of you.

From arrival we were treated with amazing hospitality! New to the military life, Beau, had all the answers to our questions, and gave us a limb to start on. She even gave my spouse and I healing advise after our long day at the beach which led to bad sunburns. Over all the entire staff are personable which makes the stay that much easier. Madeline who was our housekeeper did a phenomenal job with our room. Room was always clean.

Very comfortable room, clean and cosy. Despite proximity to the airport, no noise at all in the bedroom. Very friendly staff and a free shuttle to the airport, even at 5 am !The outdoor swimming pool is nice for families and kids.

This hotel was used as it is close to the airport and we were in a post cruise status with a couple of extra days to spend on Oahu. The location is convenient to the airport and to rental car agencies however quite some distance to downtown and Waikiki. Their breakfast is overpriced; parking was provided. Several restaurants within a few blocks serve very good food but not the 'romantic' place one might want. Nothing special but I would stay here again under the same circumstance

The hotel is close to the airport and the military bases, but is dated in style, amenities and furniture. There is a restaurant that is open for dinner on selected days. I opted out of the breakfast, which is a bit high in price. McDonald's is a two minute walk and offers a better price. There is a convenient sundry/gift store, but doesn't have the best prices. There is on-site parking, but a bit pricey - however, this is Hawaii. Overall, it was an average experience - not as nice as other Best Western properties, which often will get four stars from me.

Hotel and room were very clean. Restaurant and Housekeeping staff is very friendly. Our housekeepers Madeline and Amalia worked hard made sure we had all that we needed and kept our room spotless daily. They were outstanding and very personable. The hotel front desk staff went out of their way to accommodate myself and my family. The only problem I had was the noise from the highway, but after a visit to the front desk they moved us to a different room that was not facing the highway. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I would recommend it to anyone especially military families like ourselves.

I was fortunate enough to have Mercy as my housekeeper. Mercy went above and beyond to make sure I had a pleasant stay. I worked the late shift and Mercy took notice to that. She knew I slept in during the day so she purposely skipped my door to avoid waking me. I would see her at the same time everyday and she would always ask if I needed her to go back to my room and clean it for me. She was extremely attentive when I wasn't present. I have never experienced this level of customer service and hospitality despite frequent travel for work. Mercy definitely made my stay a good one.

Our move to Hawaii wasn't as stressful as I thought it would have been. Luckily we found a hotel that within miles from just about everything. Our lovely room attendant was very nice and worked very hard, Amalia kept our room very neat that was the best knowing your coming back to a clean room.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Stayed for almost 3 weeks they do everything they can to make sure your taken care of. Luz was the house keeper that took care of my room she did a great job. The only thing that is not good is the highway noise but it is bearable.

We love staying at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. For more than 20 years we've considered it our home away from home, because we are Neighbor Islanders. Your staff, especially Cherae and Beau, make us feel so welcome.

The housekeeper, Maerina, went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable.I was working night shift, which means I was usually asleep when Maerina came to clean. At first she left when she noticed I was asleep, but I asked her if she could do a few things each day (trash, coffee, toilet paper if needed) even though I was there asleep. She agreed and did those tasks each day without waking me.In addition, she was incredibly attentive. One day I was not there when she came, and she noticed that I use the pillows from both beds. Instead of putting them where they belong, she put them where I use them. She also made sure I had plenty of coffee, which was greatly appreciated.I have never experienced this level of customer service despite frequent travel for work. She truly made the trip!

I've stayed at the Best Western Plaza Hotel several times. It's clean with friendly staff, but during my last stay, the room temperature read 75 degrees. After maintenance was called, it made very little difference (72 degrees). There was also no bath soap. During my past stays, I did not have a vehicle.. In my most recent stay, I had not been informed there was a parking fee. I learned of it when I checked out.

Had Mrs. Mercy as a room attendant. Room was well maintained and organized. Very spacious room. Outstanding front desk service every time I had a question or needed assistance. Employees were very knowledgeable about area and great recommendations where to eat or visit.

This hotel is average in my opinion. TVs are nice but very limited channels and no HD. Best Westerns usually have a free breakfast but not this one and the breakfast prices are high. Restaurant food is really good but is pricey. One weird thing about the hotel restaurant, it is only open for dinner four days a week at the Best Western location and then to get dinner on the other 3 days, you have to take a bus to another nearby hotel restaurant!! Rooms are clean. Hotel staff and maintenance personnel are very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located conveniently near the airport but inconveniently there is a lot of jet noise and traffic noise (from it being right next to H1). I can deal with the noise but since the hotel provides ear plugs, I guess other guests have complained about the noise levels here. Another peeve, there is no hotel bar to unwind at. It's a BYOB (bring your own bar) kind of hotel!!

The staff are wonderful. The hotel is conveniently located and the rooms are clean. BUT it's extremely difficult to find parking in the evening. One night they told us to park in the fire lane in front of the hotel because there was no other space. The freeway noise is atrocious and never stops. The only thing that droned it out was the freight train AC.

This Best Western in Honolulu is one of two hotels in the area that offer free 24 hour transportation to/from the airport. It also has a really good restaurant on the property and offers free WiFi. I thought it was a little pricey for a hotel that's almost 7 miles from town, but it's very convenient if you're looking for a place to stay near the airport. I must add that there is a bus you can catch that takes you in town for $2 - Seniors $1. I would stay there again.

Without a doubt, this was the lowest point of our holiday. Having travelled in from Canada, all we wanted was a bed for the night before we left the country the next day. Having waited for an eternity for the shuttle bus to arrive and pick us up at the airport, we trudged into reception at about 10.30pm and met with some of the worst customer service that I have ever received. It would appear that the lady who had booked our accomodation had made a mistake with the American variation of the dates and our booking had expired the previous month. This appeared to make the receptionist very happy, as she proceeded to inform me that they were full and could not provide us with another room and we shouldn't have been so stupid. At which point she wandered off, happy with her nights work. When we finally managed to speak to a manager, she was equally unhelpful as she explained that they had already charged my credit card for the no show ($300 AUD) and that if I wanted to book another room, she would happily charge me a further $300 AUD for the priviledge. All of a sudden, they were no longer fully booked? Despite explaining the situation to her, she didn't even bother to feign interest or concern and merely told me pay for the room or get out. When I got back to Australia, we looked to recoup that amount from the hotel and having spoken to the manager at length, it turned out that they had also managed to sell my incorrectly booked room on the night of my no show, thus claiming around $900 AUD from me for one booking! I would only recommend staying in this hotel if you are desperate or suicidal as the rooms are old and dirty and the service is the worst I have ever experienced....and I have been to France! For a similar price, you are better off getting a cab into the city and staying in a hotel that would appreciate your business and understands how to deal with customers. Avoid Best Western at all costs!

We primarily stayed at this hotel because it was near the airport and had a shuttle. The staff at the desk gave us a warm greeting and made us feel welcomed, the shuttle driver was very informative and even told us where the Navy shoppette was to refuel our rental, you have to have a military card to use the gas station. Our room was comfortable as was the bed and the shower was great. Although the hotel is right next to the H-1 we barely could hear the trafffic noise. We would stay here again.

My girlfriend and I booked this hotel because we had a few hours to spend between two flights to go back home and wanted to rest, take shower and do a quick round trip to the Waikiki beach. Renting an hotel room is a pretty good option since you are not allowed (!!) to carry luggages in common transportation (bus) and there is no luggage room offered by the Honolulu airport. It was almost cheaper to get a night at the Best Western and use the bus than it would have been to take a cab and carry our luggages all day long through the city.The hotel offers a shuttle to you pick up from and leave you to the airport. The lobby is nice and the staff very helpful. The room were the same as in other Best Western; all the basic commodities and a nice big bed. Bathroom was clean and in condition. This was no luxury stay but it was pretty convenient. We only had to cross the road in front of the hotel to take the city bus (very cheap) that goes directly to the Waikiki beach. We did the same to go back (no transfer). If we ever have to make a transfer in Honolulu again, I would definitely book at this hotel again.

Decent hotel overall. Friendly staff, location close to the airport. Did not use onsite restaurant to comment. Only negative comment I have for this hotel - they charge $30 per day for parking, but, parking is very tight and at times you don;t find parking if you return late. You might have to circle around few times and wait for someone to leave.

My first time in Hawaii ii experienced great service esp from house keeper Mrs Mercy she was always so kind and sweet and had a smile on your face..the rest of the hotel was very lovely. The dinners were nice and hot and very kid friendly.it's by McDonald's and not to far from a park I will very much so recommend this hotel to anyone that asks.great job Best Western The Plaza Hotel

We are a military family of four currently staying in this hotel in two rooms next to each other, with two cats. We are on the second floor of the detached building, but the noise of the highway is surprisingly not bad, as long as the door is closed. In fact, the A/C is much noisier than the highway, although it works very well. We chose this hotel just because it was a TLA-approved pet friendly hotel and there was no other nearby hotel available at the time of reservation (Ford Island or Tripler), but this hotel has turned out to be conveniently located and meets our needs adequately. The hotel staff are very knowledgeable of military regulations, making it easy for us to prepare PCS paperwork. The room is an ample size for two people and a pet. The housekeeper, Ms. Sonia for our two rooms most of the time, asks what my needs are and keeps the rooms fresh each day so even our finicky cats like her now. I only wish there were more parking stalls in the garage, so people didn't have to park along the walls to make it super difficult to maneuver in and out of parking space.

The staff is excellent and makes you feel comfortable and appreciated right from the start of your stay, all your needs and requests are immediately taken care of. House keeping is outstanding. Ms. Amelia has taken excellent care of our housekeeping needs. She is friendly, professional and pays attention to detail on a daily basis.

There are only 3 pros for this hotel and a whole bunch of cons that considerably outweigh the pros.1. Very friendly staff2. Complimentary shuttle from the airport3. Pet friendlyNow for the cons1. SO LOUD! especially if you get put in one of the 2-story buildings. The highway is right next to the hotel and it is NOT soundproofed. Literally, standing next to the door, it could have been open or closed and the sound level would be about the same. You can't even enjoy the pool because the cars are constantly heard2. Crappy rooms. I got stuck in the old 2-story buildings and as soon as I walked in, I wanted to get move to the newer building, but they wouldn't accommodate. I imagine this happens quite frequently. Where do I start?...mold, dirty wallpaper, peeling wallpaper, smell of smoking (in a non-smoking hotel)3. You feel like you're on the bad side of town. It's not a very pretty neighborhood. Overall, you can't even enjoy the fact that you are in Hawaii. This hotel is crap! I feel bad for all the military personnel that are forced to stay here. Luckily, I just had to endure one night.

My husband and I stayed at the Best Western for over a month, while waiting to get housing. They work well with military. The staff is nice. They are pet friendly. That's really about the only good things I have to say about them. If you get put in a room anywhere near the highway, prepare to hear cars at all hours. In fact, bring ear plugs...really good ones. The internet rarely ever works. The tv's are extremely aggravating, rarely ever working correctly. The beds are super uncomfortable. I definitely wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

We have been here for about a month and so far our experience has been wonderful. Staff is very friendly Especially Amalia!!! She is so sweet and always in a great mood!!! The pool is great. The food at the cafe is good. Only complaint we have is the parking garage. All the spaces are very tight and people park on the sides even when spots are available which makes parking in spots 10x harder.

I have recieved excellent room service from Mercy the worker, she has a smile that can brighten any kind of day you can be haven. So if you ever come to visit i recommend this hotel and Mercy the worker.

Spent five nights at BW Plaza hotel on business. The room was quite adequate with no major flaws. There is definitely some H1 road noise, plus the room can be loud just from the wind gusting outside. The front desk staff (Cynthia and Beau) were kind and helpful, as was Soledad in Housekeeping, a dear lady who takes pride in her work. The view east from large picture window was awesome.The only real complaint I have was the parking situation. A new ticket/gate system had apparently just been installed. It was confusing to operate, the cheap paper tickets with mag stripe did not work half the time, you have to wait at the front desk to get every ticket validated, and the front desk staff had a hard time reading and operating the new controller. Was delayed getting out of the garage by the cards. A real pain when other cars are waiting in line behind you to get out (can’t go forward through the gate, and can’t back up). Other hotels use a room keycard reader to let guests in and out of the parking, and that works great. Inside the garage, the parking was very tight for the minivan I drove, but tiny parking places are typical of Hawaii, not just this hotel.Don’t let the parking situation stop you from staying here. They’ll get it sorted out eventually, and the location is far more convenient to the airport and the joint base than anything in Waikiki. Several food spots are within 5 min walking distance, including Starbucks, McDonalds, L&L BBQ, and Big Kahuna Pizza. Many more options are 5 min away by car. I'll stay here again, because the convenience factor and I loath the crowds and terrible traffic congestion in Waikiki.

I enjoy staying at this Hotel because of location and being pet friendly. The staff is very helpful and caring. It is great to have a McDonald next to the Hotel for late night snack. The only draw back is that the highway is right next to the Hotel so the car noise is there 24 hours a day.

Mena at the front desk was absolutely wonderful and helpful and Soledad in housekeeping took such good care of us and both took such pride in their work. They both had lovely warm smiles and I would love to have them as my friends. I hope you know what assets they are to the Best Western family!!!

My fiancé and I were looking forward to having a nice stay at the Plaza Hotel. We rented the room two nights. Unfortunately, there were so many flaws:We checked in at the front desk and were immediately slapped with a "no cigarette" contract. She--along with ALL the workers there on our stay-- gave my fiancé and I an unfriendly, unwelcoming, "I don't want to be here" attitude. I signed and retrieved our room keys. As we walked to our rooms we were put on the ground level near the highway where you can hear the unfiltered sounds of speeding vehicles as well as feel their gushing high pressure winds pass by.We entered our room and were greeted by the immense odor of cigarettes. I immediately thought how IRONIC it was that I had to sign a "cigarette-free" contract and was given a room that REEKED of it. One of the benefits for the stay was free wifi. However, when my fiancé and I tried to use the wifi, it FAILED TO WORK on BOTH our phones. We were forced to rely on our data.These were just a few of many flaws for the stay at the Best Western Plaza Hotel. All my fiancé and I were trying to do was have a nice stay and it turned into something unpleasant. We left the next day not wanting to stay for another night.

I've stayed here at least five or six times when I'd come in from Kauai or the mainland to work. This hotel is a good alternative to Waikiki and it's the better of the two airport hotels with the other being the Ohana Hotel just down the street (Ohana is super noisy). If you ask for a room at the Best Western be sure to ask for one far from the H1 because the highway noise can be strong near that part of the hotel but not bad at all in the back where I usually stay. Parking is covered and they charge for it but just park for free behind the hotel. This hotel is nothing special but you don't get a lot of choice on Oahu for business travel or non-Waikiki area hotels.

After a long flight from Wisconsin, I was delighted to meet Beau and Rose at the front desk with outstanding customer service. They greeted me with sincere smiles and provided me with comfortable accommodation. They sincerely invigorated my spirit are are great assets to your organization. Kudos for continually making my stay in Honolulu unforgettable one; more reason I continue to patronize this hotel.

My family and I stayed here for almost two months during the transition for our move into Hawaii. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. Myrna, the housekeeper, was very kind and knew exactly what we needed without having to ask. She was also a friendly face to look forward to seeing almost everyday. The hotel itself is very family-friendly, cribs can be brought to the room for infants and there is a pool, free wifi and tvs that allow you to connect an hdmi cord (most hotels I've stayed at do not have that option). Overall, our stay was very pleasant.

My overall stay here was excellent. Madeline, the housekeeper, was os great service throughout our stay. All of the hotel staff was helpful. It's not too far from restaurants and shopping centers. You will enjoy your stay just here!

We had a good experience at the Best Western Plaza Hotel. It was clean, employees were always friendly, and the hotel restaurant is delicious. The meal vouchers helped tremendously! Additionally, parking is free if you have one car. You won't find another hotel that supports the troops as much as this one does. It's a bit dated on the interior of the room, but the other perks outweigh that.Our room attendants for room 824 were Amalia during the weekdays and Kat on the weekends.....they were absolutely amazing!!!

I stayed at the best western plaza hotel and as far as quality goes this looks like it needs a major refit. Basic however is sometimes beautiful and if your flying in or out of Honolulu then it's a brilliant place for that rest when you arrive or leaving. The food is quite good with plenty of choice. The rooms although basic 70s look was very spacious and clean. Staff were also very helpful. It has a 24 hour free shuttle which sold it for me. Just phone them from airport and they are there in 10 mins. To get to your destination on the island get the shuttle back to airport and use a company called " speed shuttle". DONT use them shark taxis outside . They are 10 times the price. I saved $160 doing that.

This is a good option for a stop off before an early flight, but because it is one of very few airport options i is incredibly expensive for the quality. The room was comfortable and served the purpose of a layover stay, breakfast was goos and the shuttle service to the airport excellent.

Our room attendent Amalia was friendly and smiling. She took care all of our needs. Great customer service. there was issue with shower head, other than it was good experience. Close to airport and peal harbor museum. shutlle to airport was excellent

The hotel offered a great service and amenities. Our attendant, Merci, was very attentive, professional and helpful! We had a great time in this hotel, she make us feel quite comfortable. The hotel is close to the bus stop,vehicle rental facilities,taxis and restaurants.

Whether it is the guest room or the restaurant, all the staff members provide outstanding customer service! Every member of the staff will assist you with a smile on their face. 3 weeks have gone by and I still have not had a single unpleasant interaction with anyone on the staff. Just exceptional customer service, especially from Techie (waitress) and Mercy (housekeeper)!!!

I had a really great experience. Les was really helpful with the military. My room service was excellent. Mercy is a wonderful housekeeper, very sweet and approachable and did an exceptional job w my room every day. She was also good with scheduling. If you wanted your room cleaned later she would gladly come at a more convenient time.

Had a great stay, easy to catch the bus and travel to a lot of sight seeing and shopping.Close to the airport and the shuttle service was great to have. Rooms were clean and Ms Mercy Bayrigh took good care of us, in room 606.

We are staying here while waiting to get a house at one of the military base. moving here from oversea is very stressful, but hotel staff helped us a lot. They have this meeting for military family who just moved here and help us easy transition.also our room attendant Sonia, She is the best! She made sure our room is clean and we have everything we need in the room. I can't thank enough her really. Thank you very much Ms. Sonia.

The room is always clean because our attendant "AMALIA- my kids says she's the best" is always making sure that we get what we expect from our room. She is making sure that the room is clean and it is really beyond our expectation. A warm welcome from Friendly staff when we checked in. My kids love the pool, really nice food. WIFI is not bad. Thanks to " Michael" too, he is extremely helpful while we are dining in the restaurant. These are the staff that can make your stay in this hotel feel so comfortable. Overall, I gave my EXCELLENT rating on this hotel.

Mercy was my room attendant, she was very helpful. Providing great Hospitality and knowledge of the local area. Looking forward to her services again. Front desk staff was very helpful with all of my family needs. Facilities were top notch and very clean. Mahalo

Our stay has been very comfortable while waiting to get into a house-military move. Our housekeeper Amalia & Fely have been very accommodating. They are very detail- oriented in cleaning our rooms(826 & 827). Amalia & Fely are very friendly and always have a smile. We appreciate their professionalism! Griffen Family

This hotel is very close to the airport with the convenience of everything you need close by. We are military and the base is extremely close and the hotel rooms are great. The staff are all very welcoming and extremely helpful. Not to mention the good food and market in the lobby with everything you'd need. Overall great hotel.

Upon coming to Oahu for military service, we stayed at The Plaza Hotel. The shuttle service was prompt and the driver was very friendly. The front desk staff was also very pleasant and always helpful with any questions we have regarding the island. Our housekeeping attendant, Mercy, always greeted us with a smile and ensured that our room was cleaned to our liking (mind you we have three children). The room is not modern but did the job for our extended stay. Overall the service and staff here are great!

We stayed here due to our PCS to Hawaii via the Army. I thought this would be a bad experience but overall it was GREAT! Our room was clean, staff was very friendly. Our cleaning lady, Annie, was fabulous! i will miss her most! The only downside was laundry. $3.25 to wash and then again to dry so that expense wasn't the best. But overall, i would recommend this hotel to anybody. it was a great stay!

WiFi, a pool for the kids and beds. This was fine for a 1 night stay in between flights and provided what we needed. We walked to some shops with food and a Safeway. I wouldn't stay any longer than 1 night. It wasn't too noisy in terms of the road traffic or the planes. Great location. Loved the free transport to/from airport. Bathroom was too small.

had to stay here when our flight was cancelled. was expecting much worse. the rooms were clean, the a/c was nice and strong, and the staff was extremely nice and accommodating. considering this is an "airport hotel" (i.e. hotel underneath/near the freeway), it was nicer than expected. the pool (from what i could see from my room window) looked a little dingy and underwhelming. but if you're in hawaii, i don't suspect you'd spend much time at this hotel pool (vs. the beach).

My husband and i just pcs'd to Hawaii by the army and are staying in the best western while we wait for our housing to be ready. The staff here is really wonderful we were first in a double bed room but needed a king bed room and they made sure to get us the first available room. And the housekeeper Mercy has been really great always adjusting her cleaning schedule every day as to not interrupt my daughters naps. The waiters and waitresses at the restaurant are really wonderful as well. Always super friendly and helpful and even have the chef make my favorite soup at least once a week. The rooms are really clean too nice comfortable beds, cable, and no bugs seen in the 2 months we've been here. The only downsides are the mini fridge is pretty small and has a very small freezer section, about the size of a pint of ice cream, so if you plan on an extended stay i would plan accordingly. And the rooms at the front of the hotel (like ours) are right by the highway so you get the constant noise of traffic but they do provide ear plugs and we have gotten used to the noise pretty quickly.

This place is OK. Nice store/gift shop. No complimentary breakfast. No coffee in lobby (coffee maker in room). $20.00 cab ride to Arizona Memorial. Brand new McDonald's right next door. Nothing else worth looking at in walking distance. They do have airport shuttle. Nice pool, smoking area, and dog area.

The BW Plaza is really a gem. The staff ~super friendly and kind~went the extra mile for accommodating my early arrival.The grounds are well kept, the rooms are clean and roomy. The pool side is noisy but great to rest.Dinner available part of the week (not fine dining or gourmet, but hits the spot) and breakfast daily. A little convenience store, also, available.Highly recommended if you need an overnight at the HNL airport. Also, FREE shuttle to the airport!

The location is perfect for going south to Waikiki or lesser known but ever more beautiful kanehoe Bay and Polynesean Culture Center or not to miss North Shore. Great staff, thanks to Sharon, Macrina. Attentive and helpful.

We were flying into Hawaii from Michigan and a late flight created a missed connection and we ended up for a night at this hotel until we flew out the next day to Hilo. I am so happy we did! I loved this place!! It had a nice little kitchenette area, faced onto the pool area. While we were only there for a night, I would recommend it completely. The staff was wonderful everywhere we encountered them. Even the restaurant had grand staff. Our waitress, Liz Cosla, was delightful and went way out of her way to accommodate us. So happy we missed that flight!

They no longer have the all you can eat buffet on the weekends. Breakfast and dinner are still being offered but you need to order from the menu. Parking was some what limited but I was able to find a spot for the night.

The hotel is just like any other Best Western, however, the staff is all very hospitable! From the gift shop, restaurant, front desk and housekeeping... the entire staff is polite, friendly and extremely helpful. Our Room Attendant, Remy R, is so kind, fantastic with our 3 children, very diligent and exceptionally pleasant! The only downside to the hotel is the parking. The spots are very tight. Although they do, at busy times, offer free valet service to the hotel around the corner with a free shuttle bus back.

We had to stay here 2 weeks while waiting for our home to be ready. The staff was nice. Our daily room attendant Amalia was very pleasant and sweet! Hotel was close to airport and not far to beaches and other amenities.

My husband and I stayed here for a month May-June 2015. I only have great things to say. This hotel is very accommodating. The front desk staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. The restaurant is nice. The breakfast and dinner is delicious with lots to choose from on the menu at very reasonable pricing given the portions of the food. Our housekeeper for the time we were there was Amalia. She made our stay very comfortable and made sure we had everything we needed. Our room was very clean as well as the rest of the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

my stay was great it provided a good comfortable sleep, good breakfast and close proximity to the beach and shopping. I think this hotel offers good staff, good appearance and good night sleep. Kind of on the high end but compared to other hotels it was ok in price.

The staff is very friendly & helpful! They helped us find things to do! Our rooms were always clean! The housekeeping staff is awesome! The resturant staff was super nice, and the food was good! Nice place to stay!!

I stayed at the Best Western Plaza for 5 days in the summer of 2015. My first disappointment was it's proximity to the interstate. The picture online didn't show this. 2nd disappointment was the address they list isn't GPS friendly. I drove around for 30 min trying to find the entrance to the hotel. I finally found it on a 1 way street underneath the interstate. The hotel is older and worn. The shower went from hot to cold and variations of each without manual adjustment. The Restaurant was decent food, breakfast anyway but the price was outrageous. I had a basic meat and potatoes breakfast with eggs and coffee for 30 bucks! There is no discount for being a top tier member and no continental breakfast option. The internet was slow and several of the TV channels had poor reception and could not make out the picture. Two light bulbs were bunt out and the view was of a industrial park. Finally I think the bed was made in 1970 something and was hard as a rock. On the upside the parking was free for top tier members and I got a 6 PM late checkout. I probably wouldn't stay here again as it is in a crime heavy area(the not responsible for stolen items/remove valuables from car signs) and heavy transient population nearby. I've paid less per night for the Marriott on Waikiki. Not where you want to come for vacation but if it were a 1 night stay or long layover it's right next to the airport.

The Hotel's Room Attendant Ms. Annie was so nice and respectful, I counldnt help but to recognize her and her hospitality. I stayed there a total of 8 days on the 10th floor and she made sure my stay and room was taken care of. I appreciate her lots.

The hotel staff was great my room had the balcony with the pool view. the was kept clean by the staff, but forgot to leave enough towels and wash cloths. The hotel is right off the main highway and you hear the car driving by all times of night. The parking spaces are to close and need to be revised immediately, but overall I would stay again.

We chose this motel as it close to the airport and provides a free airport pick up serviceIt was our second visit and the staff were very helpful and friendlyWe are Best Western Rewards members and were upgraded to a larger room which was a very pleasant surpriseThere is some road noise as the motel is located beside busy highwaysThe small shop on site is great and the dining room provides good value for moneyHandy having the laundryWe will always stay at this place if we are just passing through Honolulu

Great place to stay while we waited for our house to open up. Pool is kept clean and is a good size. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Close driving distance to base and the NEX. Staff friendly and welcoming.

Relocated here from another hotel in Waikiki. Parking is reasonable even if you have more than one vehicle. Meal hours accommodate different work schedules. Convenient location with easy access to military bases and freeway systems. For long stay we were assigned a regular room attendant. Amalia was very personable and eager to ensure we were as comfortable as possible. This hotel is not fancy but they make up for it with great service, meal vouchers, free parking, and convenient location.

I was very impressed with the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. From our first contact with Lorenzo, the shuttle driver, to Chandra at reception, we were treated like important guests. Chandra suggested that we take public transport to the Pearl Harbor memorial complex saving us money, and it was easy too. We had two meals in the restaurant, and our waiters Michael and Ramon D were friendly and attentive. The shop near the lobby was excellent--very well-stocked with anything a traveller could need. The housekeeping staff were cheerful and friendly as we passed them in the corridors. The room was attractive with good air conditioning and the bathroom was recently updated. Despite being very near the airport and freeway, the hotel was very quiet. We appreciated the effort that all the employees made during our short stay. Well done, everyone at Best Western The Plaza Hotel!

Amalia was a great room attendant. She made sure we were supplied with the towels and other amenities we needed, and when we didn't want to be disturbed, she left us alone. The hotel is clean and accessible to shopping. McDonald's is located right next door, so getting a quick bite was easy. Pizza restaurants will also deliver here. I like that our parking was validated for our entire stay, and there was adequate parking in the garage.

Husband and I were very comfortable at this hotel. Our room was large, comfy bed, immaculately clean. There was some noise from the near-by highway even though we were on the 9th floor, but it did not disrupt our sleep. Microwave and fridge in room were nice bonus. The Front Desk staff were terrific, so welcoming, friendly and efficient. Convenient to airport, 24 hour shuttle, so really handy for fliers. Not a pretty neighborhood, but there were several small casual eateries within walking distance. We ate one diner in the on-site restaurant--large portion, good food.

This hotel is not a five star top of the line place to stay but then again its clean and tidy with very friendly staff. The money you save on accommodation can be spent on other things like a restaurant dinner or some clothes and site seeing.

We are staying at this hotel until we get housing. We're having a great time here and the service is great as well. Our room attendant Amalia was very friendly and did a wonderful job maintaining our room.

Staff very helpful: Mena remembered us from January visit, made us feel at home. She was very helpful. The evening recptionist on our left of check in desk(sorry I don't have her name). Very accommodating to each date and other changes. Both of these women eased the stress of this trip.Shuttle driver Lorenzo who drove me each morning so I could get to the hospital always made my day.Always asked how my husband was doing, and just so helpful,caring and cheerful. These staff deserve commendations!

Both woman cleaned are room with aloha and care. They were the best housekeepers that me and my wife seen in a long while. They took the time to understand what are needs were and delivered 100%. My wife offered to help them any way she could but they had everything covered. These two were outstanding for the 15 days we were here. Mahalo for your support!!

On my way to Phoenix and stopped overnight in Honolulu. Wanted to be near the airport (just 5 minutes). I asked for the quiet side of the hotel and landed on the 9th floor with a view to the distant ocean. The room was clean and perfectly adequate. Free Wifi. Movies on Demand. Some days of the weeks dinners are in the hotel, though not on my night, so I took the free shuttle to the sister hotel - Honolulu Airport Hotel - and ate at Willoughby's Restaurant. I had a good breakfast at The Plaza in the morning. This is not a free breakfast, but Liz, my waitress (here 20 years) was very friendly. Overall, a good stay.

She was the best house keeper ever and I mean ever . She was so personable and made me feel comfortable I offered to help clean she insisted for me not too. She was sweet carring and a fast worker!! They have a great employee on there hands she's a keeper :) what a sweetheart

This hotel is extremely loud because it is located right next to a freeway, making the pool and smoking area very uncomfortable to sit at for any length of time. There were 10 of us (5 rooms) and my room was in the back so it was a little quieter. It is also on the lowest level of Best Westerns (others being "Plus" and "Premier") so it was just okay. (I didn't realize that when I booked it, I was looking for something with complimentary shuttle service, which this does have.)

Great hotel. Location very good for me. Since I grew up here, getting around was very easy. Close by to many great restaurants, near good shopping like Costco and close to the airport. Do not like staying in or near Waikiki.

The Staff (Dina) and Manager (Tracey) created two new loyal customers through their focus on customer service. Each had the opportunity to hide behind Hotel Policy and each chose to make People a Priority over Policy. That focus on people and desire to understand each individual circumstance will guarantee your stay is pleasant, rewarding, and repeated. Thank you both for your help.

I spent one night. The room was big, clean and good linen. Sleep comfort was good but can hear the speeding vehicles on the freeway on the 10th Floor. It was bad as it rained made more splash noise. Had to use all the pillows to cover my ears. The staff was very helpful with the metro bus trip to Waikiki and back. Takes about an hour. Return trip was fast, less traffic.Shuttle from and to HNL airport is very convenient. At 11.am, my flight got delayed for 3 hours, which was supposed to leave 2.30 p.m. I called my airline and they booked me on an AA flight leaving in 40 minutes. Since the proximity to the airport was so close I got into flight just on time via their shuttle. It was a blessing disguise.

Stayed here at the Best Western Plaza for 3 nights on our reward points. It is a good place as it is away from all the touristy places and away from Honolulu downtown. It would be nice if they would trough in breakfast or a discount as the cost for breakfast was like $13 for an omelet. They comp our parking as I am a Diamond member otherwise it was like $50 a day. The pool is next door and we did not get a chance to use it. The room was very large and could have used an up date. It was pretty clean but the bed was not very comfortable. I would stay here again if I had the points.

Good Price for the area. Convenient to the airport and Pearl Harbor and just about everything else. The fitness room was larger than most. The breakfast wasn't included and that was a little disappointing. Also, the parking was included for us on the first day but not on the second day, so that was a little strange. The staff was very friendly though and you couldn't beat the location.

This is a clean , central located hotel. Staff is wonderful . Easy to reach everywhere on the island from here, Nice restaurant on the ground floor, It worked perfect for us, visiting family in the service and Hawaii.

Stopped for one night en route to Australia. Location was great. Shuttle was very punctual and the drivers were very helpful. I was afraid it was going to be very noisy based on other reviews, but had a corner room away from the highway and it was not noisy at all. Bus stop was right across the street so went to Chinatown for dinner. Would stop there again

We are a family of 4 soon to be a family of 5 staying at the hotel. We are having an extended stay because we are waiting for a house to be available for us to move in. At first I was a little concerned because of being next to the airport and highway but it really isn't an issue. We stayed on the 6th floor and our housekeeper was FELY she was amazing. She learned our schedule and tried not to wake us up too early. She was always very helpful and we all enjoyed her and the job that she did. The front desk was also very kind and helpful. They remembered our names and helped me with anything that I asked.

I always think airport hotels work hard for their living and some of the corridors here looked a bit tired. But our clean, well equipped and spacious room on 10th floor was perfect for an over night stop waiting for a delayed flight.Airport noise was intermittent and did not disturb us nor did the buzz of the Freeway.Unfortunately did not have time to sample restaurant or pool. Some fast food just around the corner at McDs or Starbucks . Also small shop in hotel for essentials.Staff very efficient and obliging .Shuttle worked well, worth ringing hotel from baggage hall to check where and when to meet it on arrival. Leaves hotel on hour and half hour.

Comfortable bed, good value and close to airport. We dropped off our lugguage and room was nice and clean. Upon our return the room had an odd odor. We reported to service desk and they gave us another room. Everything was fine.

I was looking for a hotel that was very close to the airport. The Best Western was the best option. The shuttle was on time and the accomodations were very comfortable. I was very pleased with the hotel and the services.

It was a convenient location for us and we may have to stay there again, but I will try to avoid it if possible. The staff was wonderful, but the room wasn't much, the bathroom had moldy tile, and even the parking was overpriced- $30 per night (kamaaina rate $15).

I visited this hotel because I'm an employee with the same company. I stayed 10 years ago and had a great visit. My second visit was awesome because I had the same housekeeper a year later. Her name is Norma. Best person of all. My first visit she definitely showed the aloha spirit, very welcoming. Attended to my needs and went above and beyond. I didn't even ask for much. Just light housekeeping requests. My second visit she was still there. She remembered me and invited me to her daughters birthday party happening that evening. My third visit I didn't see her. However, I understand she is still employed at the hotel. I believe she was on a vacation. This time around I had Beau, Athena, Charis, and Cherea at the front desk. These ladies are awesome. My reservation was made far in advance. I asked for a room that I stayed in the last two visits. This 3rd trip I had a different room. Man when I walked into my room I was so happy. The square footage was spacious and I had two views from my room. I saw the harbor and the mountains. The bathroom was nice and big. Great comfort with the room in general. I was there for a week and had plenty of space for what I arrived with and the items I bought. Lol's...The property had renovations since my visit 10 years ago. It's still my go to hotel in Honolulu. Free airport shuttle, close to airport (no airport noise), close to Waikiki and a lot of other locations. Easy freeway access. I visited many places and never drove more than an hour to enjoy the island. I did do a tour with Discover Hawaii Tours. I had to drive to Waikiki because of the hotel pick up location. Hotel I parked at was only 8 bucks. Cheap for Waikiki area. To put and end to my "over due review", I want to say "Thank You" ladies for making me feel home away from home. Until next visit...Aloha~ x's

With no other choice to get an airport hotel, we stayed here for one night. In all my travels, I've yet to see an older, outdated, musty smelling hotel. Uninterested staff, over priced rooms, decorated rooms from the 1970's and single pained glass so you can hear every plane coming and going.On the positive side, it has a free airport shuttle and is 100 yards from restaurants, coffee shops and Mc Donald's

First time to Hawaii and taking the Pride of America cruise. Got here early to see the sights first. Hotel is convenient to rental cars, airport and attractions. Were in room 1010 for 2 nights before the cruise and room 916 for 1 night after. The first several floors of the tower section are the parking garage @$15/night for guests. 1010 was close to the elevated H1 "interstate" highway with traffic noise. 916 was away from the highway and the better room. Hotel has a nice gift shop, friendly & helpful staff and a nice restaurant. We ate breakfast once and supper once there. There is a McDonald's next door with less expensive fare.

This is my second time staying at this hotel and I found the hotel stay to be very professional and helpful. My room was at the front of the hotel and it was very thoughtful of the hotel staff to provide ear plugs for the noise coming from the nearby highway/freeway. I had breakfast every morning and found it well prepared and the servers very mindful of my needs. A little disappointed that I had to go outside the hotel for dinner from Tuesday to Thursday though. But when I was able to have dinner here, I wasn't disappointed. The location of the hotel worked well for me to, close to the airport and the port area where I worked every day.

Basic room was clean. I think I could have fit a small child's hand in the gap between the window panes which led to increased highway noise. It was a high floor so no safety issues what so ever. I slept well. Reliable shuttle, quick check in and okay philly cheese sandwiches from the restaurant. Remember it isn't available every night for dinner. There are places within walking distance. I hear the big kahuna pizza rocks. I'll definitely try it if I take another layover. There is also a McDonald's and Starbucks accessible by foot. A small store with provisions and alcohol. A must for a weary traveler on site. Not so sure I won't go to Waikiki for the cost next time but if you want to be close to the terminals its not bad and full of U.S. Military so pretty darn protected.

Need a stay close to airport for a late arrival. The hotel shuttle is convenient and the staff are friendly. The room is clean, and the check-in and check-out process are efficient. Nevertheless, it is a bit overpriced given the near amenities.

Decent hotel, especially for military TDY. Great staff, free parking for military on TDY orders. Good location, close to Downtown Honolulu, Interstate access, Hickam AFB/ Pearl Harbor, Tripler, off-base NEX. Also, 5 minutes from pretty good restaurants and fast food.

Arrived in HNL at 9 pm, and needed a place to stay for 1 night before an early morning flight the next morning. Did not want to go all the way to Waikiki. Waited about 15 minutes for the shuttle, which was then a quick 5 minute ride to the hotel. Check in was quick and efficient. Room was clean, though bathroom was definitely dated and showed a lot of wear. We arrived, slept, woke up and left. Line for the shuttle back to the airport was long and disorganized, as the shuttle driver was also acting as the bellman for several families. Make sure to leave plenty of time in case the shuttle you shoot for winds up being full, and needing to wait for the next one. Hotel was sufficient for this purpose and a very reasonable price. Would never have spent time for anything other than a layover.

I chose to stay here again because the last time I spent the night here my experience was good. This time around my room fell below my expectations. The room was clean but there was a musty smell when I walked in and the carpet felt a little damp under foot. I think these rooms are a little older than the one I stayed in last time. Perhaps that's why. But overall it is a good place to lay your head before heading out to the airport the next day. Shuttle service is so convenient and so is having McDonalds' around the corner.

Stay in Oahu without taking out a second mortgage! This hotel is near the airport, close to major attractions, nice pool and courtyard, clean and comfortable rooms. Just a little noisy from traffic and the airport, but if you are tired, you can sleep!

Close to the Honolulu Int'l Airport so you do not have to deal with the freeway traffic from the airport to the hotel. However, the hotel is within easy access to the freeways. The hotel is not close to the beachs or shopping centers. The room price is a little high.

The Plaza served the purpose of an overnight stay for an overnight layover in HNL.. The hotel is very convenient to the airport and travel time between the property and airport is about 5 minutes. There is a small strip mall within walking distance as well as a McDonalds. For dinner we walked to the strip mall and had an amazing pizza at The Big Kahuna. For breakfast we walked back to the strip mall for Starbucks, Don't go to Starbucks if you are in a hurry because it is a popular place . We had plenty of time and enjoyed our breakfast there. The room was a basic hotel room, but it was very clean and comfortable. I would stay here again.

Very little value in expensive cost of rooms that are well past the used by date. Requires a complete renovation in the rooms. Pool was clean and nice enough. We did not try the food, but caught a local bus outside the front door of the hotel to Ala Moana for $2.50 and eat there. We booked 3 rooms as a extended family going back to sydney or brisbane on early morning flights. If we had mid mornign departures I would not stay there as even with taxi fares to waikiki and back included, there were cheaper and much better rooms available there. These reviews all seem consistent about this hotel, maybe management will one day listen and renovate or make it value fo rmoney.

The staff is really nice!! Our rooms are always clean!! I can always tell when Amalia cleans our room. She folds my kids extra blankets and places their dolls on the beds. That makes my kids smile and happy!!

Close to the airport, this hotel is also close to Pearl Harbor, which was what we sued it for, a two night stop over to see the Pearl Harbor sites. The rooms that we stayed in were good quality, and very nicely furnished. The hotel was average for the beds and rooms, what can you say, it is a hotel and not a 5 star resort. I would not hesitate staying here again, not telling people to use this hotel for a stop over to see the sites. We ate breakfast and dinner a the restaurant and both were nice meals. The evening we ate, the chef had a salmon special and it was very good. Breakfast was good with the typical Hawaiian flare to the normal breakfast foods. We did not use a car while we were here, only used a taxi or shuttle service. There shuttle picked us up and dropped us off at the airport with no problems at all. You might consider calling ahead and figuring out the exact shuttle pickup location at the airport, as where we can out, we had to walk several hundred feet to its location. There is a McDonalds next door, so if you wander over and get food if you do not want to cab it downtown.

I was there alone, on business for about a week. A few things to say about the facility overall. VERY close to the airport. GREAT staff. The resturant was plain but the food was resonably priced and not too bad. Room was very good, not great. Everything was clean and well maintained, just had a feeling of being an older hotel. View is NOT worth mentioning but I was not there for a view. Parking is tight between spaces but adequate. I was driving a Ford Edge and had little problem manuvering the garage. The pool was ok. Again an older design and some of the tiles were missing or coming loose. The pool area was well maintained. The hotel also had a small store for snacks, incidentals and memoribilia. Priced as expected (high) but not too crazy. Final comment. The facility was CLEAN. I would stay there again on business.

I enjoyed my stay at the Best Western Plaza hotel in Honolulu. The staff was very friendly and accomodated all my needs.It was very convenient because it was close to everything. It also had a laundry room, restaurant and fridge in the room. My only complaint was the noise from the cars on the freeway that was close to our room and could be heard all day. They did provide ear plugs in the room. It didn't bother me that much so I didn't report it to the front desk.

After departing our cruise ship, we needed a hotel room for 36 hours before our flight to PA. We were given a room at 10:00 am, 5 hours before normal check in. The following day we paid 1/2 price for the room to stay until 7 pm.We ate 3 meals in their restaurant, all of which were tasty and plentiful. Free wifi, outdoor pool, well-stocked store, 12th floor fitness center all contributed to a very enjoyable 36 hours in Honolulu.By the way, they never stop cleaning. It's immaculate!

We had not planned to overnight in Hawaii, but United Airlines ineptitude changed that. We were left entirely to our own resources when a connecting flight was cancelled--weather related so on compensation and I'm ok with that. But no advice from the airline either, as to which hotels they typically used. We were looking for clean and close and reasonably-priced and figured that would be the type United used, but at least three differently airline people refused to give us a hotel name. Fortunately, an airport helpdesk employee was there to recommend Best Western. It has a free shuttle and is only 10 minutes away. More important, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. It is not fancy or new, but it has a reasonable place to eat on premises and, to repeat myself somewhat, it was nice to be treated with kindness and respect after the airline treatment. United had rebooked me for a 6:30 am flight the next day, so I was up in time to take the 4:00 am shuttle, only to discover that my rebooked flight had been changed to 2:00 pm. I called the hotel from the airport and they sent the shuttle to pick me up again, then gave me back the room I had checked out of, all with a smile and at no cost to me. Yes, that's what I expected, but my expectations had been previously very sorely disappointed by the so-called travel and hospitality industry. So if you are ever trapped in Honolulu for a night, call Best Western.

Overall, I was happy with the Best Western The Plaza. The staff was great and the rooms were clean but are in need of updating. The windows in the rooms appear to be single pane and being so close to the highway makes for more room noise than expected.The location is very close to the airport which is convenient, especially if you are on business and not looking for a resort. The small store had a lot of amenities and snacks and kept good hours.

We arrived in Honolulu with the understanding that we would have to stay in a hotel for a month. The front desk staff is very friendly and the restaraunt staff go out of their way to make you feel at home. Our housekeeper Amalia, always greeted me in the hallways and made up our rooms around our schedule. At times I did feel watched in the gift shop, like they were keeping an eye on me.

Best Western The Plaza Hotel was not a good experience, it was walking back in time to the 1970's decor was outdated and dirty. The staff was so laid back they could care less that you were there. The only thing good about this hotel was the free ride to the airport.

I just moved to oahu and needed to stay In a hotel for over a month while looking for a house. The staff was very accommodating, especially Amalia who did a fantastic job of taking care of my room. The hotel is in a convenient location only a few miles from Honolulu as well as Hickam AFB and Pearl Harbor.

We stayed one night as a jumping off place for the inter island flights to Maui . Kudos to Sharon Nina and Lorenzo the morning staff were great. This hotel is in no means a resort in Hawaii what is a good location so close to the airport

My husband, myself, and our eight month old daughter recently stayed for 42 days during a move while we waited for our house to be ready. We were in a corner room on the tenth floor which had a great view. Our housekeeping needs were met everyday by Annie. She is super sweet and works very hard to make sure guests have everything they need. Since our stay was for military, we were able to get meal vouchers to be used in the hotels restaurant. This was a big help in minimizing our daily meal costs. The hotel also has a briefing for new military members and their families. This briefing includes information on what paperwork needs to be completed during the stay, transportation, and various helpful tips on how to have a smooth transition during your move. I would recommend this hotel for anyone but especially for military members who are PCSing. Final note, this hotel is in a perfect location. Its just minutes away from the beach, airport, and military bases.

After experiencing a 10.5 hour flight from canada, it was great to have a hotel so close to the airport. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Great sleep after a long flight - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

the room was sufficient for a hotel stay in terms of cleanliness and space, but the dated air con unit is loud, lacks temperate control and doesn't even turn off. It was an uncomfortable night and the TV was in awkward location.

Had the pleasure of staying in a corner room on the 11th floor for 22 days. Great view of the island and high enough to minimize the sound of the traffic flowing past the hotel. The maid service was excellent - definitely took care of everything we needed and had great personal service from both Annie and Macrina. There are a ton of food choices within 5 miles of the hotel. I didn't have any of the issues mentioned in some of the other reviews - check-in and check-out were seamless, parking was fairly painless, room was clean, air conditioning worked fine, no mold in the bathroom. If you're looking for a place to stay for a business trip, this is a convenient location. If you're expecting a beach vacation hotel, those are down the road in the middle of town.

Very old and broke down. The shower was dirty, mold, stains, the same in the toiled and sink. There was smoke odor from another room. The internet was slow and not working all the time. Heavy air plane traffic. Slow elevators.

We just stayed at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel last week for one night before heading to our final destination on the north shore of Oahu. We picked the Best Western because of its closeness to the airport and because we felt that going with a brand like Best Western we would be sure to get good quality for our dollars. We were totally disappointed! The whole place is outdated and in urgent need of renovation. The hallways are stuffy! The rooms feel "put together" with old furniture, partly painted in an effort to make it look presentable. The air conditioner was blowing all night and nobody was able to turn it off for us. It was a bad night and the lack of comfort stood in no relation to the money we spent! Would never stay there again.

We had a Fabulous experience beginning with the airport shuttle ride lisa found us even though we were in the wrong place and took the time locate us and greet us. Then she kept us entertained on the way to the hotel. She was very courteous and pleasant. Then when we checked in we were pleasantly surprised by front desk clerk Sharon . She greeted us and made us feel welcome. She offered to help us with any problems we might encounter. Sharon was very professional but approachable . She made us feel welcome like we were were coming home.

We are new to the Island and Best Western the Plaza Hotel has been our home and will continue to be for sometime the staff here is great all very friendly and welcoming. Amalia was our housekeeper one day and she was great very friendly and did a great job in tidying up our room. Thank you to all the staff and housekeepers for all your hard work and your outstanding customer service. You all have made our stay here great.

We stayed at the best western Plaza after arriving on a late evening flight and with a morning flight out the next day. The hotel is only a few minutes from the airport terminal and there is a free shuttle every half hour. Reception and check in were prompt and helpful. By the time we arrived the hotel convenience store was closed, but there is a MacDonalds next door if you're in need of a late night snack. There is not much else in the neighbourhood except car yards and a few food outlets which were closed when we arrived. The room itself was very ordinary; clean, basically furnished, but looking very tired. There was constant noise from the traffic outside on the freeway and the walls are paper thin. However, the beds were VERY comfortable and we slept well. Free wifi is available throughout the hotel. There is a moderate sized and reasonably inviting looking pool surrounded by a few palms to shade the tables and chairs.Bottom line: if all you're looking for is an airport stopover this place is dated but fine. If you're planning to stay and explore Honolulu, head in to Waikiki.

The rooms and staff were fine, but it sounded as if the windows were always open. The noise from the freeway was overbearing. My room was next to the elevator and woke me several times a night. Way too much noise to ever stay at this hotel again.

I enjoy staying at Best Western because its between Waikiki and Pearl ridge, the swap meet and the Arizona Memorial and the best thing is when were ready to depart there is no real rush cause your just minutes from the airport

Most would not give 5 stars because of the need of updating in the hotel. However- it was clean, staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, the food at the cafe on site was great, there is a store with great hours for most needs, and laundry facilities on site. Given the other choices in the area, it is a great option for the price and location. Also for being close to the airport and high on the highway the rooms were not as noisy as I thought they would be. Incoming military needs to take into account the crowded tourist nature of where they are coming into before giving a bad review of this place. It outweighed other TLA we have stayed in. We however stayed here as regular stop over travel in between space a flights.

This review is for the restaurant The Plaza Cafe. My family has been staying here for a month now and having to dine out on a daily basis. Everyone here has been very nice, helpful, and courteous and we have enjoyed our stay here. The food has been great albeit a little pricey. I have no real complaints. I would definitely like to point out three of your most gracious servers as going above and beyond to satisfy their customers. Ramon is very helpful, and attentive to his customers needs. He always takes time to make sure all is well. Liz also is very lively, attentive, and informative as to things to do around Hawaii and asks if everything is going well. She is always with a smile. We appreciate the little things.....My favorite friend is Michael I can only say he is outstanding, going above and beyond and always on top of his game. All we have to do is come in, sit down, and enjoy the experience. Michael knows exactly what we want and how we want it....it's like he has studied us from the very first day and can read our minds. He's the only person I know who can talk us into the dessert we thought we didn't want!!! Now that's good!! Thanks to you all for making us feel right at home away from home!! We will soon be leaving and will miss you all.

This review is for a short term stay, we are military and awaiting housing. We arrived here the beginning of February and are still here. This is an older hotel and could use some upgrading as far as bathrooms having handles installed in tub area, and working fans for ventilation. The room could use more outlets/usb ports there are not a lot of choices for plugging in electronics used these days. The refrigerator is too small for those of us that may be living here for one to two months with our families, and it kept freezing our foods. Parking stalls are small, really small, and hard to find in garage especially in the evening. Overall our experience was great, especially the service provided by several staff. Everyone made our stay enjoyable, but I must mention two very special ladies on the 8th floor...Madeline, and Amalia...I love these ladies they worked very hard around our schedule and belongings to maintain our room and keep it nice and clean. They remembered the things we liked and what we needed and if something was not right they went out of their way to fix it. When they are off especially the weekends we definitely miss them. Thanks ladies for making our stay great!

very nice employees, clean and very close to the airport. some of the rooms on the front side can be loud from the highway but you can ask to be on the back side of the building which is very quiet. place is great to stay if you only have a short layover, i recommend this for an airport hotel in Honolulu.

Location for air transit purposes is excellent but associated road noise is pronounced and unavoidable except in a few rooms, including in nice garden / pool area. Good service from staff but lines at peak periods.

Quick and easy acommodation from Honolulu Airport. A bit pricy for what you get especially if its just a layover like ours. The hotel overall and the rooms are tired looking and in need of facelift which I understand is in progress. Check in and check out was hassle free and professional. We had a cigarette smoke odour in our non-smoking room on check in and after notifying the front desk housekeeping was there in a dash to deodourize to our satisfaction. Wait staff in the restruarant were pleasant and attentive. The little store off the lobby was a refreshing saving over the high price of identical items we'd bought in Kauai.

My family and I stayed at BW Plaza Hotel on Oahu during our holiday and it was a great place to stay! We were all very pleased with our room which was very clean when we arrived and each day of our stay. The staff are very friendly and caring! I thought that the road noise would be a problem as we come from a very quiet community, but it was hardly noticeable in the room. The beds and pillows are a little soft, but manageable for comfort. We will definitely return for our next holiday adventure!

Many flights to mainland are at horrendously early hours. An extra hour sleep in the morning is great! Also good location if u are military and need proximity to Pearl. Beyond that, it is clean and well maintained. No haute cuisine, but decent pool and exercise room.

house keeping was very nice and made me feel very welcome. they had a great sense of humor and always a smiling face especially mrs Tysie and Emelita. room was good food was great. location could be better but I didn't mind the noise from the highway. front desk staff was nice too always helpful. the fitness center could use some work though.

Front desk staff needs education on how to be helpful, courteous, and make business travelers want to return. House keeping staff and restaurant staff were outstanding. As a business traveler, I would look for another location. This is a location where transient family awaiting movement are housed. If you like your business calls and contacts interrupted by children having tantrums, getting spanked, and playing with the elevators, then this is your place.

The best part of my stay was the friendly housekeeping. Renry and the other housekeeping on the 10th floor were nice, caring and eager to go out their way to make your stay a great one. The only down side I seen was the gym. Equipment was broken my entire stay over a month.

I came to Oahu for business and found myself at this hotel which was reserved by my travel agent. I don't know if this is the norm in Hawaii, but this hotel was way too expensive for what was offered in my opinion. The last hotel I stayed at was an Embassy Suites and the price matched the quality. The Best Western in Oahu by the airport needs some upgrades, I spent well over $400.00 for 2 nights at this over priced hotel. I am not speaking about every Best Western, just this one. I've had great experiences with Best Western in the past. The overall experience was OK, I'm just really bummed about the price I paid, I feel kind of ripped off.

I would love to give shout out to: Cyn, Cecilia, Beau, Athena, and ChireeThese ladies really helped my adjustment to the Island, moving from Alabama. While staying here, these ladies gave me awesome recommendations on housing, food, and entertainment. I will definitely miss there conversations about life and the history of the Island. I will be indebted to these ladies for their hospitality and customer service.Walter Herron

Stayed 2 nights because we had an early flight the following day. Hotel was more modern than a lot in Waikiki and couldn't fault the room for convenience and cleanliness. Only problem we had was the shuttle pick up from the airport. We phoned as advised but the shuttle didn't arrive. 45 minutes later we had to phone again. Local bus service to Ala Moana, Pearl Harbour, Waikiki etc leaves from just outside the hotel ever 10 minutes.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks in January while we transitioned into our new home here in Hawaii. We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and the military post my husband works at. Other than that we did not expect much but we were very happy to find that the staff were very nice and made you feel at home. The front desk staff were helpful and our housekeeping staff were great as well especially Remy, Annie, and Amalia. Remy took excellent care of our room for most of our stay and then other nice ladies helped out as well. We always saw Annie out in the halls and she was very kind and always managed to put smiles on our faces! We also loved the breakfast served at the hotel restaurant we keep wanting to go back!

We booked this hotel as we were arriving New Year's Eve and then leaving a couple of days later on a cruise. We arrived late in the evening and were delighted that the hotel was less than five minutes from the airport...our car rental only a block away. Our room and the hotel was very clean, the staff friendly (especially Rose and Beau at reception). Dining in the hotel restaurant was convenient. Food good and service excellent.

Older hotel but well maintained and kept. The staff was very polite and personable. They always greeted us by name and were very helpful with acquainting us to the island. Our housekeeper was absolutely fabulous. Because we were staying for an extended period she asked if we had a preferred time during the day to have our room made up. Amalia did a great job maintaining our room. She would even make up my daughters toddler bed if it was not made when she came to the room. She made us feel like we were home and accommodated our needs.

This hotel was older but very clean, the staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was located close to my place of business and to the airport, very convient. A little noisy do to traffic but again, location.

Upon entering our room, after sundown - the light switch that controls a table lamp did not work, as the lamp was turned off. We stumbled into the room, 15-20 steps before we could reach a light to turn on. It was totally black inside this room. My husband is disabled, so it was not a good situation. Please remind maid service to check the light situation for future guests. And yes, it's very convenient to the airport -- but goodness, we awoke once every hour - even with ear plugs! On the plus side, room was very clean and bed comfortable -- lovely decor -- but don't plan to return to this location.

Cherae, Cynthia and Sharon were helpful polite and very patient with my first time on the Island questions. It made my stay very pleasant. Special thanks to Cherae who went above and beyond to inform me of the bus routes and accessible sights after I returned my rental car. The hotel is aged yet clean and in good condition. Close to airport and military bases with easy access via public transportation.

Very good hotel, convenient to airport and business area. Friendly staff, clean rooms and covered parking. Amenities for family and business alike, well worth looking into if you plan to visit Hawaii.

The only reason that this hotel has been given an average and not a poor is because this hotel is what it is - a hotel airport that allows you easy and quick access to the airport.We stayed in a room that was right on the freeway. I seriously thought that the window was open because the road noise was so loud.The fixtures and fittings haven't been updated since baker light was popular - very scary. For one night only it was adequate.

This was our second stay at the Best Western in Oahu. I started in Sept. to inquire into a room for New Year's Eve in Honolulu/Waikiki.The price kept rising and the availability kept dropping. This hotel didn't price gouge as much as the others. Some asking $700 a night for a $100 room. We got a decent rate and a decent room. It's an airport hotel and you wouldn't want to spend your vacation here. The shuttle is quick and reliable with a friendly driver. He even showed us a small balcony where we could watch the fireworks. Restaurant is okay and they have a small shop for snacks. Brand new McD's next door. The elevated highway is close and loud. The main entrance is on a busy highway with the bus stop across the street.

In an area of very high rates, this hotel provides an economical place to stay. There is a large parking garage, the rooms are clean and spacious, housekeeping is very good, beds comfortable. It is reasonably close to attractions; almost half-way between Pearl Harbor and Waikiki. Best to have a vehicle; taxi service in this area is very expensive. Although there is no bar or lounge, the small convenience store near the lobby has beer, wine and some liquor, various snacks, and some souvenirs. The restaurant is not open weekday evenings, but the hotel shuttle offers free transportation to a decent restaurant at a nearby sister property. McDonalds, Starbucks, Jamba Juice and a couple other places are just a short walk.

Poorly soundproofed and located directly adjacent to major highway on and off ramps the noise of trucks accelerating and decelerating is continuous at all hours. If you intend to sleep...STAY ELSEWHERE . The rooms are satisfactory and the beds comfortable but the noise is overwhelming

This hotel could do a lot better. But if your only staying a night, its ok. They do have free shuttle, but not very reliable. when we called into the staff at the hotel, they told us to wait outside at the second island. However you have to go to the F gate, and must wait at the green curb. If you miss this important step, the driver will go by and pretend he doesn't see you.

Whenever I come out to Hawaii for military duty and can't get on-base lodging, I use the Best Western. It's close so I don't have to fight the traffic and can still use all the base amenities easier. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The food in the restaurateur is great too. If I'm more into the Hawaii experience I would probably find someplace in Waikiki or North Shore, but when here for business this place is perfect.

Sonia has been our housekeeper for the past five days and she has been excellent in cleaning our room changing our beds every day and asking how we are doing was very courteous.And has been very accommodating to our needs.

We had a very delightful stay here. From the moment we walked into the lobby until we checked out, the staff was very courteous and friendly. My sister flew from Japan and got in before 12pm. Checkin wasn't until 3:00, but the lovely woman at the front desk was able to accommodate us and find a room that was ready sooner. She also gave us until 1:00pm on check-out day.
