I am sorry I do not remember her name, but she was very nice and helpful. Annie from housekeeping kept our room clean and neat and fully-stocked with all the necessities. She was super friendly. We looked forward to seeing her down the hall whenever we were waiting for the elevator to wave and say hello.The only bummer was that I could not get the Kamaʻāina rate since my brother made reservations online thru Best Western. Next time we know to call instead of going on the Internet. Also, the nice woman at the front desk provided us with a business card of a contact person that can help my brother make the reservations and get a better rate. That was cool!Overall, no complaints about our stay at Best Western the Plaza Hotel.

The hotel staff is awesome and friendly!! Very impressive. The restaurant and cleaning staff are very accommodating and flexible, Amalia cleans our rooms is friendly and nice always smiling!! Great impression on our first time in the island and staying at this hotel. I would come back!!

Close hotel to HNL airport. Near busy noisy highway. Just a place to sleep for an early morning flight. Not much else to write home about this place. Shuttle runs 24 hrs a day every half hr. Pick up at F center island green curb. Mikey-D close by within walking 24 he

My husband is active duty military and the Best Western Plaza staff was very welcoming, and supportive with accommodating my family and me. Cherae at the front desk would always greet me with a smile and she would answer and address any question or concerns that I may have. Les Nishimura who is the Military Liaison for the hotel was truly a blessing to my family, for the reason that it works with military families to provide us with a place to stay until housing becomes available. The rooms could use some improvements such as the control panel for the air-conditioner would not adjust, the drainage for the tub did not work we put in a maintenance require three times and it still does not drain properly. Ms. Madeline was very pleasant and she did and remarkable job at keeping our rooms clean. The location was great it was only 1 mile away from Pearl Harbor base, airport, and close to the freeway. The Plaza Café waitresses are approachable yet, the menu needs to expand, and for example a better fluctuate. The Willoughby Restaurant staff is impolite however, they proposition a better vary for the list of options.

Nice bedrooms. Impeccable cleanliness and room services. Thank you so much to Madeline for taking care of our room and maintaining its cleanliness. I also want to commend their respect for you privacy when you don't want to be bothered. Bathrooms are a little small but tolerable.

We picked it because it was close to where we needed to be for work. But it would've been cheaper to stay on the beach than here. Parking is tough at night. You will end up parking all the way at the top and have to walk into the smoking area. Which I found disgusting. I paid a lot to park our car and couldn't find a spot parking spot. The room was ok, but the AC barely worked. I would've loved to open a window to get the stale smell out of the room but couldn't. Everything was just ok. For what I paid per night I could have got a hotel on the beach, free parking and free breakfast. Was extremely disappointed.

Nice motel about 5 minutes from the airport. Room was clean. Noise could be a problem. You are next to the highway and the airport is about two miles away. They say parking can be a problem, however, we found ample parking. Late arrivals could find few spots. I would not use this as a base to see Honolulu. I would stay here again.

This was a very nice room and the hotel service was very good also, but the noise from the freeway, was a continuous bother. But it is close to the airport and easy to get, to. I would stay there again if giving the opportunity.

I love staying at the Plaza when I'm stopping over in Oahu. It has wonderful, comfy beds, upper floors with terrific views, a nice exercise room to workout in and helpful, friendly staff everywhere. It is in an industrial area, but there is a little strip mall to walk to that has a great food court with everything from local plate lunch to juice bar to sushi. The front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping are all professional and awesome!

I'm active duty military inbound to Hickam AFB and I needed to stay in lodging for 50+ days. This hotel is the most convenient to the bases with walking distance from everything. When I say everything I mean everything, the bus stop is 25 yards from the hotel from door. 5 rental car locations all next to each other, with the first one 50 yards from the front door. Not just your mom and pop rental places (budget, dollar rental, alamo etc.). Plus the employees are really friendly and will do everything they can to make your stay very pleasant. I had the best cleaning service daily by Mrs. Sonia. Every morning she greeted me with a smile and a feel like I was home and my mother was checking on me. I can really say that most everything was very good. The only not so good was the internet in the room, it was hit or miss. But if you came to the lobby you had no problem with the wifi or the computer with printer in the lobby (printing free). I can say overall my stay was good

We stayed here for one night and the rooms were clean but outdated. The restaurant downstairs is over the top expensive. You'll get a better meal nezt door at McDonald's. Handy location and thats about it. Would not stay any more than one night.

I love the service received. The maids were great! Amalia was who took care of my room and she done an outstanding job! The café there has great food at a decent cost for being on the island. The location is not far from Pearl Harbor and the Football stadium and is just minutes from downtown.

We chose to stay at the Best Western because of its affordable price which would allow us to spend more time enjoying Hawaii. We were pleasantly surprised that despite the price, we had a decent room that we could enjoy for our week long vacation. Our maid Annie was EXTREMELY kind and very friendly! If anything we would definitely come here again o have Annie provide our service! Thank you Best Western for being a good part of our vacation in Hawaii!

I stayed here as they are close to the hotel and do have a shuttle. Let me say that the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. A very good impression is given upon check-in but then you get to the room. The room decor is adequate but the beds are most uncomfortable, The bathroom is extremely small and very uncomfortable. Our hallway had a distinct odor about it. We took a taxi to Waikiki to eat and the taxi charge was $40 for one-way. I was grateful that we were only there one evening until we could check into the house we rented, It's an adequte hotel but I wouldn't be able to stay there for more than 2-3 nights. I felt bad for some folks that flew in and were staying there for over a week, It is not near Waikiki in the least unless you rent a car. WiFi was not stable and we ended up walking to McDonald's next door to use theirs.

My sons and I flew from different parts of the world to rendezvous for a family vacation. The free airport shuttle, convenience to the airport, and other ease of transportation made this a good launching point.

Close to airport, military bases and food places. Staff was very friendly especially, service attendants Ms Amalia ans Ms Grace. Room was always clean and stocked. Parking was okay,very tight spaces. Many of the customers took up 2 spaces. Store in the lobby was very expensive. Yoplait yogurt was $2.49 each. Ridiculous! Furniture in the room needs updating. Need thicker pillows and extra covers. If you go to MD's around the corner, check your purchase and receipt closely. Twice the cashier tried to rip me off.

The hotel is nice just that you can hear the traffic going being that is so close to the airport. Housekeeping were okay. There was one named Amalia who was very nice, very talkative and did her work very good. The food was okay as well.

I have been have a good time so far here at the Best Western the Plaza in Honolulu. Although my stay is not yet complete I did want to take a moment to speak about the execellent service I have received so far. The service desk is friendly and the room waiting staff is second to none. A very friendly woman named Amalia comes to my room every morning and is very polite as she sees about any of my needs and tidies things up!!!

This hotel is a good one if you are staying overnight. The food is good and they have a nice swimming pool. The rooms are older but are comfortable. There are a lot of food places close by.The car rental places are also close by. We also went to the shopping center at Pearl Ridge. They have many shops and food places there. I enjoyed our stay there. The front desk was very nice and staff service was very good. Would recommend a room away from the pool area. The rooms are fairly large and the beds are comfortable. They have movies and games available. The parking is great and they had a store in the lobby. The shuttle service to the airport is good. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay as they need to update some areas.

I stayed at the Best Western Plaza Hotel for the time on a lay over between flights. I usually stay at the nearby Honolulu Airport Hotel which recently became a Outrigger hotel property as is the Best Western Plaza Hotel. Since the change dining has become difficult at each hotel. Now both the Honolulu Airport Hotel and Best Western Plaza Hotel's restaurants serve breakfast only everyday but close for lunch. For dinner they alternate different days between them as to which hotel restaurant. If your hotel restaurant is closed you have to wait for the hotel shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to go to the other hotel to eat.The Best Western Plaza Hotel is facing next to the Nimitz Freeway so you have heavy traffic noise of they give you a room a few feet from the elevated highway. You must ask for a room away from the freeway. The desk agents are nice but I was accused by a security guard of not being a hotel guest because I was in the lobby too long. I was interrogated. I had checked out in the morning and my flight was that evening. I was treated as homeless or a criminal. Luckily I was able to show him my hotel receipt. No apology. I prefer the Honolulu Airort Hotel but the quality has decreased since it was taken over by Outrigger. I must say that the Best Western Plaza did give me a early noon time check in rather wait until 3pm to check in.

I had a great time, Amalia was a great help. The front desk was helpful and kind. I like the parking and the store in the lobby. The Internet was a great thing to have for work. thank you for everything I will see you guys again.

This hotel, which looks decent from an exterior perspective, was run down and dingy on the interior. The hallway strongly smelled of urine and the bathroom in the room was outdated and in rundown condition. Although I had called and asked for a room at the back of the hotel away from the freeway [as suggested by other Tripadvisor reviewers], our assigned room overlooked the freeway and was noisy. The beds were decent which is the only positive thing I can say about these rooms. I couldn't wait to check out of the hotel to get away from the urine odour that seemed to permeate everywhere. One good things:The shuttle service to the airport was prompt and punctual.

Good morning, I stayed one night in the hotel as I was in connexion during two diferrent flight. This hotel is located closed to the airport in an industrial area, which is fine because you know it in advance ! Most of the time, this kind of hotel is for business purpose and everything inside is well maintained as customers are frequent travellers. Not in this one ! On top of being far away the city and in an industrialized area, bedrooms and the hotel are coming back the 90's without any refurbishment... for a Best western price (220$ for a double bed room). Should be refurnished as soon as possible ;

The stay was very convenient,hotel provided a shuttle to and from the airport. Bus stop was close by and made our lay over eventful. Good place for one or two nights,good restaurant. Close to rental cars and taxi was available as well.

Don't let the photos fool you. This hotel is right under the freeway. As soon as you get out of the shuttle, your face will drop on how loud it is. Even while you are trying to check in you can hear the traffic. Our room stunk like old sweaty socks. Coconut ants all over the room and mold growing on the ceiling. Room security wasn't up to par. Just a chain lock and the door had gaps so you could see outside.  The staff was very nice and the the shuttle driver was great. Breakfast in the dinning room was one of the best on the island - huge and more than I could eat. Right next to the bus stop so you can take the bus to Waikiki Beaches if you want. It will take about 30-40 minutes but only $2.50. I don't think I will stay here again.

My 2 children and I staying here for 6 days while visiting Honolulu for New Years. The staff were very helpful in ensuring that any issues we had with parking and room accommodating were taken care of in a timely manner. The hotel is centrally located but it is next to a highway so sounds from the highway can be an issue. The WiFi was sketchy and we frequently didn't not have access to it during our stay and there were power outages in the hotel which kept affecting our parking tickets. We also had issues with the tub not draining properly. However, all the issues were addressed by the hotel staff in a friendly manner and they worked around the clock to fix these issues in order to make our stay more enjoyable. Our hosts Rose and Beaty were very helpful in all aspects of our stay.

I stayed at the hotel for several nights and enjoyed my stay. The location was great because it was just far enough from busy downtown but close enough to drive or walk. I had a slight problem with the AC but it was quickly fixed. The staff were very friendly especially the housekeeper, Amalia, who cleaned my room daily. She made sure everything was restocked daily and ensured the comfort of the room.

We purposely chose this hotel to tour the Oahu Island. Unlike busy Waikiki area this place is more peaceful and has all the amenities we've needed: refrigerator, microwave,wireless WiFi system, TV etc. McDonalds is located adjacent to the hotel.From this centrally located hotel, we were able to access western parts to visit the Dole Pineapple plantation; Matsumoto Ice Shave Store; Waimea Waterfall Park; the Surfing North Shores - Banzai Pipeline to Laie where the popular Polynesian Cultural Center is located.The south eastward traveling takes to Waikiki and the Diamond Head; Hanauma Bay - this is extremely busy place so get to the park by 7:00 am to get a parking space; Sea Life Park is a nice place for both adults and teenagers/children . Pearl Harbor and the Arizona Memorial is less than 10 minutes from this hotel. Eastward on H3 took us to Kaneohe and the windward area within 15-20 minutes.Military ID card holders have special discounts at many tourist frequented places such as Atlantis Submarine Tours in Oahu and Kona, Hawaii. The

Mum and I stayed at the hotel from 28th Dec to 1st Jan, and had a very enjoyable stay, first we arrived after our cruise had finished at 9.00 and asked for our bags to be checked in and for mums diabetic pen to be placed in a fridge, which they did, which was a huge relief, when we did check in we had room 1017, which is a pretty big room overlooking the airport. Didn't hear any traffic, only the occasional plane taking off or landing, when using the close runway, which wasn't that often.....We met are lovely housekeeper Annie, who was very friendly and explained some good places to visit and see whilst in Hawaii....The only problem that I had was the bath leaked at a certain point, but problem solved we reverted to showers.....I can recommend this hotel, for the price and location, and that there was a free shuttle bus to take us to the airport terminal every half hour.....will stay again next time in Honolulu.....Mahalo

We flew back to Oahu the night before our flight back to the mainland so we stayed here because of the proximity to the airport. It was a standard best western. It was we a little dingy but good enough for what it was. There are several eateries close by that are can't miss while on the island all within walking distance. We even walked to the hotel from the airport but they do have a free shuttle that runs every 30 minutes 24 hrs a day. Not the nicest looking area of town but I didn't see anything that made me nervous to walk around. The hotel is right next to the highway (like 50 yards away?), see my photo from our room. We had a room on the side of the hotel and hardly heard the traffic at night. The gym is small but well kept and on the top floor which is fun. I'd inly stay here if I needed easy and quick access to the airport.

When we got there we had lots of bags. We asked the bell hop if they had a cart to transport them if they had a cart. He stated "We do but we dont loan out" and then just walked away. Luckily, the women at the front desk had the manager use the cart who was very nice and helped us move the bags using the cart. We also were charged $15 for parking which kind of just felt like this wasnt disclosed or just let a bad feeling with extra charges.

Annie(house keeper) was superNice and ensure the cleaniess of the room. The location was great. Close to airport and tripler medical center. And the staff were welcoming. Only negative side of this hotel was that the front desk seemed too busy and tight parking space.

Don't think that this is a fancy hotel - it certainly isn't, with views of the city (that of course include the highway), problems with insulation in the rooms (from the noise), and problems with the rooms (we had water on our carpet that seeped into our duffel bags). You'll need to make sure that you call ahead of time for a room as well - when there are conventions in town, people like to use the Airport Honolulu Hotel and this hotel for convenience, then take a cab to the center. HOWEVER, everyone who works there is friendly, the beds are comfortable, the restaurants are within walking distance (Blimpie's, Starbucks, Jamba Juice, L & L Barbeque - all within one strip mall), and the accommodations are certainly doable short-term. This is a good low cost option for those of you who are flying to another island the next day, or want a base on Oahu near the airport and don't mind cabs (or rent a car and pay the comparatively reasonable parking).

As a retiree of United Airlines and a Platinum rewards member, BW was the logical choice when my husband and I decided to standby for a flight a day early to Oahu on Christmas Eve. So I redeemed 32K points for our room with a king bed. When we arrived, it took about 25 minutes to be picked up after I phoned the front desk but once there the Front Desk personnel was so nice and friendly I thought nothing about it. We had booked our rental car through Alamo for a Christmas Day pickup since that was our initial arrival date. The front desk inquired if we would need transport back to the airport the next day since we only booked one night, I said "no, but could we get a ride to Alamo", she said "no problem, we can drop you off, we depart every 30 minutes, just advise the front desk person in the morning".So, after arriving at our very nice room at the corner of the airport runway and the H-1 freeway, we settled in for a sleepless night. We decided to get up and start our day and eat breakfast, dined with the winners of the Hawaii Aloha Bowl, crowded but interesting. So we ate the retrieved our luggage from our room, stepped outside to see how far Alamo was. We couldn't see their sign so we asked the front desk for a lift, they declined. Yes, they said NO we can't give you a ride we only give shuttle service to the airport. Alamo is at the end of the same block but it is long block, especially when you are dragging your luggage behind you. Keep in mind this was after the front desk the night before stated "no problem ". So my 70 year old husband who has just recovered from colon cancer, has bad feet and a bad shoulder and myself with a neck injury from a fall, my feet with tendinitis and my Platinum Status with Best Western walked the long block to Alamo.So happy we stayed only one night.

I arrived in Honolulu one day early because I didn't account for the date change - my condo wasn't ready, I had no reservations and it was night. The Plaza receptionist immediately found me a room. The views are fantastic and all of the floors higher than 3 - the other reviews don't do them justice! While there is a bit of traffic noise, the higher up you go the less there is, and the beds are so comfortable, the rooms so nice that it matters little. There is a fast and free shuttle to the airport, and several restaurants within walking distance. Everyone there, from the housekeepers to the front desk staff are amazingly cheerful, helpful and professional. If you are on a stopover, Waikiki and Honolulu and far away and the hotels pricy - without the views here:-) I love BW for the consistency, and this is a nice one. I've already booked for the return trip stop in Honolulu!

Looking at the web site for this hotel you would never know that the location is really on a highway, I mean literally on the highway. I'm on the seventh floor and right outside my window is a major highway. Cars and trucks roar past - I'm so happy I'm only here for one night. Do not believe the photos on the web site.

Here two nights for a brief stop in Honolulu. Shuttle drivers each way were terrific; front desk staff very friendly and helpful about bus and taxi info. Hotel is old and pretty beat up, but the room was clean and bed was comfortable. You can get a bus right in front of the hotel to take you to the Arizona Memorial or Waikiki.

Plus, there was no charge for in-room Wifi. Their restaurant was closed that evening, but the limo driver offered to drive me a block and a half to their sister hotel for dinner. Excellent customer service all around

Annie was our housekeeper and she made sure our needs were met. She was always smiling and takes pride in what she does. As much as we were excited to finally move into a house, we were also saddened cuz we sure will miss her smiley face. Best employee I've ever met.

My group of 6 rented 2 rooms for a night after arriving from the mainland. We needed someplace close to the airport and reasonably priced. This best western provided both of these. The hotel is older but the rooms were fairly clean and they gave us adjoining rooms. The highway is noisy so keep that in mind if you are a light sleeper. We were all tired from the long flight so it did not bother us but I could see that this might be an issue for some people as it is pretty loud. The parking is tight but they do have a shuttle that is convenient if you don't need a rental car or other vehicle. We arrived after 10 but the restaurant was closed so we had to eat at the McDonald's next door. This is just an average hotel but if you need something close to the airport and lower priced this will cover your needs.

It is nice that the hotel provides the meal vouchers for dinner at the resturaunt. And the cleaning staff is more than helpful, love that. However, the internet is TERRIBLE. That is a problem for me having school work and hardly and service in my room I need the wifi that is promised. During my stay I called 3 times to inquire about fixing the problem. During one call I got transferred to tech support who supposedly fixed it, my internet worked for 3 days that just died on me. Can not load one web page, hardwired or wifi. Along with the wifi not working the rooms are very small and do not accommodate a stay for long periods of time.

Stayed here for four nights the first half of December. I am a Best Western diamond member, and have stayed at over 500 Best Western hotels across the United States. During my stay at this particular Best Western, I paid, with tax, 183.48 per night. Since this was before the Christmas crowd, my stay was considered as being during "low" season. I have never paid these kind of prices for a Best Western except in Manhattan (New York City). But the reality of prices in the Honolulu and Wikiki area is that lodging is expensive here. It appears that all hotels on this side of O'ahu also charge you a daily fee to park your car. Despite my sticker shock, it was a pleasant stay at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel. I did have a rental car, so I did not take advantage of the free shuttle bus. When I arrived, the check in only took about 4 minutes. I had a nice clean room with a king bed. There was air conditioning, plus a small refrigerator and microwave in my room. There was slight traffic noise throughout the night. Upon awakening in the morning, there was plenty of hot water in the bathroom. While this Best Western does not offer a free breakfast, it does offer breakfast in its on-sight restaurant. Throughout my stay, all staff encountered were courteous and professional. Special mention goes to Rose at the front desk for being extra helpful. There is a daily complimentary local newspaper, along with a free copy of the USA Today, on the front counter. There is also a little store near the lobby and elevators. It is open until 9:30 p.m. Though it is not listed on its amenities website page, this Best Western does have a fitness center on the 12th floor. My check out took about three minutes. All in all, I had a positive experience during my stay. Just be prepared when you come to Hawaii to bring your bank account with you, and leave with your funds depleted. Good luck and have a fun trip!

The cleaning crew especially Mercy did an excellent job maintaining our room as well as always being polite and courteous every time we talked with them. Friendly staff throughout the hotel that react to any issues to help make your stay a pleasant one

The hotel is half a mile away from the airport. There is a free shuttle bus (plus tip) which has to be pre-arranged at the airport baggage claim and at hotel reception. The staff were pleasant, courteous and informative, when it came to figuring out how to get to Waikiki by bus. We were a little earlier than check in however our room was ready. We had a high level corner room with great view of airport a water glimpses. The room size was very generous for a king bed which meant we were spoilt for choice on where to place our luggage. We had an early morning flight which is why we stayed at this hotel and that reason only. The room was quiet enough, but we were near the ice machine. Luckily not many people used it as it was quite loud.The bathroom had a shower bath and was clean enough. Ample towels supplied as was a hair dryer. There was no steam exhaust.The hotel has a restaurant, which we didn't try and there is a McDonalds next door.On departure the shuttle is on a first in first on basis and makes a run every 30 minutes.

We were staying down the Waikiki area for the first 7 nights of our trip. Being those rooms are more expensive for all the right reasons this one turned out to only be slightly less expensive than the 4 star property we had on the beach. Seriously we could have stayed at our first property for only $30 more (through priceline express deals). Honestly this is the bottom of the list of all the Best Westerns I have stayed at. The room was clean, but it didn't smell great. Smelled like it just got cleaned and had a small mildew smell. But nothing to get too worked up about. The beds were very budget motel comfortable. This place would have been just fine for $70-80 (it is Hawaii after all, everywhere else would be a $50-60). Not their advertised $155. Thats my biggest issue... too much for what you get, the super close shuttle is the only reason I would stay. We had an early, early departure the following morning.

We stayed 2 nights after cruise excursion Oahu with airport drop off. Hotel provides free airport shuttle. Public transport to Pearl visitor center and downtown and beaches at hotels frontstep. Some shops and Starbucks nearby. Hotel also has small shop. Only bring earplugs as hotel is next to a lot of traffic on the freeway next to it.

A good location close to HNL...I stay here several times a year... clean, friendly, good beds, working internet, lighted parking garage, bathrooms small and inconveniently laid out, no readily accessible and available electrical outlets at bedside table..had to move heavy furniture to access.. multiple outlets on a power strip would solve the problem.

Parking is limited on weekends if you get in late. They tell you to park parallel if stalls are full. You take a chance of the car thats in the stall backing into your parked car thats parked against the wall.. Air conditioner stayed on all the time making it very cold at night. Shower would become either really HOT or Very Cold, then switch back again. Hotels location is very good as it is close to Rent a car return and the airport is 5 mins away. Rooms are clean and have free Wifi connection.

If you have a late night or early morning flight, and need to be close to the airport, this is one of only 2 reasonable options, without heading into Waikiki. The shuttle was fast and smooth for us, check-in efficient, the hotel shop well stocked with a variety of essentials, free in room wi-fi, good check-out time of noon, luggage storage if you need to check out before your flight, free internet and printing in the lobby (handy for boarding passes), and a refreshing pool. Yes, it is under a freeway but we didn't hear noise in our room, the rooms are well used and showing their age a bit, and it may be pricey compared to other cities, but this is Hawaii, and for the convenience of an airport hotel, the Best Western is a solid pick.

My wife and I get to Hawaii once a year. Me for work, and my wife to see friends and shop. This hotel is great for me because I work on the other side of the island, so I don't have any of the traffic. Close to Pearl Harbor and the NEX, a bus cost you two bucks if you have to go into Waikiki. The food in the hotel is pretty good, and get there early for the crab buffet on Fridays. The gals that took care of our room--Madelene and Amalia made sure our room was very clean, and were very professional and courteous. We've stayed there six times now, and for my next trip I will try to stay there again. You can keep the Waikiki traffic. They do have parking at the hotel for a daily fee.

Abandon by my airport pickup & checking in at 2AM I was charged an astronomical fee for a very low grade room that was sticky around the edges. The clerk informed me they woulld "allow" me a late check-out of 12:00 noon.10 hours in old, noisy military style barracks building for $190.00, I kept expecting to see cockroaches, but thankfully did not. When I emailed the manager, his reply was "please come again and we will make sure you are happy". Not likely to do that again.

We stayed at this hotel as it was near to the airport and we had a 3am check in for our flight. The hotel is dated, the internet does not work in the rooms. The rooms are noisy and generally not very comfortable.The best thing about this hotel is the lovely staff, they were all so friendly and genuinely caring. Especially the poor shuttle driver who drove our group to the airport at 2:30am and would not let us help with any of the luggage.

The staff at the best western plaza hotel is excellent. The front desk staff is very helpful with any request and we have had excellent customer service from Amalia who came to service our room everyday. Best stay in Hawaii!!!

I got in at 10:00 at night and had a 16 hour layover in Honolulu which was not enough time to really go to the beach area for my stay. This Best Western was just right. Very prompt and courteous pick up at baggage claim after using the nearby courtesy phone. 5 minute drive to the hotel (if that long). Greeted warmly by the front desk. Large upper floor corner room was very nice. Overlooked Diamond Head in the distance and the airport out the other window. Room was well appointed with small fridge, microwave and coffee pot. Room was very clean, Thank You Remy! Hotel is in a warehouse area so dinning is at the hotel restaurant (I did not eat here) McDonalds next door or during the week a shuttle to a nearby restaurant (I did not use this either). Probably not a hotel for vacationers spending time here due to location but good for airport layovers or someone on business with a car.

We just stayed here one night. Hotel was modern and convenient to the airport, with frequent shuttles. It's a pet friendly hotel, although we didn't bring our pet at the last minute. Very clean, and comfortable bed! Would stay here again!

given large room and very clean. staff friendly and helpful. restaurant in the evening was excellent food and great service right in front of the airport so no hassle getting there like going downtown and fighting Honolulu traffic.

We just needed a place to stay the night before flying out the next day. Loved the 24hr free shuttle. So convenient, especially after a long flight and late arrival time. Nice, clean and comfortable room to freshen up and get some rest.

This is a very friendly and helpful hotel. It is a great place to stay if you are in the military and are PCSing to Hawaii. The staff is helpful and friendly. They definitely give you a warm welcome to the island. Also our housekeeper, Amalia, is excellent. She is always kind and greets you with a smile. She does an excellent job in keeping the room clean and fresh for when we return.

Unless you like traffic noise this is not the hotel for you, my wife and I had the worst sleep ever. The room itself was good but the freeway was right outside the window and had constant traffic noise throughout the night. It was even worse in the morning during morning rush hour commute. Stay away from this one!!

It's very close to the airport, their shuttle bus is frequently picking and dropping off on scheduled time for their customers, very convenient as well bus stop is very close to this hotel for commute adventure. Staffs are friendly and the ambiance is good.

The cleaning ladies, Grace and Myrna, were delightful and helpful. Made my wife and myself comfortable. The wait staff at the hotel resturauant were also very polite and helpful. This hotel is perfect for military that is PCSing to the island. They have a program and personnel to assist all military.

We stayed for 20days am a Pilipina and my first time in Hawaii , soon as I land to the island I feel like home. Our cleaning lady Grace and Myrna are very nice and treat me like a family they keep our room nice and clean:) All the staff at the restaurant , front desk , and housekeeping are friendly, very accomodating and has a pleasant personality. Les is very helpful with my husband and very nice too. Food is great especially their Friday night which is the CRAB NiGHT . And Oh their Steak is really good too.

We spent one night at the Best Western in Honolulu, HI after a late night arrival. When you arrive, there are only 3 tight parking spaces in front of the hotel so you can run inside to check in. The shuttle bus parks in front and the driveway entrance and exit make for very difficult turns. They have a multi-level parking garage with small spaces and certainly not enough spaces to accommodate all guests. Many people parked along a wall, creating difficulty for those in parking spaces to get out. It took me about 10 minutes to park a mid-size car properly.The hotel room was clean, comfortable, and came with a mini fridge and microwave. We had two double beds and ample space to get around even with 2 suitcases and various carry-on bags. Although the hotel sits on a main drag, we didn't notice any noise coming from the street.There's a nice gift shop on the first floor with a very helpful employee. Buy the large bottle of water for only 99 cents. It's the best deal around. Their prices on macadamia nuts, postcards, and other vacation must-haves are competitive with other shops in Honolulu and Waikiki.You'll pay for parking. What I don't understand is they say guests pay less than the standard rate. I can't imagine anyone parking there who isn't a hotel guest. I didn't see anything else nearby that would warrant the need to park at the hotel.I would stay here again, easily. Maybe next time I'll pick up my rental car in the morning.

The service at the Best Western Hotel was wonderful. The food at the restaurant was really good.The best western Plaza is also a military friendly hotel. My family is military and the service given to us was very good. The best Western Plaza Hotel is close to the airport, shopping centers restaurants and the best beach on the island. My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Plaza Hotel. The gym is on the 12th floor I love watching the sunrise as I work out at the gym in the mornings.

I stayed at the Best Western Plaza hotel for a little over 2 months and I had the greatest experience. The hotel was very clean and the employees were very polite. There were two employees that stuck out the most for me. Ms. Madelene and Ms. Amalia. They made my day. They were very professional and at the same time polite and funny. If I was their supervisor, I would ensure they get a raise and put them in management. The restaurant was awesome. The Friday Nite seafood buffet was the greatest. Crab legs, fried shrimps just to name a few things on the buffet bar. I enjoyed staying there and most def will stay again.

This hotel is very run down and expensive. The locks were broken. No place to put toiletries in the bathroom. We asked for a king and got a double bed room. They had a restaurant on site which was nice because we didn't have a car. It was okay but very expensive for what you got.

I've had nothing short of great service here. The employees at the front desk were always very helpful. The food was great, especially breakfast very fast and friendly staff. My housekeeper, Ms. Sonia was amazing!! Always smiling and kept my room in great shape, wishing her the best. Thank you Best Western! :)

The rooms were nice, I just wish the refrigerator was a little bigger. We've been here for over 40 days, and our room attendant "Fely" is the best ever. Fely is very nice, and courteous, and always has a smile on her face, she makes our stay here more comfortable everyday.

Best WEstern Plaza. Great for a short stay but beware of very expensive parking at $30 per night. It was a great location for only overnighting in Hawaii. Shuttle every 30 minutes was efficient. Nice little convenience store on property

We only stayed over night but it was very relaxing and surprisingly quiet as it's located right next to the Airport. Very centrally located and easy to get in and out. We had breakfast in the restaurant and the food and service were outstanding. The location is excellent, near the Airport and Waikiki.

It was obvious this hotel was "older", but the décor and amenities were quite nice, bed comfortable, onsite restaurant, airport shuttle. It was very handy for us as it was close to the airport and we were only staying overnight.

I really enjoyed the hotel. We didn't have any problems...The entire staff was really nice.The hotel was clean. The pool area was nice also...The restaurant had great food. The entire time we was there, which was 40 days I think we had the best housekeeper (Sonia) . We stayed in room 229. She was really friendly and helpful, doing everything she could to make our stay comfortable. She supplied our every needs. I would stay at this hotel again!!!Another good thing is it's pet friendly...Nice area around the pool to walk your pets.

If you are coming to Honolulu on a budget or just need a airport hotel, please do not hesitate to stay here. Nice rooms, 24 hour shuttle to airport (free), breakfast and dinner restaurant, and small store to meet your needs. Parking was available and we were able to unload our bags to the room, and return our rental car, and then take the shuttle back for a relaxing evening before our super early flight the next day. We had a mini fridge, microwave, and a large room to relax in. Other travelers were able to take the bus to the beach and enjoy their time in Oahu.

Amalia, the housekeeper did a good job cleaning my room everyday and made sure that all toiletries were stocked in my room..............................................................................

This Best Western is located very near the airport and their shuttles run regularly back and forth to it. Driver helped with our bags which was very welcomed. A word of advice is check where they pick up at the airport and where your tour bus thinks you need to be let off. It was not the same for us, but if I had called the hotel, there would have been no problem. This hotel is on the west side of Honolulu and is near the Pearl Harbor Memorial. The Arizona and the Missouri are well worth seeing. Our large room was on the corner high up their tower. Although the hotel is in a warehouse district, we had a fine view of the ocean and to the east, Waikiki and Diamond.

I enjoyed my sTay here. The rooms are very big and I enjoyed everything within the room. The room service cleaner we've had her name was Amalia, she was very friendly and open to our family. She connected with us quite well. She took the time to clean up after us and offered to put away some mess my siblings had made. I appreciate the staff here. They're very hard workers and are always smiling and make you feel very welcome.

I love staying at this Hotel, its the best for the amount of money you pay, its close to my place of work, and hast all the convenience I need. I would recommend this place to stay to all my friends and co-workers, as well as people who ask for a place to stay in Hawaii.

I needed a quick overnight near the airport and this worked for that, but I wouldn't choose it for my whole vacation as it is not near the action or a destination establishment. The staff is friendly, airport shuttle prompt and free, room comfortable (I was 8th floor at the back so the freeway noise wasn't too bad.) I tried to read and relax at the pool, but the freeway overhead makes it a little hard to enjoy. There is no included breakfast so I tried the restaurant....food was pretty good, but pricey. What isn't in Hawaii? This place caters to servicemen and their families so it feels more like base housing. This is not a bad thing, but not like a vacation in Hawaii either. This is the only Best Western on Oahu and the rates are top end for what they offer. I used a free night voucher or I might have made another choice. Happily I had a good night's sleep and that was really what I was hoping for.

This hotel staff took care of me and my son a lot during our PCS here. They are one of the few business that actually cater to and help out a lot with Soldiers.It also felt great not to worry about getting screwed over while I stayed here. They work with you to make sure you are comfortable while you wait for adequate housing. Amailia had GREAT house keeping service, one of the best. She was very friendly and polite. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

From van drivers, check in clerks, bell hop with luggage, clerks in little shop, waitress at BW neighbor restaurant: all professionals. Hotel should include a complimentary breakfast of some kind. This is close to the airport and a nice place to stay

Thank you for great service. Amalia is very nice and works so hard. She always makes sure we have clean room every time we come in the room. The staff welcomes you with hello and byes. But the parking is hard.

Went there at the end of a 2 week vacation on other islands. Was told we could catch the bus from this location. Driver from airport said it was easy. When asking front desk about details of how often the bus runs and which bus to take, I was told to look it up on the internet which was very slow. In desperation, we ate at the restuarant in the hotel. BAD and no inexpensive. Next morning caught the early bus to Pearl Harbor which went well, but the bus that was supposed to get us to downtown and beaches we were lost. Bus was packed with people standing up and could not see where we were going. Got off at where we thought we should be and ended up walking 2 hours to get the large mall. Had a late lunch and took a taxi back to the hotel. That is when we say that they have taxi's parked in their lot ready to use. We are not regular bus riders and were not given any help form the hotel staff, only telling us that the taxi was expensive. Taxi to the hotel was $29, a small price to pay when you have only 1 day and could like to see the beach and the area. Will think twice before I ever stay at a Best Western again and they are not consistant. It was a bod ending to a wonderful vacation.

The Best Western Plaza is extremely convenient to the airport, as well as a good facility. We have therefore returned there after staying there previously. The airport noise was not a problem at all. We wish we would have had more time to enjoy the amenities.

We used BW points for this hotel, which is the main reason why we chose it. Parking is in a garage and there wasn't enough space for all the guests. We park in the handicap spots (I have several medical issues) and we had problems with motorcycles parking in the no parking zone beside the handicap spot. We said something several times, even spoke to the hotel manager. But they continued to park there. If I was in a wheelchair and had a ramp on our van, i would never have been able to put the ramp down. Those areas are no parking zones for a reason. Other than that, the hotel is nice. We didn't eat in the restaurant but it's there if you want the convienence. We were in the room very little (so we could see as much of the island as possible). Of you want a hotel that's away from downtown Honolulu this will work. If you want to stay where most tours start and near the mall and shops, his isn't it. Be prepared, paid parking garages are popular.

I am frequently required to stay overnight at an airport to get another flight the next day. That is exactly the service the Plaza hotel supplies. This is not the place to go for your honeymoon or a weekend away. This is a one night, in and out, hotel. The Plaza hotel is a very good transit hotel, on par with the Singapore Airport Hotel or the Washington at Narita. The first requirement is it must be clean. And it was. The bathroom and linen were excellent. This is hard to do when you have a parade going through these properties. The bed was firm and new, and the food service was very good. If you need a layover in HNL, this is the place. I have tried their competitors, and the Plaza wins. How was the pool and the gym? Who cares!

My husband is in the army so are stationed in hawaii for 3 years...we had to stay at this hotel for a month! Even to I was so ready to get out house the housekeeper Mrs.Annie was Wonderful! So nice and always had a smile on her face... today we leave an It was bitter sweet. Love her.

Stayed here on stopover on the way to Maui.Pickup, and drop off, from the airport was prompt. Sadly the in-between bits weren't so good.The room was mere metres away from 2 flyovers and the motorway noise was huge, and incessant.Fortunately the traffic noise was drowned out - by the in-room air conditioner, even on its lowest setting.The room was sparse, but functional, and expensive.

The hotel is just okay. Service was not as friendly as other Best Westerns or other hotels in Hawaii. Rooms facing Nimitz are very noisy. Parking is HORRIBLE and expensive. The only positive note is that it's very close to the airport.

I recently confused the two HNL hotels and inadvertently finished up at the other one booking through Hotels.com. The receptionist at the Best Western pointed out my mistake and arranged for the hotel transit bus to take us to the other hotel - very impressive service. The Best Western Plaza is by far the better of the two. The rooms are plain vanilla but adequate, ditto the restaurant. Be sure to ask for a room on a higher floor to avoid the noise from the freeway.

The hotel was nice and close to the airport. All staff were very polite, especially the housekeeper that works on level 8 named Amelia. She loved talking to our two boys and they also enjoyed talking to her. She was always very helpful and very nice.

great staff, great food at the resturant, with very friendly wait staff. Beds were comfortable, room was clean. Microwave and frig., worked fine. One drawback was the noise from the freeway traffic. It was located very close to the airport and you never heard the planes at all.. During the day you would hear the F-14's doing there daily routine, but they were fun to watch.

Staff was extremely helpful, however the hotel itself is average (clean & semi-functional) but on the pricier side for what you get. Downsides are the road noise, rooms are clean but dated and not the most ergonomically functional.

This hotel was adequate, close to the airport and the staff at the desk were helpful but that's about it. The facilities in the room were sparse at best, we went to their store and bought a bottle of wine only to discover that there was no cork screw in the room to open it with so had to buy one... There were no wine glasses so it was plastic Dixie cups. They also sold pop tarts but the room had no toaster..... There were 2 of us booked in but we only had 3 sugar sachets and no complimentary milk. Our bed was tiny, if you're tall be prepared to curl up. We would not stay there again, it wasn't that comfortable or accommodating for the price. The restaurant only operates Thursday to Sunday so be prepared to travel to their other hotel or have a big lunch and take some snacks. Sadly disappointing.

gotta do this again but use the pool. so i will need to bring my swimwear next time. nice view of the airport. i was not too crazy about the highway noise. the pillows were very comfy. airport transportation was very reliable.

for short stay this hotel meets or exceeds a great value being right in front of the airport. no long drive time to go downtown to the other hotels which in my opinion are not that good anyway compared to best Western. The only thing that disappoints me is no bar and limited times for meals. the staff is very friendly and willing to help assist you. I am 63 and the drivers always help with my luggage and are very friendly

This hotel has it's good points- reasonable rate, friendly staff, clean pool, good wi-fi, free shuttle. But the interior of rooms are quite dated and location is loud (right next to highway), definitely not some place I would want to spend a lot of time relaxing or exploring in Hawaii, but it served it's purpose for being close to airport and reasonably priced. Impressed with the clean lobby, gift shop and pool area.

It is hard to find a reasonable priced hotel in Ohau but this Best Western offered good price. We used this hotel prior to our departure to wait for our red-eye flight. Pros:Bed/bathroom (tub!)/room were clean and comfortable. Free shuttle from/to HNL Laundry Facility Cons: Far away from Waikiki area if you plan to spend time there. Next to highway so outdoor area (pool area) is very noisy. You may need to rent a car if this hotel to be your home base while vacationing

The hotel has a great location just outside of the airport for the traveler who is just staying for a short stay like I was heading to the cruise ship piers the next morning. The hotel and my room were clean I have no complaints about that. Yes the hotel could use some updating but not enough for me to complain about. They have a restaurant on premise, average hotel food. Front desk staff was helpful to a point, my wife asked them for places to eat beside the hotel restaurant and they provided a list but neglected to say that in walking distance is a Starbucks for a quick coffee. when it came time to check out I reserved my room approximately 1 month before my arrival. I reserved the room at a government rate and received my reservation email. I did not check my email thoroughly to see the rate was not on there. I do know however that it was not the rate that I paid when I checked out. No explanation was offered as to why, and I had no proof as to what the rate was supposed to be. Shame on me for that.

This hotel is great if you like A/C systems that don't work and are stuck at freeze level all night and enjoy a $30 surprise on your bill the next morning! Best thing the maintenance man could suggest at this 'Best' Western hotel was to send us some extra blankets. Two extra blankets later and we could almost sleep. Ridiculous!! And we won't even talk about getting overcharged $30 on our visa, then the hotel refusing to give us a hotel 'receipt' including the $30 charge, but just to expect it on our credit card bill. Best to stay elsewhere next time!!

Exceptionally kind and professional staff, clean facilities, centrally located with minimal traffic in the area. The only draw back is that there are limited facilities (restaurants, clubs, etc) in the area.

I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for two months. Nothing stands out in my mind as a complaint. The rooms were decent, fairly priced, location was ideal, transportation to and from the airport was phenomenal and the staff were very accommodating. I particularly had the pleasure of having my room attended to by Sonia ( I am not sure how to spell it correctly). She was the housekeeper for room 231. She had a keen sense for detail attention in a manner which made a two month stay in a hotel the most pleasant I can ever imagine. Thank you so very much Sonia, Derrick

I want to start off by saying that I would never book this hotel on my own, but that the experience was a positive one. To keep from writing a really long review I'll just give some highlights.I was required to stay there due to medical military orders and was not given any other option (which already put me in a fowl mood). I had to live there for almost a month. Pros: The staff was very accommodating and kind. The hotel itself was being painted when I was there, so it seems to be getting revamped a little.The room was clean, but nothing special. It was old, but not terrible. The bed was comfortable.I was on the 4th floor facing towards the airport and it was very quiet.The hotel store had plenty of the things that I needed on a day to day basis, and the restaurant at both this hotel and the sister hotel nearby was actually really delicious. It was walking distance to some local food places and I felt it was well lit. They have a pretty decent gym. some cardio machines, kettle bells, and 1 weight machine.Free wifiFree shuttle to and from the airportCons: loud road noise as soon as you walk out of the lobbythe pool had no shadeIf I came back for vacation instead of medical care I would not book this again on my own free will because I prefer more than what this hotel had to offer and I want a hotel close to the beach, BUT- for military stays like mine, short stays, business stays, etc. it is acceptable.

This is to acknowledge and appreciate the housekeeping department for their excellent service rendered during my three nights stay in the above hotel.The following had helped me stay in a comfortable,clean and feel like home at the hotel. Robert Gacula who gave a prompt service to my requests. Amalia, Madeline and Rosendo were housekeepers at that time who excellently cleaned efficiently and although they were trying to keep up deadlines they still manage to smile with all their friendly gestures.Thank you for such a wonderful stay at the hotel with you guys, for sure I will make it longer on my visit in town next time.I would highly recommend your hotel to my friends, relatives and even my fellow Canadians.Thank you. Evelyn

Yes there is highway noise not as awful as the review below! We your currently staying here for two months and every thing has been up to par. Ameila? I don't remember how to spell it. She is the sweetest room attendant 8th floor. Always willing to please. We unfortunately had to change floors to the 11th floor and we miss her! Food downstairs is a limited menu. (Need more healthy items) all you can eat crabs on Fridays are a hit there. If you can bypass all the strong military men to get them. Servers are also very friendly there. I would have to say the tables stay dirty for too long. (Laziness) pool is great.. Gym has only one working treadmill.

This is a review from the point of view of a military wife. Best Western is close to the airport, the joint base Pearl Harbor/Hickam, NEX, commissary, housing office, pretty much everything you need to go to upon arrival. While the hotel can benefit from a few makeovers, I would give my entire 60-day stay in the hotel a five-star. There is a military liaison named Les who went beyond his role in helping military families. He drove me to the pier to pick up my car from the mainland. And he had an assistant named Rebekah who was extremely wonderful! She picked me up at the airport and drove me around the first 2 days. I have 2 kids, one was 9mos. at that time, and she would watch them while e.g. I was talking to housing office staff or I was shopping at the commissary. I had to purchase and install car seats and she was very patient throughout the process. My housekeeper was named Madeline and she was very pleasant and would play peekaboo with my baby while she cleaned the room. She would also give me extra coffee and would make sure I had everything I needed. On some of her days off I had a housekeeper named Amelia and she was nice too. The girls at the front desk were very knowledgable about military TLA's. I'd like to mention Sharon who was pleasant and would chit chat with me. Oh, and the hotel gives out $10 meal voucher per person everyday. And they have signature crab leg buffet on Fridays. The staff at the restaurant was wonderful and I'd like to say thank you to Ramon, Gemma and Michael for making my meal times a pleasure! I remember these people's names because I stayed in the hotel for a long time (we bought a house in HI and had to wait for closing) and they made me feel that I have Ohana in Hawaii! Mahalo!

Starting with the positive - I only found one: a free airport shuttle.Huge list of negatives: old and run down, needs repairs, tacky, slow and unconcerned reception, way over priced, terrible restaurant, and most important ... the noise. I mean "the NOISE". You literally are on-top-of a very busy freeway and there are only a few rooms where the constant roar of the freeway is not heard. Skip this hotel and do ignore the "five star reviews" by clients whom only have 1 review. It is evident that someone is trying to stack the reviews and drown out the real (and often negative) reviewers.

Our stay at Best Western is an extended one! We moved here on assignment and we like it here!Any military who can't stay in lodging on an installation I recommend you stay here! It is TLA approved with extra perks like dinner vouchers!The location is convenient to the highway.The staff is helpful and friendly.Shoutout to Sonia!She is knowledgable about the area, friendly, and does her job with pride and care!

Hotel is located next to HNL International Airport. A quick overnight stay and a 3 to 5 min shuttle service pick up & drop off to inter-island or international airport. Great for travelers on the move or simply avoiding the nightlife from Waikiki & traffic hours.

We have been in this hotel for about three weeks now. We have just pcs'd here. The service is excellent! Our maid Fely is so sweet and does a great job! The hotel is in a great location. We get 40$ worth of food vouchers every day.Very military friendly!

Staff wasn't helpful, the rates were more than a star and a half warranted and parking wasn't user friendly. The noise from Nimitz highway and the interstate was annoying and the airport next door didn't help.

We are military and have been in the hotel for over a month now waiting for our Military housing. We have the greatest staff waiting on us. Sonia (the sweetest housekeeper EVER) keeps our room shinning and Michael (the best waiter in ALL times) always knows what we want for breakfast as soon as we sit down. Our family would highly recommend this facility to others. We have been in the military 19 years and have experienced our share of hotels. This one is at the top of the charts. We always feel like it's the staff that makes your stay and these 2 go above and beyond for us EVERYDAY. Makes it feel like home.

I heard lots of sounds from the freeway while sleeping and the parking lot is so small only meant for one way traffic. However, the made service was wonderful. Her name was amalia. She turned over my room very well and cleaned up after every mess.

We stayed at this hotel overnight in August 2014 while traveling to the Big Island. The shower head was covered in green mold and the bathroom had lots of dirt, grime and hairs in the corners and in the tub. Based off this visit we will never stay at a Best Western again. It was $189 and I would not pay $50 to stay there in the future. Awful experience.

If it wasn't for my husband getting this room FOR FREE I would write a scathing review.But like my mother always said, "If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all".And I don't want to seem ungrateful.

Not a bad hotel for its location. Was there working for the military and the hotel is a fair distance between Scofield Barracks and downtown. Didn't have any issues with my room, maid service, or customer service. Very nice people and helpful. The maid on my floor was Annie. She was always nice and helpful. Thank you, Annie!

Hotel is looking a bit tired and in need of an update but it was decent and clean for us on a stop over. Nice friendly staff and prompt free shuttle pick up from the airport. Very convenient if you need to be near the airport. Had a good convenience store, pool and on site restaurant. Would bump it up another star if not for the rather high price paid for a tired looking hotel.

We didn't want to stay here at the beginning based on the other reviews, but I've been satisfied so far. We've stayed in 2 other hotels in Waikiki... we had to leave b/c of unavailability. (we keep extending our stay b/c we're waiting for our household goods to come in from the mainland.) One hotel was great, but pretty expensive, and the other was much more expensive than this one (Best Western), but the quality was much less. I'd say if I had to do it over again, I'd stay here for the whole time.The location is both good (close to the interstate and convenient when trying to get to work early in the morning), and bad (not many restaurants close by and you can hear the traffic on the freeway all night). Our room was clean, the A/C worked!, the internet worked, but was slow. (those 3 are my top priorities at this point...) The washers were pretty expensive for a very small washer ($2.75 for a half size), but the dryers were better than average ($2.50) .. we put 3 loads of laundry in one dryer and all of our clothes came out dry 40 minutes later. So in the end it averaged out.the restaurant downstairs had friendly service, but the food was not that great. I don't eat at Denny's much (but the food was comparable to Denny's), but a cleaner atmosphere than Denny's. Parking was free for us (my roommate is PCSing here)... not sure if it is for everyone.., and she got a daily voucher for the restaurant.The pool was clean and nice, but again, you can't hear each other speak b/c the traffic from the freeway was loud.All in all, pretty good value! I'd stay here again if I move back to the mainland, or if I have to stay somewhere close to the airport for convenience sake, but may not stay here if I was wanting the touristy stuff and somewhere close to the beach.

the rooms are ok, the staff are very nice. there is nothing to see or do other than wait for your flight. the only good thing is the proximity to the airport. the downside is the price. i arrived at 3am or so and had to pay for 2 nights for which was a 24 hr stay. i understand they have to hold a room for me but to pay over 400 dollars total? if i was on the beach, downtown waikiki i would get it. but to be in an industrial park and pay these fees? Ive used this hotel for 20 years and the prices keep going up while hotels downtown have stayed the same. in sept i will be on the same trip again....too bad best western lost a long time customer.PS i had a review timed with my trip but its now gone. please don't delete them.

I will agree with others, the hotel is in need of repair, but what it lacks in maintenance, it more than makes up for in hospitality, we were greeted by the shuttle driver, who couldnt wait to share information with us about what to do while we are here, the staff in the dinning room knew us by the second day, and the maid service was top notch! thank you Amelia and Tedicha for the superb hospitality!

The location is kind of dreary when you're here for a while looking for a house, but it's near a few food places you can walk to which is nice, and its also near the airport which is also nice. The food here is pretty good, and the service is excellent. Not a bad hotel at all

We had a late check-in and were greeted with a smile. The room was simple, but very clean and had everything we needed. With the hotel right next to the airport, it was surprisingly quiet inside of room. There is a gift shop downstairs and a restaurant. We had vouchers for continental type breakfast and order an additional meal for our child. The food was fresh and just right (lots of fresh fruit). The shuttle to and from the airport was easy to catch and the service was good. Perfect "pit stop" before staying at a resort the rest of the time on the island. Would definitely stay there again for a one night stay.

This hotel needs a little work, some of the carpeting and other areas need some work. The positives are it is close to the airport, the hotel provides a shuttle to the airport and back. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The beds were comfortable.This hotel is not far from Pearl Harbor and the USS Arizona Memorial. It is a $20 cab ride. From this hotel it is a $40 cab ride to Waikiki.This hotel is good for an overnight stay, but if you are staying longer you may want to look elsewhere.

Only stayed here as we had an early flight and this place seemed the best of the limited options around the airport. It is an older hotel and everything was a bit dated, but the room was spacious, it was quiet and we had a comfortable night's sleep. There's nothing particularly wrong with this hotel and it was ok for an overnight stop, but I wouldn't want to stay there any longer.

Stayed one night. Hotel was near airport which we wanted. Shuttle was good. Everything about the hotel was satisfactory. Several restaurants available about a block to the right down the street. You can get breakfast, lunch or dinner. We had no trouble riding the bus to the hotel from downtown Honolulu.

The hotel, while older, was great. Right at the airport.. Room and bath were large and clean. We stayed only one night to see Pearl Harbor.. Breakfast was marvelous and wait staff were attentive. The restaurant also had a good menu for lunch and dinner. The dinner meal was above expectations. The variety of the meals was excellent. Waitresses explained the meal choices and were familiar with ingredients. Restaurant was plain but very clean and drew a large number of military families awaiting quarters in the area. A very utilitarian hotel with an attached garage that made parking easy and sheltered. Would recommend this hotel for families staying in Honolulu and needing a base of operations close to Pearl Harbor or Hickam Air Force Base. Easy access to the historic sites at Pearl Harbor,

I only spent one night in the hotel and did not experience too much of what the hotel had to offer. I arrived in the late afternoon and moved into a spacious room with comfortable beds. The room was clean and had all basic amenities. I did not use the fridge or the microwave, but it was good to know they were there. Since I had to leave very early morning I had to go to bed early too.What I noticed was that it was a hotel catering to the Government people; there were quite a few military personnel in their uniforms. The hotel did not have a bar or a restaurant, but I think there was breakfast in the morning from 6.30 or so, which I could not try because I left at 5 a.m. Unless you have your own transportation, there was not much to do around on foot. I went to a sports bar called Lisa, but it was not the place to enjoy a quiet drink. It was loud, and people were playing pool. The hotel was pretty basic; I could not even see a cart in the lobby to carry the luggage to the floors. It is possible something could have been arranged if I asked, but I was too tired to go to the desk and wait for it. I went to this hotel because it was paid for as I was on business. The hotel served my purpose for a short evening. I probably would go there again if it is paid for. Next time I will try to find out more things to do to spend the evening in the area around the hotel.

I am not sure about anyone else but when a place has the name Plaza in it, it invokes a certain expectation of what you will find, from the grandeur to the amenities etc. To be fair I booked this place in the blind via a recommendation from another hotel close by that had no vacancies, between this recommendation, a short amount of time I had to find another hotel and the fact it had the word Plaza in it convinced me to do this. Getting to the hotel to check in if you are in your own vehicle is a trick in itself. The reception area is only slightly larger than a postage stamp. It appears that Honolulu over the years has intruded little by little on this hotel and now it stands alone surrounded very closely by the highway and highway access road, the industrial area on its backside and the used car lot right next to its garage entrance. So I had to park like I owned the place feeling bad I had used up about a quarter of any reception parking area there was. The Reception area is also small, between that and the arrival area creating a somewhat claustrophobic feel. However the front area was quite nice, it has an updated modern feel with PC printer access, a brand new ATM and very unique furniture all very close together. The front staff were pleasant but in a we already know what you want we have don't this a million times sort of way. For example when checking out I asked clearly to have the room placed on my business credit card and the incidentals on my personal card as I am handing her my Personal Credit Card. She swiped my card and put the whole thing on it. When I asked about why this happened she stated that they did not swipe my business credit card upon check in, as if that had something to do with it. The hotel behind the Front counter area is mostly clean but very dated. You can see the wear and tear, from the elevator to the rug stains, to the pool and restaurant area. The restaurant has odd hours and is not even open some evenings, but invites the guest to hop on their shuttle and be taken to their "sister property" for dinner. The "snack, Gift shop" does not have to much either. If you end up having to go and get dinner there is no place within walking distance.The Room was again dated but clean, this is obviously due to the work of the very pleasant house cleaning staff. The bed was nice but actually a bit too soft. If you sleep near the edge you may experience a sensation of sleeping at a downward angle.(I only weight 165 pounds in case you were wondering). The Bathrooms are very small and the on demand system is unexpectedly difficult to navigate. However, it does offer movies that are still in theaters as well as poplular show catch up options The small things or the things you may expect are industry standard especially for a place that identifies itself with the word Plaza, are at least one step behind. For example the doors still have the Slide chain vs the bolt slide system for security and keeping your door open while you move things in and out. The rooms also do not have safes either key or Code. One thing they do have is extra plug ins and even a USB port built into the bureau, which was unique and useful. If you have Read in the hotel description that there is a fitness room?, there is a fitness room but I would call it a FRINO (fitness room in name only)The parking garage is attached to the building and you can access the elevator directly to your room from the garage area which was quite convenient although the elevators are old and can take a bit of time.If you are in need of a relatively inexpensive place to lay your head near the airport for a night, maybe this is the place for you. For those of you on extended stays for business or vacationing you may want to keep looking. I hope this is helpful and hope you enjoy your time in Hawaii whatever the reason, Mahalo

We booked this hotel because it was near the airport and had a shuttle. We had planned to return our vehicle the night before our flight but changed our minds once we realized how close and convenient the rental cars are to both the airport and the hotel. We kept our reservation at the hotel, though, and are glad we did.We reserved two rooms for our party and were given adjoining rooms. One was not ready when we checked in, but we were about 45 minutes early. That was no problem for us and the front desk called to let us know as soon as our second room was available. The lobby area is small.We had rooms on the 10th floor. The hallway smelled a little stale, but the rooms were fresh and clean. We did open the window (it will open 6-8 inches) to enjoy the breezes. There were adequate places to plug in our electronics.Our rooms were fully stocked with towels, toiletries, and coffee. There was also a refrigerator in each room.The parking garage is tight getting into the spaces on the lower levels, but P4 and up are easier to maneuver. There is an elevator from the parking garage that will take you up to your floor without having to go back to the lobby.We would recommend signage higher on the building as we were not sure it was the right place from a distance. Check-in parking has very limited space.The front desk staff (Sunday afternoon/evening) was pleasant and helpful with information and directions. There is a small gift shop with souvenirs and snacks, reasonably priced.There is a noon check out time which was nice for us as we had a mid-afternoon flight and could just relax in the morning.

Hotel was decent. We needed a pet friendly hotel. It was worth it for our furry kids. The bed was comfortable. It was clean for the most part, the floor was dusty and my feet were dirty so I just used slippers while inside. Again, pet friendly so that's all that matters.

I have stayed in alot of Hotels, here and in the mainland. But the front desk help at the Plaza Hotel off of N.Nimitz hwy. was Awesome!! Cherae and Mena made me feel sooo comfortable. As soon as I walked in... a greeting with a smile. They was happy to help in any way. I had some small issues...but no problem... THE ALOHA SPIRIT IS AT THE PLAZA HOTEL. Thank you again Cherae and Mena. Awesome SERVICE!!!!

I stay here because it is convenient to where I have to work. For that it is more than good enough. It is close to Airport for when I have to fly out to neighboring Islands and close to my customer base.

Best Western Plaza hotel is very affordable and close to everything. the staffs are very friendly specially the personnel in house keeping. I stayed in the hotel for 52 days. House keeping personnel keep my room clean and they always prompt and provide me all my request. Specially Ms. Amalia ulep and Madeline Juan. Thank you

I stayed here free for a 10 hour lay over, just enough to leave my bags for a while and shower. I did not get to sleep here. Rooms and Hotel overall looks dated. Needs some updating. Everything was functional though and I enjoyed the complimentary coffee in the room. On my own, I would probably not book here. But for free, not so bad deal. Staff was extremely helpful and I cannot say anything bad about them. Love love people from Hawaii.

Close to the airport with a 24 hour shuttle service. Next to car rental drop off which makes returning from a trip nice. Thought the place was going to be noisy with an elevated freeway next to it but, it was surprisingly quiet for the location. Parking in the structure is a little pricey if you have a vehicle. I recommend the hotel for a one nigh when getting in from the airport or the last night before you need to get to the airport.

Traffic noise doesn't bother us - we can sleep through anything, there is a constant flow of traffic on the freeway right outside but to me it just sounds like ocean waves and the air-con drowns out a lot of the noise. This hotel is really convenient because it's literally minutes away from the airport. The shuttle bus arrived promptly, check-in was fast, room was clean and very comfy, air con worked fine, free wi-fi and coffee maker in the room. Lovely hot shower, best eggs benedict I've ever had for breakfast, staff are friendly and very helpful.

Hotel is noisy (located adjacient to BUSY overpass). Decor is dated and worn. There's no elevator to 2nd story rooms in the building adjacient to pool. Hotel has a tower building which has elevators. No entry portico. The lobby small and uninviting. Beds are nice & clean, but the bath is dated. The staff tried hard to be pleasant, but the hotel needs a complete refurbishment. So they don't have much to work with. Rooms are priced relatively high, making them a comparatively poor value. On the plus side, this hotel is adequate. But suggest you first try the Ohana HNL Airport Hotel next door.

the main desk needs training on how to treat guests with enthusiasm. they were dry, unfriendly, uncaring, and not even a smile. an awful way to greet guests. being a desk person is not just a job... it's a perfect way to make a positive first impression, unfortunately... their unfriendly demeanor leaves travelers with a sour and negative feeling before the guest finds their room! what a bummer. PIE.... presentation IS everything... and here they fall very short.the facility itself is somewhat clean, but dated and tired. it serves its purpose but the experience here could be greatly improved by having the staff "try to be cordial".the hotel restaurant is very ho-hum. the food is fair, the staff is okay. the setting is dismal.the cleaning staff were very friendly... mainly speaking, amellia, helped with information about the local area.in short, the staff, front desk and the facility can't be rated stronger than a weak C. there is room for big improvement at this hotel.
