We choce to stay at this Airport location earlier this month as we had to catch an early morning flight.. Our sleep experience proved to be very disappointing because the Air Conditioning was marginaly functional and the room was extremely noisey being so close to the Airport.

I really don't like the hotel too much. I think the bathrooms have the weirdest smell! It's probably those little rugs they put in the bottom to keep you from falling. However, the housekeeper who was assigned to our room during our stay, Amalia, was a very sweet person. She introduced herself to me and told me she would be taking care of anything we needed and I really enjoyed speaking to her during the times that she came to our room. Whatever I asked of her, she did. I really appreciate that.

This hotel is located right next to the Honolulu Airport and would be ideal for someone who has to overnight in Honolulu with an early morning flight . The hotel offers a free shuttle so you can get to and from the airport in minutes. The rooms were reasonably nice, but clearly this is not a new hotel - but everything was clean, it was quiet and the price was quite reasonable. There is a restaurant connected to the hotel, but the prices were fairly high and no breakfast of any kind is offered at the hotel. They do have a small convenience store located next to the lobby, so it's easy enough to pick up snacks and personal items. The hotel is located directly on a pretty busy highway and there isn't much within walking distance. There are a couple of small plazas nearby with some fast-food options, though no name brand Macdonald's or Burger Kings within walking distance, nor did we see any moderate restaurants within walking distance. We had no problem with noise, our room faced the rear of the property on the airport side. There definitely was highway noise in the front of the building, but not a problem for us.

The Plaza Hotel in Honolulu is very convenient when you have an early flight in the morning to make sure you will not miss it. Otherwise, stay elsewhere because the airport area is far from enticing.The hotel is located on the highway exit leading to the airport, and their efficient 24-hour free shuttle service running every 30 minutes will bring you to your terminal in just a few minutes.Upon arrival, to avoid waiting too much at the airport, go to the ground level at the hotel shuttle stop, call the hotel, and they will come and pick you up immediately.Based on other reviews, in order to avoid the noise, I asked for a room facing the airport runway and on a high floor. My room (#1119) matched both criteria and was fairly quiet. I had a very good sleep. Quite contrary to my expectations, the room was clean and comfortable, it did not look tired at all. A/C was pretty silent. Many amenities are provided such as mini-fridge, microwave oven, free internet. A pool and a gym are also available, but I did not try them.Eating is more challenging. The hotel restaurant Plaza Café is only open for dinner from Friday to Monday. On alternate days, you can use the free shuttle to go to Airport Honolulu Hotel where Willoughby's Restaurant is open. I actually did not eat to either place, I walked a block from the hotel to 550 Paiea Street where a few cheaper dining options (fast food) are available.

My family arrived at the best western and even putting in a reservation in advanced my family of 6 got put in 1 room the day we checked in, but the next day they moved us to a double room with was much better. The hotel is very out dated and was very concern with having my twins and my toddler in a hotel room for days to come. The hotel is very close to the airport so we heard a lot of the planes landing and taking off. my overall stay was great! With me having infant twins, a toddler, and a 14 yrs old in a hotel room which we stayed on the 8th floor 822 and 823 Amalia Ulep in housekeeping made our stay very comfortable she always changed the bedding everyday and cleaned the bathroom, the room and always talked and laughed with the children. That was my concern with me having infants twins in a hotel room and how clean it will be, but she gave me a peace of mind and I was good.On her days off I would not get the same service sometimes my rooms didn't get cleaned and I would have to call downstairs for housekeeping service and when the other housekeepers who filled in for her come to the rooms they would say to me did you get your bedding changed yesterday and I said yes this lady told me that they are not allow to change the bedding everyday and I told her I have 2 infants and I need them to be changed and if there is a problem let me talk to a manager, but of course she went on ahead and changed the beddings. Its was a pleasure being on the 8th floor and having Amalia Ulep as a housekeeper. Thank you for being generous and your kindness is greatly appreciated.I would also like to thank James in the restaurant for being generous to my family and you are greatly appreciated.

The staff at the hotel were very friendly. The hotel location ex extremely convenient. The hotel provides free shuttle service and it was a very useful service. It was perfect for my transit flight arriving late in the evening and departing early in the morning.

Very dated and not well kept. Many items not working, lamps had burned out bulbs, shower very slippery even with bath mat. Large gaps in molding around tub. Counters worn out. TV system kept going off. Iron and board was very dirty.

Arrived at Best Westin The Plaza Hotel at 1.30am via their airport shuttle, which was located right outside the arrivals hall.Despite the early morning check in the lady at reception was very efficient and provided helpful information on our airport departure later that morning.Our room on the 11th floor was clean but very basic. Requested a fold out bed but this was not provided.The only downside of this hotel is its proximity to the highway. It is very noisy. The traffic noise does not let up.

Avoid top floors as A/C is weak and they bake! Crab leg dinner buffet on Friday is not to miss. Staff is super friendly - Alamo car rental is right down the street. Fridge and micro in the room! Driving there is a bit odd as they are off a highway and on a a one way street - just follow signs.

For closeness to airport, good selection. Would not stay beyond a nights sleep, in the industrial area, loud and the hotel is very dated. Was able to check in and out quickly. The booking process was easy.

We've stayed at this hotel several times this year. It's a great airport hotel to catch an early morning flight. The hotel provides an airport shuttle that runs every half an hour. This comes very handy for your travel. The only problem with this hotel, that it can get very noisy.. The building stands right by the very busy highway and windows are not noise proof. If your room located on highway side, you can pretty much forget about sleeping. But when you are staying in a pool side room, or the side where you are not facing this highway you are ok. You still can kind of hear it, but it's not disturbing and you can get a good night sleep.

Best Western offers exceptional service and location and for re-locating military families, traveling with pets, this hotel is very accommodating. The rooms need a little updating, however, for the value provided at Best Western our family would stay there again for our next move.

We stayed overnight on our way to Sydney, Australia and three weeks later overnight on the trip back to the Mainland. Mina, who works at the front desk, was very helpful with local knowledge of restaurants and public transportation. Our Best Western frequent visitor number was not able to be located by Mina on our first visit but she promised to investigate the issue. When we returned, true to her word, Mina had found the number and credited our stays. Mina is friendly, courteous and efficient, a valuable team team member who exhibits the "Aloha spirit".

I wanted a bed close to both the airport and the Pearl Harbor Memorial. The old Plaza Hotel recently made a part of the Best Western conglomerate got decent reviews and was relatively inexpensive. Coming in from Maui one morning we were picked up by the free airport shuttle. Front desk staff was efficient and friendly. The room on an upper floor was bigger than anticipated, was recently refurbished, and had a nice view down towards Honolulu. The front desk folks did a good job convincing us to use the local bus service at $2.50 pp instead of the $50 cab fare to go downtown and on to Waikiki. What a fun excursion. With all the stops along the way we got a pretty nice representative tour of the state capital and tourist corridor. On Waikiki Beach we watched young boys diving off the sea wall, beautiful bodies playing volleyball, and the sunset glistening onto Diamond Head. Walking around we checked out the photo ops from the public balconies of some high end hotels and found a delicious, inexpensive, all you can eat Hawaiian buffet with a mini luau show thrown in on the side. Then we picked up the bus right in front of the restaurant used our free transfer tickets and headed back to the hotel. The next morning we ate a hearty ala carte breakfast at the hotel, took a cab to Pearl Harbor where we spent a couple hours in somber reflection at the memorials and when the rains came we headed back to the hotel. Our flight was a red eye to Chicago that evening so we requested a late checkout. The upcharge was reasonable. All in all we were very pleased with our experience and felt we’d gotten more than we’d expected.

Not the best hotel I've ever stayed in, but the friendly staff made up for the outdated surroundings. Hotel needs to be renovated badly, and yes it is super close to the freeway and airport so expect some noise. It is not all that bad and will not keep you awake if trying to sleep. The free shuttle is a plus, but the resturant leaves much to be desired. On the flip side you are close to the local bus stops that can get you pretty much anywhere you want to go. Or you can walk a half block to some fast food restaurants.

The rooms were very outdated but at least they were clean. It is right next to a freeway and the airport but the noise wasn't as bad as I expected - we were still able to get some sleep. The heating/cooling system had a thermostat but I'm pretty sure it didn't control anything. The room was quite cold and we could not get any change in temperature. The air was also very dusty - probably could use some filter changes. Shuttle to/from airport was very convenient. On site restaurant had ok food, slow service and was expensive -- but hey, it's Honolulu -- nothing is cheap here!

The first 30 seconds were overwhelmingly DEPRESSING. A dark uninviting lobby in the middle of a total GHETTO area at the end of a runway at HNL International. Freeway right out the window, peeling film on windows. windows rattle. NOISE everywhere.. FREEWAY, AIRPORT. One of the ALL TIME most depressing hotel experience Ive ever had in my 40 years of traveling.

Don't expect a 5 Star hotel, it is just an excellent place to stay. The first positive is the shuttle from (& to) the airport. The second that it is on bus routes to Honolulu & Waikiki and also the Pearl Harbour complex. Also don't expect Haute Cuisine just good wholesome food and plenty of it. But I would recommend the Friday Buffet, especially the crab legs!! Then if there is a problem the GSMs will sort it out rapidly & efficiently. The staff are excellent throughout.

I stayed here one night before starting a week long cruise. Staff was very friendly and helpful, room was adequate but could use some updates. Bathroom very small and tub had many stains. There is a Starbucks and a couple of small restaurants within walking distance -- however not a great neighborhood and wouldn't walk it at night. Desk staff stored our luggage the next day when we toured Pearl Harbor which was very helpful. Taxis are always available out front.

Well located, good shuttle service with very nice drivers between the hotel and the airport. Quick registration, smiling welcome. Room spacious, clean. Furniture ok, bathroom ok. The main problem is access to food. restaurant is not open for lunch, and not open for diner except during the weekend. As a rule when I use an airport hotel, I am tired, already travelled during the day, not eaten during flight, and want to eat room service and sleep. I agree that we were directed toward a small shopping mall 10 minutes away to access some food, but fast food restaurants were few (after 21h00) and only accessible after a rather unpleasant walk, dark, noisy under highway overpass. If I was a single woman, I would be very concerned with my security. This for me is a big problem. Pool is nice but try to relax with the mind numbing traffic noise... It would really be a good airport hotel if catering services were improved. Wifi is included and works well.

The staff there are always pleasant and friendly, the rooms are nice, clean and large enough for families and they welcome pets too. Housekeeping staff "Fely" provided us with excellent service, her warm and friendly smile made us feel like home. Every Friday night is all you can eat Crab Buffet, yummy. The location and ammenities are more than what you would find at an very basic airport hotel. The noise level isn't as bad as you may think being nearby the airport. On a scale of 1 to 10, our family rate this a 10. Thank you BEST WESTERN The Plaza Hotel and "Les" for an awesome experience.

i arrived in honolulu to late to catch a flight to the island I reside on, So i checked in here because they have a shuttle to the airport that leaves every half hour.. I have stayed here before and have found the staff friendly, the rooms nice and clean and large.

Second time using this hotel as a stopover before flying onto Maui . Great hotel for this purpose as it provides frequent shuttle service to the airport which is five minutes away. Reasonably priced, clean, comfortable beds and standard restaurant for breakfast. Restaurant is not open for evening meals at the hotel but staff directed us to a Hawaiian BBQ place about a block away which had tasty quick food. Be warned that hotel is close to a busy freeway so there is noise.

We stayed here two different time in one vacation trip, booking two rooms each time. It was close to the airport when we were island hopping and again when we were leaving for the mainland. It is basically as advertised here on Trip Advisor, a very basic airport hotel, but really does not look the picture on Trip Advisor at all. There is a huge and high "double decker" highway out front, which was somewhat daunting when we arrived. So ask for a room towards the back. It is shaped in a T I believe. This is not a vacation destination hotel. Not even close. But it does the job as a basic airport hotel.  It does have an excellent service to and from the airport if that is what you are looking for. We used it four times in two stays and each and every time the driver was very helpful and accommodating. We were concerned as we were told it was first come first served when we arrived, but we never had an issue getting a seat on the shuttle. It does not run on demand, but runs on the half hour from the hotel. The rooms themselves, after seeing the outside, were a pleasant surprise, very spacious and somewhat updated. Large rooms with updated linens. Comfortable. One of our rooms, the first time, took a long time to cool down, but the drapes were open when we arrived and the sun was pouring in. The other room was cool on arrival and the drapes were drawn. (a note to the management to have housekeeping draw the drapes when doing the rooms)There is not much around for food, and the restaurant has very limited service hours. So eat before you arrive! We ordered take out pizza from Dominos once. Fast and easy.

We arrived after norm business hours with no reservation at their hotel. They got us into a room that night. The next day they accommodated our family needs by moving us into adjoining rooms. It is in an industrial area and you can hear traffic sometimes. Neither of these have been an issue for us. I walk to nearby local restaurants and star bucks almost daily. We have either breakfast or dinner here or at the sister hotel daily. It is true there is no lunch served at either site.They do have a great seafood buffet every Friday. There is a gift shop on site as well as laundry. The laundry is $2.75 washer $2.50 dryer.They have a pool. It's open daily from 9am to 7pm. We arrived 3/10 and will be here thru 4/20. I really like that we have Fely as our housekeeper. She does an amazing job in our rooms. She is friendly and never seems bothered by my questions about the area. There is also a super nice lady at the front desk, Mena is her name. She blessed me early in our stay by making up for a benefit I had somehow missed. She made phone calls and went above and beyond my expectations. If you're looking for a place to stay during a "pcs" move, I recommend coming here. Ask for Les Nishimura. He will take great care of you and your family.

Hotel is great for short layover, not a long stay, or if you want to tour the island or city. Good shuttle service to/from airport. Restaurant only open certain days, but a sister hotel nearby is open when they are not and shuttle will take you and pickup. I did eat breakfast there, it was good, price okay. Rooms are okay , staff not overly friendly, but get the job done. Gift shop has snacks and souvenirs, postcards and stamps. The pool is only open certain hours, but it looked fine, I did not go on. Next to freeway, so traffic noise til later at night. Nothing to do around there, but close to Pearl Harbor and Arizona, with bus service available near by.

The website pictures gives a false sense of niceness. While conveniently located near the airport, you are in an industrial area with no amenities nearby. The restaurant is only open for dinner Fri-Mon with no lunch service. Give this one a pass.

This hotel has mixed reviews but if you are looking for a great hotel to lay down your head that is conveniently located near this airport this is a good spot. The staff were friendly and helpful. I was a little concerned when I walked into the room about the noise from the freeway. I thought the window was open but realized quickly that it was closed and the noise from the freeway was quite loud still but I found that later that evening it had quieted down considerably due to diminishing traffic and I slept just fine. There are several small food placed to eat at within walking distance. Overall I was pleasantly surprised!

When the Plaza Hotel said it was at the airport they really meant it. The Plaza Hotel is practically on the runway, and next to the freeway and the car rental places. Tranquil island paradise it is not, but it was convenient. The rooms were clean, decent sized, and the staff was friendly. I tried to use the pool, but it was ice cold and the nice of the airport and freeway were deafening. I bought my ticket on Hotwire and I thought the price was decent (for Honolulu). My biggest complaint, and this may be a Hotwire problem not a problem with the Hotel, but when I booked my room it stated the parking was free, but when I got there I was charged a daily fee.

Room was clean and fairly basic. Staff was friendly enough if you asked questions. They do provide a luggage storage if you need somewhere to put your stuff for the day, which was really nice. The free 24-hour airport shuttle was a huge plus.

Small, old rooms. Bad elevators. Poor quality food and service. No food available most week evenings. No late food service available. Cafe staff did not know how to use Best Western travel cards. Not a good place to stay. Hotel shuttle service was good.

Very busy hotel located beside the Nimitz Freeway, one can hear the highway noise day and night. Older property, hallway carpets appear dirty, rooms large and in pretty good shape. Bathrooms need remodeling, very old. Heat did not work in my room, it was 65 degrees in the room, I put the heat to 90 degrees and finally three days later the room was 70 degrees which was okay. Hotel did not have portable heaters, did bring blankets though. I had some security concerns given that from the parking garage guests go into elevators directly to the rooms. The entrance to the parking garage was a pull ticket machine, I didn't see a security attendant. However, thankfully I did not see any security problems. This is a very high traffic hotel with lots of military personnel and families staying here.

The one positive comment I have is that the staff (front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping) and manager are extremely friendly.Now for the 'not so favorable' comments:I agree with mjmjmjmjmjmj in that this is an airport location and for that, you certainly compromise in many areas. 1) there is a restaurant on sight that has ok food, nothing fancy and certainly a premium price. 2) there is also an on-site 'convenience' store - extremely overpriced. 3) water temperature constantly changes from very cold to scalding hot for the duration of my extended stay thus far. I also spoke to other guests who are experiencing the same in their rooms as well as friends who stayed here previously. 4) fitness center access is limited due to the fitness center's proximity to guest rooms. I'm glad I did not get a room in that proximity! 5) upon arrival, we were attempting to use our very mini fridge and noticed a spoiled smell in it. We voiced our concern to the front desk but had to clean ourselves and hang a deodorizer to get rid of the smell. 6) there is a laundry facility on site as well at a per load cost of 5.25. 7) free parking garage with not enough spaces for all guests and VERY small spaces forcing many to park along the edges of the ramps causing a bad parking situation to be worse.

Warm and welcoming Shuttle Drivers, Front Desk is full of Aloha, Food is excellent in the restaurant, and the room product is good. It is an excellent hotel when you are flying in and out! The pool area is nice, and it is the associates that make the hotel what it is!! Do not bother going out for dinner as the food is delicious

ok this is an airport hotelit has no view and the rooms are just adequatebut they do have free shuttle back and forth to airport and decent place to eatbut DO OT expect this to be a pleasant expereince enjoying the beauty of Hawaiiit is what it is an airport notelNo view a rather bleak industrial type location and just below the h1 freewaynot much to do in the area if you have more time try book in town or Waikiki can be noisyif you just need a spot to rest til your next flight this may work

Ok for what it is. An older hotel in an older part of town. Price was a bit more than what I would have expected, but considering where you are, again, it is what it is. No nice breakfast included, but there is a cafe attached that had good food at a decent price. Small beds too, but guess they'd be hard pressed to fit 2 queens in the smaller rooms.

This is the end of our vacation and we were returning from the Big Island prior to a late Friday night departure for the mainland. I chose this to avoid both the $55 (2 people) downtown shuttle fees and the much more expensive hotelsThis hotel has a free 24 hour shuttle. It is accessed from the free phones in baggage claim area after you have retired your baggage. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport. The return shuttles happen every half hour on schedule. They do not require you to book a seat.Check in was easy, staff including the shuttle driver were very helpful. Local maps and directions were an added front desk bonus. This hotel is near an airport and the major highway of the state. Do not expect a quiet resort atmosphere. The cost of the rooms reflects this. That being said I found the noise not bad. The pool was fine and cooling and used by many. I think a room closer to the back of the hotel would be even quieter.I think this is an older property. That being said my room was clean and comfortable with a microwave and fridge. The furniture was newer and in good shape. The TV was a flat screen with both free and pay options. I feel Best Western has an expectation of quality for their properties and this property considering location meets that standard.I would stay here again.Randy S.

I have stayed in a lot of hotels, some good, some bad. This place is the worst I have been too. From the constant hum of the highway that rises above the hotel, to the stained and frayed carpets, to the bugs, this is not a place to stay. My room smelled like urine that had been covered up with air freshener. The only thing that this place has going for it is that it is close to the airport.Pro tip for the managers, replace the windows so they can be opened and the rooms aired out.

The Hotel served our needs - rooms were fine and not noising but the pool area and out front were on the very busy street and very noising from street traffic. Great food at the restaurant but a bit pricey

If you can find another hotel I would go to it instead, even if it cots more. The Parking spaces are ridiculously small even for a compact car and there are not enough spaces to accommodate all the guests. The water temperature in the shower would not stay at an exact or even close to same temperature. Internet is very slow and would kick me off repeatedly. The hotel is right next to a freeway, so expect lots of traffic noise all day and night. Staff is very nice and always say hello and ask if you need anything. Pool is well maintained and is 9' deep at one end. overall find a different hotel if possible.

We booked this hotel because of its proximity to the airport. It was at a good spot and shuttle service was good. Was very disappointed as we were put in an annexe at the back of the hotel on the second flow and no lifts. We had to drag our luggage up a flight of stairs that were hidden and we had tow all around the perimeter of the motel twice to find room was okay, clean and well appointed but very noisy. Not traffic noise as I expected but air conditioner noise fro. Other rooms. We just couldn't get any sleep and I would not stay there again.

This airport hotel is the most convenient hotel to Honolulu airport......probably the reason thatit survives given that its location is directly on 12 lanes of noisy freeway plus 8 airport lanes.....and has never upgraded its windows which are single pane.....the noise is endless and loud!!!!Not a good location to get good sleep.On the positive side.....there is good shuttle service to and from the airport. Staff were pleasant.The rooms are adequate, fairly updated though the bathroom while clean is not of the latest.Room rate at near $200 seemed high for what you get but you are paying for location. Parkingrate per night is $25. We ate breakfast there and the prices seemed high. Dinner ads in theelevator said Fri/Sat/Sun/Mon so it appears no dinner available on the other 3 week nights. Usedtheir Wi FI and it worked well. Used the bus service just in front of the hotel.....fairly frequent service going to Ala Moana shopping and Waikiki. If you're Medicare.....use your card and busfare is $1.

This hotel fit our need for about a 24 hour layover on our way to New Zealand. They do a good job of airport shuttle, friendly staff and basic needs. The key word is "basic". This fulfills your basic needs for a layover and is wonderfully convenient to the airport and nearby dining is walkable. Strongly recommend high floor overlooking Waikiki. Bus Stop is immediately across the street and extremely convenient for taking "The Bus" into Waikiki, a real cultural experience that is highly recommended! We then took a taxi back to the hotel.

My husband and I usually stay at the best western because their customer service is always excellent and they are friendly with pets. We decided to stay here for a few nights after our reservation expired at the Navy lodge while we were waiting for housing. The military liaison was very pleasant on the phone and so was the staff when we arrived. They let us park two cars in the garage for free. What I really did not like is the pet friendly rooms you have to stay in. I've stayed at other best western's right off I95 where you don't here the highway. Here, if you have a pet you can only stay in one of their courtyard rooms which are in a completely different building right off the highway. It feels very insecure especially if you are a woman staying alone. The doors face the highly trafficked main road and anyone can just walk up to your door from the street. At the back of the room you have a sliding glass door that faces the pool and the courtyard. This also has no security anyone can easily walk into the courtyard from the street. They don't even have a door to this area it's just open to the public. The locks are laughable, anybody can easily kick in the door. These rooms are so far removed from the main tower you feel like you checked into the motel 6. The worst part is the noise you hear from the main road and the H1 bridge which runs right over the hotel. If you are military with a pet and need a good place to sleep well, then this is not your place. You hear every single noise comig from the road. We weren't able to get any sleep and checked out after two nights. We needed a place to stay for four nights while our household goods were being moved. After the experience we decided it would be better to sleep on the floor of our new apartment instead of staying here. I understand that hotels have a designated number of pet friendly rooms but these are the worst I've ever stayed in.

One thing was that my husband sent a fax to me. but the front desk said it did not show up only the front page. but on the front page was here it showed that 4 pages came through. Maid di not dust the room at all and we had to ask for replace items like soap and shampoo.

We planned 2 nights in Honolulu before continuing to the Big Island. The Best Western was very convenient to the bus - which goes directly to Pearl Harbor in one direction and Waikiki Beach in the other direction (it's about an hour to Waikiki). The staff were very helpful and the internet was great. The hotel is set up for 24-hour operation, with people coming and going at all hours. The free shuttle to/from the airport was very convenient.

The Plaza Hotel is primarily used for Department of Defense personnel and their families for transiting in and out of the area along with peopel like myself who are their for buisness reasons. The hotel is in need of an upgrade to say the least. The garage parking leaves a lot to be desired with many customers parking illegal because of not enough parking spaces. Bathroom fixtures (shower/sinks) showing too much wear and tear. The person or persons who had the room before me must have grabbed tghe shower bar because it was actually pulled out of its holder.

I stayed here for a month while I transitioned from Massachusetts to Hawaii. It's close to the airport and freeways so it's good for business travelers. The hotel bends over backwards for military families. Great, friendly staff. Recommended. Yes, ask for a room away from the freeway and rent a compact! Here's an official review:http://www.infobarrel.com/Honolulu_Hotels_Review_Best_Western_on_Nimitz_Highway

Not the most luxuries place but I must say the friendly staff made my stay here very pleasant. Front Desk always very friendly and took care of our needs with a smile on their face every time. Now housekeeping can say I will miss Madeline. Very nice, hard working person who went above and beyond her duties to make sure we had clean everything daily. I am glad we had the opportunity to have had such wonderful people around during our stay. Thank you and if I ever have the opportunity would definitely stay here again. :)

Thanks to TripAdvisor I knew to ask for a room away from the highway! I had to get the manager to make that happen. Then on the back side you get to listen to the plane traffic at the airport. Hallways smell and the room was dirty. I specifically left crumbs on carpet, powder on counter, used towels around. Upon my return after housekeeping was there the crumbs, powder and used towels had not been touched - for days! Parking is another issue - $30 per day to park in the garage (there are no other options). Don't try to park a full sized vehicle there - it won't fit. Even a small vehicle has you holding your breath as you park. This facility appears to be temporary housing for military families. You will hear children crying and funning up and down hallways. There is no business center and if you need prints or faxing you have to have the front desk make and charge you for them.

The service at this hotel was great! We had a long stay while waiting for our housing. Our rooms were spacious and clean. The cleaning staff were very friendly and polite. One in particular was Annie, who always came to clean with a big smile on her face. She always went out of her way to accommodate our needs. On top of that, our rooms were always cleaned consistently with quality. The food service staff were also great, although some nights it got busy because of the new PCS people checking in, but other than that food was good. Parking could also get crazy when the hotel is booked. There's a nice pool, but its freezing to go into even though its 80s outside. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to stay in for its convenience, location, and great service.

The Best Western, The Plaza, Honolulu had TWO keynote features: 1) It was near the airport, with parking, and 2) was NOT in Waikiki.We were on an extended trip to various Hawaiian Islands, flying into Honolulu. I looked for a place reasonably close to airport, and planned a day's layover, in case the bags got "misdirected", and would there-after be hop-scotching behind us if we moved right on to the Big Island. The bags DIDN'T miss, but we used the lay-over day as planned and saw much of the island close in to Honolulu, but nowhere near Waikiki.This hotel is close to the airport and has excellent to/from shuttles to that facility. We rented a car, because I knew my way around Oahu, and planned to travel a bit on our "layover" day.What I had forgotten was that parking on Oahu involves parking spaces that are 24" narrower than on the Mainland. We managed, and the in/out daily fee at the BW was reasonable.(Note: after 8:00 pm, the slotted spaces will be gone, and you are going to park perpendicular on ALL levels, against the outside wall, or off the property).The rooms were clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The refrigerator worked well, so the bar items we had purchased, and cached, stayed cool/cold. The staff stays BUSY, account theconstant turnover. This is NOT a "seasonal" facility. It has a full occupancy rate account the many military families in transit to Oahu - awaiting in processing, and assignment to permanentquarters.It was obvious that they were NOT treated as a "burden" by the staff, but as honored guests. That raised my appreciation of the hotel by a QUANTUM degree!! The military occupants may predominate, but do not occupy ALL the rooms - and the in-transit tourists recieve the full range of attention as the longer-staying guests.Because we had a car, we MISSED that (semi-hidden) there is a full range of shops and services, restaurants, just a block away for just casual needs (and lighter meals). The hotel is within spitting distance of the airport, but the roads won't allow you to spit THAT far. Once you figure the layout, Honolulu/Chinatown (NOT Waikiki) is within easy driving distance, and Aiea/Pearl City with shops/restaurants/dining to the West is even closer. We booked a layover here to arrive, and then depart, a couple of weeks later. One of the wiser choices we made on a truly eventful and satisfying trip to "Hawaii-Nei". We reorganized all our luggage after arrival, and reduced our luggage by shipping all the excess clothes home by Postal Service - at the nearby USPS facilty - so we could carry all the Hawaiian Treasures home in SAME number of suitcases with which we arrived in Hawaii.Good value, excellant staff, ATTENTIVE security - an NO Waikiki congestion to deal with !!

Very good shuttle service to airport. Room was clean and comfortable and staff very pleasant. On site shop well supplied for essentials. Dinner menu needs a good vegetarian option but take out options were nearby. . Worked very well for overnight stay between flights.

This hotel is located right next door to the Honolulu International Airport. Great location to stay in if you are coming in on a late flight or leaving early in the morning. The rooms are extremely simple, but clean and comfortable. Rooms come with a complimentary breakfast, which consists of tropical fruit, eggs, toast, cereal and drinks. Very simple, but decent for a nice morning bite to eat. I was really unimpressed with the service provided by the front desk agents. Spoken down to when asked questions, and ver rudely served during both check in and check out. There is no other dining onsite, but the hotel is right next to a little take out place. We headed over there as we were starving when we arrived, but I wouldn't recommend it as it was kind of sketchy and seemed like a bit of a hangout for unsavoury types. Food wasn't that great either.

The biggest asset of this hotel is the convenience to the airport. We stayed here on our way in to Hawaii and then again for a night on our way out. As far as the rooms go, it's pretty average. They aren't a vacation or a resort hotel, and they aren't trying to be. It's clean, comfortable and relatively quiet. If you like to watch planes take off and land, we could do that from the window in our room, it's THAT close to the airport.This hotel is very convenient to Pearl Harbor, so we stayed here the night before we left Oahu and spent the next day at Pearl Harbor. Parking at this hotel is kind of a nightmare. They have a parking garage that is the first few floors of the hotel, so it's convenient that you can go right from your car to your room without changing elevators. But the parking spaces in the garage are so narrow, they will barely accommodate a mid-size car. The problem is, they are filled with big SUVs! They also are bordered by support columns, so you're either going to hit the car next to you, or you'll hit the support column on the other side. To make things a little more interesting, they also allow parking along the outer walls of the garage, so while you're trying not to hit the car next to you or the support column, you have to remember not to hit the car BEHIND you. Best to rent a compact car.I will say the price was a good value for Honolulu, which is an extremely expensive place to travel.

Best Western Plaza is okay but nothing special. Recognize that it does not have free parking and breakfast is in the restaurant. There are not many choices near the airport, and the hotel clearly takes advantage of that. Price has gone up substantially since last year when I stayed there.

Not a vacation hotel, especially for Oahu. Probably the only airport hotel. Old property but well maintain. Excellent for the night before flight situation. The property consists of a hotel tower and an adjacent 'motel' with swimming pool and dining hall. Very serviceable.

We stayed there last night Jan 2014. My reservation was oddly not there but they had a room and were very accommodating. Service was good all around. We had breakfast in their cafe and it was quite nice. Traffic was noisy but been close to the airport one has to expect that. It was clean, though aging. Typical hotel room. However for one night and then on to our amazing resort it was reasonable and met my expectations. Staff was pleasant!

Excellent room - very clean. Microwave and fridge were bonus. Very close to airport for our morning departure. Safe neighbourhood for walking in the evening. Shuttle service was excellent also. Did not use dining facilities as flight left early in the morning

We had to make last minute plans to Honolulu during the Holiday Season and this hotel was one of the few reasonably priced with any vacancies. The hotel is built in 2 sections, one low rise tower with about 5 floors including the front desk with parking and a 2 floor wing which goes around the pool. We in the 2 floor wing. The hotel is surrounded by a freeway off ramp and busy streets and it's difficult to get a quiet room. The first room we were shown was right on the street and was quite noisey so was asked to be moved. The second room was off the front street and a little quieter. Not sure how the low rise area is but it is farther from the off ramp. The staff was great and even handled our complaint in a freindly manner.

Greetings from the Keignars Family!It’s been a wonderful week since I arrived in Honolulu, Hawaii. Our shuttle took us directly to our hotel, Best Western, which was 10 min away from the airport, not close to the beach. This was because, back then, it was 10:00 pm and we did not want to transport all our stuff to the beach by taxi at this late.The word: ¨best¨ shouldn´t be on the Hotel name, because there is nothing of best on it.The hotel was a disaster; we even found some fleas on our bed which did not give a good start to our Hawaiian trip which we desired so much. Additionally, the beds were not as comfortable and one could hear the noise from the Highway. Fortunately, we only booked that hotel for the first night.Well, the hotel was big and the workers were friendly. No breakfast was included and one couldn’t feel just yet the breeze of Hawaii.The only advantage was that it was 7 min away from the airport. Just that.

We stayed here after a long flight from the mainland and continued our trip to the north shore. The hotel was clean and it served our purpose for a quick nights sleep before starting our vacation. However; do not expect quick service by there on call hotel shuttle. We waited almost an hour and with two little kids and a mass of luggage this was less than ideal. Dinner was okay but typical Hawaii it was overpriced for what it was. Staff were good but seemed burned out for some reason, probably due to tourists and who knows what else. The positive thing about this hotel is it is close to most of the rental car places so you can just simply walk over when you need to rent a car.

We just want to bring attention to one of your best housekeepers by the name of Amalia. Very pleasant, courteous, hard worker. She would always pay attention to our needs with her warm smile and services. Our stay has been enjoyable and we will definitely come back here sometime in the future.Thank you Best Western and all staff for everything!!

Friendly staff, clean, comfortable rooms. We received clear directions and assistance in locating shopping, etc. and the maid service and font desk service were really great. The restaurant was convenient and the service was provided by prompt, friendly waitresses.

Our's was an extended stay, 87 days while our home was being rewired / renovated overlooking Pearl Harbor, so we had ample time to observe staff. As I want to honor and be respectful here are the names I made a point to record and remember for this purpose; Front Desk and Customer Service Managers All EXCELLENT !!! Cheri Bolos - Reservations - instrumental in "selling" the hotel / choosing best room for us Gene Otsu - Customer Service Manager Lance Gurtiza -Customer Service Manager Cherae Moeai - Front desk Mena Betham - Front Desk Harold - bell man Chris - shuttle driver Housekeeping; Soledad Jacinto Isidro - excellent housekeeper Mercy Bayuga - excellent housekeeper Annie Pasion - excellent housekeeper Robert Gacula - supv Macrina Quilana - supv Cafe staff; James Shaver - experienced kind personable server Liz Costa - experienced kind personable server /shuttle driver Jade Orlando - - experienced kind personable cashier /server Overall genuine "Aloha" and professionalism exhibited on all staff levels. Like any business some employees and staff shine brighter than others! We are from Hawaii with college education, I own a small business and my husband is in marketing and sales.

This hotel is situated close to Honolulu Airport and adjacent to the main highway. There is therefore noise but the convenient position particularly for the business traveller outweighs this. This is not a hotel for the leisure traveller looking for a beach holiday. The rooms are of a good standard, good wifi, good beds and pillows. There is underground parking and a good outdoor pool area. Get a ground floor room adjacent to the pool, as waiting for lifts in the high rise part can be frustrating. The restaurant has good quality food but is very busy with families as this hotel is used by the military for overnight stays. Try and eat at off peak times. If you have a car and want to tour the island this can be a good choice away from downtown Honolulu

We stayed on a lay over on our way to a Seoul. The hotel is very close to the airport & there was a shuttle. That was the only good thing about it. The location is terrible. There is nothing but a freeway near but. In fact, the freeway is right on top if it! There is no where to eat near by. The place was run down and it was not inexpensive.

The only positives are price, location near the airport and a friendly staff. Also the shuttle is very clean and the drivers prompt and friendly (call for pickup at the courtesy phone in baggage claim). To bad ownership isn't giving these people someplace better to support. Bad because...- the halls stank, Really, really bad. Very musty...or something,- the restaurant closes at 9pm and the convenience store at 9:30pm and then you are a long way from any food (at least Pizza Hut delivers - as the desk for a menu and number).- the rooms are old and only fair for cleanliness (thankfully the bedding at least was clean).- the thermostat is almost non-functional. Ours you had to remove the faceplate on and work the innards manually. The slide lever to set temp was broken.- rooms are tiny. The bathroom ridiculously so .- the elevator shuddered and groaned like a haunted house. Not comforting.- windows do not seal well. You will hear the wind whistle and you will hear traffic.Would not recommend and will just stay in town next time and give up 15-20 minutes of convenience. The loss in comfort not at all worth the convenience and puts a damper on the end of any Hawaii vacation.

Hospitality is a talent, the younger staff at the hotel do not have it. They are lazy and indifferent. If they have to do anything its like they are being tortured by cruel mainlander....The older staff were very helpful and kind.

Clean and very friendly staff. Fast airport shuttle. Rooms are clean but had little issues, the handle to sink faucet popped off, the joined room door wouldn't latch. If room faces sunrise definitely make sure the blackout curtains are closed tight that sun is intense. We arrived at 8pm and was disappointed that the pool closes at 7pm, kids were on a plane for 6 hrs and needed to release some energy.

Sorry this is long; I was here a long time. Good: Breakfast platters. Front staff. Central location for visiting the island. Proximity to Navy Exchange, car rentals and airport. Easy and quick to-from travel to Tripler. Warm water and pressure.Bad: Dinner buffet. Maid service. Hotel-to-beach access (none).Ugly: The concrete. The homeless along Nimitz Hwy. The sulfur-iron tint to the water. Smash-&-grab theives (more below...)First off, you need to know that I was on a TDY for 45 days training for the US military, so I was busy most of my time here and mostly just slept, studied, and ate in my room at night after getting back from our unit doing afternoon physical training. You also should know that I was here for 28 days after staying at Navy Lodge, Ford Island. I was busy most of the time but I had most of my weekends free. So my experiences may not be comparable to yours. That having been said, ... My initial impression was positive due to the helpful front-desk staff. My room itself was average for Best Western level hotels. It does have a microwave and small fridge with a built in freezer box at the top inside the fridge, so you can do a microwave cook style while there. Regarding eating, I bought the seafood buffet my first night. It wasn't bad, but it was only average at best in quality, so I felt it was overpriced. My room smelled of carpet shampoo, as if they were trying to remove the smell of smoke. The hallways and carpet seemed a little dingy, but if you spend enough time on Oahu you'll realize this is just what happens with time on an island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. This is a 'smoke-free' hotel, though I do not believe it always has been. There is a smoking area on the 5th floor parking level. There is a pool, but not many people used it (We are surrounded by beaches and the ocean -- why are you at a pool? ...just saying). Loved taking a hot soaking bath most days in the tub. The water definitely had a sulphur-iron scent to it, but we are on a volcanic island afterall. Security is good for parking your car here, especially important on this island where window smash-and-grabs are VERY COMMON. Your parking ticket will be validated and become your parking pass if you are staying. Cost was average for Honolulu inflation of everything, though if I spent $110 a night for this hotel stateside I would be unlikely to visit again. It is only 20 min from the craziness of Waikiki along H1 even with people slowing down before Likelike Hwy for no reason every day. Very close to the main NEX (best of the exchanges by far in my opinion), with a strip mall style eateries close with all the chains (McD, PizzaHut, etc) and several local ones. Excellent location for TAMC commute, though IHG across the street is better location (though rooms much more run-down). Great central location for seeing the sites of Oahu, including Pearl Harbor. Easy access to Nimitz Hwy and H1 (main interstate E-W of the island) which takes you to H2 to the north shore and H3 to the NW shore. If you have a valid CAC/ID, the main NEX is less than 5 min away. Pearl Harbor is 5-10 min away. Ford Island is 10 min away, and a great place to go running.My complaints are that there are too many drug-addicts/homeless along the Nimitz Hwy close to the hotel. The area is also quite industrial in nature, and does not feel as if you are in a vacation area. If you want this atmosphere for your time here, this is not a good place to stay. There are lots of hotels in downtown Waikiki that would serve better for this purpose. No idea on cost, though, and traffic in that area is terrible. Careful with leaving your car unattended. If you are visiting then you have a rental, and all rentals have a sticker that thieves will see and recognize as a rental car. Leave nothing in your car when you are not there, and pay for the included insurance for the rental car. There are lots of stupid drivers and people who may cause you to wish you had paid for the protection. Also buy your protection from the rental company itself, not from some third party or included deal from say Expedia or Hotwire. I didn't get burned, but people I know did.

It was the first and also the last time we stay at Best Western Plaze. It was old, the roon is not clean and the housekeeper don't clean the room well unless you tip them to do the better job. The location is far away to the beach or shopping center. There isno shuttle but city bus can take you to the beach or mall.

My thanks to Mena and the reception desk stall for their help while I stayed for a return trip to Honolulu. Their friendly service was enjoyable to experience returning to the Islands for a short vacation trip.

We had en early flight out of Honolulu airport and wanted a hotel close by so we didn't have to get up as early. This hotel was a lot better than what we thought it would be. Rooms are big and clean. Great value for money with free shuttle to airport in the morning. Would stay here again if needed something close to the airport.

We arrived at 4pm via the airport shuttle (friendly and prompt) to find a long line for check in. When it was our turn the service was anything but welcoming and more assembly line-ish. They were doing maintenance on the one elevator (at check in) so we waited quite a while to take our turn. Upon arrival to the 12th floor I immediately wanted to turn around and go back but my husband said it was just a place to lay our head. The hallway should have been my first sign, it was disgusting. Our room was outdated, water dripped from the bathroom faucet all night long. Not to mention sleeping in a full size bed was not what I wanted the last night of our honeymoon. We went downstairs inquiring about transportation and were ignored by the young lady working. We waited in line another 20 minutes to ask where the bus stop was. Checked our bags the next morning and went to explore Pearl Harbor. Upon arrival back at the hotel, we asked the same young lady where are bags were and she replied, "bell hop, NOT front desk" there was no one at the bell hop desk which is right in front of the check in area... The only pleasant thing about this hotel was the shuttle service, both drivers were so friendly and kind. I can not believe what they charge to stay here! Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else!

We stayed for three nights. Service was very good from the time we got picked up by their free shuttle. Check in was easy and efficient. We were in the building furtherest from the reception but closest to the street. The hotel is next to a highway running overhead so noise levels were not good for a restful sleep. Facilities were good and wifi worked well. The AC unit worked ok but was pretty noisy so needed to be off for the night. The hotel is next to the car rental yards so that could be good. But it's a long way to find a meal in the late evening after 9 pm. Bus stop is right by the front door and it cost $2 into downtown or Waikiki.

Clean, but very dated hotel and certainly not worth the price charged. But, it is about the only hotel close to the airport, so they have a captive market. Why they don't moderize the hotel is understandable given that they have a cash cow going, but the hotel experience is not worth the cost. Only stay for 1 night if you need a hotel close to the airport. When we checked in, a family of 4 was checking in for 4 nights. Why anyone would stay for 4 nights in the low quality hotel when better hotels costing the same are available in town in surprising.

A very convenient location and short drive to the airport. Perfect if you are only staying for a day or so. Hotel is a bit dated and hallways/carpets are dirty and need cleaning. Rooms are very old with no real modern touches. But overall a nice stay for one night.

While this hotel is unremarkable, it was just what we needed...clean, convenient, courteous staff. We arrived late afternoon and the front desk suggested Nico's at Pier 38 for dinner...which was a wonderful place. It's a bit of a drive, but we had a car and there really wasn't anything closer.Our purpose in staying here was to get to Pearl Harbor early in the morning so we could spend the entire day there... which we were easily able to do. (Note: A visit to the USS Arizona is free, but tickets are timed. There were 120 people in line when we got there at 6:45 am, and they opened at 7 am. Our tickets were for 8 am so we enjoyed the Visitors Center for a while, and then returned to finish looking at the excellent exhibits after visiting the Arizona. We also paid the extra for the USS Missouri and Bowfin, but ran out of time for the Bowfin. If you like history at all, plan to spend the full day here.) ...and the Best Western is perfectly located to do this.

this hotel is close to the airport, reasonably priced and was chosen because -- offered free wifi, close to bus stop (literally across a small street), complimentary airport shuttle, microwave/fridge in room. we were stopping over before taking a cruise.as with most bw, it is located away from city centre and in an industrial area and close to the airport. it does have a small store, restaurant and pool in the hotel.a big surprise was -- there was a small strip mall within 3 blocks with eateries, jambo juice store and starbucks. we experienced the L&L hawaiian bbq and it was a nice surprise -- reasonable price and adequate serving size.if the hotel provided a complimentary breakfast (as some bw do), it would be an excellent hotel to stay at.bus ride into waikiki is only $ 2.50 but it does take 45 min to 1 1/4 hr depending on traffic, so if you are opposed to spending time on the bus, this would not be a good choice. along this bus route, you can stop off for costco, walmart, ala moana shopping centre, aloha tower and other tourist attractions. one of the busses (19 or 20 or 42?) will end at kapiolani park where you can transfer to a bus to go to diamond head or you can walk to diamond head from kapiolani park (took us about 30 min)staff is friendly and helpful.

We were two adults, a teenager and a 10 year old, arriving around 1 am just needing a place to rest for our morning flight.The shuttle arrived promptly after I called--no confusion at all. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient, both at check-in and check-out. Room was fine for a night, and we all had a decent sleep. Good beds. Clean room.The only downside for a one night stay would be the fact that there are no late night restaurants in the hotel or in the vicinity. But I think that is true of all the HNL airport hotels.

The proximity to the highway, and the wear and tear on the furniture had me very worried at check in, but I worried unnecessarily. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, and the staff pleasant and helpful. The highway was noisy, but more of a constant din that drowned out voices and slamming doors, which are very disturbing in some hotels.The restaurant servers Michael and Sharon were helpful to my son and me in negotiating gluten free options. Cecilia at the front desk gave us excellent instructions on how to make the most of our last day (9pm flight) and checked our bags for us.

After a long day of travel, we were more than ready to relax. Registration was completed quickly and efficiently and we were soon on our way to our room. What a pleasant surprise! The room was big with beautiful views of the city. The bed was a king with just the right amount of covers. We checked out the cafe for breakfast and our waitress certainly got our day started right. She was very helpful with directions and our food arrived promptly. It is the perfect spot to stay if you need to catch a flight the next day. Even the price is reasonable.

This hotel is within two miles of the airport and right on the Nimitz Highway. It is two blocks away from many car rental sites. We found the room to be clean, quiet and one we would return to. The parking charge of $25.00 a night is probably typical of hotels in Honolulu although the price is not listed on their website. The bathroom was clean but small. The double beds were very comfortable although we were somewhat chilly during the night. An extra blanket would have helped. They do serve meals for a price which we did not purchase mostly because we were gone from dawn till dusk.

Lorenzo, the shuttle driver threw our luggage out the door, which happened to be my carry on. In that suitcase, was my DAUGHTER'S REMAINS and her belongings, death certificates, cards and many other items that are irreplaceable. She passed away just four months ago and I just began to leave the house again, but now it's as if she passed away all over again. It's devastating the disregard Lorenzo showed for our belongings and the fact that I was bawling as he continued to toss our luggage off of the bus.

Great hotel for stay over for your next fligh and/or get away. Clean, friendly, and uncomplicated. Nice pool and gym. Staff is the best. The food in the restaurant is Comfort Food, and with a wide variety. Great Shuttle Service to and from the Honolulu Airport, and the Shutte Drivers make you feel welcomed immediately

I booked this hotel because it was near the airport. And it definitely was- a little to close. No sight seeing here- mostly a warehouse district. The hotel itself is dated but was clean and had the basic necessities. Most of the staff were helpful. There is a restaurant on site but it was overpriced for the food served. There were some small delis- like Subway- in walking distance. The hotel is a $30 cab ride from Waikiki and sightseeing. The hotel is ok for an overnight stay near the airport.

I am a Federal employee who needed a place to stay prior to permanently leaving the islands for a job transfer to the Mainland. The Plaza was convenient because it is close to the airport and the main post office rather than being located where most Oahu hotels are, over near Waikiki. It was also reasonably close to the area I was moving from in Pearl City. With the Government rate, it was affordable, although the parking fee was pretty steep. The parking lot is pretty difficult to maneuver around, even in a small car. There were a lot of huge pickup trucks taking up multiple parking spots, which made it very hard to find parking at times. The smoking area is outside on the top level of the parking garage and if you have to park near there, your car will smell as though someone has been smoking inside the car. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful. There are no luggage carts; you have to use bellhop services and tip them. I found this quite frustrating since I had to make multiple trips to the post office to send off items I did not want to have moved as part of my relocation. My room was as far from the elevators as possible, which is great for peace and quiet, but awful for carrying things to and from the car. The hotel is very old and needs a lot of renovation and modernization. The carpets in the hallways are old and outdated, and much of the room furnishings are the same way. The room had everything I required; a computer desk, free internet, a very comfortable bed, a nice shower and bathroom. There was a nice-sized television and cable, as well as movies on demand. Because of the location of the hotel and the traqffic pattern in that area of town, to go 'west' towards the airport or post office required pulling onto Nimitz Highway eastbound (toward town), driving a half-mile or so and making a U-turn to head back toward Pearl Harbor, the airport and the post office. This is easier said than done during much of the day.Overall, the hotel was adequate for my needs and is a far better value than paying hundreds of dollars to stay in Waikiki. But I would not want to stay here for more than a few days due to the lack of amenities and the noise in the area.

Excellent price and accomodations for exploring Oahu. This hotel is perfect for striking out and seeing Oahu with its central location and ease of access to Pearl Harbor, Waikiki, and all roads west, east and north. Get a Diamond Head view for a better sunrise. You are not supposed to be in a hotel anyway when in HI but when you get back after adventuring you'll sleep well.

We found Best Western The Plaza from reading these reviews and decided to book this hotel for the one night before we get our beach cottage on North Shore. We are so happy that The Plaza is close to the airport.We do have a couple of questions and hopefully someone will be able to answer them for us.We noticed that Airport Trade Center has a lot of places to eat, so we was wondering how easy of a walk it is from the hotel?Also, was wondering if there is a pub/bar close by? After getting a bite to eat, we would like to have a few drinks before going back to our room?Looking forward to our trip!!

Basically, this is a decent and safe hotel on Nimitz Hwy outside of Honolulu right next to the airport; you could walk there if you so desired. Location is good. Great access to Pearl Harbor Historic Sites, H1 (main east-west on Oahu), H2 (Northshore, Dole plantation, Shoefiled Barracks), and 15 min to Waikiki (due to traffic, not distance). If you have a valid armed services ID the main NEX (Navy Exchange) is just a U-turn and few blocks west on Nimitz. If you don't have a CAC or the like, it still has lots of fast-food places nearby (JackInTheBox, PizzaHut, TacoBell, McDs, PandaExpress, JavaJuice, and a whole lot of local BBQ and a breakfast places) that anyone can access and use. The variety, familiarity, and almost normal prices are nice if you need to get something you are used to. If you want beachfront sights this is not the place. It is on a calm main road (Nimitz Hwy) before it gets crazy in the downtown area. The traffic is loud but constant, so you don't notice it too much. Rooms are clean and they only forgot to replace my shampoo/soap once the entire 21 days I was there. Breakfast is great (ask for a 10$ voucher at check-in). This gets you a nice breakfast for about $5 after the voucher. Please be aware that on Hawaii generally there are no freebies, so a nice sit-down breakfast for ~$5 was nice; runs from 630 to 10 am. Price for me was decent. Parking is safe and included in your stay, both of which are important in Hawaii. I stayed here for a prolonged business trip to the area. Did have a chance to see some sights, but most of the time was at my work-place. I was on the 9th floor. A few things bothered me, but maybe not too much for others: Hallway smelled of carpet shampoo, which for some is 'clean' but for me was a bit unpleasant, so I bought a 99cent air freshener which worked for the entire several weeks I was there. The water had a sulfur smell to it, but I drank it and am doing fine, and the hot water and pressure are GREAT (take a hot bath after a long day on your feet at work was WONDERFUL). I would like to come back to Hawaii with family for a vacation. Don't know how much other places cost, but traffic in Waikiki and the main downtown of Honolulu is ridiculous, especially the stopping on the interstate for nothing (not too many cars, no construction, just people up ahead stopping for no reason and it trickling back to the rest of us), so I really enjoyed the fairly clear roadway next to the Best Western (Nimitz Hwy). If you are vacationing and want beachfront, try somewhere else, but be advised the traffic may drive you fruity.

Great location, but old hotel, easy access to Airport and Navy Base and Shipyard or AFB Hickam. Standard Hawaii TV channel, no free breakfast, but there is a convenient store in lobby. Overyall rate from my is very good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, goodv, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good, good

There are two sections to the hotel, a two story motel connected to a 12 story hotel both dated. Staff were friendly and helpful enough. I was in room 804 and it was right next to a very loud busy triple overpass freeway close enough to my window had the windows opened I could nearly touch the passing cars - but I had ear plugs and slept just fine. You might want to ask for a quite room when you arrive, maybe they save the louder rooms for those who don't ask like me haha The room had two double beds, was clean enough for my standards with a small bar fridge, microwave, coffee machine, tv, wifi, and desk. The room was chilly with an over draft, the thermostat did not seem to work but I wore a sweater and kept warm. The elevators are painfully slow, if you like to knit bring your needles and you will have time to knit sweater in between waiting for the lift...then use it to stay warm in the room 804. The free airport shuttle is very handy, however I had to wait 30 minutes after arriving at the airport so be prepared to wait.There is an onsite restaurant and snack bar - there is also fast food, pizza sushi bars etc within 5-10 minutes walk from the motel. You can either walk out the front door left and turn left on the next main road, or walk right and turn right on the next main road.

Our first visit to Hawaii we were comfortable here the hotel is a little dated. Although not close to anything, we did rent a car and since it's not in the hub of the island, it was a more homey feel. We stayed 6 days and the staff were very hospitable and helpful. The restaurant in the lobby was a good meal every time and again the staff were very relaxed; at no time did we feel we were a bother to them and felt like part of the family.

Our first visit to Hawaii brought us in late to Honolulu. This Hotel is just in the edge of the Airport. Just a 5 minute shuttle ride(free). A warm and friendly aloha was said to us when we walked into the front door. The staff was always willing to answer our many questions. Got our room keys and went to our room. Get your snacks before you go up as there are no pop machines on the floors. Had a corner suite on the 11th floor over looking the airport, the ocean and downtown. In the morning we had a great breakfast in their restaurant, got a shuttle and went on to our next adventure at Wakiki Beach.

The good, close to the airport. Doesn't outweigh the bad. Right next to the freeway with single pane windows-loud! Do NOT pay extra for your room to include breakfast! You get toast and a cup of fruit. Room was not real clean either.

Conveniently very close to the Airport but quite far from CBD and Waikiki Beach. Welcoming and professional staff. Also,spacious rooms with relevant equipments and furniture. Good ratio quality/price.

After island hopping or upon arrival, this hotel was perfect for being close to airport, free shuttle service, great restaurant, nice general store, excellent business center, beautiful decor and a fabulous bed.

This hotel is a good hotel if you don't want to stay in the Waikiki area. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful, room are clean. Noise from freeway is kind of loud if you are a light sleeper, the hotel is right next to it. I would stay here in the future.

The room was OK, large and clean. But you should stay here only if you're going to or from the airport. I booked for a few days but I hadn't realized it was so far from everything! And it's terribly noisy, right under the flight paths. And no free breakfast like in most Best Western. From the number of military people I saw there I guess the hotel has a special deal for people moving between the airport and the various bases. The bus service is good in Honolulu - from the airport to Waikiki Beach is about an hour by bus - so, in most cases you can probably avoid the Plaza.

After spending two weeks in Hawaii, one week in Honolulu and the other in Maui our final flight back to Phoenix was a red eye the following day. Not wanting to deal with Honolulu again we opted to stay close to the airport. The Best Western Plaza was our choice. Having read many reviews on Trip Advisior I was somewhat skeptical about staying there. While checking in and finding our rooms were facing the pool, ( my request ) and having no elevator service , I decided to look for other options. I was not wanting to deal with having to carry 4 bags up the steps.I went back to the lobby to ask the agent if other rooms were available. The reviews I read did not reveal pool side rooms had no elevator service.  After switching some things around the manager found us a room on the 11th floor facing the airport. He upgraded our original king request to a king suite. A corner room, I need to say no more. The room was great, we didn't have any noise issues facing the airport. Our night there was pleasant and quite comfortable. They do have a restaurant which is just OK. The seafood buffet that was available was nothing to rave about and the price was high. At $ 30 per person for average food and mediocre presentation the buffet was very easy to pass up. They did recommend a sports bar two blocks away called Lucy's Place. A short safe walk and we were there. It's nothing to look at and it's definitely a LOCAL'S bar. The bar food and staff were very pleasant. We had a great time while there watching Hawaii State Football.

Close to airport with shuttle service but room was average quality, expensive and with no breakfast, which was offered in their cafe at stupidly high prices. We ate the same breakfast close by at 1/3 the cost. IMO, it was an OK experience but a poor value.

I have stayed at the Best Western at Honolulu Airport periodically for years and the room this time was infested with little bugs in the bathroom and bedroom area. I arrived close to midnight and was leaving on a flight early in the morning so I could not change hotels. I reported to the front desk at checkout and she took off the parking.

This hotel has one redeeming value. That is that is located within walking distance to the Honolulu international airport.It is alone and has a monopoly position.Beyond that it is an aging property with 1970's decor and ambience.The rooms are noisy, the furniture beaten up and the hotel is located a stones throw from a 6 lane highway.Relatively inexpensive you better have a car, as there is no shopping nor dining within 5 miles.

We stayed one night before an early flight out of honolulu. We arrived from kauai and our flight out of honolulu was early the following day. You have to use the courtesy phone near the carousel at the airport to request the shuttle and it arrived within 10 mins. We got at the hotel about 14.00 and the hotel checked us in straight away. A quick swim in the swimming pool and then we caught a bus into waikiki, the bus stop is very close. The hotel is fine for an overnight stay. The shuttle back to the airport leaves the hotel every 30 mins. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if i had an early flight.

The hotel staff was very accommodating and nice. The rooms were clean, and larger than most in its price range for Hawaii. Furniture still seemed a bit dated. Overall good stay, and my family was satisfied.

Arrived very late into HNL. The Best Western was a great place to spend a quick night. Very clean and comfortable. The front desk was very helpful. They provided great information about The Bus so we could go to the Swap Meet at Aloha Stadium (worth the visit!). Also, a Starbucks and Jamba Juice about a block away - good to know in the morning.

We arrived at midnight and left at 5am, so not long enough to enjoy all the hotel has to offer, but for what we needed, a reliable shuttle from the airport, then a reliable shuttle return to the airport, and a clean bed for the night, it was perfect. The service was great, van driver was awesome.

We had a very pleasant stay in The Plaza BW in Honolulu. It was easy to find and was a great landmark for our travels in HI. The room was clean and comfortable and quiet (located on the 12th floor). The parking garage is assessable from the hotel (elevator) which made in and out trips very easy. Breakfast was ok, but we added eggs at $3 each (remember this is HI) We would stay at this BW again.

Amazing employees and they are willing to help anytime. Clean rooms, amazing wifi it's free. Amazing views. Looking forward to have more vacation trips to Hawaii and stay with the best western hotel plaza again :) it's awesome. Keep the good work and you will be rewarded and more amazing feed back will always follow.

Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Only stayed one night on our way home from Australia. 24 hr airport to hotel & return service was very nice. It was $35.00 one way cab ride to down town Honolulu.

The location is perfect for a quick get away, especially for us since we have booked for tours that picks us up early and drops us off late so technically, we just sleep in the hotel. The beds were very comfortable and we had an early check in thank you to the nice front desk agent who greeted us happy anniversary too.. However, the bath mats were dirty, you could see shoe marks there from previous guests, the shower curtains were moldy and there was a spot in there that i would rather not say what i think it is, the bath tub were painted white and there was a very prominent broken tiles. The bathroom is were you try to freshen up and clean your self, if you see the bathroom is dirty it doesnt feel right at all. The tv/microwave area needs dusting as when i opened the cabinet, there were dust all over.

convenient to the airport. room was well kept with fridge and microwave. easy airport shuttle the restaurant was closed for that day but they offered a shuttle to their sister hotel's restaurant it wasnt noisy. we stayed on the 11th floor and were able to see airport

This hotel isn't bad or good. It's away from downtown and doesn't really have anything to do around the hotel. It's decent if you are working on joint base Pearl Harbor Hickam since the drive time is short and you don't have to worry to much about traffic. One good thing is that they allow pets. Down side is that your next to the highway and I could hear the traffic from my room. I do like hotels that provide free internet which this one did. The continental breakfast was ok, you get what you pay for

I realize this is Honolulu, and there are military families going in & out of here all the time, but...some paint would go a long way in keeping up this place. I was appalled at all the rust in the shower/tub area--it obviously has been there for a long time, and the fixtures need to be replaced. The painted-over wallpaper was bubbling all around the room; the doors to the hallway and to the bathroom did not fit well (especially the bathroom door); let's just say that the entire area was SO tired. We paid plenty for this room, plus an additional $25 to park, and I would call this a ripoff. Would we ever stay there again? No way. We chose this due to its proximity to the airport, as it was a one-night layover. We have stayed in many Best Westerns over the years, and this was the worst. I will say, however, that the staff was pleasant to us.

We picked this hotel thinking it was close to the airport and we'd be better off catching our plane from there rather than Waikiki. It was badly placed in the opposite direction of the airport: We wound up going out of our way instead. Geared for cost and/or location to airport we found it not to be as clean as it might have been and we got a little bit of the cold shoulder treatment for some reason.

Older, drab, hotel near the airport. If you are there because your airplane was pouting and you needed somewhere close for the night I guess it works since that is why we were there. If you need an intermediate to long-term work place near the airport, it must work since that demographic seemed to be well-represented. But, if you are thinking this is a great place for a vacation and think hanging out at the pool all day is the way to go; then you are in the wrong place. Get away from the freeway. Go to the beach hotel, or better yet an out-island. The room was clean, the water was hot, and the carpet was new. The furniture was the standard motel formica. The only real problem was the thermostat just seemed to be soething that hung on the wall and had no bearing on the room temperature. Would have been great if there were real blankets on the bed but it was cold without them.Worst of all Byron's Drive-in is gone.

Recently stayed 4 nights at the Best Western (3 consecutive; then 1 prior to our flight home).
