PROS: clean rooms (some more spacious than others); nice and accommodating staff; 24-hr free shuttle to/from the airport; frig/microwave; comfortable beds/pillows; decent shower;a little shop near lobby; atm; parking garage (though you do pay for parking); (and I believe laundry facilities though we didn't use it); pretty convenient location. CONS: road noise; some airport noise; and on-site restaurant that was too pricey I thought (Seafood Buffet over $60 for 2 people).... (but everything in Hawaii is pretty expensive). I had originally reserved a room outside of Honolulu that did not live up to the online photos; description...so we left and got a room here instead. The first night we had a nice big room (handicap room) with good views and it would have been a wonderful stay except for the road noise (it faced Nimitz Highway and the main highway above it). The next day upon request, they moved us to a room on the top floor, more away from the highway, but it was small and very hot; so we were given another room on a different floor. It was not as large as our room the first night, but quieter. Our final night was a nicer room, again more away from the road noise..but you could still hear it a little. We rented a car and saw Pearl Harbor, Waikiki, and drove to the north shore, east and west shores. Honolulu has a lot of traffic (unfortunately what many people, including us, came to Hawaii to get away from)... but if you get out of Honolulu, the drives along the coast are pretty. I would stay at this property again... but you should ask for a room that doesn't face Nimitz Highway...or possibly bring a pair of earplugs. If you need to be near the airport though, this is convenient. Price was very reasonable with our AAA rate.

This hotel satisfied our need for stop over hotel to do Pearl Harbour. The hotel room was clean and comfortable. Alternative catering was non existence, we had to use the hotel's restaurant which was very good although this involved a walk or shuttle trip (two blocks) to its sister hotel (The Honolulu Airport Hotel). Regarding Pearl Harbour we had to arrange our own transport, no tour buses stopped at the hotel. In the end we got a hire car from Hertz and drove less than 5 miles. We had a great time.

Nice hotel just outside of Waikiki, however there is highway noise 24hrs a day. This noise not bad if you have a room further from highway and facing the pool. The service staff is very polite, friendly, & eager to help. There shuttle to/from airport runs 24 hours a day on the hour and half hour. The restaurant is good and very reasonably priced

From the moment we walked in the door, our stay at the Best Western Plaza Hotel, Honolulu, HI, was a memorable experience. The Plaza is conveniently located near the airport; provides free shuttle service to and from the airport; local public transportation, The Bus, easy to use just a few steps walk out the front door. Don't want to use The Bus, taxis standby in the front parking lot. Have your own car: park in the hotel parking garage. We had breakfast twice in the hotel restaurant. Excellent friendly service. Plenty of tasty food. Great stay!

We chose this hotel due to it's location close to the Honolulu airport. We flew all day so it was great to just get a close room and sleep before taking on Hawaii. Additionally on our way home this was a great hotle to stay at since we had to depart at 5 AM.

We enjoyed our stay at The Plaza Hotel in Honolulu! It was very convenient to the airport and they had a restaurant for breakfast. It was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They even stored our luggage for us since we had time to do some sight seeing before our flight. Their shuttle to and from the hotel was wonderful.

The staff is excellent, and exceded my expectation with assistance, including the shuttle driver.The gift shop carried items I needed and they reasonably priced. My room air was a little difficult to adjust, but oveall my stay was very good

Not in a very good area. When we arrived in August 17th the pool had been closed since August 11th and we were never notified. We had our two children with us who were very disappointed. We had to take a shuttle to their sister hotel but the service was not prompt when we needed to be picked up. Our rooms were not very clean especially the bathrooms.

Very good accommodation and service. It was close to the airport, making it very handy to a weary traveler. The airport shuttle was very prompt and the driver friendly. The room was spacious. The room was clean. The small gift shop/variety store was handy, and I was able to purchase items that I had forgot to pack. Breakfast was good, the service good, the wait staff friendly.

Not too many choices here in choosing an airport hotel in Honolulu but we made the right one!!After reading many Trip Advisor reports I was a bit dubious about booking but plunged ahead and was not disappointedWhen you arrive at the airport use the courtesy phone in the baggage claim area and a shuttle will pick you up...a sign on the bus says $1 per bag for the driver would be appreciated!!Return transfers every half hourRestaurant for dinner not open every night but they will shuttle you to a sister hotel for dinnerThere is a shop in the very drab foyer which sells a variety of snacks etcOur room 2340 was large and clean without undue traffic noise and was quietUpon checking in ask for a room away from the freeway!!!!!!We were more than happy with this Best Western and would stay there again

Most of the airport hotels in Honolulu I found to be extremely overpriced, and Best Western The Plaza Honolulu Airport Hotel was great value for money. It's not a flashy upmarket hotel, but if you're looking for friendly efficient service for a quick stay very close to the airport, you can't go wrong. They have a complimentary shuttle from the airport 24 hours a day, and are only a couple of minutes drive from the terminals so you can maximise rest time in between flights - which is perfect if you're arriving from international and connecting domestically the next day. Other reviewers have had issues with freeway noise but this wasn't a problem for us as our room was set away from the main road. The room was a little dated but very clean and everything in good working order, and staff were incredibly friendly and helpful at every stage.

I misconnected on my flight twice, once from HNL to ITO and my return from HNL to LAX. Both times I stayed at this property overnight and was very satisfied with the service and clean rooms both times. Very friendly shuttle drivers both times and friendly and efficient front desk agents! They answered my questions before I could ask them :) The hotel overall has an old feel to it, however the rooms were clean and everything worked in them. I saw a little rust in the bath tub and the room decor could use a facelift, but the rate I paid for these rooms was $40 a night less than the other hotels were charging for a last minute reservation. Their lobby store is well stocked and provided a decent salad dinner the time it was open. If you are stuck in HNL overnight, I would recommend this hotel for a layover.

Stayed one night due to a flight problem. Free shuttle was nice from the airport. Hotel is dated and badly in need of repair. Hallways are unappealing. Door to room stuck, ceiling damage, drawers on the dresser were open and wouldn't close. Furniture was damaged, stains on the carpet and damage to the walls. The traffic noise was horrible and spent a sleepless night. Bathroom was tiny and dirty.

This hotel was definitely not the standard quality that one would find of a Best Western Hotel. Breakfast was not included in the hotel stay and usually cost around $20. I had to walk two blocks to another hotel to get dinner on the Wednesday and Thursday night that I stayed there. I found the room to be comfortable but it was fairly worn, and, although on the 10th floor, was fairly noisy due to the elevated highway being just outside the window. Found the staff very courteous and professional. Hotel could use a fresh coat of paint and renew the carpets, bedding, furniture and linen. I would not stay here with my family, but it's okay to lay the head down while on business. However, based on the rate and having to buy breakfast, it might be the same deal to stay at a downtown hotel. One plus is it's proximity to the airport.

Great Hotel and especially the staff!! When catching the Shuttle from the Airport, the Shuttle Driver welcomes you with such a warm smile! Upon arriving to the Hotel, the Shuttle Driver will take your luggage into the Lobby while you registering. The Hotel staff is the best, very friendly, and very patient. The guest rooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. There is a nice pool area if you have time to relax between business trips. The Restaurant gives a varity of good food for dinner, and the Seafood Buffet is delicious. The Front Desk and Shuttle Staff are the very best!

The best thing about this hotel is its location, just minutes from the airport. It is perfect if you have an early morning flight the next morning. There is a free shuttle to and from the airport. The downsides to this hotel are that it is old and dated, and the rooms are spartan. We stayed twice and both times the room was clean but amenities are few (such as a room safe). There is a microwave and frig though. The biggest problem is that this was the noise. You can hear planes land and take off, and because the hotel is situated at the intersection of two highways, you hear cars and trucks all night. The second night we stayed we did not sleep for one minute because of noise from traffic. In addition, this hotel does not have free breakfast or free parking like most Best Westerns do. Parking cost $12 a night (in August 2013).

First of all, the staff here were all very good.The hotel is adjacent to a stacked freeway. The noise is really loud, not from planes but from cars and trucks. We changed rooms on the second night, and it was only marginally better.It does die down overnight, but I found myself waking at 5 am.It is very convenient to the airport, and has a pool that families were enjoying. The transfer to and from the airport is efficient (bring 1usd per bag for a tip).We were looking forward to our complimentary American breakfast. However this is just a fruit cup (a bowl of sliced fruit), 2 pieces of toast, jam and tea or coffee. You can't offset it against an actual American breakfast. A side order of bacon was $5 and an egg was $3. Having said that, the staff were pretty nice here as well.

This hotel is well situated close to the airport and is a good jumping off point for getting around Oahu. The room is clean, if a little dated, but good for us since we had our little dog with us. The staff is very helpful and I really like that there is security at all times at the hotel. Be prepared for a struggle when parking in the outside lot where the pet friendly rooms are but it's good when you get used to it. Definitely recommend this place as a home base of operations if you are staying on Oahu.

Upon my arrival I was greeted with a special aloha which I have never received before from any other hotels or condos that I have stayed at whilst coming and going to Hawaii I'm sorry but I forgotten the lovely girls name at the front desk but if only there was more people around like her the world would a much nicer place.I would certainly recommend staying at the hotel yes you situated at the airport and in between the on and off ramps of the highways. But for convince to and from the airport it's a great start or end to your trip. Easy to get to shopping centres via the bus for only $2.50 and the in house cafe is very good too. Nearby is some take out stores if you need more variety. Transfer bus to terminals is handy to for no charge. Will come again and to the staff keep up your happy attitudes and willingness to oblige.

Very noisy, staff was not too accommodating; they refused to acknowledge I was a Best Western Rewards member. Also, they do not advertise the restaurant is not open for lunch nor is it open nightly for dinner, with the exception of Friday - Monday.

Me & my family spent a night here and their employee Cherae made our experience very pleasant. Her customer service was OUTSTANDING and she kept a smile on her face! She event went above and beyond with directions to and from our location over the phone and definitely gave that Aloha spirit!!! We definitely need more employees like her today!! Thanks again Cherae, me and my family appreciated the hospitality.. Rooms were nice, clean and quiet. Thanks Best Western!! Room #2348/2/2013

Close to Naval Station and Hickam AFB. 10 minutes from either base. Pay for parking of course. Rooms are OK, only 2 elevators for 12 floors. Restaurant with Seafood buffet Fri and Sat at around $25.-$30. Byrons fast food around corner, strip mall walking distance. It is a C+. Long lines mostly, at check-in or check out. Airport about 10 minutes. Shuttle to / from airport. Working man's hotel. Laundry on 1st floor. Aloha spirit not seen here.

I spent forty days at this hotel in June 2012 and June 2013. I chose it for its location and proximity to TAMC. For that purpose, it worked out nicely. For other interests, like being a central location, it is also pretty good. For a resort experience, go elsewhere. The rooms are decent but awkward without a closet door. The bathrooms are adequate. The tv is awfully slow to turn on. But they have plenty of channels. There is also a fridge and microwave too if memory serves. The best part was earning Best Western points while I was staying there. There is no good running near the hotel and no exercise room that I am aware of. I recently used the hotel as a convenient place to stay near the airport. Because I was in and out so often, it made getting back to and from the hotel and airport quite convenient. On my own I may not come here but if on military duty I say definitely take it because they accept TLA rates which few other hotels will. And they give you vouchers for food in the hotel if you are checking in or arriving on island, but not if you are not

Spent a month at the Plaza, Best staff ever!!!Techie is a waitress at the cafe and just made my day every morning. I never had to ask for anything she already knew my order, had my coffee ready and always had a smile. She is kind, sweet and if not for her I wouldn't have had breakfast there everyday. Cherae from the front desk always greeted us with a smile and a BIG GOOD MORNING!Her happy face always made the morning easy and was nice to be greeted by my name. I have to say the staff makes this hotel a PLAZA... I have stayed at 5 star hotels and the staff never even knew my name getting a smile was far fetched but the Best Western Plaza in Honolulu has by far the BEST STAFF.....

Right next to the freeway, very noisy, can't control your AC so your Room is hot, old and run down!! The hotel staff has no clue about the island, they gave us a name of a place to go eat and sightsee and we paid $40.00 for a taxi ride there and the place was out of business!! Lots of Military Families call this home so it was very busy with all that going on!! It looks good on the internet but looks nothing like the pictures, the pool is a joke, right next to the pool is the smoking area, how relaxing is that!!

This is very near the airport (with a local rental car agent next door, while hotel charges $25/day for parking). This is an older building that was very clean and is obviously under renovation. Staff were very friendly. They have a shuttle to and from the airport.

The customer service was terrible! My wallet was stolen right in front of the check in desk which sits in their lobby. Management failed to assist or offer me any help until I began stating that I was going to contact their regional management. This is not a safe hotel. After walking the entire hotel property to see if anyone threw my wallet out I found the hotel lacked many keyed entrances to prevent nonguest from entering the property. I witness people entering and leaving the pool and the back parking lot that were not guests. The hotel charges for daily parking yet this back (free) parking lot is right in front of guest rooms and isn't controlled. Lots of illegal parking and easy access to all area's of the hotel.

This hotel is close to the airport, so for a one night stay to catch an early morning flight it is fine, much longer than that I would find another spot.The person working the front desk did not appear to be happy at her job.

We were a group of 16 people and not all the rooms received the discount coupon for the hotel restaurant. When we went to the front desk they argued with us saying every room has the coupon. The front desk said they would give the discount to our group and we told them we have 8 separate bills BUT the restaurant lady said "It was our misunderstanding" and we could only get the discount if we put on one check.We checked in on July 11, 2013 and the front desk clerk was not very helpful when we called for the shuttle. Their directors for where to go to get their shuttle pick up was wrong. Then when it arrived it was already full.Ice machine and elevator was very loud but at least the breakfast we did not get the discount on was good. $15The saddest part is that when we return from Palau we have two more night here at the hotel. I wish we could change to a new place.

We stayed here to be close to the airport one night and it was just meh. There is an obscene parking fee of $25 – there would have been a good view of Honolulu, but the window was completely fogged (not due to weather, but due to a bad window). There was dirt in the bathtub when we arrived. It is close to the highway, but the foggy window was also thick so we didn’t hear anything, which was nice. The airport shuttle runs every half hour and the driver was very nice.

The room was clean and a great place to rest after a busy day. We didn't want to stay in the busy sections of Waikiki so this was a great facility for getting on and off the roads quickly for another adventurous day. For some reason, housekeeping kept giving us fewer and fewer cups each day which created only a slight problem. Other than that, we'd go back again and recommend this property to others.

We stayed at the Best Western Plaza Hotel next to Honolulu airport on the last night and day of our vacation. We used a Free Night Voucher that I earned during their STAY 2 NIGHTS AND GET ONE FREE promotion and I am an. Elite Gold Member at Best Western as well.The Hotel is close to the airport on N. Nimitz Highway but parking in front for check in is difficult due to the small space. Front desk was very friendly and quickly arranged an upper floor room for me along with complimentary parking with in-and-privileges. I also asked for late check-out because our flight was not scheduled until 9 PM. For a mere $65 I was given a 6 PM late check out!! Exactly what I needed without paying for another night just to get some extra rest.The room itself is nicely appointed with a great view of Waikiki and the airport. There is a large HD flatscreen with true HD programming available. Minifridge and Microwave are also provided. The beds we got were very comfortable. The room comes with free wi-fi and high speed internet via Ethernet connection which I found to be extremely fast!! Unfortunately there are very few outlets for electronics. I had to unplug a floor lamp to charge my laptop.The shower was fine and the bathtub is deep. Standard toiletries are provided complimentary, such as soap, shampoo, lotion, etc. Towels are thick and plentiful.There is an outdoor pool but with limited hours of operation. The restaurant in the hotel has limited hours. Most nights the Hotel recommends taking the free shuttle to their sister location, the Best Western Honolulu Ohana Hotel nearby for dinner. You can buy postcards and stamps in the small sundry shop by the Front Desk. I saw a business center area with free terminal for guests.We zoomed to Waikiki beach in 15 minutes using the freeway entrance near the Hotel. And our shuttle to the Terminal was about 15 minutes as well. Definitely staying here again if plans require late departure from Honolulu International.Mahalo to the Best Western Plaza Hotel for making our last hours in Oahu a great stay!!

This was a perfect place to stay for the night when we arrived in Honolulu to go on the Norwegian Cruise Line. The staff was outstanding and very helpful! The shuttle airport service was great and had a shuttle with a lift. We stayed again at the end of our cruise. They had a great in house restaurant and gift shop. Would definitely stay there again!

Our family has stayed in this hotel several times when we had our home termite tented. When looking for a hotel again, this one caught my eye as it was identified as pet friendly. It is actually the only pet friendly Best Western on the Island of Oahu. It also had all the conveniences that we desired - situated in the middle of the Island and close to the airport, ice maker on same floor, laundry room, in-house sundry store, and nice size rooms. Our only complaint was that the air conditioning was not adjustable and set at 78 degrees. This was too warm for everyone in both of our hotel rooms.

We had a 15 hour layover in Honolulu so this hotel filled the bill. Arrived at 9:30pm called the hotel. The van was there within 10 minutes. At the front desk it took no more than 5 minutes to check-in and off to the room. We were on the top floor facing the airport away from the highway. The room was clean and the bathroom looked like it was remodeled undated good shower. The mattress looked like it was new, I always check. Very quiet room no noise. Had breakfast package with room. Good choices and a good amount of food. Van back to the airport ran on a schedule so had no problem. For a layover for a morning flight this hotel was very convenient. I would stay here again.

Just imagine walking into the room and realize that the cleaning lady has left a window open. You check the windows and realize that they're all closed.. the noise is just unbelievable.The good thing is that you will not hear any airplanes. The bad thing is that it's because of the highway noise, which is practically 24x7.They say there are earplugs in the room (there wasn't, I had my own) but your average good quality earplugs will not block all the noise. We spent four months travelling around North America and this was absolutely the worst night we had. And the plan was to stay here to get a good night sleep before flying to the east coast..The one star comes from the fact that the room was relatively clean as such and the staff was ok. I have never complained about a room at check-out but here I did.As the H-1 interstate has been there for ages, there's really no excuse for not having proper windows in the rooms. It's not rocket science. The requirements for a good airport hotel are pretty simple, you give the folks a good night's sleep and you're next to the airport.As they still charge a premium for the location, I'd book a cheaper hotel further away from the airport and take a taxi.

I can sleep through anything, so the constant road noise was not a huge deal, but the hotel staff put me on the "quiet end". And it didn't really make a difference. This hotel is not ideal for light sleepers.The breakfast was very overpriced for what was served. A example of this is an extra egg with your meal will cost you 3 dollars extra. Do yourself a favor and walk or drive a quarter mile down the road to Joe's Grill and get more food for less than half the price. A six pack of Heineken is $12.50 at the convenience store in the lobby, and don't forget the sunscreen or you will be paying 15$ for some in that same store. Ask me how I know...Now I understand the principles of supply and demand, as well as convenience, so I paid these prices, but what bothers me is that there are a lot of service men and women staying in this hotel during transition, and they are subject to these high prices, and I do not think that is right.The laundry room was nice, a single wash and dry will cost about $6.50 with the detergent included. Facilities were nice.On to the room. The room was slightly dated, but it was clean. One problem I ran into was having enough power outlets for my various electronics. Parking was not an issue, but be careful of blind corners and other vehicles.

This was an awesome stay, I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights and must I say the experience was Great. I was visiting a friend of mine plus I was on vacation and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. They anticipated my needs, offered specials and promos at the time of my check in. This was my first stay with Best Western, because I usually go for the more upscale hotels, but this location was right down the street from the HNL Airport and I was very impressed. I will say that the hotel was under construction and it was noisy for the most part of the day, but they did post signs around the hotel to make the customers aware of what they would be doing, what times, and the reason for the rennovation. I plan to use this hotel again......

Really close to the airport and with a free shuttle bus service. We rang for the shuttle (free 'phone) as soon as we collected the luggage from the carousel and the driver was there within 10 minutes. Due to the Hotel's location beside a motorway there was traffic noise but this did not bother us. Dinner is available either inhouse or at the partner venue down the road depending on which night of the week it is. The hotel shuttle bus runs every 30 minutes between the two hotels so this is quite convenient. Breakfast served in the dining room with friendly and efficient staff waiting on you. This venue ideally suited our overnight stay for connecting through to Australia from Maui.

Going into the stay, I knew we'd be next to the highway and airport, so the road noise didn't bother me or my dad at all. It's really close to the airport and didn't take long at all to get us there and back. The staff was nice and we had a nice view from our window. We had breakfast vouchers with our stay (we went on a cruise so we stayed there saturday night when we came in and for sunday when we came back in). The breakfast was great and the servers were good. It just seemed like they were low staffed because we had to wait a while before being seated and then it took a while to get drink refills. But everything was nice and what we expected. I'd definitely stay here again if I ever come back to Hawaii.

I personally thought that my stay at the hotel was pretty fair. Everything was pretty average as most hotels. The things that I disliked were the constant noise being that it is directly next to the highway. It is really not in the best location for a hotel and also the parking garage is very prone for accidents because it is entirely to small to park. I was constantly having to dodge accidents because everyone does not think to drive a decent speed in a parking garage. The thing that I did enjoy most was the cafe' and the entire staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. My cleaning service especially was great. Her name was Madeline and she was very polite. She cleaned my room each day with fresh new towels, changing my sheets, and refreshing the room with a very delightful scent. In all my stay was pretty comfortable and I enjoyed everything thanks to the staff.

I booked this hotel on my way to American Samoa. It is close to the airport and convenient for those traveling alone. I became ill on my trip & staff helped me locate an urgent care just around the corner from the hotel, along with the pharmacy where I picked up meds. Hotel staff was helpful & did their best to make me comfortable as I continued my flight the following day. The hotel was clean & comfortable...all you need if you are traveling long flights & want a decent place to stay.

We had an overnight layover in Honolulu and only needed a place to rest our heads. The hotel is very close to the airport (by the free hotel shuttle took only 5-7mins) which is exactly what we needed. The hotel could use a bit of updating but the bed was comfortable and along with the bathroom, were clean. We had a deal for free breakfast the following morning which was plenty! We had a choice of eggs,meat,toast,hash browns and unlimited coffee. Plus the waitstaff was pleasant. Would stay here again if there were similar circumstances.

The airport was near by and one of only a few hotels that allow pets. Unfortunately the highway is right over the hotel so it's loud and hard to enter except in a roundabout way. No breakfast as advertised on website included with some reservations. Rooms were dated and in bad need of referbishment. Service was ok, but not out of this world. Parking fee too each night.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Best Western - Plaza. The parking was so conveniently located, the rooms are really big and the service was incredible. It also was super to have a store within the building. The location of the hotel was also convenient and close to the airport and the medical center I was scheduled to have surgery in. Loved it.

Dried pee behind the toilet, hair on the toilet and in the tub, used coffee filters, garbage and kleenex in the ice box. We had clorox wipes to clean it ourselves and staff apologized, but definately won't stay here again. We normally really like the Best Western and stay at them all the time... the actual room, staff and breakfast were otherwise great... but the bathroom was gross enough to take Best Western off our list for future stays.

I stayed at The Plaza twice recently - first on my way across the dateline, second on the way back for several days. The hotel is close to the international airport & runs 24-hour shuttle service to & from the airport. The rooms are quite nice & the cleaning staff takes pride in their work. Everyone at the hotel was pleasant & the on-site restaurant is adequate. There is also a well-stocked variety store / gift shop near the lobby. All the rooms have free wifi & flat-screen TV.Major highways run adjacent to the hotel & there is some traffic noise but it wasn't a bother to me. The hotel is quite a distance from the "Hotel Zone" & most of the major attractions of Honolulu but the lower cost of The Plaza makes up for this. Buses & taxis are available at curbside & will take you anywhere you like on the island. There is a car rental next to the hotel but I saw no reason to rent a car while here.

The wait staff and folks at the front desk are pleasant, helpful and some go above and beyond their area of responsibility. The room was a little musty, dining area had drywall patches, there were holes in the tile in my bathroom and the place looked dated. Youre not close to waikiki. You will need to take a cab, bus or have your own vehicle. If you get easily disturbed with roadway/vehicular noise this is not the place for you.

Incessant road noise, even on the 12th floor. Dirty bathroom. Chipped tub. Lame water pressure. Uncomfortable beds. One can hear the toilet flushing from next door rooms (not to mention other noises. Just Ewwwww). Would not repeat this experience even for free. Michael, the dining room server was excellent, the only light in an unsatisfactory stay. Renovations are looooooooooong overdue for the guest rooms.

A decent hotel for an extended stay if you are up for constant construction noise and paint fumes. Cars have been broken into, and there isn't a consistent security force to reinforce dangerous parking. However the maid staff is fantastic, they really are the best thing about this hotel.

We just moved here from the mainland and I'm so glad we stayed here instead of staying at Schofield Inn. We have a German Shepherd so it's a big relief to us that this hotel accepts pets. It's in a great location. 5 minutes from the airport and there's a free shuttle bus. It isn't the nicest hotel, but you can't complain with the price and great location. It's a great place to stay for a quick visit. We stayed for over a month while we tried to find a house here and it was great for the first week or two, but I'm ready to get out. If you park your car here, park it in the parking lot behind the hotel. DO NOT PARK IN THE GARAGE! Unless you are used to microsized parking. The staff is very friendly and great. Emelita the cleaning lady was excellent and was great with our dog. It's a great place to stay if you need something affordable and close to the airport or if you are military PCSing with Pets.

...if you manage to get a good rate - this is the place to be near (5 minutes ride) from HNL Airport. Shuttle is free and available 24/7. THe pool is quite small but OK if you are staying at the hotel for a day or two. There is a bus stop near the hotel and you could get a ride to the Centre of Honoluly at circa $2.50 one way. The rooms are OK and not as dated as some reviwers make it to be..... I am sattisfied with my stay, at the price that I have paid and would definitely return if i will plan to stay in HNL Airport area in the near future.Oh.... The Restaurant.... Fri and Saturdays they run a Snow crab buffet ar circa $30 +taxes... Ecellent food items, including eat-as-much-as-you-like salads, local sashimi, kimchi, snow crab.... The food is very good quality and I enjoyed the restaurant a lot!

=we really enjoyed our stay at the best western it was comfortable my kids loved the pool and great hospitality..the house keeper was great she was nice and our kids liked her alot. madeline was our host she was great at her job and she is really nice. its a great hotel when you pcs our friends actually recommended this hotel and our stay was great.

I enjoyed our stay at this hotel! Our room was clean, the common areas were clean, and the staff was great! The service in the restaraunt was good, and the food was good. My kids loved the pool, although it was loud due to traffic. But who goes to Hawaii for the pool?! And you get free parking if you are staying there!! Most of all the excellent customer service is what has me recommending this place to everyone!!

This is a hotel that is convenient, but don't expect too much. The service is basic, the pool is basic and the room was basic. But clean. There is a free shuttle from the airport, though finding it is not easy, and I would recommend it as a relatively inexpensive, short stay hotel.

The Best Western Plaza Hotel in Honolulu offers a very decent place to stay in a very convenient location. There is a free shuttle bus from the airport, which is only minutes away. The rooms and common areas are clean and comfortable. There is a little store off the lobby that sells snacks, alcohol and trinkets. Had a great breakfast in the on-site restaurant. The only thing that I was unhappy about was the price for parking. I rented a vehicle and it cost me $25 per night to park. I thought that was quite pricey.

After a very late arrival in Honolulu it was great to make a quick call and get shuttled a short distance to this hotel. It was clean, recently painted and very comfortable. We ate breakfast at the resturant, good value, then got into the pool before checkout. It is noisy outside and view of the highway is less than interesting but can't beat the location and friendly staff.

I travel all over the world. Sometimes you have to make choices for convenience, not accommodations. Such is the case here. Proximity to the airport is the ONLY reason to choose this property. It is right on the freeway, noisy, old, A/C isn't even central (unit in the wall), beat up. No one who had other choices would stay here EXCEPT if you have to get back and forth to the airport without a long trip. The price is unreasonable for the room, but it's Hawaii. The staff were nice, although I had to wait 20 minutes to get picked up at the airport.

We had a planned layover on our way to Australia and wanted a hotel near the airport just to have a good night sleep before we continued on with our trip. This hotel was perfect for an overnight stay. We called the hotel after landing and the free shuttle was there within 5 - 10 minutes. The room was large, clean, and had free wifi. I wouldn't want to stay in Hawaii under the underpass but this was a great night sleep when that was all we wanted. The next morning we had a quick shuttle back to the airport.

We stayed here for a lengthy stay while we were waiting for our house to be built and the staff was so welcoming!!! The rooms are like any other best western nothing fancy but a good clean place to stay the night. Very convienent as it is right by the hotel and it has free shuttle service to and from :) The shuttle drivers are very knowledgable and once again very courteous. It is a little noisy seeing as it it right by the freeway but not so much i couldn't sleep. Never had a problem with having my room cleaned either, the lady that cleaned my room went above and beyond and got to know my kids on a first name basis!! Hopefully you are lucky enough for madeline as your housekeeper she is such a sweetheart and cleans everything thoroughly :) Over all a pretty nice hotel with awesome service. PS very military friendly which is always awesome in my book :)

I arrived late in the evening. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The worked with me as I was military and didn't qualify for expenses. The room was okay. The rug was loose in certain areas. Otherwise, parking was horrible. There was one smoking area near the elevator in the parking garage. I wouldn't stay again as I could find another place with a cheaper price.

This was just a one-night stay between flights so it was fine. I would not have wanted this as my base of operations for a trip to Honolulu. The airport shuttle was great--except be aware that the pick up location at the airport is in an odd place and we missed it the first time it came around because we were in the wrong area. The staff at the desk were friendly, the room was fine, free wi-fi, but the property overall was a little tired and obviously heavily trafficked. The gift shop was well stocked with snacks including fresh fruit so that was a very pleasant surprise.

We arrived in Honolulu around 06:00 and our onward flight was 14 hours later. We thought we'd use the day to visit the Arizona Memorial and get a day hotel to freshen up and rest up in the afternoon. We called from the airport and they fitted us in. Van to/from hotel included - an the hotel is very close - I'd say an easy walk.Room fine and the price a little high in my uneducated opinion. Staff friendly and helpful. Small onsite shop sold sandwiches - ready made in the fridge but fine. It has a pool but I wouldn't recommend it - the elevated highway is about 4/500 roaring yards away as the crow (literally) flies.

I had one night before a early morning flight so location was high on the list when booking this hotel. Shuttle from airport very quick to and from which means less stress when doing long hall flights. Staff very efficient and able to help with questions. Rooms very large, Free Wi Fi easy to connect and resealable speed handy for checking flights. Their is a little shop in the lobby that you can get makings for a light dinner, breakfast and some beer and wine handy if you are in late and don't wont a big meal. Hotel is old and is noise with freeways very close and you do get some noise from flights but book the hotel for the location. If looking for a hotel for a few nights their are better options.

The facility was good and helpful with my travel needs both for me and my family great hotel. Mrs Myrna was provide great service for me and my family during our stay here at the hotel, she make sure we had all the supply we need for the room as well as the housekeeping. Nicky was great also always making us feel at home especially for my daughter. We are military family on the move first time here to Hawaii and these lady make our stay here an awesome one. How to see them again soon. Great front desk staff also.
user_location: New York, New York, United States

review_body: I must say, I can't quite understand some of the more recent reviews - of course, the location close to the airport means it's noisy. Yes, it is an older hotel but we were quite happy to have the huge room with very comfortable kingsize beds after 28 hours of travel from Germany! The front desk was really helpful, we even got breakfast for free and paid 129 $ for the room (of course, we booked six months before our stay...). As many others have said, the shuttle service is quick and efficient and even friendly, so we think the hotel was worth it and wikll probably stay here again. Only thing: when we arrived at shortly before 10 p.m., nobody told us that the bar was already closed and the little shop in the lobby would close at ten sharp - when we came back down from unloading our luggage there was no way we could get a snack!

My husband and I stayed here on our way from San Francisco to Kauai. After a 5 hour flight and arriving at just before midnight the lady at reception decided to make us wait for a while before she finally decided to help us. (We only had about 6 hours to sleep before we had to get back to the airport). We were also travelling really heavy and had a lot of luggage. The same lady decided to give us a room on the 2nd floor (the side that has NO LIFT!). After pointing out that we could not possibly carry all our luggage up two flights of stairs - she had to go and check with the manager if it was possible to move us to a room near a lift. This took some more time.We finally got a room with lift access. The room was right next to the freeway and even though I knew it would be close to the freeway, I don't think I was quite expecting it to be right on top of the freeway. The noise was overwhelming. We were lucky we had some earplugs with us, else I don't think I would have slept.The room was clean but the bathroom was very squashed - getting out of the shower meant jumping over the toilet. I think it is overpriced for what it offers. At least offer some free earplugs if you expect people to sleep next to that noise. I would NOT stay here again.

This hotel reminds me why I don't like to stay near an airport. It was certainly acceptable and I can not deny it was very convenient. There is free wifi, a nice little store in the lobby, and the staff was nice. The shuttle service was perfect. The room was large and clean and I could see the end of the runway. I wish they could spend a little money upgrading the place just a bit.In the past year, I have stayed near 4 airports for one night: Orlando, LAX, Auckland, and now HNL. I would rate this hotel the lowest of the 4. And it was the most expensive at $155/night including tax. The stay near LAX was comparable but cost $100 with breakfast. So remember, you are looking for convenience. If you remember that, this hotel will do.

The front desk had something to be desired. Other than that, the place was very nice. Shuttle bus driver was very pleasant, rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the view was lovely. They have a computer in the lobby to print out your boarding pass and a nice little sundries shop for anything you may need. I would recommend this place to everyone.

We missed our flight to Maui and needed a quick nights stay somewhere, I wish I had pulled up trip advisor and checked it out. There is an outrigger hotel advertised at the airport for $20 more that probably would have been worth it. Ended up paying $170 for a night here, which is very overpriced for what we got, even at last minute. It's next to and practically under the highway!! Noise was pretty constant and creeping in through the old windows. Beds were way to small, I was to tired to think of asking for a king or queen after flying for 14 hours here, ended up with twins. Hotel showing it's age in some ways, but has had some updating. Shower worked , kind of, some water diverted to tub and shower head needed replacing. Restaurant was average, and expensive ($40 for a simple breakfast) like everything in Honolulu. Area around hotel seemed sketchy at night. 24 Hr free airport shuttle was nice. Maid was friendly and thanked us for our stay and said goodbye (more than I get from much more expensive hotels, she was showing the Aloha spirit!). They did not answer the phone when I called from the airport which was frustrating, I let it ring 20+ times, then called back later. Worst problem was NO temperature control, control was set at 80 but never got close, cold air was blowing in morning, we were cold at night as blankets were skimpy too. Sooo tired from flying in, this should not be in the best western brand IMHO, was disappointed. Front desk to busy to comment to on way out.

The hotel itself is clean and well kept - has large rooms and is on-par with other Best Westerns...what knocks this place out of the park is the staff. My Room attendant was Annie - she was so helpful and went out of her way to make me feel at home. Without being prompted, she offered me an extra blanket and made sure that I had everything I needed to ensure a comfortable stay - AWESOME. The front desk was very kind and accommodating as well. If you are traveling for work and aren't concerned with not being on the beach/downtown and just want a place near the airport or the military bases near by, I highly recommend.

We needed an overnite accommodation for our travel to Sydney. The Plaza served the purpose very well. Excellent shuttle service to and from the airport, very clean room, more than adequate space, and surprisingly quiet, even though the motel is close to the highway. Rates a 5 for this category of accommodation. Will definitely stay here in future should the need arise.

We booked Best Western The Plaza Hotel for a one night layover, coming from the Big Island to catch our flight to the mainland the next day. The shuttle driver was courteous and friendly. Shuttles run from hotel to airport every 15-20 minutes. We booked two rooms: one King for my husband and me and a Double room for our college aged kids. Our second story King PoolView room could only be accessed by stairs, which was OK. This part of the hotel looked like a motel, with the doors facing outward toward a street. I was a bit skeptical of our room then opened the door and total surprise. Everything updated and very clean and new looking. Our large window of the room did over look the pool. It had a comfortable bed, nice furniture.The kids Double room was located in the tower and was accessible by elevator. I would highly recommend the tower if you have trouble walking upstairs. The tower has both Doubles and Kings. The Double room was clean, comfortable, and had a great view out the window (11th floor). The next morning, packed up and caught the shuttle and headed to airport (very early I might add!) The shuttle runs 24/7 to and from the airport, Very Convenient!!!! Would I stay here again? Yes as a layover hotel.

The rooms were clean and well kept. Beds comfortable. All ice machines I tried were working. The hotel does not offer a complimentary breakfast, and the on site restaurant prices are ridiculous. There is a place just around the corner surprising called LL Bbq, (which isn't just BBQ) and they have breakfast for much better prices. All the staff have been very nice. Parking according to the sign is 25 per night, but they only charged me $12. In my opinion it should be free when you pay 170 per night! The parking spots are very tiny and fill up fast! Shuttle runs back and forth to airport and their sister property three blocks down, the Airport Honolulu hotel. The hotels are very similar as far as niceness. Laundry facilities on site, but the cost is rather expensive! Close to airport and also to the military base and Tripler Medical center. Ruby Tuesdays, McDonalds, Jamba Juice, Jack in the Box, Panda Express and Taco bell all a couple of miles away. Also a mall and Target.

My family (Mom, Dad, Kids 10 & 8) stayed here one night in preparation for a 7am flight home; we didn't want to pay a lot since we'd be getting nothing out of the stay other than a bed, and wanted quick access to the airport. This hotel hit on both marks. The airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes and the drivers were very helpful (we used it twice, once to the airport, once the night before after dropping the car off at the airport).We had a room on the top (12th) floor. It was fine, though looked a tad old/dingy. Not so bad that I felt bad staying there, but enough that it was noticeable. The room overlooked the airport, and while there was some airplane noise, it was reasonably muffled. It's by an airport, so you can't expect miracles. It didn't disturb our sleep. The two double beds were fine, though seemed smaller than I'm used to. The room had a mini-fridge and a microwave, which is always handy.When I say it was cheap, that's "Hawaii Cheap". We paid about $140 for the night, which is not cheap by mainland standards, but in Honolulu it's very hard to find anything below $200/night, so I though this was a comparatively good deal.The parking garage, elevators, and bathrooms all felt small and cramped. Serviceable, but very tight. The staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful.Overall this wouldn't be my first choice in hotels, but as I said above, it met the needs I had for a one-night flight prep hotel, so I was satisfied overall. With a little room renovation, it's score could go up.

We booked the Best Western Plaza for a number of reasons. First, when you get off a cruise ship on Saturday and need to fly out, it is going to cost you plenty. They know peope need to get bck to the mainland. Second, it is near the airport and has a freee shuttle running every half hour 24-7. Lastly because we sue BW regularly in our travels.The Lobby is lovely and the desk staff efficient. We were in our room in no time. This resort has obviouly had recent upgrades. Carpet, walls, bathroom were lovely. And we had a corner room on the back with lots of windows. Not much to look at except airport ancillary services but way better than listening to and looking at the FREEWAY. We had to wear our earplugs by the pool, just so we could think.( ask for a room way from the freeway!) Otherwise the pool was nice, plenty of chairs and fenced so kids can't wander out of sight.Probably not the best neighborhood for late night adventures, so we wandered out fairly early and ate real Chinese just down the block. Meals are also served in the cafe on site. The buffect looks enticing but bring your wallet and appetite. Just coming off a cruise ship, we didn't need that knid of temptation again. We were able to split breakfast, but beware that the 10% off your food purchase is not covered by your keycard. You HAVE to bring the coupon from the room. The girl even showed it to us, but couldn't (or wouldn't) allow us to use it, like some places do if you don't have a coupon ( like Kohl's). Even with proof of a key card. Just a little gotcha!The bed was geat, the room spotless, plenty of hot water and the shuttle was prompt. Only about 5 minutes to the airport. Aloha

The room was fine, the service good allowing us to check out at 1 pm due to 3:30 pm flight,shuttle bus prompt. However, the room we were given was right next to the elevator (1206) which turns out to be quite noisy.

After reading the other reviews on the Best Western in Honolulu I almost cancelled our reservation for the night of March 6th 2013. To my surprise our experience was nothing like what the other guests reported. Our room was very clean, well appointed, quiet (we did ask for a room away from the freeway) and the bed was comfortable. I realize many more people write about a bad experience than a good one, we all expect for things to go well and when they do, we just take it for granted. That being said, it was VERY noisy when we were laying out by the pool and sleeping in a room that backs up to the freeway would be impossible without ear plugs. Maybe the hotel could provide them to guests that have those rooms.The other thing I must mention is two of the employees, Charae who works at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. She did everything she could to get the room we asked for at the back side of the hotel, suggested several good places to eat because the restaurant at the hotel wasn't open that day and did her job with a smile that made us feel welcome. Lorenzo was the shuttle driver, he handled our luggage, chatted with us on the drive and helped us figure out that time to catch the shuttle back to the airport the next morning. We arrived in plenty of time and was able to get a snack before getting on the plane. So, if you need a place to stay near the airport, do stay at the Best Western, take your earplugs and say hi to Charae and Lorenzo from Pat and Sharon in Arizona!

Mixed feelings about this place. There are only 2 options really if you are looking to stay right by the airport. We got in late, took the Best Western's free shuttle from the airport, stayed one night, ate breakfast at the hotel, and took the free shuttle back that morning. The free shuttle was easy and convenient. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced (there was a coupon in the room.) The room was alright, but we had a corner room, leaky windows, tons of road noise from the highway below, and the room was not the cleanest ever. The shower was decent. Tip: Ask for an interior room, not a corner room. Also, I hear the lower floors are not as noisy because the noise comes from an elevated highway ramp.

Customer service here is outstanding. We stayed here for two weeks awaiting rennovations to be completed on our condo and all staff were friendly and courteous and always had a smile. The rooms were always clean and again the staff accommodated our every request. We needed to extend our stay one additional night and Gene the manager stepped up to the plate and found us a room even though the hotel was "sold" out. We recommend this hotel to everyone. Outstanding service and outstanding staff! Teresa and RichP.S. DOGS ARE WELCOME HERE - THE PLACE ROCKS

My husband suffered a stroke while at the hotel and the staff helped with calling paramedics and keeping me informed and helped in ways that were appreciated. The hotel is conveniently located right at the airport and easily accessible to either busses or taxi's to go anywhere you wish to go. I have stayed there on quite a few occasions and have always had good experiences with the staff and the quality of cleanliness. It is not a fancy hotel, but it offers basic needs along with restaurant services and a nice swimming pool.

This is a great hotel for a military family. We received wonderful service from everyone at the hotel. Les really explained the TLA program and gave insight to the interworking’s of PSCing to Hawaii. The ladies at the front desk were friendly and some even remembered our names, that’s an earmark of great customer service. The restaurant was good, the staff was friendly, especially the cashiers. Techi was our favorite waitress, she always remembered each one (six total) of our menu choices. We had two large adjoining rooms with view of the pool. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The cleaning staff was great although it would have been nice to get the same person everyday so we could have tipped accordingly. The rooms need a DVD player and a fitness center/gym would have been helpful. Overall, we were happy for our two month stay. Free internet and free parking along with a $10 food voucher every day, this was awesome!

We recently stayed here for one night before a cruise on The Pride of America. Since we were coming the day before the cruise from the East Coast, and staying for several days after, we really just wanted a cheap hotel to crash with a free airport shuttle. The Best Western fit the bill. The shuttle was prompt and the hotel is located very close to the airport and we got a great rate of $134 (including taxes) for the night. We arrived around 4:30 in the afternoon. The staff were all very friendly. The hotel sits almost on the highway and the road noise was loud, but we still slept well- very comfortable bed. The room was dated, but clean. There are NO restaurants within walking distance, in fact, it is a more industrial area. There was a restaurant in the hotel, but it was serving a buffet and did not look too appealing. However, there was a convenience store in the lobby that sold sandwiches, fruit and beverages. We ended up just getting a couple of beers and a sandwich and crashing for the night. We woke up very early and took The Bus- $2.50/person, to Pearl Harbor. The bus stop is right across the road from the hotel and several came by that went to Pearl Harbor, which was about a five minute ride. Also, it was 6:30 in the morning and the area felt safe, though we were the only tourists on the bus. We got to Pearl Harbor and were the second people in line. The gates open at 8, but by then the line was very long. We had reserved tickets on line and they said to get there an hour early, just not sure we needed to get there that early! Easy bus ride back to the hotel. Checkout was noon, and they called a cab for us that took us directly to the cruise ship. If you are coming to Honolulu for a longer vacation, then this hotel would not be a good choice since it is not near the beaches, or action, but it served us well.

After finally getting a flight to Honolulu (on route to Sydney) we found that we had to overnite in Honolulu. We arrived late at nite. we felt exploited by the hotel rates. we were only in the room a short time before we had to get back to the airport. They would not budge on the high price and the room was old and had a bad feel to it. We had just had a wonderful experience with a modern, upscale, hotel in L.A. that was less than half the price with twice the amenities and cleanliness so it was a big disappointment. We only wanted a few hours of rest but instead we felt cheated because the price did not match the value at all.

After a two-week yachting trip to Leeward Islands, after a night flight in a full aircraft, we were totally exhausted. It was 7 am. Having a reservation, I called to the hotel, and a friendly voice replied that a free shuttle bus will come soon. In three minutes it was there, the driver helped with our baggage and we were in the hotel in another two minutes. Good surprise: the room was ready, all perfect. Internet connection worked, the shower worked, all as it had to be. It was a big relax. Good price. Friendly people. We felt like in heaven! Vicinity to the airport is a big advantage. No noise.

Just moved to Hawaii from Ohio. Currently staying here while house hunting. Friendly enviroment and very welcoming staff! Since we are staying here for at least a month this has become a temporary home for us and a great one at that!

Cannot deny that this is a great location if you need to stay real close to the airport. That said, The pictures that were used for their web site led you to believe the facility was much nicer than it is. While the location is close to the airport it is somewhat of a seedy area. Be careful that they don't put you in the older units but insist on the tower.

We just moved to Oahu and stayed here for 6 weeks while looking for a house and waiting to move in. We found it clean and in a convenient location. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. The commute to Schofield Barracks was very reasonable and we were glad not to have to deal with the traffic in and out of Waikiki! (The drive to Hickam, Pearl Harbor or Shafter would be cake.) The hotel restaurant was nice and the waitstaff were attentive. Also in walking distance are Starbucks, Jamba Juice, Ninja Sushi, Blimpie, Big Kahuna Pizza, so it was good to have choices. It's about 2 miles from the NEX, so we went there to eat several times too. We weren't bothered by the noise from the freeway at all. Our room attendant, Annie, did a great job on our rooms, went out of her way to remember all of our names and generally made our stay more personal and pleasant. Hope to stay here again on our way out!

Pleasantly surprised at the large, clean room. Shower was great! Stayed only one night because moved to stay with relatives. Close to the airport and freeway so knew that it would not compare to upscale hotels in Waikiki. Good for what we needed. Definitely better than the poor to fair most travelers reported.

Expecting little from an airport hotel surrounded by used car lots and car rental facilities, I figured I only needed a bed and convenient location to airport. I was very pleasantly surprised by the fresh, clean appearance of the reception and the warmth and effeciency of the front desk staff. They were professional and informative. In the room, I was really surprised at how fresh and clean and nearly sound-proof the room was. Normally a light sleeper, I slept like a baby in the very comfortable bed. I am so impressed by this property that I'll be booking another stay for an up-coming Honolulu lay-over. I recommend this hotel without reservation. Clean, fresh, quiet. Excellent.

This hotel may be great if you are just flying in and leaving the next day. The noise from the freeway was terrible. We were on the 10th floor and looked directly onto the freeway. The only thing great about it is that it was close to the bus and thats how we traveled Seven days there was too long.

The Plaza Hotel is ideally situated next to the Honolulu Airport particularly for overnight stays. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is very nice and helpful, bus service operates perfectly.

We arrived earlier than expected, so we had to get a hotel. I called from the phones at baggage claim, where this hotel was listed. For $199+tax I received a room that had blood on the carpet, big red stains on the carpet, clumps of black hair in the corner, and someone's jacket still in the closet smelling of old cigarette smoke (which made the room smell like it). It was absolutely disgusting! They did put clean sheets on the bed though. I told the front desk and they gave me $20 food credit for my son and I. How thoughtful. This place reminded me of a place for drugs and prostitutes.

bring your earplugs. Convenient shuttle service to the airport. Lots of military families with loud kids running up and down the halls. The room was spacious, but not immaculate by any stretch of the imagination. .

We were very pleased with staying here, the week in Hawaii. The staff was great, and very helpful and made us feel at home..We started out to stay only a couple of nights but because of the covenince we ended up staying there the whole ten days. Cherea at the front desk, was awesome she helped us with everything, and we exchanged a little gift for each other and pictures.

Since I was only at this hotel for one night, I can only review the room, amenities, location, customer service, and the restaurant.I live on Maui and stayed here Monday/Tuesday, February 11-12th. This was a last minute decision based on the hotel's location to the airport (right outside the entrance) and Kaiser Hospital (about an 10 minute drive) where my brother was having triple bypass surgery. Even though they were "technically" sold out, they booked a room for me because of my circumstances. Greatly appreciated and they didn't have to do it.Once I got to the hotel, they upgraded me to a King/corner room on the 8th floor. The room was big, but dated and needed refurbishment. The wallpaper was coming off the wall in the bathroom and there was 1 shampoo, 1 lotion, and two small soaps for washing. The shower was hot and strong. There was a coffee maker with Kona coffee (yuck) and limited (and dated) sugar/creamer. I made coffee, but it didn't taste very good. The elevators are slow. Parking is discounted if you are a "local." Free WiFi everywhere, free local telephone calls, and newspapers. There's also a free shuttle to the airport.Their customer service is excellent though. Everyone was friendly, helpful, and went out of their way to try and help you have a nice stay. Hopefully, the hotel will get a refurbishment so these people can really sell their property. Unfortunately, good customer service doesn't necessarily equate to a great hotel experience. As the hotel is now, $199/night + taxes makes this hotel overpriced. I guess if you stay just one night because you have an early flight, it's okay and worth the price. But, for less, I can stay in town at the Ala Moana or the Hilton.I returned to the hotel at around 7 p.m. from the hospital and decided to eat in their restaurant. It was full (not because the food was good, but because the hotel was full of military families waiting to get back to their homes on base). I decided to wait. I was immediately seated . . . then, waited 20 minutes to order and another 15-20 minutes to get my food. I ordered the kalua pork with beans, fries, and cole slaw. The pork was good . . . everything else not so good. And, they were out of desserts. I felt as if I was in a cafeteria that served greasy fast food, not a hotel restaurant. Again, the wait staff was great and did their best, but it just didn't overcome the bad food and dining experience.Because I was in Honolulu to see my brother and not on vacation/holiday, my stay at the hotel was okay . . . only because the people were so friendly. If I had to stay here for a vacation, I would have left after the first night.

We stayed here for 49 days because we had Pcsd from Georgia. The staff was great, especially Mr Les who takes care of all Incoming Military. Very accommodating to military, with meal vouches and understanding with finding a place to live and payments! We also had a wonderful Room service lady named Emy! She was very sweet, and always did her job perfectly! Had a great First floor room with sliding back doors perfect for our two small dogs who stayed with us the whole time. Also had a small parking lot right outside our room which was very convenient! The only problem we had was the ac unit. It was loud and froze over often and had to be shut off to melt the huge chunk of ice.

The Hotel is great. The pool is a little on the cold side, but my son still loved it. I couldn't ever get in it. We had a room right next to the freeways so it was always really loud and my son didn't sleep very well. The room was a little outdated but still nice. Great place to stay for a week or two but being this close to the freeway for a month gets pretty old. BUT the best part of our visit was Sonia, our room attendant. She has been absolutely fantastic! She makes this stay 100% Worth it! The rest of the staff (I don't know any others by name) are also really great and so SO nice. Always trying to help out and make you comfortable with a smile!

We stayed here for one night on our way back to NY. Hotel is close to airport & provides shuttle service which is what we needed. It could use alittle remodeling. While there we noticed it alot of militay & families stay here, as well as hosting airline training seminars. Room was fine, beds, bathroom, tv, frig, micro, etc. Only problem we had was the noise from the highway. Our room overlooked the roads & the sound was loud. They need to replace the windows with newer ones to block the noise. Our rate included american breakfast for 2 which was good. Restaurant open for breakfast everyday but only every other day for dinner. Nice pool with lounge chairs & tables. Gift shop that has souvenirs & food items, beverages (be aware they charge .10 for utensils which my sister refused to pay since she was buying food that required a fork). Hotel not really close to any sights. It cost us $30 each way to go over to the Hilton Hawaiin Village & Wikiki beach area.

we stayed there one night before our return flight. we took the suite and liked it very much! wi-fi was functioning well. it is noisy from all the roads around it, but you don't go there for a two week holiday. shuttle bus was free. buffet dinner was very nice.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel because we are B/W members, we had asked for "First Floor if possible"., and were given a first floor, but it was next to the freeway with a noisy A/C unit and so got very little sleep. We complained about the room and received a $25.00 discount on our bill. When we returned to the hotel after our visit to Kona, HI. we received a very large and quiet room in the tower. The beds in both visits were excellent and the amenities in both rooms were quite good. We used the BUS to go everywhere. Getting to downtown or Arizona Memorial was very easy with bus #42 being the fastest, and if you show your medicare card it is only a $1.

We stayed for on overnight stay to attend a concert. This location is minutes away from a lot of places, central to everything. Very close to the airport, minutes from Arizona Memorial, Pearlridge shopping mall and Rooms are clean and comfortable. Close to a lot of reasonable priced eateries. Also has a lot of parking and ease to access your room through the parking garage. The staff there is also very friendly.

We are a military family new to the island. We did not pay for this Hotel so I have no room to complain on the decor however it is nice enough. The food is okay but the staff services is great. I would recommend this hotel

We stayed at this hotel for one night between our flt connection. My advanced request for quiet and airport view was accepted, but rooms in need of refurbishment (especially bathroom!!). Despite of fact, that we're four, we had only three towels on bathroom. If you want to visit downtown, public bus takes approx. 45 min there... Be prepared to carpool with questionable existences.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel our last day on Hawaii. We came from Maui and just needed a place to sleep before our planeride back to Norway.The hotel was next to the airport and had a free shuttle to and from HNL. That is the only reason why we chose this hotel.The room was big but outdated.. Same goes for the bathroom..Friendly nightstaff and shuttlebusdriver ;)

We are military moving to the island with three small children. The staff at the hotel was awesome ... Grace was our housekeeper and she was always helpful, kept our room immaculate and always smiling. The front desk staff and the restaurant staff made everything feel like home. The hotel itself needed some remodeling but the staff made up for what the amenities were missing.

We flew into Honolulu in the evening and had an early morning departure for the mainland so thought an airport hotel would fit the bill. This hotel was close-only 5 minutes from the airport;however, the noise from the freeway kept us up most of the night! If I had a 'do-over' I would have opted for a Waikiki hotel and sucked up the travel time. This hotel is no bargain, noisy, and dated. On the positive side, the front desk was friendly and we did not have to wait long for a pick up.

The service my family and I received was excellent. We were made to feel comfortable. The rooms were clean and our hosts was always polite and curtiouse. We were accommodated with vouchers to the hotels restaurant for our entire family, given to us each day we were at the hotel. The food was fresh and prepared with love. Our housekeepers name was Zenaida, and she was a pleasure. She always made sure we had extra towels to satisfy the members of our family and the room always looked, felt, and smelled fresh and sanitized when she left. I would recommend this establishment to my friends and family.

The hotel itself is about average I would say, I am not a difficult person to please and very hesitant to complain about anything so I don't know if my review would be helpful for others. As far as the front desk, all personnel working the desk are extremely polite, knowledgable, and very helpful. What ever I have needed from them they were all over it ASAP. I am military and just moved here while waiting on a house, the front desk crew are very familiar with the process for military which makes life much easier to get to your room and just relax. Housekeeping I will have to say is the best thing going about the hotel. Specifically my housekeeper Anna. She is second to none on politeness and attention to detail service of our room. She is very cordial and a very hard worker. I couldn't imagine that any other housekeeper here would be better, if so give that person and Anna a major raise, because Anna is outstanding. Room is always clean front to back, beds changed often, towels always nice and fresh, bathroom spic and span, and floor always clean. Again I am military so this is semi-luxury for me, but for you folks who have to have everything perfect then this place would be average for you at best. I don't think the hotel is bad at all, at least not that I have seen. If I had to make any negative comments it would only be that it is a tad bit noisy on the side of the highway so request a room on the opposite side, also sometime the AC unit makes noise, lastly there are no kitchens available in the rooms. Overall the stay is good enough for me, the hotel is not 5 star but it is very recommendable for my fellow military folks and your families. Great work Anna!

This hotel was horrible. The bathroom was so nasty with a stained tub, ripped up bath mat, rusty shower head, with a bad soap dish~I wouldn't even get in for a shower....Cable TV went out, our babies milk froze in the room refrigerator.The next morning black toxic waste bubbled up in our bathroom sink....For all of this we were charged $200.00 for the night....

I honestly cannot share even the slightest positive note on the B.W. Plaza Hotel. I feel extremely sorry for any tourist staying here, especially for first-time visitors. The final straw occured upon departure. A black disgusting bubbling brew started erupting from the bathroom sink drain. We could not leave this "project" fast enough!

This hotel is terribly overpriced (even using hotwire.com!) and just plain bad value. I am a low maintenance traveler, but this experience caused me to speak up. I paid what turned out to be a 4 star price for a 2 star hotel room. The staff was slow moving and unresponsive, the room was barely clean, and when I arrived to the room, I found the door unlocked and a large man dressed in a security uniform (not sure if he was one or not) in my room! I was too tired to complain, so propped a chair under the door since the security chain was broken. I am not a 'fraidy cat, but as a solo traveling female, it seemed prudent. My advice: pay for a shuttle downtown where there are better options and more competition to keep hotel management honest.

Room was very clean, and cleaned well each day.1st room I was put in has poor A/C , changed my room , it had better a/c , but the thermostat would change nothing. The air registers in both rooms could hardly blow a napkin out of the way, the windows are small, like from mid wall upward. In my opinion , the room air conditioning is antiquated. The elevator system is slow. No scenery to speak of, it is after all at the airport, I mean you can look at planes out of the window. There are lower rates at nicer locations in honolulu. It is adequate for a night to change flights etc.

I truly enjoyed the textbook service and professionalism of the Best Western's staff during my transition to Hawaii. I rarely meet such down to earth people that make you feel so comfortable each time you see them. I will never forget Mena, Charae, and Rose for these remarkable people are the definition of selfless service. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast was delicious. The location is very convenient and has all the amenities of a resort, but for a lower price. Thank you for the world class support.

For a no-nonsense place to stay close to the airport, this is a great place. The staff is friendly and go out of their way to assist you. Rooms are roomy and clean although not new, but amenities abound that are absent from other hotels. Free internet in lobby where you can print out your boarding pass, etc., covered parking with auto entry & exit with parking pass; and a wonderful large restaurant with regular and buffet on certain days and shuttle to sister restaurant a couple of blocks away for remainder days. There is also a shuttle to the airport. For the price, I feel the The Plaza is a gem of a bargain.

We were here on a business/pleasure trip. The company booked us here for a week long stay. It was very pleasant. Extremely convenient location. The staff was very friendly, room was clean, and we had an incredible view of the island. Sure, it's not the ritzy beachside Waikiki resort, but you're not paying that nightly rate here.

Hotel is fine. It's clean and has a little shop to buy what you need. There's not much activity around, so my toddler is super bored. The staff is all really nice though! Super helpful and pleasant. It's a little pricey but were in Honolulu so what can you expect? Great breakfasts at the restaurant, too!

We came to Hawaii with the military, and have been staying at this hotel for almost 2 months now and it has been a great experience! The front desk staff has always been friendly, and very helpful. We eventually had to move rooms to #115 and our housekeeper Emy was wonderful!! She was always friendly, polite, and would ask us how we were doing when she noticed I wasn't feeling well. The whole staff at the Best western plaza made it a wonderful experience coming to Hawaii!!

I needed a hotel for one night prior to our departure from Honolulu - and this was a good choice. We called and they picked us at the airport at no time, and a shuttle back to the airport in the morning worked well too (if only the driver didnt ask for the tips so obviously - is that still a "free shuttle"?). The staff is wonderful - we arrived at 10 am and we were given a room! Our room on the 9th floor faced the airport, which is fine with me. The area around the hotel is a bit noisy (highways all around) and not good for walks (although there is a small food court within walking distance). The room was clean and partially renovated, the bedding was nice. All and all, if I needed a room for one night, I would stay here. (Although watch out, the charges for parking are rediculous, if you do come with you own car).

We have flown from Maryland to Hawaii a few times. In the past, we went to downtown Honolulu for our first night. After an 11 hour flight that arrives at 6:pm Hawaii time (11:pm Maryland time) we decided to stay close to the airport. What a great idea. After getting our luggage, we were in our room within 30 minutes. The hotel was clean and the staff was fantastic. We then added the second night to our stay before our cruise. Also, various car rental companies were within in walking distance from the hotel.

My family has a cat and a dog and we have been living at the hotel for a month and a half. Among that time we have gotten to know much of the staff on a first name basis. Every morning we are greeted by some of the nicest staff at the front desk, Chelae and Mena. Those two can do anything you ask including letting our family check out after normal check out times. Our housekeeping service was very good we meet several of the employees in that department also.
