Grace was our regular for several weeks she was nice and everything was always done very nice and she was great with the animals. Another maid we had was Sonia Pagaza, she came to us later in our stay but was just was determined and would bend over backwards to get you anything you needed. She is such a hard worker for being a single parent and takes her job seriously. One day when I went to breakfast, I had David as my waiter. It came time for the bill and I surrendered my meal vouchers but when I looked in my purse I noticed my wallet was not in there. I told David this and I promised to leave him a tip for the excellent service the next day. It surprised me that he just brushed it off like it was nothing. He is defiantly a benefit to the hotel.

Great staff. The service is great. They really make you feel at home. Could use a remodle in the guest rooms though. And also more "healthy " items on the menu in the restaurant. Since there are so many millitary familys staying here 4 extended periods of time, Many with small children it would be nice if there were a playground.

First of all...Doesn't there appear to be some level of Plush and Clean with the title "Plaza"? First off, the desk attendant gave us the wrong place to go upon arrival at the airport, so we missed the shuttle. The other one arrived 30 minutes later and she acted like we made the mistake. We were given the "last room", so no Delta Employee or AAA discount...so she gives us a room, then upon giving us directions to that room changes it to another room. Here is another thing...This is not a "Hotel", but in every aspect a MOTEL. The ground level rooms are 2 feet from the parked cars bumpers and the 2nd level rooms are over the highway. Yes, you here every tire and every car as they drive pass.The room door opened to a wall of animal urine. I sell homes for a living and I know cat pee. This room had to have been the room of every ferel cat on Oahu. I called the front desk from the room. with the door open, breathing through my mouth, so as to not make my lungs collapse. Guess what? We now can move to another available room...this one has been layered with carpet powder deodorizer, so the chemical perfume overpowers the animal smell and uncleanliness of the room.For $169.00 this is a Total and Complete Rip Off!I've paid less on the other islands and had The Continental or Hyatt Regency effect compared to this . Fares should be $86 and should all come with warnings for those who don't live with animal peeing in their homes.

We stayed here a bit over a month. We are military so it was nice to have had a great staff during our LONG stay. Friendly staff. Front Desk Charae and Mena ,the shuttle driver Frank, the house keeper Tessie and all the restaurant staff was always ready to make you feel at home.

We had a OK room for 1 Night, and even though the hotel is very glose to the airport, we heard no noise from airplanes.The walters at the breakfast restaurant were slow and some were very bad at English.When checkning out we were presented for a parking fee at USD 25, Weichel no One had told us abolut at our arrival; the lady in the reception were completely indifferent abolut this and just turned her back at us as we made a novice of this

We needed a convenient overnight stay on our route from Los Angeles to Sydney. The free shuttle was a breeze and the hotel was literally just a couple minutes away. We arrived around 9:30pm and the hotel restaurant would be closing so our shuttle driver offered to take us to an adjacent hotel with restaurant service and offered to pick us back up -- how gracious of him! We declined, as we'd eaten on the plane. Our room was clean and comfortable. We needed to be back at the airport around 6:15AM and there is a free shuttle every 30 minutes -- everything went smooth as silk. If spending several days in Hawaii on vacation we would choose a fancier hotel, however for the airport access this was great.

Stayed here for one night, was expecting not much but, the beds were comfy, the room was quiet modern, the staff were friendly, the shuttle too and from airport is free. Overall all gamble payed off very impressed. Would recommend for a couple nights.

We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and Pearl Harbor. We saw (what we hope) were ants in the bathroom and on the desk. Anytime I see any type of bugs in hotels I can't help but wonder what bugs we aren't seeing! There is a city bus pick up/drop off right outside the hotel and we took it to Waikiki Beach one afternoon. It was $2.50 per person but I would NOT recommend doing this to Waikiki Beach. It took almost an hour because we stopped every 100 feet. We walked around Waikiki until after sunset then took a taxi back to the hotel. However, taking it to Pearl Harbor was very easy and economical. It was just a few stops away and only $10 for us to travel there and back.

OK. Granted. I didn't want to be here. I'd just come from a 4.5 star hotel. I was stuck in the airport and on a plane for 12+ hours. I just wanted to be home in my own bed. Flight delays left me stranded on Oahu, and I was put up at the Best Western Plaza. It's better than sleeping at the airport...I'll give it that. Situated under/next to Nimitz Highway, this is a NOISY location. It's close to the airport and I guess that's one of its big selling points. The staff were nice and seeing as I was stranded without a bag, they kindly gave me a toothbrush and toothpaste. It was 9 pm when I arrived...starving. I was informed their restaurant hadn't been open all day, and I could walk to the drive-in around the corner or ride the shuttle van to their 'sister' property. After dropping my carry-on in my room, I went back to the lobby only to be informed the restaurant at their sister property was not open. Since this is a review of the hotel, I won't go into details about the restaurant around the corner except to say it was a little creepy walking there alone. My room was, thankfully, on the backside of the hotel...further away from the highway. Although all signs indicated it was a non-smoking room, the room reeked of stale cigarette smoke. The carpet was stained. The sink had a dripping faucet and a piece that kept falling off every time I attempted to use it. I immediately turned off the a/c (too noisy and cold). Seeing as my room was on the second floor, I briefly considered sleeping with the sliding door open. Two things made me reconsider: First, the door to my room looked as though it might have been kicked in at some point in its life and the security bolt on the sliding door made me feel as though I wasn't in the safest of areas. Second, smokers tended to congregate in the area outside my sliding door and it was pretty clear the smoke would just blow right into my room. That said, I slept closed up in my room. I was thankful for the coffee maker. The microwave, although I didn't use it, was a nice addition to the room. The bed seemed clean and that was the most important thing; however, the room felt shabby. If I could give half stars, I would have rated this place 2.5.

This hotel is great if you want to be close to the airport and that is it. Our room was right beside the freeway and crawling with ants. When we complained about the ants they gave us a can of raid. No offer of a room change. The noise from the freeway was incredible. If you do have to stay there try to get a room in the tower.

Just stayed overnight. Resturant, bar, and shops available. Resturant was good and service was great. Rooms are ok...kinda old, but clean and well kept. They have regular shuttle service to the airport and are on time.

My husband and I were on our way to Australia with a one night stop over in Honolulu. We booked the Best Western using our points because it was close to the airport but yet accessible to the beach. The staff was very accommodating and despite the fact that our room wasn't ready when we arrived too early, were able to get us into another room with the same amenities. We had a lovely stay there.

My appreciation to Cynthia, Menna, and Rose at the front desk for their helpful and friendly service. Also thanks to the housekeeping staff that kept the room clean and comfortable. Much thanks for your aloha during my return visit to Oahu and the use of the room. H. B.

I booked this hotel because we were overnighting in Honolulu before flying out to Hilo the following morning. It served the purpose but the hotel was very tired, do not get a room on the freeway side it is very noisy.

I am writing this review because I read many reviews about this hotel that I feel did not do this hotel justice. My room and the staff at this hotel were excellent. The Location for the airport as well as ease to get to Waikiki Beach area is also great (Waikiki 45 minutes using "The Bus").Checked-in our room at 4 PM. Our room was on the corner of the building on the eleventh floor. Very large room with lots of windows and very clean. The view from our room over the city and harbor was fantastic. --The only issue for some might be the highways that run below that can be heard all night, but we sleep with a fan at home and this noise did not bother us at all.-- The room had a refrigerator, ironing board, iron, blow dryer, shampoo, body lotion and three bars of soap which I used. Also had a coffee pot, two chairs and desk. The airport shuttle leaves the hotel on the hour and half past the hour as advertised. We took the 5 AM shuttle to the airport with no problem. We were at our gate in less than 10 minutes from the airport and our gate was the last gate (United Airlines) at the airport.The night before leaving Honolulu we rode the city bus (The Bus) to Ala Moana shopping center on the north side of Waikiki. Several other guest at the bus stop were going to Wakiki beach area from the Best Western also. The bus was very easy to use and there was a bus stop in front of the Best Western Hotel. Coming back to the Best Western was just a matter of choosing a bus route number that had the Airplane symbol next to the route number on the front of the bus. Once I started seeing the car rental lots south of the Best Western I started looking for our hotel and pulled the cable in the bus to signal that I wanted to get off the bus. New to me because I am not familiar with how the bus system works because I am from a small town in Kansas. Across the street northwest of the hotel were several strip mall type fast food eating places less than two blocks away. We ate at Byron's next to the Best Western, but it is going out of business soon. Too bad because their food was excellent, but the other places looked good too. Also, United Airlines overbooked our flight an offerred a nice compensation for 6 passengers to take a later flight. We took the compensation and called the Best Western after we had checked out of our hotel and asked if we could get our room back to sleep three more hours before our rebooked flight. They let us have the room untill noon with no problem. Yes, I will be staying several nights at this hotel during my next visit to Waikiki / Honolulu. Price is much better than the Waikiki Beach hotels that I used and has more room.Thanks Best Western The Plaza Hotel for a great stay.RSW

Hotel was adequate, clean, a little noisy. Parking is challenging, you can drop your Enterprise rental at the hotel, very convenient. No coffee in lobby, no free breakfast. Not a Resort, don'e expect resort services.

For what it is, it’s good. The place is well used, but comfortable. They do have laundry on site though a bit pricy and the restaurant menu is also on the expensive side and leaves a bit to be desired. And the all no smoking rooms really bug me. I know it makes good business sense these days but takes no consideration of people who has movability problems for whatever reason. The staff makes up for any downside. At the front desk look for Cherae, Rose, Mena, and Cheryl. If you need ANY thing they can help. Rose even helped with a stolen phone and Cherae has this infectious smile first thing in the morning that just gets you going. In the restaurant you have Gemma, and Michael is the best. You only have to dine once and he’ll remember you the next. You couldn’t pay me to give up our housekeeping lady Amalia. Within two days she was making sure the kids favorite stuffed animals were on the right beds and even made ours with my favorite quilt we had brought with us. I would stay here again.
user_location: Somewhere in the middle of an ocean

review_body: Needed a room close to the airport as came in from the Big Island late evening and had early morning flight. Had booked well in advance and asked for a quite room away from the freeway but was more or less laughed at. Had an avrage night's sleep and the noise early AM from the freeway literally metres from the window was unpleasant. Don't think there is much choice near the airport anyway - ask for a quite room and good luck....

The Plaza is conveniently located a mile or two from Honolulu's airport, which is of great convenience if you have an early flight in the morning. It has a 24-hour diner walking distance and a coffee shop also a few short blocks away. The main detraction are the elevated highways that nearly surround the Plaza; I don't think any of the rooms escape the roar of traffic, which never ceases. They do offer a convenient shuttle to the airport.

We are a military family of 6 (plus one on the way) who PCS'd to Hawaii. I would recommend any and all families to stay here while waiting for a house or looking for a place. Everyone from the staff at the front desk to the maintenance, restaurant staff and housekeepers are always nice, helpful, and make you feel right at home. Tysie & Mercy were our housekeepers and always made us feel super welcome. We see them every day and they always greet us with a smile and treat us like family. They really go above and beyond. Same for the ladies at the front desk too. One great thing about this hotel for military is their TLA program. Les is wonderfully helpful and such a valuable source of information while trying to figure out how to navigate the TLA/PCS process. They also offer a promisary note system, free parking and meal vouchers (pet rooms are available too) for the military PCS'ing and staying here. Definately give him a call and he will help you out! :)This hotel is one of two they own. The Ohana is the second. I highly recommend the Best Western over the Ohana. The Best Western had free internet (wifi), flat screen tv's, and free computer access in the lobby. There is also a shuttle between the two properties. If you are military and get the handy dandy meal vouchers, then you will love the restaurant here. We have been eating at both for a while now and strongly prefer the Best Western over the Ohana. The food here at the Best Western is better by far. The Ohana not so much. The wait staff here at the Best Western is the best as well. After only eating here 2 days they knew our preferences and were able to anticipate our wants/needs. The refridgerators and microwaves are a wonderful resource to have for breakfast or lunch type meals. The rooms are spacious so you have enough space to go to the store (recommend the commissary) and stock up to save money on meal costs. I really love how they have 2 connecting rooms available for the larger families. That was a huge plus for us when we were looking for places to stay in between. I could certainly go on and on about how this hotel is the best for the transitioning family! If I absolutely had to find something wrong to suggest something about this hotel, I would suggest that the rooms have a dvd player and the parking have a bit more room. If the hotel had a fitness center for early morning PT that would be great too but I hear they are working on that. There is tons of parking available always. That is nice to have here where parking can be limited at places. Overall, STAY HERE! Don't go anywhere else. You will wish you were here with all the wonderful amenities and friendly staff they have!!Oh, as far as noise complaints due to being conveniently located right by the highway, if you've ever lived in a city then the noise really doesn't bother you because it's normal city noise.

This is not what you might expect in Hawaii--the hotel is located in a warehouse district next to an elevated freeway. Even my "quiet room" was very noisy. The hotel staff was nice, the restaurant was busy (although I did not eat there).

The first time we stayed here we of course enjoyed the upgraded king suite with its' big bathroom, great space and views of Diamond Head. We had the standard king the second time and just this past week, as well. We chose to stay here because we had a pleasant stay the first two times and of the convenience of hopping on the freeway to visit family who are within 15 minutes from the airport. Our room was on the tenth floor with views of the mountains. As in previous stays, housekeeping services and front desk were accommodating and friendly. So why only a 2 star this time?Granted this room was only a standard king, but in much need of TLC. Two of three lamp shades could not be 'affixed' and were lopsided because the screw-in attachment was brokenoff or stripped. The table leg had a major vertical crack that they attempted to fix with two screws. Adjustment on shower head was poor. Okay, so door jambs do get dinged up from suitcases, etc, but major dinging needs some major painting.The plus side: Comfortable beds; nearby eateries that are walking distance. Starbucks, bbq, Big Kahuna pizza (gotta try their kalua pork pizza...awesome!), Byron's drive-in (open 24 hrs).There are only two hotels at the airport and after this third stay it is sad to say that we're surprised that the city, who is pro-tourism, does not offer a higher-end airport hotel. Especially because the airport is easy access to the North Shore area and Waikiki.

We stayed here twice this year when we needed to have an easy ride to the airport. The staff are somewhat abrupt but the rooms are clean, the 24 hr shuttle is free, and you can walk to Pearl Harbor. There is a small store on site and Starbucks across the street.

As this was our first trip to Hawaii and we were on a budget we booked this hotel. When I read some of the reviews I was concerned. We had an enjoyable stay in a King Deluxe Room (Corner Room). We found the room to be clean and the room comfortable. I was pleased with the Free Internet. While the hotel wasn't the nicest hotel we have stayed in I would recommend it for those wanting to be near the airport and/or on a budget. My only complaint was the $25.00 per day parking charge which wasn't mentioned at all on the Best Western Website. We found free parking on the street near the hotel and utilized it.

We flew from Maui to Honolulu, and had a very early flight to Sydney the next morning, so decided to stay for 1 night at the Best Western Plaza so that we were near the airport. We had a Deluxe King room, and it was huge ! Room was clean, had the basics - a fridge and coffee making machine, hair dryer in the bathroom. There was a nice sushi place for dinner within walking distance (Ninja Sushi), and Byron's diner next door for a yummy pumpkin pie type dessert. The hotel offers free shuttle bus transfers to and from the airport - ex hotel to airport departs every half hour. The guy that drove the shuttle bus (sorry, can't remember his name !) was very friendly and helpful with our extra heavy bags, which were full of shopping by the end of our trip. Was interesting to see another area other than Waikiki - felt like we were mixing it with the locals. Only thing is there was no in-room safe, and no off switch for the air-con. We were in the main tower and didn't have a problem with traffic noise etc (the hotel is pretty much situated right on the highway), There are some other rooms which back onto the pool - not sure what standard these are, but I think they might be a bit noisier. Also, a very big thank you to Lance who helped us with many pre-trip email questions and suggestions!

My husband is military and when we arrived in HI the post hotel was booked so they placed us here. We were both weary of staying in a civilian hotel because since we are military we would be staying there a LONG time and we have special paper work that we have to have every 10 days. When we arrived the staff new exactly what to do and made the whole process very easy on us. The maid, Annie, was very friendly and understanding of our situation. I usually feel awkward when I have a maid service since I am so used to cleaning up after myself but she made me feel very at home. So far me and my husband have been here for a little over a month. I do wish that they could implement some things that would make a longer stay more comfortable, such a suite style rooms with a full fridge instead of just a mini fridge and more space to place clothing and personal items.

Traveling with a 6 and 9 year old, and with a flight departure time of midnight, we were searching for an affordable and convenient option to rest and get some sleep prior to our long return trip home. Based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, the Plaza Hotel seemed to be the best option, and pretty much you get what you pay for. Yes, the hotel is close to the airport (about 10 minutes away on their free shuttle bus). The rooms are small and satisfactorily clean (although pillows and beds did have some residual odors). The other hotel guests are colorful, although not scary.The hotel is built practically UNDER the freeway and the walls are somewhat thin, so it is somewhat noisy, but overall, it's a decent option compared to waiting in the actual airport. Would I want to stay here overnight? No. But I would recommend it for someone who didn't want to spend lots of money or rent a car and had time to spare between flights? Yes.Food options are limited at this hotel. They do serve dinner on some nights, but you can also get some pizza delivered (or walk to a nearby strip mall to pick one up).

We have stayed at many Best Western Hotels over the last 10 years and we've had very positive experiences. This Best Western Honolulu Airport location was not as it appears in the photographs. The check-in staff were surly and not apologetic as they stated there were no queen or king beds available yet we had made reservations for 2 rooms (queen or king bed) back in July 25, 2012. When we insisted, they found one room with a King for our 2-nights stay but only a double for my sister and husband for their 1 night stay. Our door key-cards would not work, meant a trip back down in the only working elevator to be recoded. Our King room was on the top floor right beside the freeway ramp. The cars/buses/motorcycles were whizzing by and actually rattling the windows. Back down in the elevator to ask for another room and surprise, the new room (6th floor) had a queen bed (which the surly staff had earlier stated, there were none) and thankfully was much quieter. Unfortunately, the bathtub and shower were unacceptable.The tub drain was plugged and would not empty plus the shower head was partially blocked. Mildew on the grout and shower/bath seams, under the edges of the badly stained bath rubber piece which should have been securely adhered to the bottom of the tub and rusty tub fixtures. The room was fairly clean, but aged furniture, wallpaper and in need of a facelift. The one great experience we had with this location was our dining experience. The attached dining area provided a welcoming and attentive staff, many meal choices and well prepared/presented entrees. I recommend if you have valid complaints on any hotel, contact their head office while you are still in the hotel so the issues can be addressed /corrected while you are there to enjoy them. The Best Western has a good reputation and wants to keep it.

Nice hotel - you will need a car if you stay here. No bar in hotel and restaurant is open only on certain days for dinner. Hotel is clean and rooms are nice and large and breakfast is pretty good. Only really bad thing is be careful as the gift shop may cheat you on prices. They took the price tag of something our friends were buying and upped the price on them - really illegal especially since we had purchased the same thing the day before.

This hotel serves the purpose of short overnight stays as you are traveling through the Honolulu airport - that is all! There are 3 hotels close by the airport, this one had the best reviews. I can't imagine what the other hotels were like if this was the best reviewed!! But it serves it's purpose.The freeway was built very close to on top of this old hotel. Outside the front entrance you can look up and practically be underneath the freeway onramp. We had a corner room which was clean, decent size and looked newly redecorated. It was very noisy from the freeway and air conditioning. We had asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel but by the time we checked in they only had a few rooms available. I don't really think there is a quiet part of the hotel anyway. There was a small microwave and fridge. The tub/shower had the newer style rounded shower rod but there were black spots of mold along the grouting. The king size mattress was by far the softest, least supportive mattress I've ever had the displeasure to sleep on. You can sit on the edge and almost slide off! We did eat at the restaurant for breakfast. It was ok, the fruit was fresh and food ok. We left thinking at least we aren't hungry to start the day. The staff is pretty indifferent to the guests, interacting when they need to but don't go out of their way to acknowledge you. I would think the staff is just in survival mode having to work in that environment all day, every day. Bottom line: if you stay there bring ear plugs, ask for a newly renovated room and move on quickly! We were there less than 10 hours and I couldn't wait to leave and take my headache with me! Next time I find myself with a short layover in Honolulu I would seriously analyze the time lost and hassle of staying downtown or staying close to the airport and not sleeping anyway! There is a small swimming pool in a courtyard area, even out there it was too noisy to enjoy the pool.

Do NOT be fooled by the professional photos posted on this hotels website. This facility is the grungy brown building in the front. Dirty and Disgusting. Rooms looks as though they have been 'renovated' by someone trapped in the 80's, using second-hand materials and wallpaper (which was peeling off the walls). Air-conditioning is loud and messy; power cords held together with electrical tape. Our door did not work, leaving our bags and belonging (including passports) trapped inside the room while we were forced to wait outside for maintenance to show up. Do yourself a favour and find some place else to stay.

Decent Hotel near airport. People were nice and place was clean. Best of all it was easy to get into airport for early flight. Free Internet.Not a vacation venue, area is commercial. Good for a quick overnight prior to flight.

I booked with Hotwire and was told this would be a three star hotel. It is not 3 stars and is only 2 stars. I was ripped off! Hotel is old and has noisy air conditioning. Windows do not seal and there was wind noise all night. Trade winds are normal in Hawaii and it was not unusually windy. Waste of money. The photo of the hotel looks to be another hotel and even though the website says it has been renovated??, maybe painted only? Tired and old! Only good part was courtious and efficient shuttle driver. Waste of money.

We stayed one night after a late night arrival and early morning flight to Maui the next day. Finding the courtesy telephones on exiting the arrivals hall was quickly sorted. The shuttle drivers were really great and accommodating - the free service is appreciated. The hotel is located in a noisy spot right by a motorway overpass but our room faced the airport so we didn't get disturbed by noise. The lobby was pleasant, though dated, the staff friendly, but on our arrival there were a few wacky characters (didn't appear to be guests) hanging around the lobby. The room was really generously sized, the bed super comfy and the free wifi excellent. The only thing was the air con didn't have an off switch so we had to listen to it making noise all night long. Would stay again if transiting through overnight.

Old and tired and LOUD. Between the freeway traffic (dear BW, haven't you heard of double pane windows), the airport, the buzzy fridge and the walls made of newspaper and spit, it was deafening.But - it was clean, the shuttle was free, the internet was free and there's some decent food options about a block away. And at $126/night with AAA discount, the price was right. Probably won't do it again, but the price was right for just one night. Hey, it's not a resort -- it's a place to crash for one night because flight schedules didn't mesh.

Directly at some elevated highways, due to thin glas, very noisy. Take earplugs.Quite expensive also.Staff rather unfriendly. Forgot to give us vouchers for breakfast. When we asked, first reply was "continental breakfast is not for free"; checking our reservation cleared things up. Friendly and helpful drivers. There are free phones in arrival halls at airport to call hotel for free shuttle bus pickup.Pool is quite old and well, noisy. so forget about relaxing. Taxi to Waikiki are 35 USD; bus would stop close to hotel for USD 2,5.free WLAN

In a word, our family's stay at this Best Western was disappointing. The furniture in room was old and scratched. The bathroom/shower had no exhaust fan. A queen sized bed would be expected but only a double bed was furnished.The refrigerator was very tiny and in an out-of-the-way location in the room. No breakfast was offered. At the rate of $192.00/night/3 people, I will not go there again.

I stayed 3 nights at the BW Plaza in Mid September. I chose this knowing it was an airport hotel/ motel and not a resort. My daughter is stationed on Oahu and was being promoted to CPO. I wanted to be there and have as little impact on her as possible. The prompt and courteous airport shuttle service made this possible. The clientele appears to be mostly transient military. The staff and guests were friendly. The pool was a little on the chilly side for this Florida native, but certainly acceptable and clean. A little heavy on the chlorine, but that's to be expected. The surrounding area seems to be safe and I had no problem wandering about. The choice of nearby restaurants is lacking. I did have breakfast at the Plaza. I thought it was a little expensive, but this is in Honolulu and everything seems expensive. While situated right on a major highway, I did not notice any disturbing external noise. The free WiFi was high speed with a steady flow. I saw folks booking in at all hours of the day without issue. Parking was free for registered guests. Location was convenient for pick up and drop off from my daily excursions. There were no hassles at all and it was a very easy trip for a whirlwind weekend.

Stayed one night in the Best Western The Plaza Hotel before flying home.When we arrived at around 1 pm, one room was ready and the next room was beeing cleaned.(We had booked two rooms since we where 4 people traveling.)Nice beds to sleep in, air conditioning was working ok, but in one of the rooms the plastic from the control was loose, but after some fideling we also got that one to run.The hotel is very close to the highway, so there are some noise from there, but not as much as I expected after reading the initial reviews (with window closed of course)Beds was very comfortable, and also the bathroom was in a good condition (nothing to complain about here)The hotell is very close to a gas station, fast food place, and after an additional 5-10 min walk there was a very good Big Kauna Pizza place (together with a mini mart and some other restaurants).We did not use the pool (but it looked cozy) nor the restaurant.The hotel has a small minimart of its own which has most basic stuff you can need during your stay.And the free shuttle from and to the airport was very good. (Even though the luggage handling was a bit cramped when the shuttle was loaded to its max capacity).

makes this excellent for late night arrival, regrouping, general travel fatigue sitting next to those billion horsepowered engines, I walked fifteen minutes to shake out middle seat, straight-jacket syndrome on a 6 hour flight (the longest allowed anywhere over water for start-finish flights) arriving over the darkest waters. Standard older time fittings but sleep and air coming-in the suicide window too tight for anything but a nose, yummy air.

Best Western the Plaza was our home for 11-days after moving to Hawaii from Virginia! The entire staff was awesome. Housekeeping was quick, efficient, and pleasant. The front desk staff (Rose and everyone else...EVERYONE!) was proactive. Immedidately on check-in they realized I should be in a lower room rate with extra benefits that I was not signed up for and they immediately shifted me to the correct benefits package. The restaurant staff was phenomenal. Quick service with a smile and great advice about living in Hawaii. If you are military, Les Nishimura is a hotel military liasion that will help you with any questions about benefits and hotel options. This hotel is clean, close to Joint Base Pearl Harbor Hickam and other areas, and avoids the tourist areas if you are trying to relocate in a more peaceful and accessible environment.

Arrived late off international flight. Comp airport service is great. Arrived to room to find TV did not work. Had to unplug alarm clock to plug in coffee maker. Felt like a shortage of power outlets and it was an inconvenience to turn something on. Great for if you want something convenient and basic.

We were greeted by a friendly driver after a tiring 10 hour flight from Manila. He helped us with our luggage and gave us the ride to the hotel, We only had to wait about 5-6 minutes after picking up our luggage.. The room was nice size and comfortable and clean. The staff friendly and welcoming. Our room did overlook the highway but the noise was not bad at all.

I made reservations months ahead of time. I had one day alone in Honolulu after my sister headed home. I was a little concerned about the reviews but I just wanted a place to rest after a long busy week that had an airport shuttle. I had a room at the back on the 12th floor. I thought I was finished with the beautiful views but I was high enough to see waikiki with diamond head behind and also see the ocean. Yes if I looked straight down it was commercial but not dark or dirty or scarey. Just businesses. Best Western has a stay late option so I stayed in the comfort of my room with a nice view and a flat screen Tv until time to leave for my flight home. The room was clean. The carpet looked new. The bed was comfy with lovely sheets. The bathroom was spotless with all the usual amenities including a coffee pot. May not be a great location for your whole vacation but one night was great.

the hotel is average, but once we came back from dinner there were geckos in the room. No idea how they got in. Horrible location, right next to the highway, and a sketchy neighborhood. food was all right. the shuttle bus driver was so nice though. only staying for one night was too much for me

My sincere thanks to Beau and Cynthia at the front desk for their fantastic service. They were very understanding about some unexpected requirements that came up during my stay and helped me alot. The staff really try hard to help you with whatever you need. Its got some very useful amenities (free internet, coin laundry). I was in town doing work at a military facility close by and it was perfect for me. The hotel is very quiet internally despite being next to Nimitz Hwy and I got great sleeps.

I was traveling for business and I'm never sure about my accommodations until a few days before, normally we use a hotel in Waikiki so I was a bit disappointed when I learned I'd be at an airport hotel. I was pleasantly surprised though. I had a wonderful experience and I learned a valuable lesson-service trumps location. Sure it's nice to be right in the center of bustling Waikiki but at check- in Rose helped me with logistics, from car rentals to the local bus schedule. And I realized I wasn't even that far away. The hotel was quaint and quiet which is actually something you don't get when staying at any of the hotels in Waikiki. It's pretty centrally located with all the amenities I needed near by, such as a Starbucks, great local food, etc. Rose at the front desk gave me a personal map to fit all my needs. She was extrordinary, patient and kind. Frank, the shuttle driver was also excellent. I needed his services to get me back and forth to the airport daily during my stay, he was so pleasant and showed me where everything was. Their professionalism was unparomount. Real Aloha, very refreshing. You could tell they both loved their jobs. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. It's a little piece of real Hawaii! Many thanks to both Rose and Frank.

First off, the front desk staff and shuttle bus driver is friendly. We checked into our hotel room and noticed that paint was peeling off the ceiling as well as mold in the bathroom. During our stay, we called the operator for a request and a male operator answered. He was very rude and kept repeating the same response in a monotone voice. This hotel is a bit pricey though.Recommended only for a 1 night emergency stay for couples.

In summary-great free and fast and friendly shuttle service -basic and clean and spacious bedrooms-VERY quite considering its on a mega busy road and near the air port. -watched planes take off and land from our window. -People with pets stay in a separate building which is a win situation as I'm not pet friendly person in terms of hygiene . Relaxing night before flying out from Hawaii .

I can only speak from my experience as a Soldier PCSing to Hawaii and staying here on TLA, but that experience has been excellent. I highly recommend that you stay here if you cannot find accomodations on an installation. All military staying here or at sister hotel will deal with Les, the military liason and he is a pro and wil make sure that you are properly taken care of.The room is clean with new furiture and flat screen TV. These are better accomodations that some of the older hotels down on Waikiki beach (which cost much more).The location is convient for getting to all of the major installations on the south side of the island (I think they are all within 5 miles). However, you are not within walking distance of anything exciting so you either have to rent a car or take the bus (they have a really great transit system here.)Free parking and free WIFI are also a huge plus because you will pay anywhere from $15 to $30 a night for parking in Waikiki. Internet if not free can cost around $45 at the weekly rate or $10 a day! Quite the rip-off.Bottom line, great hotel and staff.

Staff were very friendly and helpful. It's closely located to the airport and has a free shuttle to and fro. We stayed for one night on our way home and thought it was of a good standard. rooms large with good amenities and free wifi. Bit noisy as close to the road. Only real complaint was a very noisy air on which we couldn't seem to turn off as part of a central air con system. Not much around in terms of dining, we ate at the sister hotel which a shuttle was provided to and that was fine. Did have a good little convenience store.

Cherae is a wonderful worker who is always greeting us with a smile and already knew our name on the morning after arrival. We are here for an extended stay and they have been so kind and helpful to us.

We stayed at The Best Western Plaza Hotel for 40 days and had the best experience!! Everyone was very welcoming and helpful! Rose, one of the hostess at the front desk really was terrific and always greeted everyone with a smile! She was very helpful with directions, activities, diners etc. any questions you had she could answer them! Thanks The LeBarons

Stayed here for one night only prior to our departure from Hawaii. The first problem wasa few hours before we checked out when we asked the front desk if they could store our bags so that we could do a bit of shopping before our flight which was 6 hours away. The 'wonderful', lady on the front desk then told us it would cost us another $75 dollars as we would have to pay for a later checkout time!! $75 to store our bags?? We weren't even going to be there!! All that this 'wonderful' lady had to say to it was "oh well, at least you will be able to have a nice hot shower after your shopping" What the??!! We made a phonecall to the manager and he told us to stay the entire day at no extra cost which would have been excellent if he had told the front desk, so more hassles about cost when we checked out for good. We later went back to our room after shopping and we had been locked out of it!!!! Another trip to the front desk! The 2nd problem was ordering breakfast. We showed ourselves to our seats as none of the staff bothered, sat down and waited. And waited. No menu to peruse, so we waited some more before one of us got up went to a staff member and asked for one. The breakfast was really small and we are not even big eaters. I asked for the cereal and fruit and a tiny little bowl of rice crispies (honestly approx 7 spoonfuls) came along with a tiny serving of fruit (about another 8 cubes!). My husband asked for the cooked breakfast and had 3 slices of sausage on his plate, an egg and 2 tiny tomatoes, fried. It was expensive. We were still hungry so we walked to the local supermarket and bought extra. On the good side, the beds were comfortable (although there was dried food on the floor between the bed and the bedside table). The bathroom was okay, but the bath was a little rusty and the bottom of the bathroom door was warped from being wet and hard to shut, no jug, only a coffee maker which you had to use in the bathroom, the hairdryer was ok, the fridge was very handy to have and the tv was good. Very noisy as it is directly under and next to the highway, but we had ear plugs when sleeping so it was okay. The convenience to the airport is great and is what you obviously pay for as it's only a 5-minute journey, the man driving us there and dealing with our bags was friendly and helpful - much more so than the front desk. The internet that we used in the lobby was good. Just a shame about the service on the front desk, it could be improved a lot!

staff are very warm, professional, pleasant, and knowledgable. i came to best western on military orders while looking for permanent housing and was overjoyed by the friendliness and helpfulness of staff during my transitioning. they answered all my questions and were willing to take the extra time to direct me to local cuisine and events in the area. even more surprising, the lobby staff had made it a point to remember my name after only a few days lodging. rooms were kept clean without any incidents and the restaurant serve good food with even better service from the waiters and waitresses. i would only recommend they have a little more variety on there menu only because i've stayed here for 2 weeks but overall, i can't complain. 5 stars!!!

The staff here has been so helpful and so nice. im so glad we have been staying here they have helped with everything from paperwork to road trips and more! they are so kind and our whole expierience has been alot more pleasant because weve had their help mahalo best western!!

Close to the airport. Very helpful reception staff, good breakfast. We only stayed one night after long journey from the UK. The Hotel we very helpful in arranging shuttle to ship next morning. Rooms large and good bathrooms.

Let me start by staying I stayed at this hotel with my mother my very first night in Hawaii. Our plane had been delayed hours, and we had been traveling over a day. We were dead. It made more sense to stay somewhere close to the airport since we were flying out to the Big Island early the next morning. That being said, we were awake enough to be shocked by our surroundings. The hotel is located UNDER a massive freeway. You will hear it...see it...smell it....don't expect to get away from it. The rooms are standard (perhaps substandard....it depends on what class of hotel you are used to staying in). Double, generic beds... there were a couple small holes in our sheets. Tacky, stereotypical Hawaiian ukeleles and flowered patterns for curtains and framed pictures in the room. The shower seemed nice, considering (but that's probably not saying much considering I would have bathed in a watering hole had that been my only option). The elevators were covered with what looked like heavy blue blankets (hanging on the walls) for some inexplicable reason. There was a small shop downstairs, a gift shop, that sold a variety of goods. The food was insanely expensive, even for Hawaii. One little cardboard carton of milk (you know, the small individual size like in school lunches) was $2.50! Don't even get me started on the cereal. We even found they stocked expired chap stick! I will say that I bought a great pair of sunglasses there, that I still own to this day and wear everywhere, despite their exotic bight blue and yellow hues. I will also give credit to this hotel's pool. While very small, it was clean. I never actually got in it, but I did eat my breakfast laying out by the pool, and it was easily the best thing about the hotel. Another pro is that it is located near the airport (not within walking distance though, mind you, as one man tried to tell us...) and they have a convenient airport shuttle. Ultimately, this place is DOABLE if you are here for a business trip and will not be in the room much, or need a place to crash for a few hours before your flight leaves. If you are looking to travel to Hawaii (leisure trip) and don't want to spend a fortune.....keep looking. This is not the place. This may be cheap, but it certainly isn't showcasing Hawaii and it's in the middle of nowhere. There are other hotels that are affordable that still offer a pleasant experience. If you can't afford Waikiki, check out Kanoehe, the North Shore, etc. Oahu has better.Good luck with your search!

Very close to the airport, friendly staff and good services. Make sure you book breakfast, if not it is quite expensive and the nearest place to buy food is a gas station and drive thru place. The hotel only offers dinner during the weekends but has a small store where you can buy food to prepare it in your rooms. The bed was really comfortable and bathroom very clean.

Airport shuttle was quick and convenient. We just had a one night layover before continuing on to another island. I read the reviews and decided this one looked like the best of the three options in this area. I called them directly and was able to get a corporate rate which was considerably less than the published rate. The front staff were very polite.The lobby is a typical 3*, but small. The elevators are old, and the entire place looks like its been here since WW2. The room is sparsly furnished. We had a king bed, and comfort level was about 4/10. Pillows are horrible and lumpy. Little square things and only 2 per person. There were no extra pillows or blankets in the room. The thermostat was fixed and could not be changed. I'm sensitive to a/c and prefer my room to be a bit warmer. It was however, a comfortable sleeping temp, but I didn't like the a/c blowing on me all night. This place is a firetrap with wiring. The plugins look old and worn. When I went to plug in my electronics there was a spark and a zap. I suspect the wiring is very dated and looking for trouble. The bathroom is so tiny, you can't even sit down on the toilet properly because the door is either right beside you, or you have to squeeze between the toilet and the sink to close the door. Few pics on the wall. Ugly green carpeting and the rooms and walls definitely need a paint job. This hotel is right by a major highway, so even though we were on the 7th floor, we heard highway noise all night. Overall, we got about 4 hours of sleep.The restaurant (actually a coffee shop) is horribly overpriced. $14 for breakfast or $31 for weekend buffet. You can walk down the street to a fabulous diner and get meals for under $5 (by the Chevron station); or walk across the street from the Chevron and there is a plaza that includes Starbucks, a sushi restaurant, and a Hawaiian BBQ restaurant. We chose the latter and had burger and fries for 2 for $12. Breakfast of spam and eggs runs around $3 pp. I'm sure there are other places in the area, but that's all the time we had to explore.I noted that the city buses stop right close to the hotel, so that would be a bonus for people not wanting to rent a car.I noted that the army puts their people up here, so I guess its adequate for them.Personally I will never stay here again. I'll take my chances and try the other potential fleabags in the area. This hotel is very overpriced for what you get. They have a lot of nerve charging what they do. It should only be charging about $59 for the quality. But this is Honolulu. BTW, you are nowhere near any beaches. This is an industrial part of town.

It was my first time staying in Hawaii for a couple of days and needed to be close to the airport. I made my reservations online and the price was reasonable. All we needed was a place to stay for a few days, reasonable price, close to the airport, there were a few restaurants nearby - so finding food wasn't a problem. You want something simple and convenient - this is the place to go. The front desk is always smiling and willing to help. The shuttle bus comes every 30 mins - we waited less time than that. My family enjoyed our stay!!! We left happy, when we return going back to the states, I didn't think we would need a hotel, but our flight got delayed and it was an 16 hour wait. I called to booked a room, in less than 20 mins, the shuttle was there to pick us up. No complaints here! Thanks Best Western!

We stayed here one night after a week on Kauai before heading back to the mainland. We chose this hotel purely because of convenience, as we got in very late, after 11 pm, and had to leave early the next morning. The shuttle drivers were dependable and very helpful. We called when we got our bags and they were there within minutes. The room itself was ok, the bathroom is badly in need of updating but it was clean. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was very good, great service. If you need to be close to the airport for your flight, this hotel works!

I stayed here during a business trip for two weeks. The photos on this site are fairly misleading. It's actually a pretty small hotel with many floors making up the parking garage. The rooms are modest but adequate. I did appreciate there being a fridge and microwave available in my room. The air and street traffic aren't terrible at night (note: I was on the top floor so I don't know how lower floors fare) but the walls are very thin and you will hear your neighbors if they aren't the quiet sort. The staff is extremely friendly and my room was maintained very well.The hotel shop is well stocked with pretty much anything you'd need, including an impressive array of alcohol. The shop selection is invaluable great because the area outside the hotel is too sketchy for a single woman to walk alone. I witnessed a car pull over and solicit a woman...after that incident, I made it a point to not go outside after dark. If you do need to get out of the hotel, there's a small shopping strip nearby with a Starbucks, Jumba Juice, L&L, etc. Beyond that, you're pretty limited.In summary, the hotel is what I'd expect from a budget airport hotel. No frills, but adequate.

Stuck unexpectedly overnight in Honolulu? Head to the Best Western. Friendly service, clean room with no funky smell. We arrived too late to eat in the restaurant but they had a great little store on site with beer, wine, cereal, milk, fruit, etc. By far the best hotel gift shop I've seen in awhile. Not a lot of gifts there, but lots of everything else you need. In room coffee maker and a free shuttle to the airport that leaves every 30 minutes. Definitely recommend!

If you need a hotel close to the HNL airport consider Best Western The Plaza Hotel. The airport transport is a breeze and takes only about ten minutes or less. The hotel is also very close to a few car rental agencies Alamo and Advantage are almost next to the hotel. A bus stop is right in front of the hotel if you need to go into Honolulu or get around the island. The room we had was a little shabby but adequate. For an overnight stay it was OK. I would not recommend it for more than one or two nights. Try to get a room away from the highway as it can be very noisy. There are food options near the hotel if you chose not to eat in the hotel restaurant.

We just returned after a one night stay to catch an early (7am) flight leaving from Honolulu. The property is very close to the airport and has a complimentary shuttle to and from the terminal. The property itself is basic and our two adjoining rooms were clean and functional. Our rooms had flat screen LCDs with small refrigerators and microwaves in a cabinet underneath them. There is a small convenience store in the lobby, a pool (which we didn't use), and check in and check out were quick and uneventful. The price, especially with our AAA discount, was very reasonable. The largest drawback was the noise. We stayed on the 12th floor, which is the top floor, but the traffic noise (even at 2-3am) was bad even with the A/C on full blast as the property is located directly adjacent to Nimitz Highway, which seems to have a constant flow of trucks, cars, and buses travelling at high speeds at all hours. We were woken up several times from the noise. As a one-night convenience this place was OK and served its purpose, but I've stayed at airport hotels elsewhere, including Embassy Suites properties, which were nicer (and quieter).

Best Western was able to accommodate us as our plane connection was late so we couldn't get to Molokai that night. This was convenient as it is very close to the airport and the hotel provides free shuttles every 30 minutes. We did get a room near the back, Room 730, so we didn't hear all the highway noise other reviewers have complained about. However, the ventilation-cooling/heating system was loud in this room. The room was very clean. The bedspread was just a thin piece of olive fabric (about 12 inches double-folded) over the foot area of the bed on top of the sheets and draped over width-wise. I thought it was just decoratively folded that way, but when I opened it up to cover the entire bed discovered it wasn't a full bedspread. So, we just used the top sheets as it was very late when we got in. The shower had plenty of hot water and was strong. We were thankful to get a room close to the airport at the last minute and the staff was pleasant while checking in and out.

We stayed at the Plaza for a week and a half in March 2012. The room was fairly small but satisfactory for our family. However, the highlight of our stay was the fantastic customer service exemplified by EVERYONE on staff, especially the servers in the restaurant - they all had a knack of making you feel valued like a member of a family. I would highly recommend the Plaza for this alone! The hotel is also centrally located within all of Oahu's major tourist attractions as well and is reasonably priced.

I read the trip advisor reviews with some apprehension, but gave in to the convenience of this hotel for a stopover from Vancouver to Sydney, australia. I asked for a quiet room, and mine was fine as it faced away from the freeway. Dinner was a quick dash across the street to the sushi place - nothing flash but ok. The surrounding streets are a bit industrial, but given that there is a lot of military housing, and shuttle bus traffic etc, I didn't feel that unsafe as a single woman traveller. Of course, not all women would feel safe if they are unused to travelling alone. The room did feel a bit humid, the carpet had a sticky spot, and the bathroom was fine if you didn't look too closely! No bedbugs to report thank goodness. Sure, most airport hotels in other cities are better value with newer rooms. Given the limited choice in honolulu, the room price is primarily replacing what you would pay for a taxi from waikiki to airport at 6am ( about 35 USD)! As a tourist, I wouldn't stay more than one night, but it was acceptable.

I stayed at the Plaza in early January 2012. I picked this hotel because it was close to the airport and had a free airport shuttle. I flew in to Honolulu late in the evening and was flying to Maui early the next morning, so I wanted an inexpensive hotel convenient to the airport. The shuttle both from the airport and from the hotel was extremely convenient. Also, the hotel has a nice restaurant for a good breakfast. I did check out the free wi-fi and it worked very well. The Plaza would not be my first choice for a long stay in Honolulu since it is not close to the beaches or Waikiki, but I would definitely go back for a short stay. Also, I want to compliment the front desk staff for being very courteous and helpful on both my arrival and check out.

I had to stay close to the airport & wanted a free shuttle. The shuttle driver Ken was prompt, friendly & SO helpful with our surfboard bags!!! The next morning at the airport I realized I had left my pillow. I called the hotel & Mena saved me!! She had housekeeping find my pillow & the driver DELIVERED it to the airport before I flew out. Amazing!! *Mena & the shuttle drivers, Harold (& Ken) made my day! Mahalo for spreading the Aloha!!!!!

Stayed here for one night in late February 2012 after a late international flight in and an early morning flight out to Big Island.The hotel was handy to the airport. After arrival and collection of baggage we telephoned the hotel using one of the free telephones available before exiting to the arrivals area to the taxi rank etc (just punch in the two digit number, into the telephone, as highlighted for Best Western on the adjacent info board). Very easy, and the shuttle arrived (to the location spelt out by the hotel in the call) within 5 minutes.Reception staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little tired, in style and furnishings, but it worked for us on this occasion. Our late arrival meant no food on-site, but heck we had quite sufficient on the 9 hour flight there.The room was spacious with modest sized twin beds. Good air conditioning, perhaps a little noisy. The bathroom was a little old fashioned but everything worked well and there was adequate towels (a little thin perhaps), soaps and shampoos. There was some continual noise from the adjacent elevated, and other, highways. But to tell you the truth we didn't notice it - but we were dog tired. The booked alarm call came on time. And the return free shuttle to the airport (for a Go) flight worked very efficiently.So the hotel met our needs: an overnight stay squeezed in between two flights. For certain I would not stay there on a longer stay - picking somewhere in Waikiki (which we did last time).

this hotel is the "best" great location and most people that come here look for a bargain so stop complaining your in Hawaii chill out. I've been here for a month all the staff is great nice polite i want to give a shout out to Rose and Chandra they are always smiling at the front desk believe me I've heard some dumb questions they always answer politely and professional. Mirna and her friend work on the 7th floor they are always happy I feel that some times you need to acknowledge those people that do more than their jobs. being so close to the airport it is the perfect place to go to Waikiki is a tourist trap and has very bad traffic. enjoy the coffee :)there (wahiawa)......................................................................................................

We stayed at this hotel because our travel agency booked it for us (we were on honeymoon), otherwise we would have stayed at Waikiki (as you have to go downtown for dinner anyway). I think this is the only airport hotel in Honolulu; there is a shuttle bus from the airport that you have to call when you arrive from the phones in the luggage claim areas. The two advantages of this hotel's positions are the airport, of course, and also the proximity to Arizona memorial and Pearl Harbour, that you can reach by 10 minutes bus ride. The hotel itself is nothing special, the rooms are minimal, there is no AC, no restaurant, there are also very few places to eat nearby (fast foods).If you want to go and visit Waikiki you have to take a taxi (35 $) or the bus, that is cheaper but takes a really long time! (1 hour!)So, in my opinion the only reason to spend a night at this hotel is if you have an early flight in the morning.
Close to airport that's all it has going for it.very noisy being virtually under the freeway.no complimentary breakfast,you can purchase it in the restaurant but at a price.

Thjis hotel is very close to the airport and car rental places. It is ideal for a layover for another flight (shuttle) and worked for us as we were waiting for a house rental on Feb 1 and arrived on Jan 30 because of cheap flights. We decided to take the 1 full day Jan 31 to see chinatown honolulu (not worth it) and visit our niece in Waikiki (well worth it) We took the local bus and enjoyed the local flavour, transferring at Chinatown and on to Waikiki for happy hour. We took a taxi back to the hotel. The next morning I walked to Thriftys and got our rental and drove to the house in Kailua we rented for 3 weeks (See other review).The best Western serve the purpose. It was clean and well kept but not located for a vacation in Hawaii

The TA reviews led us to believe this was a good way to go for an early morning flight. But yikes, this was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at...right next to the freeway with thin windows/walls. While the room had been refurbished, I actually saw small bugs in the bath/shower area. The temperature control was also poor. The restaurant food and service were the only redeeming features...but appreciated after a long day. Good, efficient shuttle to the airport. I might just stay downtown next time and take an early morning taxi....to get a good night's sleep.

We did not have any real idea what British Airways had got us, reading some of the reveiws on this website prior to leaving U/K,we were a little concerned over the noise !! facture, . We were allocated a very well presented room on the 8th floor overlooking the airport, We were very suprised how little the aircraft noise is a bother , in fact most nights we have slept very well with the windows open..The service by madeline our cleaner on our floor was excellent,nothing was a problem, she is a credit to this hotel, also the reception crew were excellent..We ate here sometimes, also this service was good.... The shuttle service to & fro to airport is legendary, as excellent... Used the Bus, to and fro to also very good...If I had a fault with this hotel its the lack of a BAR...

We stayed here for 1 night while laying over for an interisland flight to Kona. The shuttle bus to the hotel runs 24 hours per day, and took less than 5 minutes to reach the hotel from the airport. We arrived after midnight, and left at 8:00 am, so did not have an opportunity to use the restaurant, pool, or other amenities. The hotel is directly on the freeway, so request a room on the back of the hotel if noise is a concern. As others have noted, the hotel is not appropriate for a Hawaiian holiday, as the surroundings are commercial and industrial in nature and the hotel is not near tourist attractions (although is reasonably close to Pearl Harbor). However, for a layover and convenience to the airport, it is right on the money.

This was my first move while in the Army. The staff at this hotel made my wife and I feel like we were at home among our friends. I would like to recognize one staff member who helped my wife anytime she needed assistance. Cherae who works at the front desk. Thank you.

This is not a luxury hotel but it has everything that you need during your stay, like spacious rooms, a free shuttle to and from the airport and to it's sister property for dinner, free wireless internet which non of the fancy hotels in "Waikiki" offer, free parking and for military you receive a $10 voucher every day which can be used towards breakfast or dinner. I am military and have been staying here for 35 days and have many more to go and I would tell you that it is very convinient as you are just minutes away from the main NEX, Commissary, Joint Base Hickam and Pearl Harbor, Fort Schafter, Trippler and Camp Smith. Right across the street "walking distance" in the housing area there is a shoppette and gas station.Customer service is great, from the staff at the front desk to the house keeping ladies on the 6th floor to the security guards. At the front desk, I would tell you that I had the honors of dealing with Cecilia, Chandra and ROSE....ROSE is awesome, she always has a smile on her face and is always willing to help you, to the extent that everytime I go to the front desk I make it a point to see ROSE. In house keeping, Annita and her partner are awesome, will take care of you.Bottom Line: If you want to have an enjoyable stay in Oahu come to the Best Western by the int'l airport and see ROSE.

Overall, this hotel is inclusive and cost-effective! Best perks are the free internet, easy access to the airport AND food, usage of "guest computer" in the lobby, AND ROSE- at the front desk (if you're lucky!), who made my stay much more enjoyable!!!

The hotel provides a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. However, you need to call for it. And even after you call for it, it can take them 45 minutes to come pick you up, even though it's just a 5 minute drive away.The entrance doesn't look promising. The rooms are okay, but there was a couple fighting next door and the hotel security was trying to handle it. Even after the door was shut, I could still hear the couple shouting at each other.The hotel felt dated.Breakfast was slowly prepared. And rather oily for a standard American style breakfast.You can use their computer to print out boarding passes, but you have to do it standing up.Saving grace is that the front desk staff are really nice and helpful. And they have thoughtful things like a list of buses that you can take to Waikiki. But beware, the wait for the buses can be long and the ride can take 1-1.5 hours into the city.

In summary, this hotel is exactly what you expect at the price point for an airport Best Western hotel. We arrived at Honolulu airport in the very late afternoon, with an early morning departure the next morning (leaving hotel around 5:00am). This hotel is perfectly fine for a relatively inexpensive place to catch a few hours' sleep, very close to the airport with fast shuttle connections. It is difficult to find the location at the airport where the shuttle picks up hotel guests (this is due to the shoddy state of the airport - not the hotel's fault - when I called the hotel they explained exactly where to wait). Shuttle service from hotel to airport is excellent (and clearly marked!), and I should add the shuttle drivers were very friendly/helpful.Hotel check-in was very efficient, rooms are as advertised; rooms perfectly clean but very dated (not a flat screen tv, etc). There seemed only to be wifi in the hotel lobby (which was free, but inconvenient when you just want to check email). The hotel staff were all very friendly at all times. Hotel tip: there is a plaza literally about 3 minutes' walk that includes a Starbucks and a take-out sushi restaurant (when you exit the hotel, turn left (heading west), then take the first left (at Byron's restaurant); as you walk down this street, this plaza is on the other side of the road.

This hotel is great for the transit person waiting for a flight going out the next day or a lay over for a cruise or something like that. Close to the airport with a van that runs on the half hour 24 hours a day. Not close to any visitor intrests nor areas for eating or entertainment with out getting a cab or a van ride. Clean but obviously well used.

Such a good place to come to and relax. They have really welcoming and friendly workers here. Rose is someone I'd like to point out, she's really helpful and she has helped us tremendously. She's really patient and comprehends our situation very well. She's helped us with our luggages, rooms, parking, and ways to get around Hawaii. Best Western The Plaza Hotel was like 1 minute away from the airport. The shuttle driver was really generous to help us carry our bags and to bring them up to our rooms. The swimming pools were awesome! The food here is great, they have great services too. They have really spacious rooms and they provide TV entertainment! I'd say, choose BEST WESTERN PLAZA HOTEL. Such a cheap and neat place to sleep in. Mahalo for all your services. I recommend people come check them out.

Arrived late -airport shuttle was quick to come - fast checkin - spacious corner room but a little noisy from nearby freeway and weird noises coming from A/C. Couldn't turn it off and didn't seem to want to get warmer when turned down. No blanket. Otherwise staff was very nice and room was clean.

This is a good place for one last night before flying out, or when you've just arrived and are too tired to deal with trying to transfer to a Waikiki hotel. The room we had was spacious, king-sized bed, corner room. TV included purchase movies and some games (not our thing but with kids would be good.) The bed was SUPERCOMFORTABLE!I stayed 4 nights, but wouldn't really recommend it for a place to base yourself from unless you have a car rental. You'd have to drive everyday (in crappy traffic) to get anywhere or take a bus. The buses in Honolulu are great, but still its about an hour to Waikiki each way, it gets old after a while.The airport shuttle is a great service, free, but tip the driver a buck per bag. They say that it leaves every 30min, but when we went to go at 9:15pm the driver said hop in and we went! Took 5 min.I didn't use the restaurant, but bought cereal/milk and fruit from the little shop in the lobby. When I went to restaurant to try to get something, it was a 30min wait. I then went to the desk and asked what was around, and they recommended Byron's Drive In. Good stuff! Local lunch plate type of food, but cheap and good. I asked for salad instead of rice and it was lovely and fresh.Overall, good place when you land or head out.

The Best Western The Plaza Hotel is located close to the airport in Honolulu. They offer a free shuttle service to/from the airport. It is not that easy to locate the shuttle (mainly due to the poor information at the airport - goes well with the general awful quality of the airports on the Hawaiian islands), the best bet is to call the hotel upon arrival at the airport. The trip to the hotel from the airport is short so arrive in less than 5 minutes.Check-in process was quick and we were given a room high up in the building (as requested when booking). The room was large but sparsely decorated - it would not have hurt to put a sofa our something like that in there. The hotel is close to the highway so it was possible to hear cars passing by.I would assume that being high up (and facing away from the highway) shields some of the noise. Most standard things were provided in the room such as TV, fridge, free wifi, and a coffee maker. I was missing mainly missing a water kettle to be able to make tea but other than that everything needed was in the room. The bed was comfortable enough (granted I was so tired so I would probably have been able to go to sleep on the floor), there was a small desk and an additional table. The hotel is good enough for one night if leaving early or arriving late but I would not go here otherwise as the area is not very interesting.

We needed an overnight stay prior to our trip to Maui - the airport closes there at 5:30 PM! So, we were very pleasantly surprised at the Plaza Hotel Best Western near the Honolulu airport. First, there is a shuttle bus that picks you up at baggage claim. Then, the driver was extremely helpful in getting all our gear (we are divers) onto the bus, and brought it to the room for us.The room itself was quiet, spacious, and overall very nice for an airport hotel at a reasonable price. Bathroom with lots of supplies, separate makeup area for the wife, and a couch for packing and staging. The next morning the luggage was back on the shuttle and we were on our way, no muss no fuss.Although we weren't hungry, there are several restaurants within less than one block if you want to eat. Supposedly there is a cheap shuttle to Waikiki if that's your thing.Overall a good experience.

Affordable and clean - pet friendly hotel. Room was spacious, ADA compliant bathroom, and staff friendly. Stayed overnight while house was termite tented. Would recommend to family and friends. My dog pee'd on the carpet, but staff said they would shampoo afterwards.

This was our second stay here. Staff is welcoming and friendly. Shuttle from airport is quick. Rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. There can be some noise from nearby highway, but if you leave the a/c on the white noise is useful. Otherwise the room was quiet, and wi-fi worked. It's probably not where you'd want to stay for several days, but if you need only a place to sleep and can get around by bus or car, it's a good base. City buses stop nearby and will take you to most places of interest to travelers.

Due to proximity to the airport, pet friendliness, and beautiful pictures online, I initially had a 5-night stay reserved here. Before the first night was over, I downgraded that to a single night and made reservations for the other 4 nights at another hotel.I made reservations here because of an impending move off-island, and did not want to deal with high prices and traffic from Waikiki, where almost every hotel on Oahu is located.All pet-friendly rooms are in the "old" part of the hotel. Not the fancy tower you see in the picture, but an old, two-story motel-looking structure right next to H-1, the busiest freeway on Oahu. The rooms have nearly zero sound silencing ability and the noise kept us up all night. The rooms were incredibly small. We were led to believe we would be given either 2 queens or 1 king w/ a pull-out sofa or rollaway bed plus a rollaway crib for myself, my wife and two children, but all pet rooms are tiny 2-Double rooms that did not even have enough space to fit a rollaway crib, and we had to climb over our luggage to get to the 2nd bed as there was no real storage. Because we couldn't fit the rollaway, my 18 month old daughter had to sleep on the floor in a makeshift bed of blankets between our double beds and our luggage so she wouldn't roll off the bed.The beds were far from amazing, and the rooms were in poor condition, with mildew in the bathroom.The staff was very friendly and wanted to be helpful, but because we had a dog, they would not offer us a larger room in the main tower. They then tried to move us to their sister hotel, the Ohana, but their pet rooms were identical, as the two hotels are practically the same thing.The rooms all come standard with a microwave and mini-fridge, but no other "frills". There was a "barbecue area" next to the pool, but no grills in sight. Maybe they were in a storage room? All I saw were benches and butt cans. There was also advertised a small "play area" for the kids, but when I was there, the play equipment had been removed, leaving only the rubber matting. What??This "pet friendly" hotel also adds $50 a night non-refundable pet fee (a fairly standard price on Oahu) to allow you to keep your pet in their ghetto old rooms. There are many other places in Waikiki that, for a little extra money, will treat you, your family, and your pet much better.

The staff here are wonderful.. Rose and Mena have been exceptional while working with me through the process of checking in and out while the corporate office extended my stay. Rose has been helpful to coordinate my reservation between the airport and hotel. It has been a pleasurable experience from start to finish.
Needed a place to saty near the airport for flight solution and this was it!

I read that this hotel was near the freeway but I didn't think it was really under the freeway!!! We were so close if a car came off the freeway it would have been in our room no problem! It was noisy and that's the truth!! I think if you ask for a room on the other side of the hotel it would be better!! We were on the 7th floor in the corner so we had a view of the freeway, the car rental lot, and warehouse area. The room was pretty clean if you didn't look real close at the shower tiles and the bathroom door that was peeling. The people at the desk were very friendly and helped us alot with transfers to the cruise ship...which was really close! For the money and the time we spent there it wasn't bad.

The air conditioner is on all the time and there is nothing anyone can do about it. We were offered one additional blanket per person but that is of little help when the room is very cold, especially before bedtime.

We've stayed at this hotel once before. It is close to Pearl Harbor and away from Waikiki. It's a great place to stay to save money on Oahu. The rooms are clean and well-kept. We were given a corner room facing the ocean (which is off in the distance) and the airport. The room was huge, and we didn't notice the airport noise.

I've recently been relocated to Hawaii with the service and required to stay at the plaza hotel. I was nervous about adapting to the new culture, but it only took about 2 days for the good people at the plaza hotel to make this feel like home. Frank the bus driver has his assignment mastered, and is very efficient with transporting you whenever you need. The front desk team of Cherae, Rose, and sometimes Cecelia were outstanding. During my stay, I've found myself at the front desk receiving lessons on Hawaii and the culture, as well as just passing time making conversation. I could not recommend a more welcoming yet proffessional crew.

This hotel is right under the freeway and he hotel room windows are single pane sliders. So unless you sleep like a log you might consider another hotel. It is nice and close to the airport and the staff was pleasant...but the towels smelled and it was imPossible to change the thermostat.

This is a wonderful place to stay for business and/or pleasure! The hotel is not in Waikiki... but is close enough and just enough away to enjoy your stay! If you do stay I recommend that you get a room away from the H1 Highway... (A bit noisy) Other than that they just replaced the TV's to flat screens and the place is very pleasant!I also received awesome service from Rose and Cherae! (Please ask for them if they are working that day! They will show you Aloha! )
Cecilia at the front desk was very courteous and helpful.
