Dated but clean room. free wireless internet. (Some 5 star hotels still charge for this!) You would not holiday here at all! (no offence to the hotel!) The hotel provides a FREE 24hr airport shuttle. (Please tip the driver!) DanoCanada: There is a 24 HOUR diner RIGHT NEXT DOOR! And a shopping centre with about 6 different eateries open till 11pm just across the road from that. And yes it is right near a freeway as it is RIGHT NEXT DOOR TO THE AIRPORT! Accurate ratings and comments are useful here... so get facts right before giving a hotel the DL! I mean, how long did you stay there!!?? NO ONE would holiday here unless they were insane or just down right poor! I thought this hotel was well priced, at just under $100 AU. I mean what do you expect. I was at this hotel for a total of 12 hours, it is what it is. I slept fine, they even provided ear plugs, which I did not need. The staff were beautiful! I just love the Hawaiians they are so friendly. Thank you Best Western The Plaza Hotel, My stay was everything I wanted!

This hotel is way overpriced given the location under a freeway and its condition. The hallways and carpets in this hotel are dirty and smelly. The noise from the freeway is so loud you can't even sit out by the pool. The rooms are tired and noisy from the traffic on the freeway as well. Staff were very helpful, however, and the size of the room was good. Bed comfort was very good. The restaurant was closed when we arrived and it was quite a hike on foot to any restaurant or shopping. The only reason one would consider staying here is because of the hotel's proximity to the airport and the free airport shuttle. Otherwise, the Best Western in Waikiki downtown is much better value.

My apologies for the delay in submitting my comments. After a 12-night cruise ending in Honolulu, we stayed one extra day (Sept. 21) and chose Best Western The Plaza Hotel as it is close to the airport and offered a free shuttle to the airport. We were not disappointed. We arrived in the morning and met Rose at the counter. We were able to get into our room right away which was a real bonus. In spite of the main highway being across from the hotel, we were not bothered at all by traffic noise. The city bus stop was across the street and as a senior, we could ride for $1.00 each and it took us right down to Waikiki Beach area. We were unable to access WiFi in our room, but it was available in the lobby, and we could print off our boarding passes from the computer in the lobby. Rose was amazing in helping us at all times, even remembering our names. Once we’d checked out, she made arrangements to store our luggage as our flight wasn’t until the evening. We also had an excellent breakfast in the morning.

Ok so I can't say that staying in a hotel is my favorite place to be but if I have to be in a hotel I'm glad I'm surrounded by the wonderful staff here! They go out of there way to say hi and ask if they can help you. If you have a problem they try to fix it immediately and if they can't they get someone who can. My husband and I have to stay in a hotel because of military reasons, since we just moved to the island. and having people like Rose on the staff makes being here a home away from home.

The front desk ladies were most helpful, friendly and over all took care of everything! We PCS'ed here from Fort Campbell KY and the military placed us here. My over all favorite thing about this motel is it has all the convenients of home. Rooms were clean, beds were comfy. I would definetly recommend this hotel! Go talk to Cherae at the front desk.........She is the BEST!!!

I stayed here on a recent business trip and was hesitant after reading online reviews. No idea why there are such low marks and negative comments. Very good hotel with a GREAT staff (especially Rose and Athena). Location isn't as easy to get to as I'd like, but is great for business travellers. Close enough you can almost walk to the terminal, yet still pretty quiet. My room had a nicely made King bed, new ammenities, and looked recently remodeled. Great value compared to resorts, great location if catching a Red Eye back to the mainland.

The Best Western was ok. We needed to be close to the airport for the next day, so the shuttle and close distance was very helpful. For aone night the hotel is good, beyond that I wouldn't stay. The Interstate is right next to the hotel and the location isn't the greatest for access or attractions, etc.The room was ok, needs some reno's though and not what I expected.Exception to it all was the restaurant on-site. Went for breakfast and received a great, well made and extremely fast meal. Very impressed.

The hotel is close to the airport and provides a convenient, free shuttle. There is nothing nearby in the area, and apparently parking is very expensive as well. It is the perfect hotel for an early flight out of the airport, however, given its location. The rooms are comfy. TVs are old, free high-speed internet is wired ONLY in rooms, though a somewhat slow wireless is available in the lobby. Restaurant is closed for dinner on Tuesdays, it seems. Convenience store on-site. For an early flight, I'd stay here again if the price is right.

Hotel is convenient, has all you need for an overnight stay, comfy beds.Hotel and rooms are a little dated, but staff are friendly and helpful. Room has mini fridge (empty) and a microwave, coffee maker with yummy Kona coffee. Can catch wireless internet signal for free, also have modem in room for free.We stayed in 611 - can hear highway noise, but not too bad...earplugs recommended. Was quiet most of the night, road noise picked up around 7:30 a.m.Would stay again - good price for what you get!

Traveling alone on August 11, 2011, I was picked up by Frank and driven to the hotel. Frank had my bags in my room before I was finished with check in and check in was FAST!! I had the best Chicken Alfredo ever with excellent service in the dining room. I stayed one night and forgot my robe, called 2 days later and they offered to send me the robe, I told them I had another reservation for August 23 and would pick it up. I called for the shuttle on August 23 and Frank picked me up again. My robe was delivered to my room the next morning. check out was noon, but my flight didn't leave until 7PM, they stored my bags so I could run around all day.

My buddy and I decided to get away from New England. What better place to come than Hawaii? Or so we thought....We checked in with the front desk, who were very helpful, but that may be the hotel's only redeeming quality. After walking into the room, we realized that Nimitz highway was immediately to our right outside the window. Within a weak stone's throw. To our left? Honolulu international. This would have been tolerable had the windows not sounded like they were open....all the time! It sounds like they're expanding the highway with a new exit- our room. The sound is constant, never gives up. The room has a 1970's feel to it. That must be a part of their "recent" renovations. Which brings me to our next experience. About 3 power outlets in the room, one of which is in the bathroom, where we had to charge phones.....I will say, that Best Western provided us with a wonderful microwave, and fridge. They were both located below the TV in a cabinet. Upon further review, they were plugged into a power strip behind the TV unit along with enough plugs to fill the power strip. We left the doors of the cabinet open, just to ensure it didn't get too hot for the fridge and microwave. Ready for a comfortable night's sleep? The beds are misleading. They lure you in with a picture perfect made bed (which is another redeeming quality...Thanks Soledad!) But I digress. Although the room gives off a 1970's vibe, the air conditioning shouldn't give off that same vibe. We cranked the AC to approximately 50- to get it nice and cold. Unfortunately, the temperature in the room was a balmy 75- TWO DAYS LATER! So the shower- I don't know about you, but I enjoy keeping up with daily hygiene. Best Western made it difficult without getting either burned, or frostbite by the all over the walls temperature. I can deal with one or the other (in a perfect world absolutely not) but to fluctuate so much is insane!What's next? If you're looking for a centrally located hotel, you got it. Centrally located in the locally acclaimed "nice ghetto". Although it is wonderfully close to the airport (.6 miles, yes .6; not 6 miles), it is terribly far from anywhere I don't feel like I'm going to get shanked. Step into my office for a side story-We ventured out onto the streets (Nimitz Highway- great) to try to get food- a basic need. On our approach to Byron's, we realize that not only are we the minority, but we are just waiting to be front page news- "Two Tourists die in Fast Food Stabbing" I can see it now. So we move on- trying to find the near shopping plaza with a buffet. Upon walking about 50 feet, we realize that people are coming out of the woodwork, clearly not liking our presence; so we sprint to our room to get our car keys and drive. To all the other reviews; I completely do not understand your logic or thought process. If you get here late one night and need to leave early the next morning, don't want sleep, or sleeping on the highway, like the thrill of possibly getting stabbed, sweating profusely in your sleep. This place is for you. Other than that, absolutely never again!

Great quite place, close to airport and easy to get on to city bus line. Walking distance to Harley Davidson dealership to pick up rental bike. We were there when Tsunami hit in March, and the staff were very helpful. This hotel is far enough from beach that we were high and dry. Great food and service was great. Will definetly stay again.

If your purpose for being on Oahu is to out on a beach within walking distance of your hotel, then stay at Waikiki. But if you want to see the rest of what Oahu has to offer then this is an excellent choice. It's away from the crowds at Waikiki, far enough away from the downtown traffic of Honolulu, practically next door to the airport, several rental car companies withing walking distance, and great access to H3 if you want to go Windward. The room was clean and basic, but the air conditioning was not adjustable. I am not sure if the thermostat was broken, or not connected. My only other issue was with the billing- my reservation was prepaid but I noticed they attempted to authorize my card a second time. After dealing with being double billed by a hotel in Virginia a few years ago I was prepared for the worst, but after a quick talk with Cherae at the front desk she contacted her manager immediately and the problem was resolved almost immediately.If I ever return to Oahu I will definitely be staying here again.

Good place for a stopover. The room waxs large and clen. The staff was very friendly and helpful, The food in the restauarant was very good. The shuttle to the airport was fast and close/Very reasonable. --No complaints. Would stop here again

My husband I stayed at this particular Best Western Hotel to and from our honeymoon home on the north shore of Oahu. We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and the friendly service we always received. The front desk was always welcoming and friendly, and the restaurant always had excellent waiters/waitresses (all four times we ate there!). I highly recommend this hotel. The shuttle is great too. Our driver was SO nice and helpful! Would go back in a heart beat!
Black dirt came up bath tub plug into bath. Room was on 11th floor. Thank God I wasn't in it at the time!When we asked reception if they had had this problem before, they replied, "not today!!"

I needed to go to Hawaii for a couple of days to take care of some personal business. This hotel was nicer than I expected from the reviews I previously viewed; it has a tower building (10 floors), restaurant, tiny gift shop. There is separate 2-story building for people with pets. My main complaint is that the shuttle never showed up to pick me up at the airport. I called them 3 times, and after 50 minutes, finally got a different ride to the hotel, which is only about 1/2 mile from the airport. Sheesh, I could have walked there in less time.I was not in the hotel itself very much, except to shower and sleep, since I needed to be elsewhere to take care of family and friends during my stay. But it was fine for the purpose.

Upon our arrival the sign states they take AAA. They said no. The room was $134 bucks which is cheap for Hawaii. You get what you pay for!! When we opened the door to the room, it smelled like wet dog! There was a long hair stuck between the stacked cups they provided us to drink from. The coffee tray had shorter hairs on it. There was smashed bugs lining the wall in the bathroom. Eventually another long hair turned up on a towel. The drawers by the TV had dirty men's underwear in it!!! And finally, the booklet inside the room states "free continental breakfast" of which there was none! You must pay for breakfast!! Good luck if you stay there!!
Average place to stay for one night. We did it after flying into hawaii and needed a place. The $25 for parking was high. No free continental breakfast like most best western's offer.

Ness' help to military families is superb. Always ask for discounts, never know what hotels provide. Join the rewards program, points do add & help out. If there is a problem, request a solution with understanding, personnel is not to blame. Build a "customer service" relationship with personnel, requests are addressed more effectively and with a smile. I know we will be staying at the Plaza next year. Hope to see Rachea and Cecelia, too.

I just wanted to thank everyone for their great hospitality. I would like to recognize Mrs. Ceceilia Fata for her hard work, dedication, assistance and patience. She is very approachable, professional, knowledgable of the area and kind. Additionally, her customer service is outstanding. I will pass this information on to friends that may want to vacation in Oahau. This is a great hotel.Thank you.

I had an overnight layover between flights and this place was perfect for me. I had requested an upper floor and that is what they gave me. The room was spacious and very clean. The desk staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced. The hotel is right next to a noisy freeway, but I never heard it.The friendly shuttle driver who picked me up at the airport pointed out the ONLY restaurant nearby that was still open: a drive-in. (note: this seems to contradict the hotel's website, which lists a number of restaurants nearby). Fortunately for me the C-store in the lobby was still open, and I was able to pick up a sandwich and some fruit; adequate for me.One thing I might change -- they have free internet in the lobby for printing my boarding pass. But one must stand to use it. I have a disability and that was unpleasant.If I had been here as a tourist, I probably would not stay here, only because it is a long way to waikiki. But for my purpose - it was perfect!

I stayed one night at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel near Honolulu International Airport in November 2010. The hotel was perfect for my purposes.Room was reasonably clean, shuttle access was straightforward.Paid $85 plus tax through Priceline, which seemed a bit much for the quality of the room, but there weren't many other affordable options near the airport that night.Reception clerk was a bit brusque but otherwise professional.There is a small convenience store in the lobby -- but prices there are pretty high.Would return if for just a night. Would look elsewhere for longer stays.

Very clean and nice. The manager worked great withme on an issue that I had. Unfortunatley two days of my stay in Hawaii landed me in a hospital. The hotel manager was generous with a reduced fare for the two nights that I could not return to the hotel.

The greatest surprise at this Best Western Hotel was the bed...big soft pillow-top mattress with luxurious linen. We had the best night's sleep. The room was nicely decorated with everything we needed efficiently layed out in the room. The staff were also very pleasant and helpful. We will definitely look for Best Western Hotels in our future travels.

Old hotel. Quite run down but clean. It's a good place when having a short stay in Honolulu with an early flight the next morning.They have a free shuttle bus running from the hotel to the airport and the other way round. Just call them from the airport and they pick you up. Worked well.Windows cannot be opened. Airconditioning ok.Was a stop over hotel for us. Arrived in the afternoon, took a taxi to the center of Waikiki, stayed there for the evening and went back to the hotel to get some sleep - had an early flight in the morning. It was a good price offer - so there's no reason to complain.

We stayed here on our final night of our honeymoon as we had an early flight and splashed out on a King room which was fine, very spacious without being special but good enough for our needs. Our hope of a nice meal for our final night was not realised. We stood waiting to be seated for a while and the food was fairly average. There is no separate bar in the hotel so we had to go a couple of blocks for a few end of honeymoon drinks.

We had a very early flight out of HNL and decided to chance a night here, as it seemed to have better reviews than its sister hotel the Ohana. Since I had seen noise complaints and reports of bedbugs from last fall, I emailed the hotel to request a quiet and pest-free room. The manager was very gracious and assured me this would be taken care of. I booked a deluxe king which anywhere else might be about 2/3 the price but as there's not much competition at HNL it was a little pricey at $120. When we arrived, the front desk staff were very gracious - Lance and Cynthia helped us with getting our room situated, answered our questions about the shuttle etc. We got to the room and it was quiet and very spacious. VERY obviously new clean sheets and new shower curtain which we were very happy about. There's a fridge and microwave in all rooms. We had an early dinner in the restaurant - it is open weekends only. Others have complained about the quality and price of the food but honestly, Honolulu restaurants are expensive and for an airport place especially we thought it had a good range of choices. There was a seafood buffet for $28 all you can eat but we don't eat seafood. The seafood did look and smell good. We had spaghetti and a chicken burrito. Our server, Sharon was one of the highlights of our trip. Because we don't eat seafood and couldn't do the buffet she brought us rolls and salad, and some rice for me, that weren't really included with our meals.The spaghetti was good and burrito was more like a fajita with a nice spicy sauce. We were pretty satisfied. There is a Byrons Drive in Next door if you wanted burgers etc. Don't know about prices etc. Our bed was comfortable but we did wake up several times with a screaming family of children, I'm guessing "Army brats" whose parents had obviously let the kids take over one room so the adults could get some sleep. We had to tell them several times to be quiet which really really spoiled our sleep. I was kind of surprised the next morning at 5 AM when I complained that the front desk didn't offer to comp our meal or something. It's not their fault but it did ruin our night. All in all I was Ok with our stay. We try to avoid Best Westerns, to be honest, and this one seemed at least newly renovated in the more expensive room category and fairly quiet too. I was VERY concerned about bedbugs and am a little concerned that there was a more recent complaint than the one I'd seen from last fall. My experience with contacting them beforehand was that the manager did his best to get us a clean, quiet room so I was very happy that he was so responsive. Oh yeah parking is $20 a night so do what we did - return your car to HNL and take the free shuttle to the hotel and back. I'd say the staff make this hotel better than it might otherwise be. For an airport hotel it's not bad.

This hotel is only 5 minutes away from the airport which Is why I chose to stay here. The rooms are old and in need of a renovation. Bathrooms feel dirty and the noise from the freeway is terrible. They do have a free shuttle to the airport which is a bonus.

Being close to the airport is nice, however, the two levels of the adjacent Nimitz Freeway/Highway provide a constant drone of vehicular noise. When you can’t hear each other while swimming or sunning, it sort of takes the fun out of being at the pool. Staff are courteous and friendly, the shop provides snacks and beer/wine, and a "The Bus" stop is close-by for trips to Waikiki or Pearl Harbour.

My husband spent two nights at this hotel. Once for a one day lay over and the other for 6 hours prior to boarding a plane to return home. On the 6 hour stay to catch some sleep he was eaten alive by bugs and returned home with 80% of his body covered with bites. He has been to the doc who confirmed bed bugs. I contacted the hotel to advise and when I received a call back was patronized, and treated as though this complaint was frivolous. I was advised that they had a very strict policy, that they checked the room and that if I was really persisent they would return his room for the night but that was because they were being nice, not because he was eaten alive. Which still hasn't happened , by the way.I was advised that perhaps it was the hotel he stayed at the other ten nights. I attempted to explain that in those 10 days he was not biten once and arrived at this hotel without any bites. I was advised that bites can come out 14 days after a person has been biten and I must be mistaken!!!!!I was asked several times whether or not I was happy to be called back and if calling me back to advise the room was checked was satisfying enough....There was no concern, no compassion and definetely did not care that this complaint had come in.We travel numerous times a year and the majority of those are to third world countries, where we have never come across bedbugs or attitudes such as the one I dealth with. Don't go!!!!! Best Western won't deal with your complaints!!!!

Cherae and Cynthia at the front desk were so helpful during our 1 week stay. They should be commended for a courteous, friendly and job well done. They showed true compassion while we were there attending a family funeral. Angel in the resturant is awsome also!! Can't wait till the next stay. Herb Wayne Weatherington

My husband and I stayed here one night when we arrived in Hawaii. We had a flight first thing the next morning to travel to the Big Island and we knew we knew after our long days of flights from the Midwest US (not to mention getting married a couple days before!) we would be exhausted. We booked this hotel with convenience and practicality in mind. We didn't want to spend too much on a room we'd only see for one short evening, something close to the airport that would be safe and comfortable without any expensive bells & whistles. This was exactly what we needed. I would not have chosen this hotel for a romantic getaway - it's close to the airport and highway, not much of a view, a little outdated, very busy, etc. However, the staff were very friendly (especially the FREE shuttle drivers!!!!) and while our room was a little oddly situated we found it clean and comfortable enough for our night passing through. Getting to the hotel was no problem and the driver was nice enough to visit with us and give us good helpful advice on getting to our flight the next morning. Check-in/check-out was easy, and it was helpful to have a little convenience store on-site for drinks and snacks. The bathroom was not that super but this was a very inexpensive hotel for the area.I would not reccomend the hotel restaurant. We were shuttled to another Best Western. We figured that (like our room) it would be a fast, easy way to have a simple meal before we crashed. It wasn't terrible but there was a pretty long wait for our table, and we both felt the food was a little overpriced considering we didn't like the food all that much and the service was average... My only real complaint - While we stayed in the the staff was very nice and helpful. However, during our visit we realized we'd lost a luggage lock. We stopped by the hotel before leaving Hawaii just to ask if they had a lost and found. My husband said that when he ran inside to ask, the person at the desk that day seemed not only to have no idea what to do/where to look but also didn't seem to care. That said, we really didn't pay that much (relative to other prices) for this room.

Although, being close to any airport has its disadvantages, I was very pleased and appreciative of the assistance I received during my stay at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel in Honolulu. Not knowing the area, Sherae at the front desk was truly wonderful in helping me. I would definitely recommend this establishment. Thank you Sherae.
The Staff is very friendly and helpful. I seems they strive to find the best room for the best price.

This is the closest hotel to Honolulu International Airport. Our room was spacious and well appointed. The room was very clean and the hotel staff was helpful. There is 24 hour shuttle service to and from the airport. The restaurant has a limited menu but is fine for quick meal before or after a flight. The hotel caters to military families and there are usually a lot of children in the dining room. The downside of the hotel is that it is right next to the freeway and can be noisy. The hotel is fine for a one night stay before or after a flight but not a place to stay if you are in Honolulu on vacation.

Due to a mishap, I ended up stranded in Honalulu without my luggage. I was headed to Alaska, but, was dressed for Hawaii. Needless to say, I was not a happy traveler. I had nothing but rudeness from the airport "staff", and it was looking like there was no hotel room available. The Best Western Plaza Hotel was like a beacon in the night for me. I had very low funds and just needed a decent place to stay for a few days. The hotel was clean and well serviced. Yes, it was a bit older looking, but, I felt safe and secure. The noise was minimal from the airport. The nicest thing to happen to me, was at the counter when I was checking out. It was chilly outside and the front desk clerk, a woman named "Chera", literally gave me the sweater she was wearing to help me on my way home to Alaska. It was an amazing gesture of kindness. I have nothing but good things to say about my stay there. I also felt safe having so many of our soldiers and their familys staying there also. If I ever stay in Honalulu again, I will definately stay there again!!!!The shuttle bus driver is also a great guy!!

The highlight of this hotel was their late night shuttle driver from the airport to the hotel. He was very nice, unassuming, helped us load our bags, and wanted to make sure we were getting where we should be going.Before writing the rest of this review, let me just say I've stayed in other Best Westerns and understand that while they are not 5 star first class accommodations, they are typically comfortable, a good value, safe, clean, and friendly.This hotel is right off the freeway, well, right below the highway, and with rooms opening to the outside, it made for a very noisy walk to our room. The lighting of the walkways was quite poor and for a weary traveler, it made me nervous to be walking outside, around corners alone. Once inside the room, the noise from the roads was very well blocked, but some of that was from the modified window unit air conditioner that blew cold air but made you worry that it was going to leak onto your belongings.The room itself was fairly larger than expected, but a lot of space was taken up with oversized furnishings that wasn't needed. The bed was more comfortable than you would expect, but don't plan on flipping through the channels you would get at better hotels -- there aren't many channels to choose from. Because we had been stranded for an extra night without our bags, we were relying on the toiletries provided in the room. These were extremely limited and sparse. There was a small bar of hand soap, a tiny (smaller than you would usually find in hotels) bottle of shampoo, and the same sized bottle of hand lotion. Tada, seriously that was it. There was a sign saying that the front desk would happily provide any personal items guests may have forgotten so we went down to the front desk to ask for conditioner and toothpaste. The front desk staff told us it would be sent up to our room right away. It never did show up. Every other Best Western I've stayed in has offered their guests a pretty good continental breakfast for free. The only breakfast this BW offered was one you could purchase in their on site restaurant and from our experience as a whole there, the restaurant was not something we wanted to add to our experience. Then, when checking out, the staff seemed to have better things to do than practice customer service or "service with a smile." The front staff was very flat and curt. The shuttle driver loaded our things onto the shuttle, allowed us to load, and then hopped off and walked away for about 5 minutes. We were glad that we weren't in a rush to get to the airport.Overall, the service staff isn't really hit or miss, it's just pretty much miss except for a couple of very nice staff members including the darling man who drove our late night shuttle from the airport. We wouldn't really recommend staying here unless you were stranded unexpectedly late at night like we were. We didn't feel safe, felt like the money spent wasn't worth what we got, and would not recommend it to others. There were several servicemen staying there and I felt bad that the men serving our country and protecting us were having to stay there.

We were in Hawaii for the ProBowl and our flight out got delayed by three days. We had no where to stay and the Best Western managed to get us a room at the very last minute. They were very nice and quite accomadating. The room was very clean, laundry and dining facilities on premise, easy access to the airport and we could even return our rental car right there at the hotel. We will most certainly stay at the hotel again. Maholo~

Enjoyed our stay at this hotel with the exception of a few things. The rooms were nice and clean, the beds were very comfortable. The microwave and refrigerator was difficult to operate with the location of where it was placed. The refrigerator didn't get very cold, had concerns about our food going bad. The hotel staff were very friendly and tried to accommodate our needs as best as they could. If you are a light sleeper, I would highly recommend getting ear plugs as the traffic noise can be very loud at times. It was great to have secured parking available. The security officer was very helpful when the parking garage got full during the late night hours. The rooms provided great amenities, but needs a little work...

We had a trip planned elsewhere but had to change our plans at the last minute. I booked this hotel as part of a vacation package through United. Because of it being so last-minute, I didn't have the time to do my research before our trip, but we found the hotel to be clean and comfortable with a gracious staff. We had a king size bed poolside and it was a very comfortable bed and a large room with a mini fridge and microwave. Although the highway is right there, and the airport right around the corner, it did not disturb our sleep except for the first night (I slept fine throughout the stay but my husband said he kept hearing the planes taking off only on the first night).What we didn't realize was how far we really were from Waikiki...though we enjoyed being close to Pearl Harbor, it took us an hour by city bus to get into the Waikiki area. If we went back again we would certainly rent a car, though parking is a bit pricey at $20 a day for non-military.The only snafu was that we had paid for our hotel stay through United Vacations but I was charged again on my credit card erroneously. I noticed this on the receipt at checkout and it was immediately taken care of by the very kind staff.

My wife and I traveled to Honolulu expecting to have Military facilities available, as we had several times before. This was not to be, all were at full capacity. I called other hotels and found none available. Then i called the Plaza and found rooms available. We were expecting to find less than a quality establishment. We were very pleasantly surprised. The rooms are average, but maintained wonderfully well. The service by the staff was excellent. Our thanks to the staff and employees of the Plaza for an excellent stay in their facility. If we return to Honolulu, and are unable to find military facilities available, we will be staying at the Plaza again.

We had long flights from Ottawa to Kauai and decided to stop over in Honolulu going and returning for a couple of days. Changing airlines in winter we decided to leave enough time should we get delayed somewhere along the route.On arrival the shuttle bus was round in minutes of us picking up our luggage.The rooms was a good size and looked as if they had been recently renovated.The restaurant evening meal was straight forward and simple. Good company with other travelers. Breakfast was easy and good service.Having a bus stop outside the hotel was a real plus for getting into Honolulu , but there was a double deck freeway a few feet from the hotel. The traffic starts at 4.00am so if you need a deep sleep ask for a room on the other side of the hotel.On the way back from Kauai we had a room at the opposite corner which was a lot quieter.The shop in the hotel was well stocked even with some good wine if you wanted a tipple, they even let us borrow a corkscrew.All the staff were really friendly and helpful, giving us change for the bus and giving us info on which bus went where.

Stayed here one night as we had an early morning flight. we were not expecting much - but didn't expect to get ripped off. Soon after we got home (Australia) we found our card had been charged twice. when we enquired, we were told we had smashed a bedside lamp. We were sent a photo of a lamp that had been glued back together. We no full well we did not break that lamp - it must have been close to a foot high ex the shade, it was pretty heavy ceramic - I think we would have noticed the noise let alone the mess. If they did it to us, they have probably done it to others - and can do it to you.

My daughter is in the military and was being transferred to Hawaii. We were put up in the Best Western Hotel by the airport. All I can say is that the staff is wonderful and we have been treated like family. We have been well taken care of. The food has been the best we have had since our stay here. I highly recommend this hotel.

It started with the aiport shuttle. It took an hour to arrive. We subsequently discovered the hotel is 5 minutes away. They put us in a room with 2 double beds even hough we requested a king and ran out of king beds so we were stuck where we were. We quickly discovered the internet wasn't working and called for help. They directed us to the number on the side of the internet cable-ie:contact teh company because they weren't going to help us. My boyfriend was livid at this point and went down to complain. Everyone was really nice and we were switched to another room-whose internet also didn't work.All in all the food was inedible, the 'non-smoking room' reeked of cigarette smoke and the hotel is right under a major highway. The sheets were clean however and it was clos eto teh airport and the shuttle was ready and waiting for us the following morning. I would not recommed or stay here again.

Unfortunately when we missed our flight, we were forced to find last-minute accommodations. This hotel was the only thing available -- disgusting, filthy, dated and in a scary neighborhood and located directly under a freeway over-pass with deafening traffic noise. The staff is unpleasant to say the least. The rooms reek of smoke but be careful complaining about it -- the receptionist had us removed from our room by a security guard when we asked for our money back due to the intolerable stench. I would seriously rather sleep on the ground in an airport terminal. This place is one step up from hell.

Check-in staff top notch..friendly, wonderful and accomodating...one of our party had a cast and crutches and he was treated like a king...they were so helpful to him...the shuttle can be a bit slow (ie we waited 15 min..no big deal really...we are on vacation..) to come around at the airport but the driver was kind and he actually carried the luggage to the room of our injured party...the rooms are tired and a bit out of date but they are CLEAN...the air conditioner is a bit noisy but it works...great value for $129 in Honolulu...bed was comfy....there is a store at the hotel with win, beer and snacks...the shuttle in the morning was great.... would recommend

My husband and I stayed here for one night in Feb 2011. We are military residents of Oahu, and needed somewhere to stay with our two cats while our home was treated for termites. We received a military special package: our room (2nd floor poolside), parking, 5PM late check-out, and the fee for one pet for $145 before taxes. We felt that rate was very fair. Paid an additional $20 for the second cat we brought (we foster for a rescue group). The positives: the room was nicely decorated, we had a nice selection of TV channels, the king bed was comfy, and there was a large selection of fluffy pillows. Also, lots of towels readily available and plenty of storage space. Even with two adults and two cats, we felt we had plenty of room. The curtains across the window were great for providing an almost night-like effect, which was great, since my husband works night shifts. The room wasn't too noisy--not a lot of activity at the pool. The room air conditioner was quick at cooling down the room and kept it at a great temperature. We were able to get parking right in front of our room, and there was a diner within 10 feet for a quick greasy snack (Byron's Drive Inn).The negatives: The room air conditioner was not properly attached to the wall, and several layers of plastic grates fell to the ground loudly in the middle of the night. The nonsmoking room smelled of cigarette smoke when we first entered, although a few quick spritzes of perfume got rid of it. The wired internet in our room did not work, but we were able to pick up the wireless signal from the lobby, although it dropped in and out pretty frequently. Also, a little gross--our kitties began playing with something on the floor, and when I took it from them, I realized it was a large chunk of fingernail or toenail. Found a few more of these gems around the carpet. Room had no "do not disturb" sign, so we had to call down to the front desk for one (didn't want housekeeping to come in and startle/lose our cats). The sign was at our door in less than 5 minutes. I shared my concerns with Cherae at the front desk upon checkout, and she graciously offered to remove the additional $20 pet fee we had paid and was very apologetic for the inconveniences. I was very disappointed with our stay this time, since we had stayed here in June and had a great experience. I would advise you to stick to the main tower building and avoid the pet/poolside rooms if you can, as those seem to be in need of some TLC.

...to closed from the highway H1Staff polite . We found the air conditioning a little difficult to balance,I found it somewhat noisy.I ware earplugs the last couple nights which helped as it was just too hot without it. Breakfast was simple, but nice.

We were staying at a condo at Turtle Bay Estate and wanted to make arrangements to leave the keys in the condo at check out as we had an early flight out of Honolulu.. the management insisted we drive to the next town to return the keys in the morning...that would have been in the dark... we decided to leave a day early and find a hotel close to the airport.. we always travel Best Western in Canada and find their service and amenities to be top notch... we knew in advance that the Best Western Plaza was located under and by freeways so expected it to be noisy and not in the best location for strolling the city! Our room was very comfortable and clean ...located on the quiet side of the hotel... it appeared that it had be recently renovated and updated..We arrived earlier than check in and the hotel stored our bags til we arrived.. and delivered them to our room when we checked in... the front desk enquired if we were happy with our room and would like to move.. but we declined as we were very comfortable. the shuttle service is frequent and on time... Looking for a very convienient place to stay coming or leaving from early flights .. the price is right .. sensitive hearing bring ear plugs! ..Wandering Juanita

We stayed here for a week. The primary reason we chose this hotel is because it was pet friendly and we were moving to the island and had our dogs with us. Possibly my view is a bit more relaxed because it is so hard to find a pet friendly hotel in Oahu. The room was renovated, but had an old a/c window unit that was loud and was situated over the desk area where the intermittant internet cable was located. There is not much of a variety of cable channels on the tv. Now keep in mind that I was not on vacation and was spending more time in the room that the vacation travel would have. The tub drained really slow too. Housekeeping was friendly. The front desk seemed a bit overwhelmed at times. Parking was available but kind of tight spaces. Its an airport hotel so that tells you what you need to know about the location. It is industrial and does not have that vacation feel about it. That being said, I pretty much sucked it up and dealt with it because I could have my whole family there with me and that included the dogs. However, when our housing fell through and we realized we would be staying in a hotel longer than expected my DH decided he couldn't take it here any longer. Fortunately, we found a pet friendly hotel that we loved that was closer to Waikiki. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for the vacation of a lifetime at all. If you are on a budget then fine or needing a place close to the airport for a night or two then fine. If the hotel and its ammenities are important on your trip then look elsewhere.

There were hairs on the bathroom floor and bath tub from the previous guest. Absolutely disgusting. DO NOT leave anything behind in your room when you check out because you will never get it back again. I called today to ask if my watch was returned to the front desk and OF COURSE they told me they didn't find anything. The front desk employees were extremely unhelpful.The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It is located near the airport. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

The hotel's best advantage is, that it is close to the airport. Unfortunately, that means a business district, ugly views and insane distance to walk anywhere, but the airport. That would not bug me as much, as the two "episodes" I had with receptionists. First was on our first trip in December, when someone screwed with our departure date and all of our card-keys stopped working. Instead of admitting a human error, I was lectured about having my key near to cellphone, or other strong radio/magnetic field. Well, there was none, not for all the cards, especially when we left (forgot) one card in our car. Because I am an IT guy and I KNOW how these things work, because I service them for our company's clients, I was pissed, but swallowed it. It insulted me to be lied to in the face, but I told myself to cool down and enjoy the vacation.Second thing was, when my in-room internet stopped working. Being an IT guy, I have tried everything possible, except the last thing - trying different cable. I went down to reception, asking them if they have a spare. Instead of being told "no" first, I was told by the receptionist in a strict tone, that I have to return with the cable to my room. On the second try, the receptionist told me, that they don't have any spare. So I asked, if it would be possible to go to another free room and borrow a cable from there, just for a test sake. She told me, that she has to check with the security... "WTF, why security?" I asked myself, but maybe in this country you need a security guard to fetch you a TP cable, whatever. Woulnd't matter to me as long as I would got the cable. But the receptionist answer was after a while, that the security will not touch any internet cable in other vacant rooms, due to liability issues. LIABILITY ISSUES? It is a stupid piece of twist pair cable, with no identifiable markings on it, it is simple to remove and put in, unless you are a retarded monkey, because common monkey could do it. So I am pissed, writing from a slow lobby connection, unable to send my photos home, unable to solve my e-mails, stranded and sleepless with the receptionist. The internet here is slow, sometimes crawling, my cellphone is faster, hell, my smart watch are faster that that! :/ But I can live with it, as long as my photos get sent home overnight... Which is not going to happen now, because I am not spending my night in the lobby, being aggressive and silent threat, pondering about human lazyness, inteligence or lack thereof, and ability to not make any unnecessary actions on behalf of the hotel's clients...The bottom line is - LIMIT YOUR STAY AT THE HOTEL TO THE MINIMUM TIME POSSIBLE, it is not bad hotel all and all, but the service is terrible. Period. Not going forward to help you solve any of your problems, not a tiny bit. I miss European accomodation... :)

The Good:1. Rooms were clean2. Beds were comfortable3. Staff was smiling and helpfulThe Bad:Problem 1: Welcome to Hawaii, unless you smoke.If you smoke you are discriminated against at every turn.Smokers are forced take an elevator to sit or stand in unprotected areas to have a cigarette, regardless of wind, rain, or mosquitoes.There is one area (P5) that is in the parking structure protected from rain, but is subject to fumes from cars exhaust, gasoline and oil, hardly an equitable situation.During my stay I incurred 11 mosquito bites, and you can rest assured that if I come down with any disease from those mosquito bites I will be suing Best Western Plaza Hotel and the State of Hawaii for medical bills, discrimination, and distress (disease incurred from mosquito bites, anger at being subjected to mosquitoes in the first place, irritation at being treated like a leper, and the three weeks of itching since then).While non smokers do have the right to not be subjected to cigarette smoke, smokers also have the right not to be subjected to the elements and disease carrying insects.To treat half of your guests like this simply because they smoke is ridiculous and unfair, and leaves you open to lawsuits if a guest becomes diseased due to being forced to go into mosquito infested open air areas just to have a cigarette.Solutions to Problem 1:A. Best Solution - Provide a smoking lounge on each floor with adequate ventilation fans that remove smoke from the air, comfortable couches and chairs, small tables and ashtrays, wastebaskets and a TV. This will allow guests a very comfortable place on each floor to smoke away from non smokers, yet still be protected from the elements and disease carrying insects, just like your non smoking guests enjoy.It would also eliminate the necessity for guests to take an elevator each time they want a cigarette, resulting in all guests being happy, instead of just the half that don’t smoke being happy while the guests who do smoke being irritated and unhappy.Oh, and it would also negate the possibility of lawsuits resulting from disease incurred while being forced to stand in a cloud of mosquitoes to smoke.B. Adequate Solution - Provide covered screen enclosed balconies on each floor with chairs or benches, cigarette disposal units or ashtrays, and wastebaskets.This will allow guests a semi comfortable place to smoke away from non smokers, while protecting them from rain and disease carrying insects.There would still be wind, which would act as ventilation for the smoking balconies, but smoking guests would not have to take an elevator, or be rained on, or be bitten by mosquitoes.This solution also negates the possibility of lawsuit due to disease contracted from being forced to feed mosquitoes while having a smoke.Problem 2:Rooms in the front part of the hotel are subject to loud noise from the freeway.Cars, motorcycles and trucks go by all night, making it impossible to sleep.After the first night I had to check out several rooms before I found one quiet enough to allow me to sleep all night.Solution to Problem 2:Invest in double paned windows and foam wall insulation in all noisy rooms.Problem 3:Newsprint cleverly disguised as toilet paper had me bleeding so badly that I had to resort to using washcloths, which I am certain disgusted the maids as much as it disgusted me.Solution to Problem 3:At $130.00 per night you can certainly afford to provide toilet paper that is softer than 220 grit sandpaper.Problem 4:Water temperature in the shower constantly fluctuated every 10 seconds between burning hot and freezing cold.There was no comfortable or consistent water temperature in the shower at all.Solution to Problem 4:Call a plumber.Problem 5:TV in room on 6th floor has no sound on half of the channels.Solution to Problem 5:Call a TV repair man.Problem 6:Hallway on 11th floor smells like wet dog.Made me gag every time I walked in.Solution to Problem 6:Shampoo carpet until smell is gone.Problem 7:Beds are made like burritos.Sheets and blankets are tucked in all around making it necessary for the guest to unmake the bed and then tuck the bottom sheet back in before being able to go to bed.People like me with medical conditions have difficulty with this chore, and to have to do it every day is irritating and simply exhausting for us.I ended up having to write a note for the maid to please not make the bed.Solution to Problem 7:Tuck only the bottom sheet under the mattress, allow top sheet and blanket to simply drape over the end and sides of the bed.The Bottom Line:I will be staying at the Marriot from now on.Final Note:I hope that bringing these problems to your attention and offering solutions to these problems will prompt you to improve these situations so your future guests will have a much more pleasant stay at your hotel and actually wish to return.Mahalo

All in all the location was good and the hotel reasonable if you have an early flight to catch. I read the reviews before selecting this hotel and was surprised that the issue with the airconditioning was not raised more often. You are unable to change the setting or turn off the in room air conditioning. The noise and force coming from the vent would put a 747 to shame. The alarm clock was inoperable and when reception was notified they suggested setting the alarm on a cell phone. A depressing end to a wonderful Hawaii experience. Go to Waikiki instead and get up 30 mins earlier.

Perfect if you just want to sleep before an early flight. If you have time and if money is not an issue, sleeping in Waikiki should be considered.This hotel is trapped between highway ramps. The highway noise in the pool court is ridiculous.Very limited restaurant options. We ended up eating at the corner pizza place. Pizza was very good.

Our stay at this hotel was perfect. We arrived after 11 hours on the airplane and the hotel shuttle transported us to the hotel with no fuss or problem. (Two days before our flight to Hawaii, my husband fell on the ice at home and pulled muscles, ligaments, and tendons in his knee. The emergency room doctor fitted him with a brace to limit the knee movement and sent him on his way with crutches and a request that he see a specialist.) We had no time for that! Therefore, I needed to change my reservation to a room set up for a person with disabilities. (No bathtub, just a shower) This hotel accommodated our needs at the last minute. The driver of the van took care of the luggage also getting it to our room. Our friends stayed in a corner room, which was larger than ours with windows on two sides. Their room was clean and comfortable as well.Our room was nice, clean, and met our needs. We felt safe, welcomed, and respected. We appreciate what was done at the last minute to help us have a restful stay before we flew out to Kauai. The room was on the 6th floor but road noise was not a problem as noted in other posts.We only ate breakfast at the hotel and it was as we requested. The price was not out of line with other urban hotels. I read many reviews before we made the decision to stay here. I realize some were unhappy with the hotel. We were very happy with our stay. We will stay at this hotel on our return to Honolulu and the final leg of our vacation. This is a fine hotel to stay overnight. It is not a resort but matches “Marriott Courtyard” and is so convenient to the airport. No big taxi fee!Even with the crutches and knee brace, we went into Waikiki for a day on “The Bus” As a travel note… It would be good to recognize landmarks from the hotel is on the way out, so you can find it in the dark later. However, the bus driver was gracious and told us when to get off. We found Waikiki interesting and expensive so a one-day visit was enough. You won’t be sorry you stayed in this hotel for a night or two as you rest up for other flights.

This is an airport hotel- don't book if you are looking for sand and Waikiki! But if you need easy access to the airport and don't want to pay a billion, stay here! Very clean, the hosts were so kind and helpful and the shuttle drivers were excellent. They offered great assistance and advice! The shuttle goes back and forth from the airport every half hour- no worries for those early flights home.

I was on an Army-directed move to Hawaii and stayed at the hotel for 9 weeks.The waiters and waitress in the on-site restaurant were efficient, warm and friendly. I actually enjoyed eating breakfast there every morning. Top notch!The Front Desk staff were also attentive. Mena is the best-she remembered my name from Day 1. I can't say enough good things abour her efficiency and attention to detail.

This was our second stay at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel in Honolulu. It's the perfect place to stay if making a connection, as it is very close (<5 minutes) to the airport. The free shuttle met us at the terminal in less than 5 minutes after my call. The room was comfortable, with a good king-size bed. Thgough some people have complained about the noise, we found it fairly quiet, even though we could see the Nimitz Highway out our window (we were on the 6th floor) and the hotel abuts th airport. The only issue I have is that there is no place to eat nearby (walking distance) other than the hotel restaurant, which is not open every day. We had to take a taxi to get to Ruby Tuesday's, about 2 miles away.

So you need to renovate a few floors of your hotel and you have a hotel full of guests who have flown in from the mainland or another country. When would be the best time in the morning to start hammering? 7:30am??? What are they thinking?Anyway, apart from that the room is comfortable and the location is handy. There is some aircraft noise but it not overwhelming. Main noise was caused by the hotel themselves.

Housekeeping was sad, many days no coffee left, not sure they know what a wash cloth was. Floors were not swept or vacuumed, a few days sheets were not changed they just made the bed. The throw at the foot of the bed was often times wadded up and shoved in the end table. Toilet paper was not left.Teh Airconditioner was positioned so it blew cold air on the opposit wall, so the room really did not have proper cooling. The hotel is located right under the H1 and is so noisy that if you are outside and need to have a conversation on your cell phone you cannot even here the other person. Food was horrible. VERY VERY disapointed.

This Hotel was recommended by others and at first I was leary but when talking with the staff there when we checked in it became clear that this Hotel in my opinion was the right choice for what was needed!

Expect to pay $20 more per day to park your rental car, mildew in bathroom but at least the beds were comfortable. No clean towels provided during daily housekeeping. The room on the top floor was surprisingly quiet.

Located 5 blocks from airport, near Hickam & Pearl Harbor bases. Easy access to 3 major highways, but very quiet. Check-in & check-out very easy. Wheelchair access to hotel facilities, including gift shop, restaurant, parking, etc. The wheelchair accessible room was very spacious, with a walk-in shower; clean & very comfortable. Ramp makes parking convenient. On-site restaurant serves breakfast daily. Byron's Drive-in within easy walking distance.

I found this hotel to be ideal for a short layover in Honolulu. My room, in a corner of the 11th floor, was large and very comfortable. The carpet and drapes looked fairly new, and the bed was amazingly good. Everything was clean and functioned perfectly. The only small nitpicks would be a noisy a/c system (I used earplugs), and a lot of light flooding under the door to the hallway (I parked a large suitcase in front of it to block my view). Having arrived well after midnight, I greatly appreciated the quick and pleasant airport shuttle service. There are bus stops right by the hotel, a free internet kiosk in the lobby, and free bag hold service. I didn't try the on site restaurant, but I did take advantage of the gift & sundries shop to grab a bottle of water and a snack. Service at the front desk was friendly and efficient.For a short layover, I could find nothing to complain about, and would certainly stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel just for one night as we had to catch an early flight to another island in the morning. It is conveniently located for the airport with a shuttle bus service (you have to call them from the arrivals hall). That's about all on the positive side unfortunately. The rooms are quite spacious, but furniture is really outdated. The aircon was not working properly and made buzzing sounds all night (it sounded like an alarm clock ringing). Bathrooms were alright and clean. Other hotel facilities are not recommended. The pool looked dirty and unpleasant with constant noise from the nearby airport.Breakfast next morning was a really bad surprise. Everything was offered on plastic (i.e. dishes, cutlery, etc.). It felt more like a fast food chain than a proper hotel.We paid USD 99 for the night and felt this was really bad value for money, but altough we had read bad review before, we couldn't find another hotel so close to the airport.

I stayed at this hotel to be near the airport. Its a fantastic location because its walking distance to the rental car places and very near the airport. The rooms look exactly like the photos. The carpets are clean, the bed looks clean and inviting. However, thats where it ends. The wall have seen better days having several coats of paint and grungy look. The elevator floor is warped and peeling up. In my room the light switches didn't work but I finally found one lamp that would turn on. The phones were pretty grungy, I didn't want to pick it up. Its a old great hotel if you don't mind the cockroaches scurrying thru the hotel lobby which is the only place I saw them. The front desk didn't seem too bothered by it. I do not recommend eating there after seeing these guys. I would love to recommend this hotel for its great location but can't get over the cockroaches.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The room was very good- the beds are nice, bathroom, etc. The location was my biggest issue. The hotel is located very close to the airport and a busy street- it's a very convenient location, but the noise can be a little grating. However, all but the lightest sleepers should have no problem getting to bed. It is also a very centrally located hotel, near a lot of attractions, including a mall and military bases and many places that are even within walking distance. As far as service goes, housekeeping is very good at what they do, but not overly friendly- with one exception. During my stay, I met Annie, who is hands down the nicest and most helpful person I have ever met at a hotel to date. She singlehandedly redeemed my opinion of the housekeeping and even got to be on a name-to-name basis with me. I have yet to try the food, mostly because it is slightly expensive even with vouchers. Though the prices seem to be in line with what I have seen in other hotels.I would recommend this hotel for anyone seeking convenience and ease during their stay in Hawaii.

The hotel was good but bit expensive. I travel a lot for work and I stay in a lot of hotels. Hundreds every year. and I have never ever had to pay to park in the hotel I was staying! $129.00 plus taxes and a $10.00 charge to park THAT IS JUST WRONG AND GREEDY.

I would recommend Best Western for a stay....that's not the problem. I HAD to stay there. My husband was airlifted to Honolulu from the Big Island for open heart surgery at Moanalua Medical Center/Kaiser. I HAD to stay somewhere close and this did work out..mainly due to the shuttle system them offered.I stayed 4/22, 4/23 and 4/24/10. THEY (the staff) had me fill out the paperwork to receive a $50 cash card since this was during their "special" at that time. I can't tell you how many calls I have made, how many people I have spoken with and still nothing. In fact....they even have our Big Island address to mail it to and still NO CASH CARD. The last person I spoke with was Jim at the rewards dept (1-800-237-8483). I thought after talking with him it would be taken care of. This is absolutely no way to run a business and I will keep at this until I receive my $50 cash card that I was promised...and actually asked to request!!!!!!!Mrs. Noonan760-223-0374 (cell)

If you are traveling w/ family then this is a great place. The lady that helped us, Cynthia, was very hospitable and honest. She refunded the extra money that we paid after she realized i was active duty here on orders. I didn't know they had lower rates for military. She actually called up to our room and said "come down to the front desk w/ your orders so I can give you what we owe you." This hotel could have easily taken advantage and gotten away with overcharge. Not only that but maid service was great, staff were friendly (i can only speak for us of course), the room most importantly was very clean and adequate.

Stayed One-night August 13thTotal Guest: 37th Floor RoomCleanliness: No problems here, expectations met for this type of propertyService: Could use a little more smiles, but overall does a good job with dealing with the varying type of guests that stay at this airport hotel.Location: Yes, its only 5-10 minutes away from the Airport, but your in an Industrial Type of area. Waikiki Beach is about 25 minutes away. Good location for military personnel. Pearl Harbor Naval Base and Hickam AFB is about 10 minutes away.Value: In my opinion, the $109 a night I paid for this room night was too expensive. I consider this property comparable to a Days Inn or Super 8. For this type of room and industrial location, room rate should be between $75 to $89. Parking a car is an additional $10 per night. A FREE 24-hour airport shuttle is available.Rooms: Room we had was a perfect rectangle shape room with ample space for 3 people.Sleep Quality: Poor, in addition to the airport being close by, the Airport Viaduct Freeway is a mere 20 yards away from the building. So, please bring earplugs if you plan on sleeping.Another issue is Security. Parking Garage and Guest Room access use the same elevator. So basically, anyone can pull into the garage, hop into the elevator and press any button above 5 and your immediately in the Guest Room corridor. If your in the middle of nowhere, then maybe this would not be an issue. But when your near the airport and adjacent to a industrial zoned area security can be issue.

This hotel wasn't bad until tonight. The location is convient for the most part. Rooms are clean and most the staff is very nice. Like I said it was cool until like 5 minutes ago was doing laundy, put 2 dollars in the soda machine to try to get change back for the laundry machine. The vendinding machine wouldn't give change back so I go to the front desk kind and courteous as you could be and the lady at the front desk was not only rude but also said I was wasting her time straight to my face. If that isn't bad service I don't know what is, Her job is to make people feel welcomed and she made me want to leave this very night! Do not stay at this hotel!

The front desk personnel have very bad service and very snotty!! Very disrespectful, the only nice person in this hotel is the security guard. Rooms by the freeway suck, too much noise. Next time I will spend a lil more money for a better hotel. F*** this hotel!!!

the security and obviously staff here was very rude and wasnt allowed to DRINK anywheres on premises! which i thought was obscure since i was in honolulu freakin hawaii!!!!! o but they sell it (alcahol) downstairs at a dive hole of a novelty shop. i felt like i was in boot camp more than a beautiful island where its supposed to be paradise. if you want paradise.................this one is not the place to be. beggars everywhere and aweful staffing rates this dump a -99!!!!! look around or spend a little more, but not here. this is a military housing place as far as im concerned! dispicable!!!!!!!

I stayed with my two teenage grand boys on an overnight before going on to Kauai. This is an older hotel, so don't expect the impossible. But it is very clean, very convenient with airport shuttle and quite well-maintained. The beds were SO comfortable, and the sheets nice and thick. The pillows were plump and generous. The pool is OK. They have a nice restaurant on site, but we were time-constrained, so had breakfast a half block away at a suggested "drive in" type place. We ate open-air. The food was excellent and very reasonable. I definitely recommend this hotel for 1 or 2 nights in Honolulu.

My corporate travel agency booked this hotel for me. If you are traveling on business and/or want to be close to Pearl Harbor or the airport - this is the location for you. Also good for travelers on a budget who don't want to pay top dollar for Waikiki hotels. Small clean room, reasonable rates and parking fees compared to others in Hawaii. Nice cafe on-site. Not a luxury hotel - just a nice clean room and a shower. I had a problem in that I was there on business and needed to work in the room at night. The in-room internet was very very slow: taking 2 min to load a single page. Unfortunately, these smaller hotels contract out their internet service so they don't have to pay a full time IT staff, so I ended up on the phone for 40 min troubleshooting the hotel internet problems myself. Not good. Anyway, they were unable to fix the problem the next day, so I was forced to go to another hotel. It could have been a big hassle with the hotel charging me for checking out early, but nothing could be further from the truth. The Manager - Lance was superb. He understood that I had to work, and no internet was not an option for me. He let me check out extremely late (3PM) and apologized for the inconvenience and even refunded 50% of my one night stay. This guy gets it - now he has a loyal customer every time I come back to Oahu. The service at this hotel could not be better!

The overall hotel is nice and almost everyone is friendly. My husband & I had no choice but to stay here for the military until our housing got set up..this hotel has LOTS of military staying here.The housekeepers are basically just rude. They STOLE our do not disturb sign TWICE. There were mornings where I was still asleep and I would wake up to them standing at the end of the bed asking if I wanted them to make it. I was sick for about a week and a half. I just wanted to sleep. Every morning they would knock on the door and wake me up, even though the do not disturb sign was there.I have a friend staying here with a baby. The housekeepers complained to the manager that she had dirty diapers in her trash..my friend was at risk of being kicked out of the hotel while she was waiting for military housing. The housekeeper even entered her room and proceeded to talk loudly at 8am while the children were trying to sleep. Her 2 year old daughter even had a sheet SNATCHED off of her. Its a great hotel, if you don't enjoy sleep.

The free shuttle to and from the airport is great. In hotel restaurant is pricey. Check in staff very helpful. There are several places to eat within walking distance. room was clean with the exception of the bathroom which had hairs in the tub. Noisy at night as it right across the street from the exspressway overpass. We used this hotel for one night as we had a very early flight out in the AM. It was the prefect location for that. Not somewhere I would use for more than one night.

We stayed here on 2 separate nights a week or so apart during May 2010. Really the best thing about this hotel is its location to the airport - it is less than 5 mins drive away and they offer free shuttles (the driver was quite friendly too). Also, we found the rooms clean so no problems there. Otherwise, aside from the shuttle driver don't expect good service as the people there are slow and apathetic. Plus, no free breakfast and the Wi Fi in our room was pretty much unusable on one of the nights we were there (apparently because there were too many people using it so there was nothing they could do). I should add that the downside of the location is that is right on the freeway so you do get some traffic noise but we found it wasn't too intrusive, especially on the second night when our room was higher up on the ninth floor. Overall just ok for an overnight's stay though for the price you pay you do feel slightly ripped off. That said, I believe options for hotels near the airport in Honolulu are quite limited and overall the convenience of staying so close to the airport probably does justify paying such inflated rates.

The shuttle service to and from the airport was top notch. The rooms were clean (but small), the beds were comfortable (but small). Rental cars were near by walking distance. The staff and front desk were friendly and helpful. This is a great hotel if you need a quick and affordable overnight stay in Honolulu. However, if you are vacationing in Oahu, this is not the best place for an extended stay of more than a day or two. Parking in their ramp was also affordable for hotel guests.

My husband and I just got stationed in Hawaii and needed a place to stay until we got a house. The hotel gives military on PCS orders a $10 per person per day meal voucher. It made eating very affordable. The food was decent at the hotel restaurant, but the servers were very friendly, especially James.

We were promptly seated in what we think was the best place to visit with our friends and family. We only wanted drinks (to bad the lounge closed and there was limited selection of drinks to choose from) so James was very courteous in his delivery and promptly served us our drinks. He was very friendly with our group which made our visit to the restaurant very memorable. We are looking forward to visiting there again and would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

Hotel recognized my stay was prepaid upon arrival in refusing to reward my Best Western Account with points - upon leaving they charged me the ten dollars for daily parking per day and I thought all was well. Upon reviewing my credit card statement, they charged me again for the entire stay. As a service member, I have many choices on island - The Plaza Hotel will not be used in future ADT or PCS stays.

Tonight is my last night at the Best Western The Plaza Hotel, I was supposed to stay here for another 10 nights, but this place is the pits. Somehow Best Western managed to find the worst property on the island, it is close to nothing except the only highway and the airport and about 20 car rental companies. The room might have been okay had it not been for the noisy air conditioning unit, the highway 100' away from my door, the non-cooling but very loud refrigerator that I couldn’t unplug. The Hi-Speed internet is as Hi-Speed as a 56K dial-up modem, and that was after I called the technical support line to get it working in the room. The comment card from the resident prior to me was still in the room filled out when I checked in, he seemed pretty happy with the room, maybe it's just me, but for your money, you could do much better. I am moving to a hotel 1 block off of the beach for $20 less per night.
Ok for last minute. 24 hour airport shuttle. Drive-in restaurant next door open 24 hours.

We needed a hotel close to airport for an early morning departure. Best Western generally has a good reputation for hotel/motel accomodations in the state where we live.Checked in using AARP discount rates. We were given a room on the top floor. At first glance the room appreared to be as pictured in on line advertising. However, closer inspection revealed a bathroom with rusted chrome in the bathtub, a leaky sink faucet. An inspection of the room revealed areas that had not been dusted for months, furniture that was worn and dirty. Climbing into bed revealed a king sized mattress that sagged. The mechanical unit above the room on the roof was extremely noisy.The dining room next to the pool had a pleasant appearance and the staff was courteous and prompt. The meal was not tasty and one-half of each meal was not eaten. The dining room was only open Friday thru Monday with a pricey menu.A disappointing ending to a week's vacation in Hawaii.
My stay here was great and the service was outstanding. Close to the airport and the food was great. Everytime you saw any personnel that worked here they always had a smile.

The hotel is nice place to use for a stopover if traveling thru Hawaii. It is also great if you are working at the base. It is 5 mins from the base and has a great military plan. The bed could be a little more firmer cuz I did have some minor soreness a few times when waking up. Restaurant food is good but only breakfast is available 7 days a week. Dinner service is shared between this hotel and a "sister" hotel. The hotel also needs more free TV channel selections. No essential channels like Syfy, Hist, NatGeo, or TLC are available. Pool area is nice but nothing like the hotels in Waikiki so if you are a tourist, hotels in Waikiki are for you unless you need to cut your vacation costs.

It was so confusing and the driver that picked us up was very rude telling us to walk to the best western or back to the airport. Whoever idea was these, very clever! try to fool the tired people who the last thing we need is scolding from drivers! Fix your shuttle van's signs because it is not funny!

I had two nights on business on the west side of the Island. I arrived on the Island on a late flight and booked the Best Western, Plazapartly because I could take their Airport shuttle and not worry about a rental car until the next morning. I booked a Budget car and was able to walk to the pick up spot. If you book at Thrifty or Advantage their lots are one block and two blocks away.The room was well appointed, there was a handy shop in the hotel wtih a variety of food and beverages. I wondered about staying between the airport and the freeway, but my room in the tower was quiet. The fridge and micro in the room were handy. I would stay here again if I was in on business. Pool area is very nice.

Stayed here back in 01 when we moved to Hawaii and then again for a trip back to Hawaii w/ kids. It's probably the most affordable on the island, great views of the mountians and you can see the rainbows and the beach. The hotel is nice, good, clean rooms, wonderful pool, gift shop etc. The location is not so nice. If your military it's great...close to Hickam and Pearl Harbor, but it is an industrial area. Right off nimitz under the highway, surrounded by car lots and sooooo close to the airport. there is a decent resturaunt in the hotel. If this is a vacation you will have to have a rental car or use cabs or "Da Bus" to get to shopping or the beach...no where near walk on access. Really best for an economy trip or a military family move (for military folks...the resturant issued TLA bucks, so if your on TLA you will save a ton on meals!!!)

We stayed at the plaza best western late March and early April 2010. This was a clean hotel close to the airport with a free airport shuttle. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Next to the hotel is Byron's Drive In but you can walk in also. The have very authenic hawaiian food at a good price. The hotel does not have a hot tub but does have a nice pool. The only other downside is getting to Waikiki. The bus takes about 45 min but the stop is right outside the hotel. Taxi's will run 25 to 50 dollars

I stayed here after I got into Honolulu and before catching an early morning flight the next day. I was only going to be in Hawaii for a few hours and catching a cab to another hotel was definately not worth the expense and time. This hotel was fine for a quick stay. The room wasn't very clean (desk and dresser tops had goo on them), so I was careful not to touch much. The free shuttle to and from the hotel and airport made the stay tolerable.

We spent two nights in the hotel. First night was upon arrival into Honolulu and the second was after a short sightseeing trip in Honolulu before flying out onto one of the other islands. The hotel is fine. It first does not have 20 floors as another reviewer stated. It has 12 floors and we stayed in room 1120 on the 11th floor. This room overlooks the airport from one window and the bay behind the airport and Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach on the other side since its a corner unit. Its not overly quiet, but it was fine. The room is furnished ok, nothing spectacular but it serves the purpose. Good bed to sleep on. The A/C cannot be turned off unless you put the temp to 90 degrees but it was just fine for us at 65 degrees throught the night,The staff was very friendly overall and again I do not get what the people are complaining about the staff. Perhaps they need to be nice to them and the staff will be nice to you as well since they helped us out as much as possible and absolutely no issues here with any of the people we came across.. The restaurant though we did not try it had decent food (we got some muffins for breakfast) however the price I think was a bit high for the muffins,

My partner and I booked to stay in this hotel due to its close proximitey to HNL international airport so that we could get as much rest as possible before our long journey back to the UK - big mistake!On arrival we were greeted with anything but the warm ahola welcome we had come accustomed to on Oahu. The receptionist simply grunted at us and gave us our room key.
